reviews.text: We came as walk-ins during a Friday night and ended up getting seated right away at the bar. The space is really cute and the dishes were awesome.

We came by during my birthday weekend for brunch one Saturday afternoon after snagging a reservation online. Upon entry we were seated alongside the front window which was perfect since it was a SF Summer in Autumn kind of day.

Came here with my father who was, let's say, already into the night a bit. I was worn down from outside lands. But, the owner was more than accomidating, setting us up at the bar while we waited for the table. Chef sent out some mysterious foam breadsticks which were good though quite confusing. Food was good, classic trendy american fare.

Outstanding. Came in here on a hunch since it's been in the neighborhood and a visit seemed overdue. The atmosphere was more casual than I expected, but the food was second to none. Great portions, great variety - service was good but not super attentive, perhaps a bit of room for improvement there. But basically a top notch experience, we'll be back!
Delicious food, incredible beer menu, fantastic service. I only wish I could eat at Stones Throw every night of the week.

I came here for a dinner with a couple of coworkers. The space is open and modern. We decided to order family style. To start we shared the puffed potato and egg. As my fork cut into the little ball, a gooey egg ran out. Scrumptious!
Small portions.
Loved the brunch.

So, so, so good. Came for a special occasion and it was a great choice. Parking sucks, but it's SF so what's new? The service was on point, and interestingly it seemed to be an all male wait staff; not sure if it was just the night or is intentional. My dining partner did have the only negative comment of the evening that there was far too much urine around the toilet for a restaurant as cute as this is, but if there are few women on staff, it seems sadly unsurprising. Still, mop around the toilet fellas! I didn't see it, so I can't confirm her findings. However, sullied bathroom aside, this place is fantastic. Inventive without being crazy. Bites with all parts of a plate, or pieces of it, were equally delicious. I had the sea bass, my fellow diner had the duck for our entrees, both were fantastic. Our snacks & starters were the potato egg balls, which in reviewing fellow yelpers' pictures, our may have been a bit overcooked as our yolks were solid. Still yummy, but would have preferred a looser yolk. We also had the mushroom ragout, which was super flavorful and delicious and the squid ink pasta which was quite lovely -- especially the foam which seemed to be a very delicate sweet onion.  Dessert was a tough choice, so we didn't choose and got both the s'mores and the pb&j donuts. Though the s'mores was quite yummy, I was surprised by how effing delicious the donuts were. I didn't want them to end and held myself back from licking the plate. Crazy good all around. Left feeling full and quite happy.

Stones Throw has yet to disappoint. Had an amazing brunch this morning, after having had dinner here twice. We split the puffed potato and egg, smoked salmon mousse, messy breakfast sandwich, and the brioche pain perdu. The only thing that did not completely wow me was the smoked salmon mousse. It was good, but everything else was off the chain! Splitting the sandwich and brioche is perfect balance of sweet and savory.

Had the great pleasure of going here a couple weeks ago, and the chef and staff did not disappoint. I had the best meal I've had so far in SF here. We had 8 people so we did the chef's tasting and split a couple bottles of wine. Every dish, from squid ink pasta to the burger. This was the type of meal that blows you away. The staff was also very courteous and responsive. They even hooked us up with a little post meal digestif.
The Espresso version - go here and get ready for one of the best nights you'll have.

This treasure of a restaurant is worth the arduous journey of finding parking in Russian Hill. The staff is a superior blend of attentive service and authentic, friendly personalities. The menu is a smorgasbord of consistently high quality across inventive dishes that delighted our table throughout the night. Every one of the following dishes are worth ordering:

Let's cut to the chase: Everything I tasted here was incredible. Despite yelp classifying this place as American, some of the menu items are more of a fusion of different cuisines so you won't find anything that's "typical American" - which is refreshing. This is one of the rare restaurants where everything on the plate tasted great together vs. sometimes I get fancy looking dishes and the garnishes and stuff on the side are kind of gross or feel like an after thought.

Went here with friends for the first time. I was thinking this place was going to be American cuisine, but after looking at the menu, it's more of an Asian fusion. We tried the octopus fried pancake, sea bass and the duck. All were exceptionally good. We finished with the s'mores dessert.

This is my new favorite restaurant.   We had the squid ink pasta, mushroom ragout, potato & egg and octopus appetizers.   They were all good, but do yourself a favor and have the squid ink pasta and octopus!  I hate these things normally, but this place makes the pasta look so appetizing and the octopus is so tender, it's amazing! I couldn't resist a taste which eventually turned into almost finishing both dishes :P. My friend had "da burga" which came with the best tater tots I've ever had.  My husband had the ribeye, which was perfectly prepared, and I had the pork tenderloin with pork belly spatzle.   We finished with the donuts, smores and pavlova desserts which were all delicious.   It's pretty unusual to find a place that does all three courses equally well and doesn't disappoint as the dinner progresses.  This place has it all.  To top it off, they have an extensive beer menu.  I had the Dieu du Ciel Rigor Mortis which went well with everything, in addition to having a high enough ABV to make it worth the calories ;).
I started with the orange blossom cocktail and ended with the PB&J donuts, and I can contently say that this meal was great from drinks to dessert.
Mixed feelings about this place.
Thursday evening ~10pm. Busy bar.
The food was really creative and everything was cooked perfectly but the taste just didn't blow me away. I think the flavors just need to be bolder and more aggressive. Service however was fantastic.

Came here for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. I briefly mentioned that in the reservation notes and they had a cute hand-written "Happy Birthday Tim" card put at our table and added a birthday candle to our dessert. Thank you! That was very sweet!

I was here for dinner with a client. Not too loud, but also not too quite where everyone could hear our conversation. Good service. Ended up coming back a week later because I was craving the squid ink pasta

We live in Davis and were in San Francisco for the evening for a concert at the Masonic.  Based on Yelp reviews we decided to give this restaurant a try and were glad that we did.  Our reservation was honored; the service was fantastic; and the food was delicious.  Though everything was good, our favorite item was the peanut butter and jelly doughnut, it was just yummy!
This is the best restaurant I have been to in San Francisco for a few reasons.
I really wanted to hate this place. I figured it was just another San Francisco, American New, menu full of pretension and douchebaggery.... but I was wrong.

Came here for my bf's work party.  It was amazing.  I am currently on an elimination diet, so didn't expect to eat much, but before the meal started a waitress came around and asked if anyone had allergies.  i mentioned the diet, and they accomodated me!!  I got my own veggie/starter plate.  Followed by a diet approved similar fish entree to everyone else, as well as a pork tenderloin, similar to what everyone else got, but free of the things I am avoiding.  Not only did they do that, but a friend across the table forgot her reading glasses and couldn't see the menu, so  the owner borrowed her HIS glasses.  Later someone else spilled wine on there shirt and they brought over "Wine Away", which magically made the red wine disappear.  The service here is AMAZING.  And the food, is to die for.
Pro: cute decor, good location on Hyde, server was nice
This review is long overdue.
Simply put this place is outstanding. The food was so good that if no one was watching I would have licked the plates...no lie.

Stones Throw has a highly curated selection of quaffs and Michelin quality cuisines with an equally attentive and friendly staff - which makes sense given that the owners also run Fat Angel. If you haven't been to either, you're really missing out.
How can such a low score come from a place that has such high reviews?
After seeing numerous five star reviewed for Stones Throw, I made it a point to visit for our next date night.
Tried this place last night and was VERY impressed.

Here's my story with Stones Throw.  I already heard great things about them from fellow yelper reviews, so when I saw that they had a booth at the 2014 San Francisco Street Food Festival, it was a perfect opportunity to try their famous Puffed Potato & Egg (
Located in the heart of San Francisco's renowned Russian Hill, this charming little hidden gem of a restaurant serves up inspiring American cuisine in a friendly, unfussy yet contemporary setting.
Creative Excellence

Really cute place, in a really cute part of Russian Hill. The food was mostly solid, with a lot of inventive flavors and techniques.  Some dishes seemed one note flavor-wise, but I was in sort of a sweet/sour mood so it could just have been me. I also appreciated that they had such a great alcohol program. Tons of sour beers, and interesting wines - - I'm always a fan of that. In general, I thought it was totally reasonably priced for the service and quality of the food. i

Had just about everything on the menu.  Standouts were corn risotto, pork two ways (esp. the tankatsu) and duck pate w/ soft pretzel roll (3 to an order so you make sure you can have two).  Love the environment.  Cozy and casual.  Sat at table but would have gladly ate at bar.  Many wines and beers available.
Lovely, lively atmosphere, super staff all complement the FABULOUS food.
Nice Crowded place with great audience.
Fantastic German food, great staff, good beer, what could be better?

We had such a lovely dinner here on Sunday night. Pork loin, chicken dumpling soup, all of it absolutely delicious. This is one of those places that makes San Francisco special - it has real character and personality, unlike a lot of the new restaurants around these days. It is really adorable, with the staff dressed as, what were they, townspeople from the Alps? I'm not up on my Austrian and German history here, alas, so I apologize. But they were so sweet-looking, with flowers on their aprons, etc.  - a really refreshing nod back to more classic, historical times. And this staff was incredible in how well they treated us. My companion and I sat for two and a half hours having one of those heart-to-heart dinners with the time just flying by - and we looked up and hadn't realized how long we'd been occupying the table - and you know what? We never felt rushed or encouraged to be on our way or anything of the sort - not even once! They were kinder than ever to us. I greatly appreciate this - it's what makes having a nice dinner like this worthwhile - when you can really sit and fully enjoy the company you are with and delicious food and wine just appears in front of you at the perfect time as you are doing so. The chocolate soufflé dessert at the end was the perfect ending to a lovely evening. Thank you so much to our darling server for her understanding and in being so accommodating.
I love Leopold's. It's one of my go-to spots to take people visiting from out of town or anyone I'm with who hasn't tried it.

Definitely the best German food in the city.  Now, I love Walzwerk, and Suppenkuche, but the love they put into the dishes here, and the huge portions, is just really impressive.  And I love that they have Kostritzer on tap!!  (Though it'd be better if they had more dark beers!)

I shared the wiener schnitzel and the pan-fried trout. The schnitzel was very good, but I could do without the sides that came with it, which was too sour for me. The sides that came with the trout were delicious though. The two orders of Käsespätzle on the table looked great too!
This place is really good.  Owned by a German dude with a bubbly personality.

Freaking amazing!! The waiters were very kind, friendly & helpful. the food was just beyond delicious, we ate so much & just wanted more. Even the next morning...wishing I had leftovers. I absolutely loved the selection of beers and the glasses they used for individual beers were fun. Can't wait to go back!!

Came in here during a Giants game, and we had the place to ourselves!  Really small, cozy atmosphere, and the food was great!  Our server was a friendly, cheerful girl who was very attentive.  Huge beer selection, too.  This is a really great place for a date.

Let me start out by saying this was the absolute best "German food" I've ever had! Ordered the pork tenderloin which also came with pork sausage, an awesome dumpling, and sauerkraut that's second to none. Everything on the plate was delicious and the portions were generous. But in addition to the good food, the atmosphere and super friendly service make me want to go back again and again. I can't say enough about how welcome the staff made me feel from the second I walked in the door until the time I left. I'll most definitely make a point to return on my next visit to the city.

Excellent meal, top notch service, and you can't beat the beer. We walked up and caught the street car back to our hotel. Fun, fun dinner and was really glad we took the time to do this in San Fran. Mashed potatoes are to die for and our one year old was super tolerated. Only suggestion?  They only had booster seats, not high chairs.

With Yelp at my helm, I sailed by the Golden Gate bridge, full steam into Picky-dom,  ecstatic for being in San Francisco after so many years absence.  I admit, I feel like anything less than a 4 star average rating these days should be ignored.  At least until I have exhausted all that 4-5 stars has to offer. San Francisco Yelpers made it easy to choose what should go in my mouth next.  It is so easy to be picky in SF.
Let me tell you a story:
Vielen Dank Leopold's for your hospitality, great food, good beer selection (that's why I went there!), and service.
Very fun restaurant. The waitresses wear lederhosen, the beer is served in glass boots and the food is delicious. The servings are large and overall a very fun atmosphere.

I'm a born and raised San Franciscan and this is hands down one of my favorite restaurants that has ever been in business in SF. From the staff & owners, to the food, to the ambiance it is top notch. The braised short rib makes my mouth water just thinking about it. One warning, DO NOT go here if you are looking for a quiet romantic dinner as it can get pretty noisy and a little rowdy on Fridays & Saturdays
Some of the best choucroute in town!  Wonderful short ribs. All served by the friendliest waitress we've had in years!  Huge beer selection. Great evening surrounded by a happy crowd of people.
PROST! That's the german word for cheers because the moment you step into this place is when you will feel the ambience of all things German.

Wonderful place!! Huge portions (I ha the choucouterie which was a combo plate including pork loin, ribs, sausage, potatoes, and saurkraut---had leftovers for breakfast today) that were yummy and Nadine was great!!! She gave us an appropriate suggestion for an app (meat plate) that was fantastic!

Fun place to go before a night out. There is a nice beer selection. The food is okay but not stellar. The sausage is good but everything else we had was meh. It's overpriced for the quality of the food but still a fun neighborhood joint.
This place is amazing! One of the best meals I've had! The goulash and combo pork plate are stellar!

Authentic Austrian food and beer.  Especially like the seasonal German draft rotations.   Linzer tart and apple strudel dessert were freshly made and spectacular.  Owner is Austrian, jovial and friendly!  Went out of his way to find a table for us without a reservation at a packed house.

This place has great beer but that's it. The ratings here are probably based on the beer or from drunk people eating. The food is not that good, everything was Okay but I would never come back for food. I ordered the Cured Salmon, Pig Trotters and Schnitzel.
Very wide selection of beers!!!! of very very good beers:) Amazingly tasty meat dishes.

We love this place. The food (authentic as it could ever be) is consistently good as is the service. Beers on Tap- always a great selection. the tip is to make sure to tell the server the timing that you desire on food- otherwise it may come out sooner than expected if you are wanting a more leisurely meal.   Of note, tonight was a crazy night in SF and Joe and Kristen (sp) did an awesome job making sure our night was special. Living just down the block, this will continue to be a regular spot for us   Prost!

Cute, authentic, good music. Very carby menu. Goulash was solid. Mom loved her waffle (went for brunch, which was kind of quiet). Was jealous of the table that had the big platter of meats and cheeses - which seemed like it was off-menu. I'd go back for that and maybe a beer, which I do so rarely.

Great atmosphere  and great food. We had homemade sausage with sauerkraut and caraway potatoes which is probably the best sausage I've had and WienerSchnitzel with potato-cucumber salad. Schnitzel was amazingly crisp and salad had great combination of flavors. There were a lot of german-speaking guests which is a good sign
Great food, great beer and friendly servers. Fun atmosphere and you will walk away with a smile on your face.  What more could you ask for.

I went to Leopold's for brunch, and perhaps that was the mistake. The poached egg on my hash was undercooked at first, so they took it back and then was overcooked when they brought it back. I didn't bother sending it back though since it wasn't too big of a deal. As I kept eating, I then noticed a hair in my hash.

I love this place - it's fun, homey, and really reminded me of a smaller scale of the beer hall in Munich. However, Germans don't drink with the boot really, it's more like an American thing such as the so called German chocolate cake.

This place is kind of theme-heavy, it looks like a chalet inside and even the waiters and waitresses are dressed up in Austrian attire. The atmosphere was lively and small and I ordered a hefeweizen and the schnitzel, which I thought was lacking in flavor. I dipped it in the lingonberry sauce but I've had much better schnitzel. I tried the ghoulash but was not impressed with that either. I came away just feeling meh.
So i gave this place a second chance after my first review and I am glad I did!

I came here with a huge group of friends (about 12) the other day and Leopold's was very accommodating. I had the Ksesptzle, the Austrian mac and cheese, and it was delicious. The portion was huge and very cheesy just the way I like it. I also tried their Choucroute Garni Platter. Their house-made bratwurst was very tasty as well as their  potatoes. I'm not a huge fan of German food, but this place was pretty tasty.

OH wow. Seriously? LOVE this place. Spent a lot of time in Germany and this is probably one of the few places I've been that got it right. I mean, native German-speaking servers were there. From the first beer until we walked out, I was in love. I really had a hard time deciding if the schnitzel or the Austrian mac n cheese (spaetzle dish) was the best, but I would've probably gorged on more of it if the prices hadn't stopped me or the wife. Honestly, would recommend and would definitely go back.
Went here with some friends and this place was great.
i wish i could give zero star. very very VERY RUDE waitress. i will never come back again, and definitely will share my experience with all my friends.
I love this place. It's small, has a great atmosphere and the owner is always friendly and jolly no matter how late it is or how intoxicated his customer are.

Two stars for great service, tasty Austrian beer, and dessert, all else was not good. The house made sausage is flavorless, as in no spices added and the meat tasted off. The short ribs were super dry and their mashed potatoes def didn't have gruyere in them. The plates come out super hot because ... all the food is already cooked sitting back there for god only knows how long, they plate it and then stick it in a super hot oven to warm it up and completely dry it out. So sad. The goulash was okay, again with the lack of flavor and the spätzle was okay but def not work $19.75!

Leopold's sets the bar in the Bay Area for beer, and the fact that you can order them in anything from a .3 liter glass to a 3 liter boot just makes it that much better. As if their tremendous selection of Bavarian beers on tap was not enough, they also provide excellent German cuisine and a beer hall-esk atmosphere to boot (sadly, pun intended).

I went here with my friends on my birthday, and it was by far the best restaurant I've been to in the city. If you like German or Austrian food, you'll love this place. If you don't know yet whether you would, then eating here will make that clear! The scenery is the right combination of hip and authentic, with good service and amazing food and import beers. Try their goulash and wash it down with a stein of dunkelweiss!

An authentic German brasserie (though I'm not sure if Germany has brasseries). Anyways, I came here for a World Cup match and it was so much fun! (minus my team losing). I might've had a splendid time due to my boot! of champagne! (which was probably 2 bottles of champagne and then a bit of OJ on the top :-)).
Gelato was just OK and the service felt awkward and not welcoming.
I guess it over price

Great Deli and Dessert place right in the heart of North Beach on Columbus. Not much seating, basically 4 bar stools in the middle, and 2 sidewalk tables in the front. Some nice classics, like Chocolate Mousse Tort. A bit glitzy at night, but that attracts you in. Great Gelato selection in the front, Salamis in the back.
Everything is fresh you can see what you are getting the place is clean and so cute! The sandwiches taste amazing!!!

Great handmade sandwiches - many choices but not too many!  Fresh ingredients, good bread choices and quite reasonable prices for the area!  Gelato for dessert!  Limited seating but small tables on either end of the shop seemed adequate the day we were there!

Had the Goodfella Sandwich-- perfectly crafted and packed with flavors. Went back in immediately after the sandwich for gelato for dessert. Amazing/friendly/funny people and amazing food. Will definitely return for more.

Delightfully real Italy! The owner immediately greeted us and served incredible portions of the most delicious gelato...and I promptly noticed the dry salami...wonderful with the sharp cheddar slices and a latte to share with my bride. There's a new found affection for this place. We're setting Alimento's as our new Italian standard in our favorite city.
One word: perfect. Service feels like family & the sandwiches were just right.
The guy was rude! He totally rushed us when no one was even behind us. Rude. I've had better gelato in Berkeley.

This place is fantastic. I went in and was about to leave because I felt like if I were to stay for too long I would buy everything in the store. The owner Chris saw me about to leave without buying anything, grabbed me by the arm, and asked me what I want that he doesn't have. With a friendly little back and forth, he agreed to make me a sandwich and said he would pay for it if I didn't love it. I loved the sandwich, and have added this place to my list of great places to go in San Francisco. Chris is awesome and so is his shop. Do yourself a favor and go there!

This place is really expensive! Jeez... I'm really hoping that they just overcharged my by accident looking at the reviews below.... because $15 for one flavor in a cone and another cone with two flavors is really, really expensive! That means it's about $7 per cone or $5 for my bf's single flavor scoop and $10 for my double scoop! Two gelatos nearly cost as much as one entree at an Italian restaurant in the Little Italy neighborhood...

My friends and I stopped here after dinner one night while in North Beach to get some dessert instead of opting for the in restaurant option.  I literally might have walked by this place in the past but never actually stopped in.  Gelato galore and lots of cool products lined the shelves and walls of the place.  I knew I felt like a sorbet gelato which are usually my simple favorites when it comes to this Italian treat.

The Gelato here was amazing, and the atmosphere of this little shop was authentic feeling. If you have a sweet tooth and are in the San Francisco area, I highly suggest coming here for a nice dessert. The white chocolate raspberry and coconut almond gelatos were fantastic.

Don't save paper, get a receipt or get conned. Cute sandwich & sweet shop for locals and tourists but the register guy will try to over charge u when u least expect it. I sensed that he thought that I was a foreigner , as I was speaking portuguese to my out of town family members.

This has been our 3rd trip to Alimento's and it is by far a neighborhood favorite for my husband and I. We have gotten the Mafioso sandwich the last 2 trips (added avocado) and it is just delicious. You can tell how fresh the ingredients are and they use Molinari meats (yummy).

Gelato is apparently made with half the buttermilk fat that ice cream is made with and significantly less sugar. Because of this, Gelato is served in smaller portions because the flavor is much richer. But you know what? I still go for the double scoop waffle cone at Alimento because the counter man is very generous with his servings and this gelato is just too good. Hazelnut and Espresso Chip are my favorite flavors. Service is great and of course it is in North Beach. What's not to love?
My date and I were taking a post-dinner walk around north beach to walk off our feast and stumbled upon Alimento. Gelato melts so of course there was room in my belly for more.
Great sandwiches, great service...highly recommend stopping in.  Everything is fresh and delicious!

I never imagined I would find a good hot dog in North Beach, but I am happy to say I found one of the best hot dogs I've ever had. Alimento has a variety of sandwiches and puts an interesting spin on all (at the least the dozen or so I've had). They are very particular about assembling their sandwiches so don't be in a big hurry - it's definitely worth the wait. I am the ultimate hot dog fan and Alimento creates the best one I've ever had.  By the way, their gelato is fantastic, extremely flavorful - try the black cherry!

Omg! Delicious to the max! And open late , what more could you ask. I espessially love the fact that they have an assortment of goodies and gelato flavors. Great, fast, friendly service . Don't even go across the street, forget about it. !!!!! I mean I know I'm just visiting San Francisco but I will definitely be back to have this again next time I'm around.

We tried the Siciliano, Goodfella, and Milanese. Best sandwiches we've had in years. The Rum Raisin gelato was great. Reminded me of something my Abuela would make, when I was a kid. Owner was very welcoming and personable. What an enjoyable experience.
Italian meats at their best, I thoroughly enjoyed their Goodfella sandwich. The owner was also quite nice, and we left happy.
One of the greatest Italian sandwiches I ever had in my life.

My wife and I were in town visiting friends and stopped at this place while roaming the streets of SF.  We we came in for sandwiches and left as customers for life.  We'll definitely stop by and see Chris, the owner, every time we're in town.  He's extremely nice and approachable and went out of his way to make us feel welcome.  After purchasing sandwiches and some other things for the trip home, he offered us free coffee and sweets (hellooooooo cannoli).  That's quality service and a man striving to make his customers feel welcome and at home.
Great place if you want a taste of Italy in San Francisco.

Had a wonderful time at Alimento. Me and my friends tried their gelato and we all agree that this is the best gelato we've had in San Francisco. My favorite was the coconut almond and pistachio. We got to try as many sample as we wanted and they were super friendly. We'll be back!!
Great coffee, great ice cream and awesome customer service. The owner Chris is super friendly

Its been a year and i am still going to alimento everyday while working. From Sandwiches, gelato to Coffee sometimes even meeting up with lady luck i am always satisfied.  They always have whatever i want to eat, if not sandwiches they have salads and even thin crust pizzas.  I literally go there for a Morning cappuccino, sandwich for lunch and chai tea to end my day.  This is a place for my one stop shop.   Staff is always friendly and helpful, you can tell this store is amazing because the owner really care about the quality in their food and services.  this is one of the most cleanest deli i encountered.  I will always go back!

This cute lil Italian deli / dessert had much to offer in flavor and choices. I built my own sand which. Turkey, cucumber, lettuce, pesto, mayo, olive oil, salt, swiss, and avocado. The serving size fits the price and even half a sandwich was filling, but I ate the whole thing. The workers are pleasant and kind, the owner was very involved with greeting guests and making sure we all felt welcomed and enjoyed our meals. They made my sandwich quick too.

I was craving something italian for lunch today, so I looked up places in North Beach and came across this one. The reviews were very good, so I had high expectations - and I was definitely not let down.
Alimento is not only a delicious and fresh deli but their management and customer service is stellar.
This is our favorite gelato spot.  They have a great selection to choose from and haven't found another gelato place we like as much as this place.

Great Italian deli! We had wonderful sandwiches and caprese salad, and the service was very friendly and attentive. Nice spot out back to enjoy lunch on a beautiful SF September day!  Our teenage boys had us bring home extra meat and cheese so they can try to recreate the sandwiches at home. :) Will definitely be back!

This place. So close to my house & always dependable when it comes to a dealio us sandwich. My recommendation is either the Cuban or the Mafioso, but only if you're feeling the seriously italian. Also get the gelato. Do it. You won't do it.
The owner is an incredible guy and very cordial. Delicious food and fresh choices.

Stopped by after dinner for some dessert -gelato- and was blown away with the fresh deli and great service.  Where else can you find great deli, fresh bread and authentic salami.  The owner, Chris, treats everyone like family and the rest if the staff was really friendly.  By the way the banana-Heath bar gelato was phenomenal.  This will be a regular stop when I am in San Fran.

Great little North Beach Italian deli and gelataria! The sandwiches were bomb, made with good quality ingredients - fresh produce and premiums sliced meats. A bit pricey but the sandwiches are fairly big (and honestly what isn't overpriced in SF these days).

I've continued to go back many times since my first review and after getting myself adjusted to SF prices, I now feel like this place deserves 5 stars. Fantastic sandwiches made with great care every time. Give this place a try!

Calabrese Sandwich was amazing, great hot spread (good flavorful heat).  Followed it with a cappuccino and a slice of cheesecake.  This is a great little shop with a very helpful staff.  Will return again!

Great place for gelato or your favorite italian treats! The owner, Chris, is great! Love stopping in here and grabbing some gelato at night and some biscotti for my coffee in the morning. Highly recommend!
One of my favorites in all of San Francisco.  Great for romantic dinners, or a business dinner.   The food is excellent and the staff are incredible.

Unfortunately Frascati did not live up to our expectations. The old-fashioned bread pudding for dessert was the delicious highlight. In Russian Hill I have had better meals for less money. The entrees were mediocre.
Frascati is one of the best restaurants in the city we ever tried ! Everything was tasty and delicious. Perfect service.

We were lucky enough as tourists to spot this gem from the cable car.  We ate at the corner window table and watched the neighborhood come alive in the evening.  We sampled the appetizer menu and the well priced wine list.

Outstanding neighborhood restaurant.  Great service and excellent food.  Our group shared apps of steak tartare, bruschetta and figs with blue cheese.  I had their pork porterhouse as a main.  It was wonderful, as was a friend's roast chicken.  Also great was their bread pudding for dessert.  I wish I lived in Russian Hill so I could drop by anytime.
Parking is a PAIN.

I love a good steak dinner, and Frascati makes an OUTSTANDING filet mignon. It was so good that it turned my cooter into the Fountains of Bellagio, with music playing and all. Not only was it presented in an amazing sauce, but it also had a generous dollop of this tasty white stuff on top (which might have been herbed butter, not cum). The meat was so tender and flavorful. I scarfed down my portion and wanted more.

What a great gem of a restaurant! Walking in I felt like I was in Italy, the vibe of the restaurant makes you want to stay there for hours.  Our server was amazing, she was friendly, witty, and knew what to recommend. The food, was incredible - I had the halibut and could easily have had 2 servings.  The wine selection was great, we were there on a hot night so chilled wine really hit the spot.

This place has a relaxed, homey and down to earth ambiance while giving comfort food an upscale, yet unpretentious, twist. Everything they did was done very well and there was no sense of them trying to stretch beyond that, which is refreshing in a city where a lot of restaurants try to be more than they are.

Small, but so big on flavor and service! Whilst visiting San Francisco, I had the pleasure of dining here. The Owners (maybe he was a manager) greeted us; they were attentive. I ordered the Pappardelle which was probably one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. The grilled bread salad was also a great starter. My fellow diners raved out their pork chop as well! We ordered a cheese plate and a mushroom bruschetta to eat while we waited on our friends; they were also fantastic. Recommend if you are ever in Russian Hill.

This place has been consistent. The maitre d is great. The servers are great except for the one woman who addresses the tables primarily for the order. Unfortunately she doesn't know how any of the dishes are prepared. So be prepared that you're on your own. But the good news is that the menu fluctuates little except by season. The duck: over cooked. Skin undercooked. Consistently underwhelming. Pork chop great but commonly over brined and raw near bone. No one seems to know how the octopus salad is made but they could always do better with fresh octopus rather than needing to poach it, marinade it and then fire it. Pass. The pappardelle is great. More sausage to noodles would be great. I find their pairings to be very sharp in contrast. Take the duck salad. Where you may want to see a nice lemon balance with a duck salad, they put maytag blue on it. It's like throwing a hand grenade into the whole dish muting the subtle warm rich tones of confit duck. Good neighborhood gem and more like the typical versus the rare brasserie. The lava bread cake was microwaved and in 15 minutes it was rock hard. What a shame.
Great Halibut entree. Restaurant was too warm in October and menu was a little limited. 4 out of 5 overall though.

Delicious! Frascati is the kind of neighborhood restaurant everyone wishes to have within a short walk from home. Well thought out creative menu, excellent curated wine list, and a dessert menu you can't pass up. All this combined with an experienced staff which provided great service made for a perfect night out.

When you find yourself trying not to get chicken at a restaurant. Do not resist at this place. The chicken here is cooked to perfection. Gnocchi as a starter was simple and yummy. Wine was paired perfectly. Dessert was good but I should have tried the Panna cotta. It looked yummy.
Hip little place...amazing steak, great wine selection and the chocolate bread pudding and hazelnut ice cream was fabulous. Definitely going back!

The food and service here is fantastic. I had passed by this place many times and always wanted to try it.  Luckily we got the last reservation on a Saturday night because we saw them turn people away.

We got to sit in the corner table overlooking the intersection. There was no air circulation at this corner table on this rare 80+ summer day on san francisco. But this is not the reason I gave this cute little restaurant 3 stars. We had made reservations for 4 and having parking is hard to find! We circled for about 30+ min and finally found a spot on vaness . Upon arriving, the other half of our party was seated and we the server approached us in a unfriendly (bitchface) demeanor. Asked us about drinks and then came back and asked us about the order (no explanation of dishes, specials, or recommendation). We ordered the fig/prosciutto appetizer, kale risotto, and duck breast. The food was great but the server was mediocre and looked like he hated his life and his job. Would love to grab food here for Togo in order to avoid a sour face that would ruin my appetite.
Amazing first dinner as newlyweds! Food and service was spectacular! Best fish I've had in a while. Will go back when we visit again.

This place is amazing! Took my partner here for his birthday and we absolutely loved the food and the wonderful service. I highly recommend the maple duck, the filet mignon, the gnocchi appetizer and the peach and blueberry cobbler! Every piece of food we received on our table tonight was cooked perfectly. My partner -- who is incredibly hard to please -- said that the filet mignon was the best food he's ever tasted. Also, the waitress that we had (Coni) was really superb! She's funny and perceptive about our needs as customers. She even brought out a little candle for our birthday dessert. So glad we came here. We will be back again!

If I could give this place 6 stars I would! I had a reservation for 8:45p but got there around 7p. We were not too dressed up but the waiter made us feel very welcome. Offered to seat us at the bar. Every course we had was amazing! My friend ordered the figs for an appetizer which was sweet and decadent. I ordered the fresh pappardelle with beef and basically licked the plate clean. The deserts were so rich! I ordered the chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream and my friend ordered the peach blueberry cobbler...so delicious. Definitely recommend!
Went last weekend with a group of friends and our experience was strange to say the least.
The bread pudding is so delicious, I'm willing to let it violate my mouth in the middle of the night.

This was a disappointment.   With such great reviews we expected more.  The service was good, the ambience tasteful tho nothing special and the cheese plate was a decent start.   But it was downhill from there.  My GFs dish (gnocchi) was dry and uninspired.  My pappardelle was too watery to really show it's flavour.
Frascati is a terrific, friendly, neighborhood spot. The food is always reliably good and the service makes you feel right at home.  This is a place to come back to, time and time again.

Thank you again Yelp! While traveling my husband and I wanted to get a five star meal without any of the added expense and commercialism of touristy San Francisco. We found it here in this intimate bistro. Food was superb and service great. While the duck, as others have mentioned, was wonderful, the best thing I ate was the mushroom bruschetta appetizer. A great find!

This is one of the numerous excellent neighborhood restaurants in San Francisco. We started with the delicious wild mushroom bruschetta. I had the best roasted chicken dish that I've ever had1 My husband enjoyed his beef pappardelle as well. We finished with a lovely peach-blueberry cobbler. We'll definitely be back!
Cozy, great service and just amazing quality fine dining!
Frascati is the ultimate date spot for a special occasion or just a nice grown-up weekend dinner.

Frascati has that warm, inviting neighborhood charm mixed with fine dining.  A cozy little place with a quiet upstairs dining area.  Get the table that's overlooking the kitchen and enjoy watching the cooks work their magic.  The duck breast and grilled octopus salad were absolutely delicious, both recommended by our fabulous server,Julia, who kicked our dining experience up a level!  Julia wins my Best Server award!  She has such positive energy and spirit that just gave us such joy to share that space with her.  Will definitely go back!
Great neighborhood restaurant- the food is always lovely and the quiet atmosphere is perfect. Very accommodating and gracious service!

After a bummer day, my friends decided to treat ourselves to dinner at Frascati. Everyone was nice when we walked in. The gnocchi, octopus, pork and duck dishes were really delicious. They really have a way with meats and sauces. Dessert and wine were fine. Best of all, steering us through the all-star menu was our waitress Julia. Not only did she know the menu well, but she has that rare quality about a person (kindness, good cheer, sincerity and a sense of well being) that we were all just honored to have run into her. We were having such fun whenever she stopped by that we joked she should sit down with us for dessert. What a great meal, and what great staff! We'll be back, hopefully soon.

We just walked in on a Saturday and got seated. The cable car stops right there which makes a great start on the SanFrancisco experience and ambience. We had the best service during the whole night. The cheese platter had Epoisses on it, my favorite cheese in the world, so I had to order it. The Sardines were not great so my husband was at first disappointed. But then the main course came and the Maple Leaf Duck Breast was incredible and so was the Pan Seared Bass they had that day. We found a very good bottle of wine as well. We wished we had room for dessert especially their bread pudding which looked so yummy but we just couldn't. I would highly recommend this restaurant.
Came here on a walk-in, and didn't expect much, but I was pretty impressed with the overall dinner experience.

WOW! let's just say i'm thoroughly impressed by frascati.  dare i say they are the epitome of how dining out should be in sf...yep i said it and i meant every word.  we were about one hour early for our reservation(yes, one full hour) and thought, what the heck, let's see if they'll seat us.  the guy in charge, john, was so accommodating and actually sat us!  it was our lucky day!  we ordered the cheese plate, gnocchi, octopus salad, him the pork chop, and me the halibut.  i could not find fault in any one of our dishes.  seriously.  gnocchi was so soft and fluffy.  the accompanying sauce was delicious.  octopus was amazing.  cheese plate, well you can't go wrong with cheese.  one word to describe my halibut would be perfection.  the meat was flaky and fresh and juicy and just everything you look for in a piece of cooked fish.  my boyfriend's pork chop was really something.  not at all tough or dry, it was in his words way better than the chop they serve at nopa.  we finished off the night with their black and white bread pudding and basil cheesecake.  needless to say i was a full and happy camper by the end of dinner.
The food was top notch. Had the duck and it was perfect. Sweet corn bisque was excellent. And the staff was top notch. Would highly recommend
Its been a while and I should have already reviewed them because the food is great.

I thought the food was very good as was the service.  They have a room upstairs toward the back that looked very nice for small groups...up to about 10.  We were unable to get our preferred time of 6:30, but saw lots of empty tables when we arrived.  Very curious.

I'm a bit disappointed with Frascati, having seen the general reviews and the restaurant's promising menu beforehand. I was here for a celebration, and despite having a reservation we waited a bit longer than usual since the restaurant was fairly cramped a couple hours after opening for dinner. The tomato soup of the day was a bit thick and not very well-seasoned. Their maple leaf duck breast and roasted half chicken were pretty average, albeit a bit overcooked and under-seasoned as well. Really nothing to write home about there. My favorite was their black and white chocolate bread pudding, which complemented well with their hazelnut ice cream and caramel sauce. I would give this place a second try, but with so many other enticing restaurants in San Francisco, it may be a while before I return.
Great experience and food.  The octopus salad is amazing.

Parking: parking is TERRIBLE. We had reservations at 8pm on a Tuesday night and it took us at least 30-40 minutes just to find parking. The staff at the restaurant recommended parking in the parking lot on Broadway and Polk, we drove around but couldn't locate the lot and eventually parked 10 minutes away.

Came in late on a Tuesday night around 9:30pm with two friends for my last meal before leaving SF for a few months. We were promptly seated and all the tables/chairs were arranged in an intimate fashion. The server was polite and recommended the sausage plate, which I ended up getting. It was delicious and the portion was sizable! My friends got the risotto, which I tried. It was extremely well prepared - one of the best risottos I have tasted in a while. The dark storm is the drink of choice for anyone who is a dark rum lover like myself, and it couldn't have been better. The decor, atmosphere and music all matched to provide a cozy and intimate dining experience. Extremely pleased with the food, restaurant and service.
Had dinner yesterday in this small restaurant.
I love this place. You know when you ask your server for suggestions and you get a bland response? Not here. Our server was full of feedback and very helpful.
The burger was solid, as was my wife's buttermilk fried chicken (apparently a limited item). Nice cozy atmosphere, and really reasonable prices.

Came here on a Friday night around 7:30.  Looked busy, but they sat us right away at an available table. I had the burger which was cooked perfectly medium rare, as I had requested.  My boyfriend had the prime rib, which he said was very good.  I ordered the prosecco, and when it came time to ask for another glass, it took a while to arrive.  The waitress brought it over and explained that this second glass was on the house because they were out of the original one I had been drinking and had to find a replacement and it took longer than it should have.  I didn't mind at all, and that kind of attention to detail and customer service was greatly appreciated.  Great atmosphere, quite dark, but a good date night spot for sure.

This restaurant is exemplified by what they hand make everyday: sausages, pasta, infused vodka, and every dessert they serve (these are just the examples from our groups order). A couple thoughts on our experience

Where do I start!! I'd love to start with the clam and rock shrimp chowder but let's start from when I walked in the door. I was offered a table but knew instantly that I needed to sit at the bar with the heart of the restaurant. I could almost hear her praises from the polar opposite side of the world and what I heard was AMY AMY AMY!! I hardly toot horns but she was so on top of not just the drinks but the menu as well! If you have a night to spare or just a spare hour stop by and say hi!! P.S. The souffléd goat cheese and arugula meal is over the top!!

Aftering checking Yelp reveiws, my wife and I visited Street over the weekend and we're thrilled we did.  We arrived early and decided to have a drink at the bar.  We were greeted by a fantastic bartender named Amy, Saint Amy in fact.  She was extremely helpful in selecting beer and wine, and made appetizer suggestions.  All the suggestions were perfect and we decided to sit at the bar for dinner.  Again, Amy was very helpful with dinner suggestions. We ordered the wontons to start, and enjoyed the tuna and sausage sampler for entrees.  We followed that up with bread pudding for dessert-all delicious.  The restarant is relativley small but they do take reservations.  If you have any trouble getting a table, I would strongly suggest grabbing a spot at the bar and enjoying a clear view of the kitchen where John prepares masterful yet simple meals, and the company of Saint Amy.

Mediocre food that took forever to make. Ordered the calamari appetizer first which took about 5 minutes to get to us. But time between ordering and getting the entrees was more than 30 minutes. We ordered the steak and bolognese which were both ok. Service was excellent and atmosphere was good but ... Maybe the kitchen was experiencing some issues although I've also read in other yelpers' reviews about the excessive time it takes for the food to get on the table.
Yum-my!  The Mac and Cheese is a must have with the applewood bacon.  The burger was fresh and tasty!  Glad we found this place. It's cool!
Food was fantastic and at a good price. I had the new York steak and it was easily one of the best steaks I've ever had. My wife had the macaroni and cheese which was also excellent.
I've been going here for years and street has never disappointed. By far the best Burger in the city, but anything you get will be damn good.

Definitely one of my new favorite restaurants in SF! Great service, lovely ambiance, cute, cozy, & quiet. I came here with a party of 4 and we had a wonderful experience. The wine was great and the food was delicious! I recommend trying the mushroom risotto, so amazing. The Brussel sprouts are also a must!

Great food and fast efficient service. Calamari starter is a winner, along with the Ahi main which is served with mash and green beans. My only change would be to serve this with a  wasabi mayonnaise. The crab cakes are also fantastic.

Just a burger? Just a burger? it's so much more than just a burger. I, I mean, that first bite. Oh what heaven that first bite is. The bun, like a sesame-freckled breast of an angel, resting gently on the ketchup and mustard below. Flavors mingling in a seductive pas de deux. And then, a pickle, the most playful little pickle, then a slice of tomato, a leaf of lettuce, and a... A patty of ground beef so exquisite, swirling in your mouth, breaking apart, and combining again in a fugue of sweets and savories so delightful. This is no mere sandwich of grilled meat and toasted bread. This is God, speaking to us through food.
I have been here for million times, and this review is way long over due.

This is a great place to have a quality meal with friends without breaking the bank. I had the steak salad, cooked perfectly and good portion. I am a hard critic of steak salads and this one was one of the best I have had in a while! Cute environment inside with good art on the walls. As an MFA, this is also something I pay attention to. My beau had the shrimp and clam linguini which had great flavor, but if you are looking for a big bowl of pasta I would try the pasta with meat sauce instead. Flavor trumped portion with his dish but we all left full and happy! They overcharged a couple of bucks for our bottle of wine and the salami appetizer but were quick to fix this on the bill. Wait staff was great and the chef even took the time to talk to us as we left to make sure we enjoyed our food. Would definitely come back! This is a great date spot.
Came here with my girlfriend and they were so friendly and prompt as I was happy and sofisticating well. I loved them much. Good location and awesome decoration as well.
My boyfriend and I had originally made

If you know of a better burger in San Francisco, please let me know. I've yet to find it and I've had plenty. The burgers here are outstanding!! The mac 'n cheese, flash-fried calamari with spicy thai dipping sauce, and fried chicken (on Sunday nights) are also great. And the food ALWAYS comes out piping hot! That's a major plus in my book. Wash it all down with one of their signature cocktails and you'll be good to go. The Moscow Mule with house made ginger syrup and the Manhattan are both excellent. If you're looking for a casual spot with a friendly vibe and good ole fashioned comfort food, look no further.
What a pleasant surprise.  We were walking around looking for a place to eat and this popped up on yelp near us.

A favorite spot for an above average casual meal.  The menu is small and I wish it changed more frequently, but there are several items that are done very well.  Especially good are the kale caesar, gazpacho, pasta Bolognese, and linquine with clams.  I'm afraid to get the fried chicken because several people seem addicted to it.  Shout out to our favorite bartender Monica.  We always try to eat dinner at the bar because she's the best!
My lovely wife and I enjoyed yet another casual meal out at what is quickly becoming a neighborhood favorite of ours.

My first 5 star review. So damn good on all levels. Food, ambiance, experience. I started with the steamed clams then baby kale salad then tomato bisque. All perfect. Oh, and the malbec was very lovely as well. My friend had the steak and seemed to enjoy also. Parking on Polk sucks, that's my only disclaimer. Enjoy!

The first time I went here with a large group, it was a decent experience. We had to wait for setting, but with no reservations, thats what we get. Food was cooked quickly and served quickly, waitstaff was courteous, everyone was happy.

T'was my boyfriend's birthday last night and it was the perfect spot!  It was a little past 9:30PM when we arrived and the waitress informed us (kindly I must add) that the kitchen was closing up in about 15 minutes (closes on Thursday's at 10PM) but never hassled us about choosing quickly like they do at many restaurants.  Everything was very prompt and yet amazing!  I was sure that the food was "iffy" because it arrived so quickly after our rather tasty Martinis.  My boyfriend had a regular Lime Martini while I had the Fig, which was rather delicious.  It made me remember why I love Martinis so much.
It might seem crazy what I'm 'bout to say. Sunshine she's gone, but you can still take a break. I'm a hot air balloon that could go to space With the air like I don't care, baby, by the way.
3.5 Stars

I live a block and a half from this restaurant and for the past 8 years I've frequented Street at least once a month. The Sunday fried chicken is out of control. John the chef pretty much rocks with all the dishes he serves. The steak is outrageous, as is the hummus appetizer. Very fair prices. Nice staff. Highly recommend.
Very excited to try this cozy New American spot on Polk, but was severely disappointed.

Amazing! I had the souffléd goat cheese custard with mixed lettuces and tapenade crouton. My friends had risotto with wild white prawns, red chard, basil, reggiano and truffle oil; the short rib and a lamb dish. Paired with some red wine, good laughs, excellent ambiance and service and DELICIOUS (we tried them all) desserts, I would highly recommend this great spot on Polk.

I took a friend out for a nice casual dinner. This place was super nice, the waitress rocked. I had the mixed grill which is lamb chops and sausage. So tender it almost fell off the bone. I would recommend for a nice date night  :)

It is a small place on Polk which is a busy corridor for restaurants and wine bars. I had the fried chicken which was fine. The mash was superb, but overall it was just a mediocre meal. Nothing particular wrong with anything, but not much to write home about either. My foodie friend, Sara, would say, "meh"
**Review is for drinks only.**

My boyfriend and I went here for dinner on a Tuesday night.  The place was only half full, but it took a good 45 minutes to get our dinner (fried chicken).  When we asked the waitress nicely if our order had been lost, she seemed very annoyed.  Each plate had 3 perfectly formed triangles (unusual for fried chicken), and it was the driest most bland fried chicken I have ever tasted.  We were both very hungry and yet only ate half.  We left with a $66 tab (including $10 tip), and both said that it was the worse fried chicken either of us had ever tasted.  Total rip off for what we were served.
For as simple and modern as Street is, I wish there were more places like this along Polk Street.

The food and dessert were amazing! I had the steak salad and it was perfect! I have yet to try the fried chicken. It was not on the menu when I ate here but will keep checking back for it. The peanut butter ice cream was delicious as well! Ambience was a little dark. I will definitely be returning here! Service was great as well!
Street..... You are our new late night goto! My steak and blue cheese salad and manhattan were mind blowing! See you soon

Street is my favorite go-to for comfort food in a comfortable environment.  I always feel like a part of the family.  Monica is a fantastic bartender, and the food is precisely what it appears to be: comfortable, not fancy, just great real food.
#worst
Zarzuela has a diverse menu of dishes to choose from, and they are all delicious.
Potato brava was a lazy dish of fried potatoes with a tasteless tomato sauce. The roasted peppers looked like something out of a can.
Excellent, authentic tapas in a lively, frenetic environment.

The jamón with bread+tomato is really delicious, they use a good quality of jamón. The pulpo a gallega is also delicious and flavorful. After having the appetizers, we moved on to the arroz caldoso. Unfortunately it was not so good. It didn't have much flavor, the fish was overcooked and the collor was not bright. We found it very pricey for what we got - although we like the 2 first dishes.
Food is super yummy! They don't take reservations since the place is small. The people are friendly. Come early if you want to be seated right away the place gets really busy.

My friend and I were hoping for a tasty tapas dinner at a nice place. While we enjoyed the ambiance, we were unimpressed by the tapas. From what we ordered, i was left under impression that they don't know how to cook. At all. We didn't finish our dishes and didn't have any desire to pack them to go. We had quail, potatoes, empanadas, sausages and mushrooms. Mushrooms were the only good dish. Flavorless quial, dry potatoes, soggy empanadas, nothing special sausages. On a good note, they have an interesting selection of red wines (as you may note, they don't have a chance of ruinung them by cooking). Their sangria is kind of lame, tastes artificial.

SO. GOOD. The giant white beans with ham, the quail, the prawns... All SO GOOD. I will definitely be back. I don't have anything bad to say. The service was good, the atmosphere was good, and the food just really hit the spot. The quail was my favorite, hands down.

If I could give this place negative 20 stars, I would. My wife and I went to this place for a birthday party, we got there and the table where the party was was full, so we had to sit on the other side of the very small restaurant. We sat there, and after 15 minutes, we still didn't have anyone ask us  what we wanted to drink or eat. They kept on ignoring us like we were invisible. I will never return to this place! I am Spanish and many of my family members are still in Spain and I have been to Spain. All I know is that if a Spaniard from Spain were to be treated the way I was treated, they would have spit in the owner's face. Bad service=no more customers. Two thumbs down, this place sucks!

I waited to go to this place for over a year and then I went and then I was disappointed.  Bland is the right adjective for this place. I wish it was better because I live two blocks away. It seems like a tourist trap, that's because it is.
There were a few stars to our meal:
Missed me some authentic Tortilla Espanola (Spanish omelette), and Zarzuela satisfied (and for only $6!!)  Also split the Bizcocho Gitano (chocolate spongecake) which was yummy.

One of my favorite restaurants in Russian Hill. Liked every dish we've had there except the potato with tomato sauce. My favorite dish there is the Paella, the Spanish pie of the day (they have variations) and the Shishito pepper (a little pricey though, last time we ordered it, it was 7.95 for a tapa dish).

This place has the most authentic croquetas outside of Spain that I've ever had. All other Spanish places I've tried have gotten the texture wrong, but Zarzuelas nailed it! The croquetas were light and creamy and so damn delicious. We also had patatas bravas, gazpacho, goat cheese with tomato sauce, and a meat dish that I don't remember. They were all very good, but I'm still obsessing over the croquetas. Service was quick and on point. I appreciate that you can call ahead and they'll reserve a table for you, which is key on a weekend night since the restaurant isn't very big. I was also very impressed with the price point given everything else in San Francisco seemed to be so expensive. I will be back if I ever find myself in San Francisco again.

This place is just OK, Years ago it was much better but since it has become so overly popular the staff has stopped caring and the food is assembly line production....last time I had send 2 plates back, Success ruined this place---if you want something special look elsewhere.,
This place is okay.  they don's take reservations...but it seemed family/friends can. There were a couple tables were empty the whole time during our (more than) an hour wait.

It doesn't get better than this. Every time I eat there I'm so satisfied, full and ready to force down another plate of bacon wrapped dates because they are SOOOO GOOOOD! I don't eat there nearly enough. Definitely a must in the dining out rotation. Love this place!

The food is good, I will admit. Lots of selections on the tapas and the paella is excellently made. But to rate my experience with all things in consideration, it's just alright. There can be an incredibly long wait, they may sit you on tables where you are too close to the next party (sitting on the same long table) and it's not exactly a bargain in terms of pricing.
I will never forget celebrating my 26th birthday here and having the whole restaurant sing happy birthday to me... and the delicious chocolate espresso roll cake that ended the night.

It's been a while since my last review, so it is time for an update. I still come here pretty often because we live very close so it is a convenient stumble home after dinner and a bottle of wine. I was just here 2 weeks ago and had the jamon, gambas al ajillo, octopus, shishito peppers, grilled oysters, and short ribs. Everything was great as usual. I loved the grilled oysters and octopus, which was the first time we had those dishes. The octopus was so tender, which is hard to do. I also recommend the braised quail and paella.
Their tapas were mediocre and not that all together, creative and snazzily tasty!

One of the few places I've ever eaten at and had such a good experience that I put it down in my todo list to write a review for them. I actually ate there 3 months ago, and still remember the quality of service and the quite decent food.

3.5 stars. Dinner before 6pm parking was still brutal. Food was better than average, but expected a little more due to the hype. Wish service was a little bit better. BFF needed water all night long. Server passed us 5 times, but was too busy for us to stop him for water. Felt a bit rushed as well :/ hmm
Fantastic intimate Spanish restaurant. A great date night spot. The food was authentic and delicious. Oh and be sure to try there sangria!

They take only walk-ins so the wait is long on a Saturday night but worth it.  Most items we ordered were really good, in particular the squid w aioli and the mushrooms. Service is um..., very un-American so be prepared you might be served - as we were - by an old man who doesn't feel the need to be friendly or speak to you which in a way is pretty funny.
I was craving paella so came here based on the good reviews and pictures I saw on Yelp. First time I was let down by Yelp! The paella was very bland.

Delightful relaxing Spanish Tapas experience! Stopped in after work on a Thursday. The sangria is refreshing and subtle. Food is tasty and satisfying. What we really loved was our service and the fact we didn't feel rushed. Also, the serenading by our waiter to a girl next to us for her Birthday. Go across the street for ice cream from Swensens for a nice dessert.
Fun meal, great service, tasty tapas on a busy Friday night.
Quite a wait but worth it. Wish they would split the big single bathroom into two smaller ones to cut the wait. At times the bathroom wait seems longer than the wait for a table :(

I came here around 7 and surprisingly, it wasn't very busy! But around 7:30, it was packed with a lot of people waiting outside. I guess my timing was right. Anyway, I came here with a friend and because I wasn't very hungry, tapas seemed perfect.

We showed up with a group of 12 at 8:15 and the owner said come on in. We ordered many different plates to share around the table and everything was amazing. We had many different dishes, but some of the best were the calamari, snails, paella, empanada, and this almonds in dates thing.
Excellent paella, and great service. I tend not to give away 5 stars on any restaurant. But when I'm certain of something, I'll like to share it so everyone can have the same great experience.
Great food, decent location, great service, decent prices, great servings, great wine selection.  Very glad we went here.

What a fun place, tasty small dishes that are meant to be shared. If you are coming with a group of friends, you have a great chance to try everything. I have to warn you about parking! There is no parking in this part of the town, so plan accordingly. They were out of octopus that everyone raves about on the day i was there, so it's a perfect reason to come back again.

Very good atmosphere and service. Delicious tapas that taste exactly like you are in Spain. The paella is authentic, meaning it is very good but relatively bland. I would prefer more spices, however it is one of the better paellas I have had outside of Spain.
Cozy unpretentious Tapas restaurant in Russian hill.

Loved it. They were great about pacing our dishes and ordered them perfectly. The pulpo was so tender and the anchovies had great flavor. They also brought bread, olive oil, and olives to the table, which was nice. The sangria was good but not really special. The dates to finish were delicious.

Although I usually hate seafood (minus salmon and tilapia) and this places wreaked of seafood, we had a great time! Sangria is obvs a must, yes the whole craft. We opted for the second paella (with less seafood) , still had a ton but i picked my way around it and it was  delicious. The servers were great and we got to hear the owner sing happy birthday!
Wifey and I were on a paella fit.  We heard zarzuela was the best in the city.  So, we decided to make the trek over and give it a try.
Typical tapas place. There is usually a wait, so be prepared. I have had almost everything on the menu at some point, everything is fine, but not mind blowing. The sangria is always good.

Awesome service ( Andy ) the owner is so friendly and helpful. The food is authentic and delicious. We have been there for 8 years and never disappointed!! The special sermon is outstanding. It's not on the menu
Amazing sushi!

So, I literally can't even with Elephant Sushi.  My friends who live in the area swear that this is one of the best places in SF for sushi, so I've known that I needed to at least try here at some point.
I've been here 3 times and have yet to write a review. They open at 6 and only accept reservations at 6.

Came here on a Thursday night for dinner. Wait wasn't too long for a party of 2. Great service, good sushi, interesting options and reasonably priced. Had a standard avocado/salmon roll and tried the beastie boys (which I thought were just okay). $2 sake bomb is quite a great deal as well!
Well its been well over a year since i last came here. Last time my friends convinced me to eat elsewhere due to wait. That was a serious mistake. Lovin it just as much as the first time.
Hamachi Truffle - 4.5 stars (must order)

This small and friendly neighborhood sushi restaurant is strictly for nigiri lovers. You won't find edamame, miso soup or chicken teriyaki on the menu. Instead there are delicious rolls like the red dragon and perfect nigiri including the trout, hamachi, otoro and always sublime uni. It's never fishy or metallic tasting. It's my Cheers and I love it!
My favorite sushi place EVER! IT doesn't get better than a flaming seabass roll from Elephant Sushi. No reservations, but there are plenty of places to grab a drink nearby while you wait.
Took my family here last year (4 little kids who destroy sushi like tornadoes in trailer parks).

Everything here is mind-blowingly delicious (especially the albacore tataki and white out roll), and arriving before they open/calling ahead can seriously cut your wait time down. They even take your phone number down, so you can wander over to Polk for drinks/Loving Cup while waiting.

A REALLY tiny restaurant that will make you wait 2 hours to be seated.  They only have 3 tables that seat 4, all others seat 2, and they DO NOT move tables around to accommodate.  Once you finally get seated, you HAVE TO get the flaming sea bass roll. That's a culinary experience that will make you want to smack someone.
This place has been on my list since it opened and I finally got to go last night! It totally exceeded my expectations and I'm already planning on going back soon!

Visiting from out of town and walked all the way from fishermans wharf and waited another hour but boy was it worth it.  The hamachi and trout sashimi starter were amazing.  The only thing that kept it from getting 5 stars was the beastie boys.  I think that one was a misstep for me.  The combination of sea urchin and raw qual egg didn't really do it for me.  Other than that the white out and the flaming sea bass were great.

Elephant Sushi is my favorite sushi spot in town. Their rolls are super fresh and creative. The staff is very friendly and you can see the brothers who own the place roll sushi all night long. My favorite thing here is to get sake bombs and the flaming see bass as well as the roll that has banana in it.
I so badly wanted to give this place 5 stars, 6 stars if I could. The food is absolutely delicious and my first few experiences were great, but I can't after my last visit to Elephant sushi.

Elephant Sushi is not your traditional Japanese sushi place: the focus is less on perfectly fresh fish than inventive and unique rolls, which are still very delicious in their own right. Freshness fortunately doesn't suffer, so it's still worth it. I really liked the Beastie Boys - you get uni, monkfish liver and a little quail egg yolk served gunkan-style. It's very rich, but the rice cuts through the richness some and the ingredients just melts and oozes in your mouth.

The Sushi is simply amazing. Especially the sashimi. Really fresh and tastful. I can highly recommend this place. This will be my new sushi hot spot. The wine is a little pricy I must say. Nevertheless, amazing Sushi!!!
Wow. This place is great. The beastie boys and sea bass were unique and delicious. I would go back here just for that.

This is a great place for rolls. They do an excellent job of introducing new and interesting flavors/combinations to the dishes they serve. If you're looking for good old traditional amazing nigiri, keep looking - this ain't that kinda place.

Overall, this is my favorite place to eat in SF. The sushi is very fresh and flavorful, and there are a lot of options available. There is even a cooked roll -- the flaming sea bass roll-- is actually a cooked roll that people that do not generally eat sushi will enjoy. If you are a fan of good fish, this place is definitely a must visit.
Best sushi of my life. Lion King Roll is a must order. Go on a weekday night to avoid the crowd.
The place is tiny. We had reservations for an early dinner and there was no wait. I loved everything we ordered except the Godzilla. The tuna wrapping the roll was too thick for my taste.
Great place, the special rolls are the way to go, American Dream Roll! I'm going back for more!

It's okay - not as great as the hype. Very loud inside so not that great for ambience. The spicy hamachi is good, the ya man has too much of an oniony taste. Plus, we thought they overhyped the wait list - so instead of walking around and waiting for an hour, I think if u just wait at the door u can get seated before ur 'turn' comes up.

Absolutely incredible!  The sushi is amazing and fresh, definitely doesn't need to be hidden with a bunch of sauces and tempura.  I have never had a bad meal at this place.  Very reasonably priced and an amazing local experience.  Highly recommended!

My boyfriend and I have been on the hunt for the best sushi in SF - and we finally found it! We live around the corner and had been turned off by the often long lines outside of Elephant Sushi, but tonight we swung by and we couldn't be happier with the decision. The sushi was unique and absolutely delicious - it literally illuminated our palettes. From the Walu Carpaccio sashimi (w/truffles!!) to the Flaming Sea Bass - it was such a treat and we will definitely be back.
I'm going to have to just agree with the other reviews of this place. WOW. We waited an hour on a Sunday evening. It was worth the wait. I would wait longer.

The food was amazing!! If you love fresh sushi you will love this place..the only problem I had with this restaurant is the parking it's very hard to find a spot in that neighborhood. Still haven't had sushi this good in a long time def worth the trouble..

Not sure why the reviews are so good. The food was weird, not good at all. They were out of half the things we wanted to order & was completely unapologetic about it. The server kind of did this laugh at us actually, like too bad for you better luck next time. And the server also tried to do a bait & switch bringing us something else pretending it's what we ordered when they didn't even have it in the first place. Worst service I've ever had, that girl should just get fired. Then at the end they gave us the wrong bill. Complete incompetence. The whole experience was something I would''ve preferred to live without
I do not give out stars freely.
Simply the best!

Came here for a celebratory dinner with the husband - had read about it on Yelp. This place exceeded all expectations. The menu is non-traditional in that they make twists to sushi place staples such as tuna rolls. The fish is phenomenally fresh and the pieces of generous.
Best sushi restaurant I've ever been to. If you like sushi you must try this place out.

Typically speaking, when a sushi restaurant gives their rolls creative names like the "White-Out Roll" or the "Flaming Seabass," you can be sure that the quality of the fish takes a back seat to whatever random flavor combinations the kitchen can throw together.

Ahhhh...sushi! We went back for our 2nd time last night to celebrate my fiance's birthday because, after all, we'd been dreaming about it since our first visit 4 months ago. Clearly it was far too long to wait-pretty sure the restaurant owners realized they were "giving away" too much fish for the price and have significantly paired down the portions, particularly with the Himalayan Trout sashimi...alas, still the best damn sushi we've ever had and we will be back! Though I will say, they we're quite generous with the shavings of truffle on both the Hamachi Truffle and Walu Carpaccio sashimi.
So my girlfriend and I decided to eat here before heading back home to Los Angeles and arrived at aprox 5:50 pm on a Thursday.

In my opinion this place is overrated. Their reservation, wait system is a joke. You have to physically present yourself at the restaurant to put yourself on the wait list. Then you provide the hostess with your telephone number so she can call you when your table is ready. She then spends half the time stressfully answering the phone and calling people on the wait list rather than tending to guests who are physically present. Expect to wait at least an hour on most nights. I get it, this place is busy so you wait, but get it together.

This place was great and we are happy it was our final dining spot in SF. The sashimi portions were really generous. We had the toro and the hamachi truffle, both dishes were delicious. We also had the Beastie Boys, unagi, flaming seabass, and uni. All were great. I am a fan of sashimi, so the flaming seabass was a great cooked alternative. I drank the HELLO KITTY martini and it was really tasty. Place is super packed as it is tiny, but it was worth the wait for us.

We tried to go to this restaurant for our friend's birthday and they turned us away because they do not take groups of 5. They wouldn't even let us split up into two groups for dinner. It was ridiculous. I didn't appreciate the rude attitude from the hostess when we asked to be split into two groups either.

Good inventive dishes here with pretty good fish.  The chef special plates set the menu apart, while the normal sushi and rolls are good but not great.  The white out roll, apparently the most popular item here, is overrated and has a weird fishy bbq taste.  but the hamachi truffle appetizer is insane.  also also nice to find Sapporo on tap.

One of my favorite restaurants in my neighborhood.  The food is great.  My favorite things include the cast iron baked pizza, the calabrese sausage glazed with honey, and believe it or not, the caesar salad is the best i've had anywhere.  Levi, the bartender kicks ass, and Sergio the GM is so accommodating and friendly.  Everyone here has a true passion for what they do and will treat you like family, you can't go wrong at Capo's (unless you forget to make a reservation, then you might have a long wait ahead of you.

Capo's really does feel like an old family neighborhood place in the heart of north beach. The service was friendly but a little slow but the food was fantastic. We shared the garlic bread with cheese and mushrooms, Caesar salad, and The Dillinger pizza.
