The Chicago style pizza, although not my favorite (I'm a ny guy) is so unique and has a great crust from the cast iron skillet. It's a truly filling meal but one I would come back to time and again.

A night at Capo's for some good deep dish Chicago style, clams casino, artichoke dip, garlic bread and precisely poured Hendrick's Martinis a little dirty with 2 olives. Just another great night out with good friends! Wrap it up with an Affogato of course ...Like a Boss.
Tony's joint.  Just a couple of blocks down Columbus Avenue from his Stockton Street joint in north beach.  It was a great night...
This was truly the best pizza I have ever had in my lifetime. The Dillinger pizza cooked in cast iron with cheese crust. I will be dreaming of it for months to come.

I came here with high hopes after missing a reservation last time I was in San Francisco. The atmosphere was wonderful and the server was exceptional. Her name was Kelly. I started with the appetizer of clams which I would highly recommend. Then I split a steak sandwich which was very good. Then for my main course I had the eggplant lasagna. It was no joke the worst eggplant lasagna I have ever eaten in my entire life. I felt bad leaving such a large portion but I could not choke anymore of it down.  The server was very understanding and I do not fault her at all for the horrible entrée. As I looked around the restaurant I founds a few patrons eating the pizza which looked wonderful and I wish I would have tried some. I would definitely recommend going here but staying away from the eggplant lasagna.
Review #800 goes out to Capo's!

By the looks of Capo's, I've just stepped into the 1920s when the talk of the town were mobsters & bootleggers. In my prohibition era-obsessed mind, the phone booth is where you give a secret password (for who knows what), & the brick walls contain trapdoors (leading who knows where.) No need to worry, everything was copacetic, no funny business occurred, at least not while we were there.

On Saturday, 10/25/14, my girlfriend and I along with one of my good friends and his wife ate at Capo's for dinner. We've all been to Tony's Pizza Napoletana and I must say we are all true fans! My girlfriend and I have been to Tony's a numerous amount of times and I've actually had the chance to meet and talk to Tony Gemignani. He is a true class act and a PIZZA GENIUS! I saw Capo's on the show Check, Please! I've been so eager to try Capo's so we finally made it happen.
Dillinger best pizza in the world

Ever since I've eaten here I want to go back every night. The food is beyond delicious, with wine and other libations to match. I was never a fan of deep dish pizza, but after eating the award winning Dilinger, I am a believer.  Wow. The crust and the fact that its not drenched in sauce is heavenly. I also had their minestrone soup and artichoke parmesan dip....soooo good. I cant stop thinking about you, Capos!
Nice place which showcases a special point in time! Portions are HuGe, they serve you broth before you meal as well as a side of meatballs with each entree~yum but ouch!
Friendly family style Italian. Good for kids. Clams and Linguini done right; whole clams, garlic, Olive oil, and wine.

Crispy yet saucy, savory and creamy, flavorful yet simple... Old Chicago style deep dish pizza. So delicious, but we could only down one slice each. Service was on point, quick and efficient. Manager was there to personally check on us. We were seated quickly as well. Alcohol was overpriced so we definitely didn't partake.
The most amazing food. Amazing drinks. Great service. Good people. All around amazing place.

We saw this place on Check Please and my brother-in-law decided to have his birthday dinner here. We were lucky enough to get the front window booth which made the birthday boy happy. The Dillinger and the Big Jim. Chicago style. Sis said the Big Jim was her "flavorite". Everything was yummy and we had a ton left.
We love deep dish pizza, so it's too bad it didn't hit the Mark here. The pizza did not hold together at all when it was sliced and served - making it very hard to serve - it was just too soggy.

Dine on September 27th approx 9:30 great service by McKenzie always impressed they can memorize everything we wanted without writing it down. Place was full we didn't mind waiting a bit which gave us a chance to review the menu.  We ordered a sampling of quite a few items all were delicious and came out timely.  Cant wait to return.
Sat at the bar on sat night without any wait. Bartender was awesome and so was the food
Food-amazing! We couldn't decide so we handed the menu to the bar tender and he just ordered for us. Best decision we made all night.
The pizza was awesome. We ordered the big Jim. Yeah, we went deep dish. The bartender was great. Glad we stopped by and grabbed a seat at the bar and had a great dinner!

Service is great. Atmosphere is great. The servers are very friendly! The deep dish pizza was amazing!! Will definitely come back to this place next time we are in San Francisco!! Overall such a great experience here!

Celebrated a birthday here. Great bar and ambience was typical of what you'd expect of an Italian restaurant. We had a deep dish pizza between 5 of us and there were leftovers! Servings of salads were huge as well. I particularly liked the bar.

I haven't had such a warm welcome to a restaurant in more than a decade. Sergio and the staff treat you like family, and the food brings it home. The bar has some great innovations on classic drinks too. Great place to chill out with friends, cozy up on a date or hang out at the bar just off the little italy strip.

Meeting with some old friends, I was the last arrival of our party of five at Chubby Noodle.  Walking in, the bar/restaurant only had a few occupied tables, a stark contrast to my last visit during the holidays.  My friends had drinks in hand when one friend grimly said "The menu's changed."  My eyes studied their menu which did not have any of the staples that I knew and enjoyed.  In emergency mode, I called Capo 's and scored a table ten minutes later.

Really good - hearty Italian food. I particularly liked the pastas which were nice and al dente and the meat sauce was rich and full of flavor. They gave us a complimentary minestrone soup which was good, albeit a little weird at first. We had the cracker thin pizza which I thought needed more sauce. Next time we'll try getting the deep dish instead.

Went for my birthday on 9/10/2014. Very pleased. The restaurant is exceptional, from the fantastic, old-school booths, to the staff and the food! The drinks are rather nice also. Had both deep-dish and thin crust pizza. Absolutely delicious!  My only concern is when can I go back? A very nice find.
Every thing from the first greeting to the goodbye was amazing. The hostess was nice, friendly and personable. The waitress was funny and helpful and the servers and bussers where great.
The wine blends, pizza, and service is just amazing! YOU MUST try the Farmers pizza-and always, always, always go deep dish.

Great place. Eat at the bar.  Ordered the garlic bread with arugula, truffle, etc, roasted artichoke, sausage with honey, and caprese salad.  All 5's except for the caprese. Give it a 3. Great service.  Looking forward to going back and ordering off the pizza menu.

The deep dish pizza is AMAZING! I went with one other person and we were both pretty hungry so we just ordered the deep dish they always have baking since all the specialty ones were going to take so much longer! It was really tasty but waaaay too much for 2 people, so definitely be prepared for leftovers or go with more people! The only thing I didn't like was the tables were soooo close together I could hear everything the people next to us were saying, it was like we were at the same table.
Authentic deep dish pizza. DELICIOUS authentic deep dish pizza.

Capo's is a near-perfect comfort food Italian experience.  If you're looking for very tasty, traditional takes on Italian American dishes this is the current place to go in North Beach.  The only real problem: if you don't make reservations you can forget dining here and even if you do be prepared to wait because the space design and heavy entrees definitely promote people sitting around ("oh my god I ate so much zzzzzzzzz") long after the bill is squared away.
Insanely amazing pizza pie! Would recommend 1 pie between at least 6 people UNLESS you're planning on taking the rest home haha!!
Great place tucked just off Columbus. A cut above typical Italian-American fare and one big plus is the homemade pasta and flavorful, robust sauces
I was unimpressed. The pizza was burnt. The sauce tasted like  tomato paste. There was a long wait, forcing us to hover around people seated at the bar. I won't be going back.

Excellent service, fun and cool ambience, spot-on antipasti, and cast iron pan deep dish pizza as good as it gets. Sink into the plush booth seating, order the family blend of red wine, and tuck into some of the best pizza you'll find anywhere. Loved this place.
3.5 stars-A-OK
We came here for an after church lunch one Sunday.  I was very impressed with this restaurant.  Felt very authentic and very East Coast.  I was raised in Boston and it felt like home for me.
In a nutshell...

Really great place. The meatballs as an appetizer were the best I ever had (sorry mom). The bruschetta was excellent. We shared the Fruitta de mare, which was also excellent and fresh. The price was unbelievably inexpensive. Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgable. The best Italian restaurant I have been to.

My favorite Italian place in the city!  Really quaint and cozy.  Everything we've ever had on this menu is delicious.  My standby is always the Carlesimo.  I don't eat meat so I get it without the pancetta.  My husband and friends have ordered the meat ravioli, spaghetti/meatballs and the chicken cacciatore.  ALL have been amazing.  You can't go wrong here.

The best Italian food in North Beach and all of San Francisco.  I've been here numerous times and tried a variety of dishes.  Everything is delicious.  Some favorites that come to mind are; the Carpaccio, Caprese, Valdostana, Gnocchi, and their impeccable Bar and Wine list.  If you find yourself in the neighborhood, do yourself a favor and stop in at the Trat.  You'll be thanking yourself later.

We absolutely enjoyed celebrating our 7 year anniversary today! My wife was overwhelming surprised with the gift but our favorite dishes are Carlesimo & Salvatore!! We flew from Dallas, TX to just eat at this restaurant just to celebrate!! The best Italian food!

Pretty delicious. The burrata appetizer wasn't so great -- rather oily. The clam and wine-butter pasta was fantastic. Elegant, understated interior made for an enjoyable and relaxed meal. Definitely coming back.

My husband and I were craving Italian (and neither of us is pregnant) so Yelp guided us to this wonderful little place on a Sunday afternoon. This is not a high-end restaurant, but it doesn't matter because the customer service and food make up for the lack of tablecloth and fancy waiters. For example, they were serving Sunday brunch, but the chef was kind enough to make a dish from the dinner menu that we really wanted to try. Tiny bar, but the Bloody Mary blew me away - and I don't even like Bloody Marys! My favorite thing was the 3-Meatball appetizer; we practically licked the plate clean of the sauce. We're really happy that we listened to other Yelpers and tried this place... Will definitely be coming back.

The place is not fancy but charming, and the food is outstanding.  The food is old school / authentic Italian.  The meatballs are to die for. Plan on making a reservation a few days in advance for dinner as it's hard to get in as a walk-in. Last seating is at 900pm but you can stay in until midnight.  Their Sunday brunch is easier to get into last minute and the food is also fantastic.  Highly recommended.

I was in SF for a tech conference and a local that I met at a baseball game recommended that my co-worker and I try this place.  I'm glad we took his advice.  The seating is limited, so I'm also glad we made a reservation.  It's also tight, so be prepared to hear other peoples conversations(or them hear yours).  When we walked in, our table wasn't free yet, so we ordered a drink at the bar and waited for our table.  I ordered a Drakes Hefewiezen.  This was my first time drinking it, so I didn't know what to expect.  I wasn't a big fan of it at first, but continued to sip it as we waited for our table.  When we got to our table, the guy tending the bar, who I think was the owner, came over with a new beer from a fresh keg and notified me that the next Drakes he pulled was the last of the keg, so mine was probably flat.  The new beer was much better, and I'm glad he made the effort as I probably would have just finished my first (and last) Drakes. As we looked over the menu and eventually ordered, all of the staff was friendly and helpful with any questions that we had.  This place truly has that family owned feel.  On to the food...  We ordered the meatball appetizer and bruschetta (antipasti).  The meatballs were possibly the best Italian meatballs I have ever had, and the sauce that came with them was amazing.  The brushetta was also very good.  Then onto the main course, I had the Salvatore(chicken ravioli), which was awesome, and my co-worker had the gnocchi with asiago tomato cream sauce, which I tried and almost wished I had ordered that instead...Until I took another bite of mine.  The sauces were all wonderful.  After we finished our meals, we ordered desert.  I had the hazelnut gelato.  It arrived in a dish with much more than I was expecting.  I quickly noticed that some of it was very crystallized as if it was melted and re-froze.  Thankfully, the top two scoops were not this way.  They were rich and creamy as I had hoped for, and two scoops was probably all I needed.

Excellent service and excellent food. We were in San Fran for Dreamforce last week so we ventured out of the hotel/conference area and found this place.  Looking forward to returning some day soon I hope!

They started a Sunday brunch in the last year and it has blown my mind every time. From the lemon ricotta pancakes to the breakfast risotto - you will not be disappointed. And the coffee and bloody marys make it even that much better. Sadly, it hasn't quite taken off like they planned and they might only continue it through October 2014. Please go and try for yourself! It is a decadent, fantastic brunch.
Amazing, traditional Italian joint. Best in SF I've had. Cute, cozy and definitely need to make a reservation any night of the week. Meatballs are outstanding!
Average. Didn't really wow me

If you're looking for great food and good service, this is the place. So glad we made a reservation (a MUST on Saturday nights) and we were seated right away. It is a family run business and they take pride in their history.

Unfortunately I remember this place being truly great Italian food, but I think it has outgrown itself now.  What used to be intimate place with incredibly tasty and high quality food has dipped into more of a generic churn - who knows, probably yelp helped to do this - the volume has brought down the quality for sure.  It's not bad, but it's not great (anymore).  For the price, it should be great.  And our server clearly had better places to be.

Was blown away by the taste in each bite of food we had tonight at Trattoria Contadina.  Glad to see that the restaurant is staying in the family.  The owners and staff were warm and welcoming.  They really took the time to make us feel special.  You could taste the love in each dish that was prepared for us.  If you are looking for a romantic cozy spot to have a delicious meal then this is the place to go. Will definitely be returning.

Top notch Italian restaurant in the Russian Hill/North Beach neighborhood. I had been here once before a long time ago (think I was only 14-15 years old), but I still remembered the place pretty well once we walked in. It is a one room restaurant with maybe enough space for 20 or so tables. There is a small bar near the front door and lots of window space. Even at 7:30 PM in the summertime, there was quite a bit of natural light coming into the restaurant.

Love coming here for the gnocchi! They took the Gorgonzola gnocchi off the menu.  But when the waiter saw how disappointed I was he had the chef make it for me anyway!!!!!! Love the food here, love the service!
Great old italian restaurant ambiance.  The food is old style too.
The portion size I got last Sunday afternoon was literally only a quarter of what I see in these photos.....

Awesome local find in a slightly hilly and pleasant neighborhood. Eat great homemade pasta and watch the trolley roll by. Start with the antipasta meat and olive dish. Don't miss the pesto ravioli, it was perfect, I'm still thinking about that. And end with their homemade tiramisu, gosh that's good. Compliment with a bottle of Chianti (any on the menu will be good) and you are set.

Really nice Italian restaurant that's away from the chaos of Columbus St in North Beach. Enjoyed some burrata and meatballs as an appetizer. Both were great. The meatballs were dense, but not tough, nice flavor and the homemade sauce was done well.

Treated a friend out to dinner, restaurant was way smaller/cozier than the pics showed, parking was pretty crazy, parked in a lot around the corner for $20. Bruschetta was ok, I have had better but it wasn't bad. My friend got the Caprese salad and that was really delicious! For an entrée I got the chicken with gnocchi and mushrooms, really really good. For dessert we both got the stratiacella gewhich was divine. Service was quick and atmosphere was lively, kind of loud actually but fun. Would for sure go back for another special occasion. Prices were a little steep but I felt the quality of the food was also up there.
Delicious food, great ambiance and wonderful staff.
Although the restaurant seems a bit dark downstairs, I was surprise there was a upstairs. The food was delicious and filling. Fantastic Italian food.

Great spot for an Italian dinner in North Beach! My husband and I really enjoyed our experience here.  We had Jesus as our server who was very attentive and recommended an excellent red wine. Our favorite dish was the gnocchi with a tomato cream sauce.

Service was lacking-- second bar drink was offered and we sat waiting at the end of our meal for about 10 minutes before we got our check-- even though it wasn't busy. Meat balls were too compact right but the entrees were delicious: red snapper and spaghetti with scallops, shrimp, peas, mushrooms in a tomato cream sauce.

Prior to an evening of Beach Blanket Babylon laughter, my wife and I made a reservation at this wonderful restaurant through a Google and Yelp search. My wife selected this gem and the two of us, just wishing for a an evening of delicious Italian food, found our mecca. The service was sweet, the food was impeccable, the libations tasty, and the ambiance was like I was sitting in my own living room with many guests. The atmosphere was very relaxing. I had the spaghetti special with homemade egg noodles, shrimp, and scallops, in a white sauce. It was very tasty and so delightful. I highly recommend this little gem in North Beach. I could have sat there all night, eating Italian food, sipping wine, having conversation with my bride, and watching the cable car whisk by!
Four and three-quarters stars for this great spot!
With very limited experience with this regions food, I let my date order for us and I was pleasantly surprised.
Why go through all the hustle and bustle right on Columbus? This place is a knockout. Great atmosphere, cozy, and authentic. Enjoy!
I'm a local and this is my favorite spot in North Beach. I've been going for 10 years now. You can never go wrong with the Carlesimo and Burrata to start.

Came here for my post courthouse wedding dinner with my family.  They were able to accomodate for our party comfortably.  The wait staff was very attentive and patient with our party of 10.  Everyone enjoyed their authentic Italian dinner.  I was in love with my pesto pasta with green beans and my husband got the veal dinner which he loved a lot.  Overall I would come back to this place for a good Italian meal.  It was a little pricey but that was expected for the area and meal.

We wanted to love this place. The reservation was easy to make, but when we showed up, our table wasn't ready. We ordered antipasti, pasta, and secondi, and our waitress was thoughtful enough to recommend 1/2 portions of the pasta since it was a lot of food. We ordered drinks, but then they were out of raspberry syrup. We ordered coca cola, but then it was flat. We ordered the saltimbocca, but then they ran out of potatoes. The saltimbocca also had a bit too much rosemary (maybe another spice?) so it overpowered the entire dish. Probably just an off night.

Each time we visit San Francisco we make it a point to eat here, a neighborhood restaurant away from awful tourist traps; we have never been disappointed. The staff is great, the warm olives are a great way to start. This time we had the veal with risotto... And the house made raviolis with spicy tomato creme sauce... Scrumptious!
Brilliant food, amazing wait staff, tables are close together to inspire some friendly back and forth between diners. Great pastas!

We are visiting and went for dinner with our 5 and 7 year olds. Amazing is all I can say! Food, service, pricing, ambience! We has Burrata salad and meatballs to start with an incredible bottle of wine by Nancy's recommendation. Followed by veal for my husband and I had the spaghetti al'merica(?) I know I said that wrong...it was second choice under pasta; best pasta I've ever had! Go here, you won't regret it! I spent more on lunch at the wharf and the food wasn't good! (Lou's Fish Shack). This place is a gem, go and you'll see why;)

Love this restaurant! Owned by 100% Italian family!  The atmosphere makes you feel like you are in Italy! The food was delicious!  I had the gnocchi and it was awesome! Highly recommend making a reservation otherwise you will have to wait for a bit!

I love the ambience here!  Also, the food is really fantastic.  My only minor complaint would be that the tables are very close together because the restaurant is small.  I think the prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food and portion size.  I also absolutely love the pasta dishes here and will go back again and again.
We  tried a number of italian places  and all were booked. Finally found this one.  We were not disappointed.  Great food, great service.

My son and I stopped in on a recent Friday night as we were touring the city.   We were seated upstairs right away.  Cozy atmosphere and everybody was very friendly and prompt.  Our server, Jesus, was quick, very friendly and professional.  The place was busy but we were not rushed or overlooked at all.   I had the Pavorotti 1984, vegetables and cream sauce. My sons gnocchi was probably the best we've had.  Same family owners for 30 years- they are definitely doing everything right!  Prices were moderate too.  We would certainly visit again when in town!

There are so many fine dining available in SF but La Folie is my absolute favorite place to dine.  Chef Roland Passot is truly a culinary master that understands how to make every senses come vividly alive.  Every entrée is visually stimulating, pleasing to the scent, and tastes out of this world.
Still speechless with the quality of the food and super amazing service. Beyond perfect!
4.5 stars

This is the worst Michelin star restaurant ever.  I used to dine here often but not after experiencing their service last time I came.  Rob, the so called manager was extremely rude and doesn't give a fk about his customers.  He was ungrateful to help.  He was plain rude and show no sincerity.  There are just way too many wonderful restaurants nearby, I will be more than happy to dine else where.  Other than the service, I actually love the food here.

This was our second visit here and it certainly did not disappoint. The featured seasonal menu was out of our price range, but the waiter came by and let us smell a white truffle and I was ready to dip into the kids' college fund to order the menu. We ordered the five course menu and (I cannot believe I'm saying this) it was more food than I could handle. The amuse bouche selections were presented artfully. Loved the egg in the shell, especially. However, mid way through the dinner I had an allergy attack. I don't have food allergies, but I guess it could have been a reaction to the truffle or just dumb bad luck that my allergies flared up. I was suddenly miserable: stuffy, sneezy and wheezy. The waiter gave me funny looks and when the Chef came out (a touch I absolutely love), I just felt like I was a dining disappointment. I want a do-over! The wine pairings were excellent. Too bad I was such a hot mess. It'll be awhile before we can afford to go back, as La Folie is a rare treat so all day today I was depressed.

Great tasting menu, I came here with friends, one visiting SF. There were many small courses and tasting dished inserted between our main dishes, often came at a pleasant surprise. Totally worth going.

My experience at La Folie in regards to customer service has been the best by far! I was greeted with lots of smiles upon entry. Seating was very prompt, and our waitress was impeccable! She had nothing but patience as we were deciding on what to eat for the night, and explained everything to us without any hesitation.

Enjoyed a night here to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  So many courses, so much food, and for the most part....all good.  My favorite was the scallop with uni, but the uni was microscopic.  I noticed other yelper's pictures had a big piece of uni.  Not fair!  Loved how so many dishes has complementary truffles.  YUM!  There's no need to spend the $75 upcharge to have truffles scraped on top of your dish, as there was plenty of truffles anyway.  My husband and I both agreed that while the food is good, the dishes are very 80's.  I hadn't seen a salmon lollypop since 1987!

I was in the depths of a quarter life crisis when my best friend took me here, hoping to take my mind of things. And considering I cannot remember anything but the delicious food and wine pairings I had that night, I would say it worked.

La Folie probably just made my top 5 list of restaurants to go to in San Francisco. The atmosphere and ambiance stepping into the restaurant was amazing and very romantic and not noisy at all. When walking into the restaurant you can feel that a lot of important people wine and dine here but our waiter made us feel right at home. Made reservations for my gf birthday and for the whole 3 hours it was awesome.Each of us ordered the 4 course tasting menu and we were so stuffed by the time the 3rd course came we could barely finish our food. *they let you play around with the menu so I opted out of dessert and got two appetizers for my tasting* We even got the pleasure to eat next to Mayor Willie Brown. What a great night and an excellent way to spend a special occasion. Can't wait to go back and try the rest of their excellent menu.
L O V E
I'm sad SF has no more foie gras, since I heard La Folie used to be known for their foie gras.

We came to La Folie and got the chef's tasting menu. It was more money than we had ever spent on a meal in our entire lives. Due to a personal emergency, we didn't even get to stay for the dessert we had already paid for. And yet, it was so worth it. It was far and away the best part of my week long trip to San Francisco.

We were looking for a truly special dining experience, and we found it at La Folie. A delicious tasting menu with marvelous surprises. The servers talked us through each course with enthusiasm and exquisite care. Marvelous.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday a couple weeks ago and I loved it! We were running about 15 minutes late and called in, and the lady who picked up accommodated us. Luckily we found parking nearby the restaurant without using their valet service.
THANK YOU papa & mama from kentucky for treating us to such a special dinner at la folie!

La Folie is truly a romantic space, wonderful felt-y orange red velvet-y walls, incredible acoustics (so so easy to hear your dinnermaters) - can't stress enough how great the sound of this space is. A little disorganised with the late reservation - had to wait 15 minutes in the cool bar next door - but complimentary wine as apology, of course. Top top top food, as the pictures show.

Our new favorite restaurant!!!!! The food was extraordinary, each course was better than the last!  The service was impeccable, everyone was extremely sweet, knowledgeable  and accommodating;   they really made our night one we wont forget.  The experience was perfect, the courses were well paced so we were truly able to enjoy a leisurely night out together.

Okay I came here last night with my pledge sisters for a birthday dinner for one of them. We had a group of three. We ubered from by the pier to the restaurant and we were right on time for our 7:30PM reservation. I reserved via Opentable, they will need a cc on file, and if you don't cancel in time there is a fee that is charged in the form of La Folie credit I believe.
I gotta say we eat a lot of places from anywhere to $-$$$$
Beautiful restaurant with professional and friendly service and excellent food.  We were in SF last month and dinner at La Folie was the best we had that weekend.

I have been to the best around the world and had no great expectations of a neighborhood restaurant. I have been amazed, pampered, surprised and exited by the creativity, perfection, and delicious almost decadent dishes presented at our table. Fresh, gorgeous dishes presented at our table by a courteous knowledgeable waiter at a fluent pace and always surprising master piece. Without a doubt an experience not to be missed!

I haven't even eaten there yet, but I am attending an event with a fixed menu tonight. I hadn't been able to see the menu so I called to ask about it and found that I basically couldn't eat anything due to my dietary restrictions. Elsa called back and my husband (I have laryngitis and can't communicate via phone right now!) told her my restrictions and she said the chef would do his best to make something I can enjoy as well (I am always happy to eat ahead, but figure it's worth asking if there are options for me). I know it is short notice to create something special for me so I am thoroughly impressed with the customer service of both Elsa and the chef in being willing to accommodate me. I don't even care if it's good (though I'm sure it will be), this is one of the best experiences I've had since being on a restricted diet, so I am already a happy customer. Thank you!

There just aren't many places in San Francisco where this quality of food and service together is available. If you want to eat in a civilized fashion, without having to scream across the table to be heard, this is your place.  If you want to eat where the food is fresh, expertly prepared and delectable, this is your place.  If you want to eat where the staff is top-notch, non-intrusive and professional, this is your place.

An absolutely lovely place to take someone special out to dinner! I took my boyfriend here on his 25th birthday. Reservations were not hard to get. We were able to book a table for two at around 7:00pm a week in advance.
I'll be thinking about this meal for a long time. Everything was phenomenal. Their portions are generous, the ambiance was lovely and the service was attentive.

Great food and ambiance. Did the chefs tasting menu (which I never do) and its was great. Great wine selection and the staff was very attentive and made sure that we had everything we needed plus some. If you want to be pampered and eat grey food and drink great wine, then you can't miss this gem of a restaurant. May be pricey but as they say, you get what you pay for. 6 stars and would definitely come back again when I'm in San fransisco.
The owner and manager which is a very old
La Folie is a solid and authentic French restaurant. I've been here three times and each time was absolutely wonderful.

I gave this place an extra star because the setting is really very nice. Rather serene and romantic. I was not impressed by the food, though I will admit I had high expectations coming here due to the high yelp reviews.
Dinner at La Folie did not disappoint, but it also did not blow me away. Most courses were great, but a few were let downs. I've been to far better Michelin stared resturants.

I think my expectations were too high.  Ordered the 3 and 4 course meal so that we could share a dessert.  All the courses with the lobster really good but the others were a little disappointing.  Had the heirloom tomato salad and it had these little crunchy brown things on it that looked like little worms.  I kept thinking that they were worms in the back of my head, so it kinda ruined the dish for me.  Also had the tasting of the roe, but I found my oyster to be a little pasty.  For some reason, it didn't that taste fresh to me.  Aside from that, the butter poached lobster was amazing!  I wish I asked for the salmon lollipops tho.  I was really looking forward to it and saw every other table get it but mine.  But I didn't want to ask and be moded and have them tell me it only comes with the tasting menu or something.  Wish I read some of the other yelp reviews first.  Till next time!  I will try those lollipops one day!

Very disappointing. Inattentive waiter. Didn't even ask if the food was good. Lobster was basically a seafood-flavored peace of rubber. Cheese platter was too much sweet stuff and not enough cheese. Why this place has a Michelin star is a mystery to me. I've been to French restaurants in at least 20 european cities that were much more interesting than this place.

I'm typically not that into fine dining as I'm perfectly satisfied with an in-n-out burger. That being said, I was gifted a meal here, and it was really delicious. Service was great. We did one Chef's tasting menu and one three course off the a la carte menu. Maybe because we shared everything, unlike other reviews, I didn't find having different number of courses to be awkward at all. The amuse bouches were delightful and beautifully plated. It really is amazing how much flavor they can concentrate into a tiny morsel of yumminess.

I had high hopes for this restaurant.  I came here for a special occasion and expected every dish to wow me.  None of the dishes tasted bad, but the dishes were not that spectacular.  I did not like my entree -- Quail and Squab stuffed with Mushrooms.  I don't get their concept, what they were trying to do with this.  Things didn't fit well together.  And what is it with putting an egg in everything?  There was an egg in my apps, amuse bouche, and the quail and squab entrée.  It may sound kind of cool, but it seems out of place.  I spent $300 here for a dinner for 2, and I want my money and time back.  Service was really good, saving this review from being 1 star.

La Folie is a special occasion restaurant. Every time you eat there, it's a special occasion. Chef Roland Passot and his wife have owned and operated this classic French restaurant since 1988 and their experience in giving you an experience shows.

my second favorite restaurant in SF.  fleur de lys started my french dining obsession many years ago and i was also lucky enough to partake of foie gras before it went off the menu as well as the reviewer below.
1 star is strictly from my particular experience which my group seemed to agree with me as well.
I didn't want this dinner to end. And I was practically in pain by the time I left...because I ate so much. I just couldn't stop.
Two of us did the chefs tasting menu. It was a chefs feasting menu. It was a lot of good for a french restaurant and we came hungry.
ZERO SERVICE period.
Showing our friend from Chicago around Fisherman's Wharf, we decided to warm ourselves up in this cool evening with an infamous Irish coffee at Buena Vista Café.

It was a very busy place but if you don't mind sharing a table with tourists then you won't have to wait long. I was not very impressed with the Irish coffee. It was pretty strong. The Classic egg benedict was okay. Waiters were not very helpful. No one told us that we could sit ourselves until we asked.

I chose a $3.5 "Fresh Squeezed Orange Juice" vs. $2.5 normal OJ and it came out as it just went straight from a can of concentrated orange juice. So I politely asked for the fresh squeezed one as it was an order mistake. The old lady said "It's fresh!" and simple walked away. I was so in shock as if I was just a third world country citizen who came to America and didn't know how "fresh squeezed OJ" suppose to taste like.

Totally big time tourist spot. If you want to come here expect a table on your own or great service, then this place is not for you. The server will serve quick and let you go quickly so others can also come and experience A drink of Irish coffee for $9 a cup was over costly for decent coffee.  Overall, that s okay drink.. overrated restaurant. My pot roast was ok. Bloody Mary was not that great.

Happened to walk in on the celebration of the Irish Coffee here at Buena Vista. It was loud, with a live Irish band and hard to find a seat. Here at Buena Vista you're going to meet someone while you eat so I hope your friendly. While I was here I tried Irish Coffee since it was the Anniversary of it. I hate coffee but this was amazing. It was a subtle taste of coffee and whiskey blended with fresh cream and was just right, even for my picky palate. The fish and chips where worthy of, dare I say Britain, and the staff was kind and attentive. Come for the coffee, stay for everything Buena Vista has to offer.

The main reason to come here is if you have friends who don't believe that restaurants in tourist areas have very little incentive to do anything more than get people in the door. Once you are there and ordering that's more than enough to sustain their business model.
As a local, I usually avoid the tourist stuff in SF, but this place is legit.
Irish Coffee is awsome atmosphere is great !!! Service is great !!! Just a good time.

Irish coffee, Irish coffee, Irish coffee, Irish coffee, Irish coffee!!! Oh wait, there is food there? We did have breakfast but to be honest nothing was memorable. Decent solid bar food. Just as bar food normally is. Soaks up liquor and fills your belly.
You're only allowed to get Irish Coffee here. I don't care if you prefer beer to whiskey or tea to coffee. You are ONLY allowed to get one of their well balanced Irish Coffees.
Wow worth the wait best breakfast ever!!

Walked in and walked right back out. Felt very unwelcome by the Asian man working the bar. He acted like we were bothering him so we left. Do not go! This particular area has very rude service everywhere.
Don't miss this spot.  Stop by for an irish coffee after a day of walking around and enjoy the view of the water.
Amazing! Get the Irish coffee and the nutty can't go wrong with either.  Cream is yummy and the coffee is hot but whiskey is the best in it all.  Try it and you just might want another one.  I did!

Classic San Francisco place that brought Irish Coffee to the United States, and boy, I'm glad they did! The drink was amazing albeit expensive. Service was a bit slow, but even at a non-meal hour, they were busy.

Went to Buena Vista for my friend's birthday because she wanted their Irish Coffee. It was good but pretty expensive. There was surely an older crowd there, but the World Series is in the city right now- so lots of rich guys were out.
Well, this is a very classic restaurant that is synonymous with San Francisco.

I loved the food and history!  We got the crab omelet and french toast.  Both were really good!  The service was fast and no-nonsense.  I'm very glad we discovered this place on Yelp!  Would definitely go here again and try other food.
Super yummy Irish cream coffee delicious French dip sandwich. Staff is a bit rough around the edges but it comes with the environment. Overall great place to grab a few drinks.
Killer Irish coffees and great bloody Marys. The crab Benedict was delicious, as was my wife's dungeness crab omelet. Try the corned beef hash and be sure to pick the SF sour dough bread.
Irish coffee is good, but overpriced.
Holy stong Irish Coffees Batman! Good, but you better like them because that's what they are known for. Fun place and we got to watch the Blue Angels from inside last weekend when we were there!
Best Irish Coffee EVER!!  If you are in the neighborhood, please take a moment to stop in and experience the BEST IRISH COFFEE!  No need to sit down and eat, grab an Irish Coffee, its well worth it!

Stopped in for a nightcap and to see the last of the Giants NLCS game one victory. It was crowded but the barkeep instantly took our order for their famous Irish Coffee. The drink is fanastic, the service stellar and the patrons were friendly. A wonderful finish to the evening.

What can I say about the Buena Vista? It's the kind of place your grandparents told you about. One of my favorite places in my favorite cities. They are known the world over for their Irish Coffee. They may not have invented it but they surely perfected it. Do yourself a favor and come in at 7am any morning grab one of their amazing breakfasts, eggs Benedict would be my recommendation, and grab an Irish coffee or 2, while listening to the stories from one of the bartenders who has worked their longer than I have been alive. Friendly, knowledgable staff about any subject this is truly a operational landmark. Go there and mark it off your bucket list.

If you are visiting San Francisco you MUST enjoy an irish coffee at Buena Vista Cafe.  I'm not a whiskey drinker and my boyfriend loathes coffee, but we were both mad about the Irish Coffee here!  The bartender puts on a show when making close to 10 coffees at a time and the end result is a delicious, yet strong, alcoholic coffee drink =)
OMG!!!!  Get the Irish Coffee!  It's the BOMB!!  The food is wonderful too but it's known for it's Irish Coffee and you won't be disapointed
Super touristy, unremarkable food, bad attitude from staff. No free soda refills. Potatoes were undercooked. And the name is misleading - the view is not so good.

Very entertaining bartender, and he likes to make Irish coffee! He makes them by the dozen. I didn't come in for coffee and ended up having 2 for $8 each. I had to ask twice for a glass of water. The bar and atmosphere is clean and classy.  We would stop in again if in the area.

IRISH COFFEE & Eggs Benedict. You can't ask for more. The history on this place alone makes you fall in love. The crowd makes you wanna stick around & the staples will keep you coming back. Great location & concept
A MUST if you're in San Fran! Irish coffee is the best you will ever have. Fun atmosphere and friendly staff!

I came here for their Irish Coffee and I left pleased. This was the first time I ever experienced it and it was a nice experience. Place is very old school with friendly staff. I say stop by here for breakfast or if you want a quick drink.
Irish coffee. That's really all I need to say.

Irish Coffee.  No matter what else you try in this place, you will never have a better glass of Irish Coffee.  Touristy area, but Buena Vista has a mix of characters on staff and as regulars that make you feel welcome, at home and like a place you would visit far too often if you actually lived here.  Loved this place.
Went here for breakfast with a friend of mine. Our waitress was super nice and attentive. I definitely recommend the b. v. breakfast, it seems like a lot but the portions were perfect.
This place is amazing. Make sure u know to seat urself or else u won't eat!! Catharine was our waitress and she was amazing, make sure u go in looking for a morning cocktail!

Being East Coasters, we stopped in to the Buena Vista Cafe not knowing what to expect. However, after reading about the place's storied history, I felt like I've been living under a rock and should have known about this place all along.
I'm just not crazy about places that let rude servers run amuck and call it entertainment. I just find it rude and crass.

I went with my boyfriend for brunch. I got the corned beef hash and my bf got the burger. Corned beef hash was ok, potatoes were barely cooked. For the burger, medium is the lowest they could cook it for accdg to the waiter. So it ended up being dry. I wouldn't go back here.

best sandwich I've ever had in my life. Actually, probably one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life. I got the hot coppolla, and it was amazing. I tend to despise any kind of deli meat, but this stuff i could eat all day. the fries are fresh and delicious, and the portions are ridiculously generous (i couldnt get through the 2nd half of my sandwich). the bread...oh, the bread. too good to even describe. How is this stuff under 10 bucks?
Great little bar/sandwich restaurant. I had a pastrami and my daughter had a salami sandwich. They put their fries on the sandwich, which sounds strange but is delicious.
On the list of top ten sandwiches I've ever had!! Authentically Pittsburg...so don't try to change anything on any of the sandwiches! They know what they're doing!!
So here's the deal about this place: the fries come on the sandwich along with a mound of cole slaw between the buns.

I  take my sister here when she visits (she's a Steelers fan) as the place is Pittsburgh central.  It's small but the food is delicious as are the beers.  When we've gone, there was only 1 server but he works hella hard and you aren't waiting to long for anything.
I order pastrami & egg or coppa & egg. Sandwich includes coleslaw & fries. Remember to add the egg.

We went to this place for a quick late breakfast bite and got a Coppa sandwich with prosciutto, coleslaw, fries with vinegar. It was reasonably priced and tasted very good. The place is all about Pittsburgh Steelers, so definitely a recommend in general and particularly for football fans :)
Came here for a sandwich.  Kinda pricy for a sandwich but all the ingredients were so fresh and huge portion.
Great food, good people. Actually prefer the sandwiches at Giordano Bros to Primanti Brothers. A convenient option to have in San Francisco.

Perfect place to watch football. Especially if your a Pittsburgh fan. Went there with a group of friends. Our server Zack explained the menu to the out of towner friends and put it into words we could understand. I will infidelity be back. The bartender was helping running food too when she saw the server was busy.

Excellent sandwich after walking around San Francisco all day.  Fresh ingredients, just the right amounts of each.  The all-in-one is the way to go.  Must have a cold beer with this for a perfect lunch. For a guy, just the right size.  I will definitely go back when I return to San Francisco, since I have no plans to travel to Penn.
Meat. Fries. Soft bread. Fried egg. Beer. Sports.

I am usually in San Fran 3 to 4 times per month,  and for years I have recommended this place to my Pittsburgh friends...  times have changed,  the bar staff isn't what it used to be.  We had John and other Pittsburghers... now. The SF games are on the prime tv not Pittsburgh.. and good luck getting a beer while they talk to their friends, not to mention they are immature. sigh... need a new Burgh place in San Fran.

Yum!! Came here for the first time today with my boyfriend. We aren't coleslaw people or much into provolone cheese but MAN perfect sandwich!! I got the kielbasa and my boyfriend got the hot salami!! Perfect combo. Never had fries on a sandwich but I loved it!! The bread was fresh. Never got soggy with all the ingredients on it. Cole slaw was the perfect ratio and was like a light salad. The meat was fresh and full of flavor. Super cheap for the city. 7.5 each sandwich can't beat it. We will be back. Our waitress was awesome and didn't get annoyed when asking questions. Fun and cool environment. We went in starving and left full :). Thank you. See you guys soon!
Service is great, wings are the best in sf and the beers are cheap, couldn't ask for much more!

I remembered this place being a lot better the first time. I ordered the pastrami sandwich. It was generously sized and more than filling. The meat was a little tough but I loved the coleslaw. It was lightly dressed with oil and vinegar and was nice and crunchy.
Very tasty sandwich.  Would definitely go again.

Really friendly staff and great sandwiches! I was boring and ordered a turkey sandwich, but it was amazing. The combination of the thick-cut white bread, the vinegar-y slaw, crispy fries, and delicious turkey made this sandwich a home run. I can't believe it's taken me this long to go here since my friends always rave about it.

Sandwiches here are delicious! I wasn't really sold at first on the whole french fries on a sandwich deal when I was told about it. But when I tried it for myself, it was utter heaven! The French fries are crispy perfection too .

Giordano Bros, a Pittsburgian sandwich shop run by ex-Pittsburgians. I have no clue if that's the appropriate terminology to describe the residents of Pittsburg. Perhaps Pittsburgoids? Possibly Pittsburgers? Mmm Pittsburgers...that sounds like it would be the name of a delicious burger.

Fries on a sandwich. What more could you ask for? When I go to other restaurants and ask for fries on my sandwich or burger, they look at me like I'm crazy, here they'll look at you crazy if you don't want fries on your sandwich! The delicious fluffy bread is so soft you won't tear the roof of your mouth while you stuff this glorious sandwich in your mouth. Make sure you get a cookie, they put rice crispies in it and it's amazing!!
I have always been a fan of great pastrami, so when your a fan, its always best to go to the spots that can get the job done with taste and service. Giordano Bros is the place to be

The food was pretty good and wasn't too expensive. Got a spicy italian sausage sandwich with fries and sister got the capola. Total around 20 bucks with tax. The dressing was a little heavy and it soaked the bread with it.

Kinda mad at the people who ordered wine with their sandwiches and expected a table to have a three-hour conversation at. This is an unpretentious bar, modeled after a famous Pittsburgh sandwich shop, not a place for a romantic evening for two. That said, I ate here and watched a Penguins playoff game with some fellow Pittsburghers now living in S.F. It felt like being home. Tourists and locals were walking by with confused looks as they heard the cheering coming from the bar and echoing around North Beach.
This place gets a 4 for the wings and the beer!  Even though my server had some attitude, it's overall a decent dive bar for drinks and fast-food in the North Beach area...
Meaty meats and fries.
The sandwiches are great but that's only the start.

One word: Excellent!  I took my nephew to SF for his 21st birthday and stopped by for a sandwich and beer.  We had a wonderful time.  The food was fantastic and the beer (Stone IPA) was great as well.  The service was also outstanding.  The manager Jamie (Earl) was very professional and made my nephews day when she asked him for his ID.  We will go back very soon.
This place isn't for me...
Came here because I saw that the sandwiches were like Primanti Bros and I've always wanted to try their sandwiches but have never made it to Pittsburgh. So I figured this was the next best thing.

As a Pittsburgh native, I'm sort of pissy about Pittsburgh style food. Just putting fries on it does not make it Pittsburghian. That's like eating salt and vinegar chips without the vinegar. There is an essence to our cuisine that is not suitable for finer palates. I love that about Pittsburgh.
The fried pickles here are bomb! Served with ranch dressing and oh so crispy and non greasy. Get them.
Love the pastrami and hot capicola. Fried pickles are amazing! Pale Ale is my favorite on tap. Great place to watch the game and even catch a band every now and then.

One of the best spots in SF!  The best sandwich I have every had, and wonderful friendly service.  Also very reasonable for only $7 a sandwich.  Love this place, and always bring out of town guest here.  Very low key and casual environment is nice too.

The sammich was huge.  I ordered the coppa with an egg (as recommended by the waiter / bartender).  I will say that it is a little weird to have your fries on a sandwich, but it is worth the experience.  Add a couple beers and this place is awesome.
LOVE this place!!!

Places are defined by the product and atmosphere. If you want to get a good bite to eat, catch a game and have a beer this is the place. The staff are blunt, I appreciate it. Get the COPPA & don't change it, you will fuck with tradition.
A friend and I were catching up over drinks but she was kinda hungry so we stopped here when we noticed they were serving food.
I love coming here to watch Pittsburgh football/hockey!  The food is AMAZING, the atmosphere is awesome, and the staff are super friendly.  A Yinzer really feels at home here!
This is a great, happy, fun loving Pittsburgh bar in SF! Good sandwiches ad good beer. Excellent bar tenders!
Order the lamb vindaloo with rice and garlic naan! It was fire! So delicious and savory! The prices are excellent and the food was extra satisfying! would go back if there was a closer one to me!

We came here because of the high reviews and really enjoyed the food! The atmosphere is 'self serve' - we had to bring plates, utensils and water to our table from the back of the restaurant - this way the staff can focus on making delicious food that comes out really fast! We ordered the Saag Dal, Tandoori Fish, Garlic Naan and side of Plain Rice Pillau. It was the perfect amount of food for 2 of us and was absolutely delicious! Although we didn't take advantage of it, it looks like it is BYOB. Would recommend to anyone who loves Indian food!
Every thing I have ordered here has been fantastic.  I had some tandoor lamb and biranyi today that was perfect.  The chicken roll is a great quick snack.  Polite service.

After hearing that Ali (former manager of Pakwan in the Mission) opened Curry Leaf in North Beach, my friends & I were anxious to try it.  We went the other night & it was a lovely experience.  The food was delicious, nuanced, and the portions were just right (not so large that you walk away groaning in pain & wishing you had more self-restraint).  And the samosas were light, fluffy, and flavorable, which is hard to find in a samosa.  Curry Leaf is casual and low-key and Ali & his staff and nice & welcoming.  The Curry Leaf is a welcome addition to a neighborhood that was previously missing a quality Indian restaurant.  I wish Ali & his partner all the luck in the world and am very much looking forward to my next Tikka Masala at their restaurant!

I went to the Curry Leaf with my husband. We both enjoyed our experience and the meal. We sat down figured out out what we wanted to eat and placed our order. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Our food was brought to our table once it was ready. Let me tell you we both loved what we ordered. My husband ordered the Garlic Nan and Lamb Vindaloo and I ordered the Bengan Bharta and Masala Nan with one order of the Vegetable Biryani rice. The one order was enough to serve 4. The food was very flavorful. My husband often complains that food that is supposed to be spicy is not. That was not his complaint at Curry Leaf. They asked him if he wanted it spicy and they provided a dish he was happy with. The owner greeted us and even gave us an extra dish to sample. My experience was pleasurable all around and I will visit again.

Great food, but little pricey for self service. Chicken seekh Kebob was phenomenal. Chicken leg was juicy with right amount of spice. You will be surprised by the size of the chicken leg piece. Naan was decent. Overall great food. Also pakora was nice.
I am never a big fan of Indian food, but I LOVE Curry Leaf !  Highly recommended. Good vibe in the restaurant, good customer service
Liked the place previous few times I was there. Good food and casual classy. However, it was closed on Tuesday evening 10/14.

The best Indian/Pakistani food by far. I am from LA and there are many Indian/Pakistani Resturante but Curry Leaf resturante tops all of them. Specially Lamb Curry and Chicken Tikka Marasala. And don't forget the Naan. Not expensive at all and the hospitality is amazing. Five stars for sure
Really solid food, cool atmosphere, extremely generous and friendly staff and such a clever concept. Love the hybrid of sit down vs. fast food, gives the restaurant a really homey feel.

Russian Hill, you're not as fancy as I remember... and that's a good thing. Because when you lose the fancy, you make room for cool liquor stores and byob Indian places with counter service. That cuts down on price but keeps the good stuff coming and coming. I can dig it.

Really delicious food for a good price. Not giant servings but you can get a full stomach off $10-$14 or so. basmati rice is perfect. You order at the front & have to get your own plates, water, etc. so don't expect a fancy sit-down experience. The owner was friendly & asked us how we enjoyed our food when we were done.

Best Indian food in the Bay Area! Anyone who wants authentic Indian food must go to Curry Leaf. The staff is extremely friendly, the food is off the charts, and decor is pleasant. Absolutely recommend this restaurant for everyone.
Awesome food :) heavenly delicious food:) must try for all desis in Bay Area:) especially karahi chicken, tandoori and biriyani.... Loved it:)
High quality, Good price, and good taste food. very clean too. Its chef is the owner. Inexpensive.

Nice environment, rude people, mediocre food and forgot our rice and naan. Wasn't pleased. For now I'll give them one star until a next visit. Please train your staff to be polite and respectful to their guest. Thank you
This place has great food. I always get a couple of vegetarian entrees and I'm here 2-4 times a month.

Fantastic food I went with my friends and we all love what we order. Little pricing but no complaint in food if you really want to buy some good Indian food this is the place to check it out. Self service restaurant and the service is ok ok
The most awful biryani I have had in my life. Please don't judge biryani on what you eat here.
Best karahi chicken I've had in the US. Kher is must have dessert. Am still waiting for my exciting masala chai to come :)
Pretty good food - very flavorful and fairly priced. I would go there again.

This is a self serve restaurant. You order before you sit and they serve you. Best food ever. Bengan bartha and chicken kabab n beef kabab. Samosa. Raita was good. Rest all was amazing. Fresh hot nans. Clean place. Not for people who are in mood for some classy restaurant service.  Its quick and fast service. They do need to buy new plates.  I hope they do that soon. Rest i wouldnt worry. Just order sit and enjoy.

So last night the fiance and I decided to go for a post meal stroll. Understand we had already eaten. When we walked past, what used to be Rico's Mexican, and smelled the spices seeping through the entrance door we couldn't resist but to find room for a second meal. We ordered lightly- chicken curry, a dal, and then one naan. For beverage we ordered a mango lasi and a coconut cream rice dessert. Let us just keep this review short. It was simply sublime! Will definitely come again to do more damage with an emptier stomach.
Food was really good and the price was reasonable. It's self serve but the staff was very courteous.  Would definitely come back

I walk by this place everyday on my way to work and just decided to check it out.  Its never busy, but figured it had to be better than India Curry House across the street (curryleaf had a 4.5 star rating afterall!). Well, its not and certainly not deserving of its 4.5 star rating.
Solid, clean, affordable Indian. Sadly CTM didn't do it for me. But the other stuff did, including the fish and the daal and spinach.
The Curry Leaf is a small no-table service restaurant. It is a no frills establishment, but it was busy at 10pm on a Saturday night. This is always a good sign.
Not bad but not great.
Wow! We were so impressed! Loved everything we ordered and the owner was so friendly! A definite thins up!

Curry Leaf serves fantastic Pakistani/North Indian food, and the owner used to work at Pakawan in the Mission. The food is fantastic and the service is very friendly. I highly recommend the chicken saagwala (its usually a special, and not on the printed menu) and also the tandoori chicken. The naans are great too. Curry Leaf is a great addition to North Beach!
It is the best Indian restanrant I ever tried. Everything taste good, especially the lamb chop, so tender, juicy and flavorful.
We ordered take out for a large family gathering from Curry Leaf.

I am frankly amazed by all the four and five star reviews. I've had a lot of Indian food all throughout New York City, and this falls near the bottom of everything I've tried. The tikka masala was 98% sauce with only a few of the tinniest cubes of chicken. Upon eating it, my friend and I immediately likened it to Trader Joe's frozen tikka masala dinners - decent but far from what you'd expect at an Indian restaurant. Five bites altogether and we had finished all the chicken and only had sauce left. The chana saag had a nice spice but was definitely not Chana saag. There was very little spinach and a ton of dal and chick peas. To top it all off, the nan (both garlic and regular) was chewy and dry - as if it had been frozen, heated up too long and then served without any butter or oil. Generally, my friend and I love naan, but this was, as she said, "less tasty than an unsalted pretzel."
Love this place...
Solid choice. Fresh, well prepared, and reasonable. Also, very clean and a good place to sit and eat.

We did order online and thought they will deliver, to my surprise when I call the restaurant to confirm they told me my address is too far. Therefore I decided to cancel the order online by calling eat24 as well, but somehowJeff from eat24 (thank you )convince them to make the "trip" for the delivery. Anyway, the order took 2 or more hour from ordering and the delivery and when it was missing the chai!!!
Amazingly delicious food, wonderful service, fun atmosphere!  I love this place and will definitely be back!
I've enjoyed Indian food for many years and have dined in Indian restaurants in London, and throughout California, including just about every Indian restaurant, current and past, in San Francisco.

No complaints, my husband ordered take out when we were at a near by hotel, everything was great. At first it looked like there wasn't enough food but we ended up stuffed. Our eight and two year old loved it too. Service was fast as well. Chicken tiki masala was one, lamb that was spicy (but not too much) with jalapeño, and a vegetable dish all very good.

Friendly and fine food. The owner and staff were courteous and inviting. The karahi chicken was perfectly spicy and salted. The chicken curry was wonderful slathered over a nan. We skipped the rice but the nan was good and chewy yet airy.

Lackluster service. My friends and I came here on a Friday night and patiently waited over a hour on a waitlist for a booth to open up to seat 6+. After a hour wait we were excited when a table opened and we took our righteous spot as #1 on the wait list. We were then kicked out and our table given to a group of 4 as "they requested a booth" but weren't on a list. On a busy Friday night they don't much care for locals and their customer service. In a city full of places trying to gain customers, never going here again due to the bad service. The long list of beers don't justify the terrible service.
Poor customer service.  Put my party's name of six on the list and the staff completely by passed us and gave the table away even after calling their mistake out. Get a drink somewhere

The beer is the star here. Very large selection of some very special beers, mostly Belgian. Had three very delightful bottles a vintage Trappist ale, an ultra bruin, and a Belgian blond ale. I was disappointed that I went 2 for 3 on picking beers that "we just ran out of". The server suggested something "very similar" here I also went 2 for 3 on a up charge from my original choice, however much to their credit they charged me the lower price.

My husband and I visited La Trappe after a fun day touring the north bay. We were able to drop in and get a table without issue at 6pm on a Friday night. The restaurant really didn't start to fill up until a bit later.

Service here is brutal. Their incompetent waitress, Cecilia, forgot our order, and we had to wait for over an hour to get two mediocre burgers. We had to go get our own napkins, and we got the silverware halfway through the meal. Getting a beer was also a battle.
Love this place for its beer, food and service!

If you love traveling to Europe and miss it.  La Trappe will fill that void.  As soon as we started descending the spiral staircase, I immediately started thinking about when I went to Paris.  How most of the restaurants are down a level.
Mariniere mussels were yummy and well-priced. Bartender also brought us 2 half glasses of Gouden Carolus Cuvee van de Keizer Blauw on the house. Friendly service. Will come back.

We found La Trappe while looking for a place to eat before going to Cobb's. Definitely go downstairs, the place has a very European vibe. The restaurant lost a star because it was hard to read the menus. yes, menus: one for beer, one for wine, another for the cheeseboard, a dessert menu and finally the dinner menu. The attentive waiter recommended my beer and we each ordered burgers which we gobbled up quickly. My burger was cooked to order, MR, and delish with some chipotle mayo in it. Definitely will return.

Love the beer and the Belgian basement decor, but that one long-beard bartender, the guy who looked around me while I was queued to order for 20+ mins, reduced me to an #UglyAmerican with a fanny pack in a Brugges bar.

Great service, great food, great beer.. The only thing that could be commented on, was the noise level which were quite high, however we were sitting downstairs where the bar is located, the upstairs level seemed more quiet ..
very wide selection of beers ;) and also have the specific type of glassware for the beer you order!
Stopped by before a show at Cobbs. Let me just say; mussels, mussels, mussels!!! They have 4 different sauces of choice. One down, three to go.
Wonderful decor, atmosphere, food and beer selection! I went here for a casual,fun work dinner and it couldn't be more perfect.
Very Belgium.   Loved the vibe, Jeremy the bartender is great, picked beers based on my taste. Don't go expecting an easy tourist experience.
Great food, service and atmosphere.  Horrid bathrooms.

Came here a few years ago, reluctantly came back - so glad we did! The bartender was so helpful and did a fantastic job helping us pick and choose and I so thoroughly appreciated his willingness to discuss assorted flavors etc.
This place is a hidden gem!!!!!! Love the food and the ambiance! Do not be fooled if you look in the window, the restaurant is downstairs with old world romantic ambiance. Great date restaurant!

I was looking for a good introductory restaurant for a 20something family member from out of town. This was perfect including the Russian Hill drive as a SF introduction. Do not be confused by the small upstairs. Go downstairs to the main restaurant. The decor is dark and cosy and the crowd noisy. The place was crowded on a Friday night and they didn't take reservations. We arrived at 8 and didn't need to wait.

Their beer selection is fantastic! The burger, fries, and dipping sauces are just out of this world! Definitely recommend this place. The waitress was super nice and very helpful as well. You have to stop by this place even if it's just to look at the book with the list of the amazing beers they have. You won't walk out without trying at least one.

5 stars for La Trappe just based on the ambiance and beer list. What a great, cozy place to go during the winter to enjoy one of the best beer lists around. So many great choices it is a bit overwhelming, but all of our waiters were engaging and willing to help out. I could go on and on about the great ambiance and decor but let's just say it makes the place.
Great beer, good place, glad I am in the hood.
What a great find near where we stayed on vacation!  Who knew Belgian food was do great?!  Fabulous beer selection, too.

Great little place to grab a beer.  Waitress was very knowledgeable and made some excellent suggestions.  Had no cell reception on bottom level so keep this in mind if you are meeting up with a large party.  Overall, can't wait to go back and try more!

The downstairs bar is very cozy. I came here after going to a comedy show nearby and thought they might have delirium (they don't have it on tap and ran out of the bottles) but ordered some other belgian beer on tap. It was great! The bartender happily poured my date and I some samples before we ordered.

La Trappe is quite a little find, well... at least being adjacent to a tourist trap. This is in part due to its newly-refurbished downstairs, which hides the fact that locals actually enjoy their fine food, beer, and even wine selection. In fact, the downstairs is so comfy, so full of tables with chess boards built-in, and so full of old brick and funky wall coverings -- I could spend an entire review just raving about the decor and ambiance. Let's be glad I'm not actually doing that, eh?
Best beer bar in San Francisco. Hands down. The best.
This is one of my favorite places in San Fran.  It is only open certain nights so check before you go.

We found La Trappe as we were walking back from dinner and decided to have a drink. We went downstairs and James Knox was probably the best bartender/beer know-it-all we have ever met. He was friendly, knowledgeable and funny and the beer he suggested was a perfect match for my husband and I. We will most definitely come back to La Trappe next time we are in The City!

Took my family here this weekend expecting some delicious Belgium food, and although our main courses were pretty good, they weren't very authentic. If you've had a real croquette, don't expect theirs to be anything like it we were really disappointed. They also didn't have 5 of the beers that we ordered, the waitress kept coming back to say they were out of stock. It took a long time too, for us that wasn't an issue because we had the time but it's not a quick place by any means. Our waitress also tried to charge us for a glass of wine that we sent back, and didn't drink because it wasn't the wine we ordered. She took it off the bill eventually, but it was strange she even tried to charge us for it. It's pricey for what it is, but the atmosphere is fun.
Wow.  Wow.  Um - wow.  If you are drinking a lot, the price goes up quite a bit.  But it is totally worth it.
once you head downstairs to the beer cave, take a look at the beer menu. it's pretty extensive. service was ok, ordered some small appetizers and they came out to our table in what seemed like hours.
Don't be fooled... Ate here on a Friday (may 2014) and food was dry and overcooked. Service was totally chaotic like nobody had a clue what was happening.

We were excited to try La Trappe and enjoy some great food. At first the server was attentive, we got our drinks and orders promptly. They brought some bread that was delicious and a little pat of butter. We waited for our server to reappear so we could ask for more butter. Finally my husband went and found her and she brought another little pat of butter. Later when we ask for more, we were told the restaurant was out of butter. Out of butter?? After waiting for our food for about 30 min without any one checking on us (we were in a corner), our server came and told us the printer was broken and our order had not reached the kitchen but now it would only be another 10 min or so. We finally received our food and my husbands food was not hot. But of course, no one checked on us for another 10 min, when he was able to tell them. A good 15 min later she returned with his plate. By then, I was done eating. Poor service. Definitely not a friendly place. There did not seem to be any real concern or care for the customer. The food was good.

This is the place my husband chose for his birthday dinner and we were not disappointed.  Had not been there for almost a year, and I don't know why! We will definitely be back soon for the mussels and fries! I do wish they served Guinness Stout, or draught from the bar.  (I do not like Guinness draught in the cans. Not the same.)

Mussels were bountiful.  Sauce was good (curry).  The french fries are double-fried, so it's got that nice Jack in the Box crust.  It comes w/ two dipping sauces and my fav was the wasabi mayo.  I also had the spaghetti.  Surprisingly good, better than most Italian pasta joints.  The noodles were thick (like udon) and were cooked perfectly to al dente.  The brussels sprouts were okay, plentiful, but boiled or steamed and covered in a ranch like sauce.  I was hoping that they would be roasted, but I needed fiber so they worked.  Overall, beer selection is crazy.  I'm not a fan of tripels, or doubels, but this place has a ton of foreign beers.  This place reminded me a lot of bars in Paris.  It has a really cool vibe and the servers are very nice.  I'm glad I came here.

Great Belgium beer selection and even have Russian River beers in bottles. Probably not the most adventurous meal, but I had the cheeseburger. The burger was good sized, approximately 1/2 lb but lacked flavor/seasoning. Fries were crispy and above average.
Awesome beer, awesome good. Super friendly staff. If you have a problem with this place you probably have a problem with yourself.

I went to La Trappe a few months ago and had such a horrible experience that I'm still bitter about it. I invited a few friends out to see our favorite comedian and planned to go to La Trappe for dinner prior to the show. We gave ourselves ample time (about an hour and a half) so we could eat, drink, and still have time to find good seats at the show. As much as I want to base my review on the beer and one appetizer, the one star is mostly based on the slow chef in the kitchen and the hostile manager that left such a bitter taste in my mouth.

4.5 stars for a gastropub. Come here for the crazy encyclopedia of wines from every country - it's literally as extensive as the wine list from a restaurant like French Laundry, except in beer. I have never seen anything like it. They even had champagne beer which I have never heard of. The beer sommelier (is there another name for this?) was super knowledgeable on recommending the best beer to one's taste.

Best italian food i have ever had. The bruscetta was so flavorful and perfectly crisp it started themeal out on a high note. The gnocchi,as people have said before, melts in your mouth and makes you close your eyes so you can fully enjoy it. I got the lasagna which tasted homemade and was amazingly hearty, cheesy and satisfying. The tiramisu was of course great, but the cannoli was the star of the desserts and even their coffee was fantastic! Great servicethat is really quick and attentive as well! Dont miss this place :) it would make an amazing date night spot!

If you are looking for an authentic old world family experience, this is the place.  They are a family owned/run business in the style most businesses should aspire to be.  We made a reservation and were seated promptly.  We had our soon to be 4yr. old with us and he was warmly welcomed.  Our appetizers were tasty and our entrees were delicious. Our son's dessert was brought out with a birthday candle and the tiramisu was amazing.  Throughout our dining experience we traded anecdotes about small children with the family/waitstaff.  If you are interested in real people that serve great food that actually have pride in what they do, I suggest you give this place a visit.
This place is a really cute, small Italian restaurant. Definitely looks like a great date spot. We got seated right away (table for 2) on a Wednesday night.

Last Thursday night, before going to Beach Blanket, one of the gals in our party of 4 had suggested Franchinos.....we couldn't have been more pleased.....we were greeted and seated right away......by the sweetest lady....Mrs Franchinos I am thinking....we ordered the gnocchi as an appetizer for the 4 of us to share....it was delicious.... Our entrees couldn't have been better....and desert, oh my!!!!! The finish to a delicious meal.... I complimented the owner and told her, we would be back....

This is our favorite Italian place in San Francisco!  My girlfriend and I went here early in our relationship and it quickly became our go to venue for special occasions.  It's got everything we need for a special date: delicious food, intimate atmosphere, and friendly service.
My absolute new fav gem in my neighborhood.

This place disgusts me. Completely disappointed with their service!  I made a reservation at 6pm and called them at 5:58pm as a courtesy to tell them I was on my way and was going to be 5 minutes late. They proceeded to tell me that I'll then have to be put on the wait list and my reservation won't be valid. For 5 minutes of tardiness, that is completely excessive!  I can't believe that.  And the women that answered the phone was completely rude and gave me total attitude.  Just a heads up that supposedly the food might be good but to have that kind of service is unacceptable and other places in the city are better.
Excellent pasta - perfectly cooked!  We also enjoyed the clams, they were in a salty, buttery broth that was to die for!  Porcini Ravioli was amazing!
Just exceptional! This is exactly what I was looking for in Little Italy. A family business. Exceptional food!
Very nice mom and pop restaurant. I too think the owner welcomed us in and sat us in one of the 8 or so tables the restaurant has.

Awesome authentic Italian restaurant owned by a family. Very cute and cozy. Everything was really delicious. We ordered chicken parmigiana with pasta on the side, definitely a must try. Tortellini soup had enough flavour, wasn't too salty, again, great overall. We also ordered their homemade tiramisu, for me personally, the cream on it was a delight. Nice friendly service. The restaurant was packed, so if recommend making a reservation.

My second time here and definitely not my last! By far the best Italian food in SF! The owners treat all customers like family and I can say with confidence that everything on the menu is amazing! I love the lasagna and their ravioli. For dessert, the cannoli is the way to go!
Best mom & pop italian in sf! Walk right by the stinking rose & go here. Ask what ravioli the lady of the house made that day & order it!
- food: mediocre, store-bought pasta
