A wonderful casual place to eat in the Ferry Building. I probably get my lunch from here more than any other restaurant in the building. The cafe serves fresh, healthy food with a menu that changes daily. I had the best ham sandwich I've ever had in my life here. Warm succulent ham with greens. The salads are delightful. Creative vegetable combinations with various cheeses and dressings. The stews are hearty and the rotisserie chicken fantastic as well. I've never had anything I did not like from this restaurant. Ask for a card if you are a regular there. They have an around the world sort of menu card where they give you a stamp for trying each of their different menu items. When you fill the card up they give you 50% off a lunch of your choice. A friendly staff who remembers you by name. They do have seating but it's in sort of a drafty corridor of the Ferry Building. Usually I get my meal to go and eat it in my office or take it someplace else.
My bad. The "random" guy on the sidewalk is the restaurants namesake. Interesting. And the food is great. Treated like family, small, intimate setting that's grey for talking and laughing. Nice.

I was here with a group of six women for a dinner meeting. I was excited because I don't get to North Beach as often as I'd like and was anxious for some real Italian food. I had a tough time parking and was a little late to our 6:30 p.m. reservation, but the other 5 girls were there. I called my friend to let her know I was walking and she said that they were already being pressured to hurry. I hastened my walk a bit and got there around 6:45 or so.
Nice Little family owned restaurant. Nicer than your average hole in the wall.
The service was good and the people are so nice, but this is over-priced and nothing special. It's typical "Little Italy" fare.

Incredible service and food. We got the lasagna and chicken parmesan. They were both AMAZING! We left feeling full but not heavy. We got a table right away, but I got the feeling that it's usually not the case. I'd recommend calling ahead or arriving early. Also, they only seat you when everyone in your pretty has arrived.

You might find cheaper, or nicer decor in North Beach, but you will not find better food.  If you aren't charmed by the Mother and Daughters working hard while exuding Italian warmth, you ain't got a heart. Yes, you might have to drive around to get a parking spot and then wait, but it is  worth it.  Fresh, hand made pasta and Tiramisu by mom were wonderful.  We will be back.
I don't write reviews often unless I feel the compelling need to let my annoyances or pleasure out about a place.
A very lovely setting. Pastel blue tables, lots of "Italian" paintings/items, and clean plates/silverware.

My wife and I are both of Italian dissent  so we are extremely critical when it comes to Italian food. We both grew up in households where our parents and grandparents made their own meatballs and gravy (yes true Italians really call it gravy and not sauce or meat sauce).  If you want neuvo cuisine type food maybe Franchino isn't your cup of tea. But if you want great pasta with meatballs, and great gravy that is all homemade by Mama who is originally from the Amalifi Coast of Italy, this is your place. The restaurant is small and fills up quickly so get there early. We arrived by 6pm and had no problem getting a table. Arrive at 7pm and the place is packed.  The owner makes all of her own pasta and gravy and you can tell. Her daughters work as waitresses and they are all a delight.  We're from the Phila area originally and these folks made us feel right at home.  The chianti is great accompaniment and if you save room for dessert, the homemade tiramisu is to die for. To be frank, I can't figure out how anyone could give this restaurant a 1 rating.  The food is just too good. Maybe if you want quiet romantic, you could deduct points for the ambiance but still, the food more than compensates. I cannot say enough good things about Franchino. We would absolutely make this one of our eateries on our next trip.

We had a good meal but it was overshadowed by the attitude of the hostess/owner/waitress.  Very rude. All about her needs.  No regard for allowing the customer to enjoy the experience.   If she wants to turn tables so quickly,  maybe she should say that upon booking reservation.  Rushed from the get go.

Awesome restaurant. Easily the most authentic in Little Italy. not the biggest or showiest - but this is where you come if you want amazing authentic Italian cooked by Nonna ! Book way ahead or walk in but be prepared to wait 20-30mins on busy nights - but worth the wait. The Gamberi was awesome
My new favorite hole in the wall Italian restaurant.

We have had dinner here twice. The most recent was last weekend. Both times our dinner has been excellent. The family is very friendly and made us feel welcome. We were seated right away. We received water and bread along with olive oil and vinegar.

With so many choices in the area, very few, if any are as good as this one.   Love eating at local family owned and operated and this one did not disappoint.  Price is reasonable and service was friendly and fast.   Excellent quality as well.   Not a big bar selection but enough to satisfy.   Will return next time in in San Francisco for sure.
I've really gotta give this place five stars...

We stumbled into Columbus Ave on our first day in S.F.  This family-owned place is excellent.  My boyfriend's chicken saltimboca was really good.  I had a pasta with marinara. It was perfect. The place is small and we were lucky to find a table.
Yummy Italian food at an authentic family owned joint. We need a place like this in Palo Alto!
Either the quality has gone down or my taste buds have higher expectations than the last time I was here (about 2 years ago).

The small restaurant is in a great location right in Little Italy. Next time I go to San Francisco, I am for sure coming back here. The Veal Saltimboca  was to die for and I can honestly say I have never had a more delicious fettucinni than the one they make here.!

I love this restaurant to death. My friend and I ended up here after The House told us there was an hour wait. Ain't nobody got time for that! Yelp guided us to better. So far my favorite Italian restaurant, it's too bad I live in LA.

Absolutely a wonderful experience. The caprese salad and house salads were a great start. My wife and I had 2 different veal dishes (mustard and saltimbucco). Both excellent! Followed our meal with delicious limoncello custard. Very friendly and efficient service with a great atmosphere. Will definitely be back.

Best Italian we have had in years. Mama must work her butt off each day to create gnocchi, cannoli and ravioli of such quality. Vongole, smoked mozzarella, ravioli and the special pappardelle all excellent.  The family inadvertently entertained us while we ate, go early as I think it gets a bit chaotic as the evening wears on. Thanks for great service Monica!

Our family of six had dinner at  Franchino's Sat night.  We are from San Diego and live near a mall w a Buca De Bepo (sp?) a franchise that imitates old Italian family food w tacky/sheek decor.  Franchino's must be where they got the idea from!  Everything about this place was a joy.  From the older Italian grandpa with booming voice and playfull welcome, to grandma who helped us  tease/scold our naughty 12yo son, to the daughter waitress.  Space and decor was a visual delight.  Food was delicious and complex, much better than mall restaurant mentioned above.  Tiramisu for dessert was the best I've had.  Thanks so much for making our stay in SF a delightful vacation for all our senses.
After walking all the way from
Amazing food. The mom, Carmela, and the dad were wonderful hosts. Felt like being an Italian home, such warmth and comfort. Small dining area, but wonderful atmosphere.
Wine was pricier than I anticipated ($8 for a house red). But it's a cute bar with friendly staff and a relaxed atmosphere. Good for people looking for a comfortable spot to have a drink and a snack.

A solid, local neighborhood bar with a great atmosphere. My go-to for 49ers football. The bar food is damn good too. I've had a burger, veggie burger, breakfast chroizo tacos, and the famous bacon-wrapped tots--all are really, really good. Solid bloody mary's as well, albeit a little pricey at $8.

Cool bar, BUT there are a few douchey guys that  run rampant 'round this place. I guess that could be just about any bar in SF, so I'm not hating, just saying.. I will definitely be back but I will bring friends and ignore all weirdos lol
Great place to catch a game (what ever sport you want to see). There are at least 5 tvs inside. Its a casual local bar that can get packed depending on the day.
Taco Tuesday is off the hook. Try the carnitas tacos. And you can never go wrong with bacon wrapped tots

I'll give the bar itself 4 stars, but if I was rating the clientele, they'd get a big FAT 1 star. Talk about a Sausage Fest. And not the good kind of Sausage Fest, ladies! All the worst kind of douchey sausages that you could never want to meet. I truly hope that we had an off experience last night when we went to trivia because I feel sorry for the Boardroom staff if that is what their normal patrons are like. I'll probably only go back if I feel like it's a good night to get constantly harassed.

I have mixed emotions about The Boardroom. On the one hand, it's in North Beach, a place I love, the staff is incredibly kind, they play great music, and have lots of big TVs for ample sports viewing.
Bacon wrapped tator tots !!!
Yay! I'm a fan.  Here are 5 reasons why I give two thumbs up to The Boardroom:

To the guy below that call the place "Racist". I was there and I'm african-american. You were kicked out for taking your beer outside. No place allows that if they can't serve liquor outside. The Bartender ( Sal ) was super polite, reasonable and gave you NUMEROUS WARNINGS. You and your friends were out of line and rude. You can't break the rules and be sh*tty!!!! Sorry... you gotta Pick One! That is why you got the Deuces, bruh!

After eating several entrees of food and enjoying a couple drinks, my friends and I were outside chatting with some other guests and my girlfriend brought me a beer while I was outside. She claimed that the bartender was cool with this. While we were outside talking, a man who claimed to be the owner happened to be walking into the bar at the same time. He stated that we could not have our drinks outside, to which we gladly obliged and brought our beverages inside. At this point the owner seemed very upset with the bartender for letting this happen. Once inside, my girlfriend went back outside to have a smoke and did not have any drinks with her. She had been outside for about 20 min and since the area is a little dark and shady, I decided to peek my head out the front door to check on her. Let me clarify, I did not set foot outside of the door I only looked outside to make sure my girlfriend was OK. At this point, the bartender very rudely asked me to give him my drink. I believe he was trying to make up for his prior mistake of letting us take the drinks outside and to look good in front of the owner. Once again, I did not put up a fight and gave him my drink and the bartender never mentioned that I was cut off or could not have another drink. About 5 minutes later, my buddy had an extra drink, which he gave to me. When the bartender saw me with another drink he proceeded to officially kick me and my whole group of friends out of the bar. My other friends asked why they were being kicked out as well and the owner claimed "Because you are with him and I have to backup my bartender". My friends were from outside of the area and I felt we were being treated unjustly and unfairly because we were seen as outsiders. Message to the bartender: own up to your mistakes and don't try and make up for it by being overly strict to customers, that is not a fair way to treat your business.
We came in last night for trivia and had a blast.
Looking for a dive bar in the city that locals frequent and the tourist don't wander into? Then The Boardroom is your place to go!

Try the bacon wrapped tater tots!  I am not sure they are '$9 good' but it is bacon and tater tots, you really can't go wrong.  The Boardroom was a typical dive, order at the bar and disgusting bathrooms, but it was fabulous to get away from all the tourists!!  We each had a cold beer, wolfed down some bacon wrapped tots, then decided it was time to move onto the next watering hole.
A true North Beach gem. A must goto bar / food spot.
Excellent brunch!!
Cool bartender and a chill vibe in this neighborhood bar. Don't pass up the bacon wrapped tater tots. Truly an appetizer born from binge drinking.
A couple reasons why this place is great:
Decent for a neighborhood dive. They accept credit cards which is also a plus.

Nice place! Very nice staff and super comfortable and chill feeling for an easy Sunday lunch. Must try their bacon tots while rooting for your team on tv. Their drink selection is nice too so take a snap at it.

This place is awesome!  Salvador was the bartender and he was incredibly friendly the food is delicious.   Take my advice,  ask the cook to "get crazy" with their Boardroom burger.   You won't be sorry.   Also,  have to heard of bacon wrapped tater tots? Because you should have.
Love love LOVE this place! Best bloody Mary's and breakfast! Great place to watch a game, super nice people
We were able to get a table and it was comfortable and big. I got a beer and tried a couple of a friend's fries and they were yummy! I've heard this place has better than average food.
Trivia nights are fabulous and the staff is awesome. Fun chill nights are spent here. We live close and make it here at one or two times a week and it's always pleasant.

This is an excellent neighborhood bar/dive. Its small and pretty bare bones with old booths and beer buckets that hold utensils and condiments. We walked here for a quick drink and bite to eat before flying out on Sunday. All of our plates were under $10 and the Bloody Mary was awesome.

Wandered into the Boardroom by myself to catch some of the NCAA tournament. I'm from out of town so the bartender was very friendly since I was all by myself. I think his name was Lou... The place had a good atmosphere and a good group of people trying to get their Friday drink on.

Went to the boardroom with some friends last Sunday morning, because I heard they had a decent brunch and a bloody Mary that could "knock my socks off".  Both had exceeded my expectations. I had the loco moco with house made gravy, which put me directly in heaven, and the side of bacon smothered in maple syrup.  Can I just say, I will return for the bacon alone! if there is a heaven, I sincerely hope it is made of this bacon! Moving on...

Was having a pretty good time here with a group of friends until I was getting ready to leave. I was waiting on my boyfriend when suddenly I felt something hit my chest. The bartender had thrown a plastic cup at me from behind the bar. When I asked him why, he stated "You looked like you weren't having fun." Yes, because hitting me with a projectile object is going to help me have an awesome time. Screw you. Who behaves like that and works in customer service?
Time: 9:07pm/59°F clear
This bar is a great neighborhood spot.  I always have a good time - whether it is for weekly Tuesday Trivia, Thursday night football, college football Saturdays...or just to pop in for a few drinks.

The bacon wrapped tots are the shiz but the BELT was dry and flavorless, lacking avocado and any perpetual longing for a future visit. The onion rings were decent and the one dude I met was friendly but Overall  this bar is good for the tots but lacks much else

I was drawn to this place with the promise of bacon wrapped tater tots and brunch.  I understood this is a dive bar, so I didn't expect too much. The food is cheap bar fare. There are lots of tvs showing sports and lots of frat alumni for those that enjoy those things.
Great bar, awesome bartenders, cheap chicken wings and bacon wrapped tator tots...plenty of tv's to watch sports.

Friendly service. Great food (bacon wrapped tators,! Deep fried pork buns with awesome sweet and spicy sauce!). Great drinks! Non pretentious patrons that will sing along to Whitney Houston and do push ups for shoes! What more can you ask for?

bacon wrapped tator tots.  in theory, it sounds awesome, they were actually overcooked, dry and quite salty.  i do appreciate they give you a mix of buffalo hot sauce and ranch to dip it in, but for $8, it's a little steep considering there were about 12 tots on the plate
Went here because someone that I share a workspace with said they have good wings and other bar food.
My wife and I were in town during college football season and were looking for a place that both served food and had our

I am revising this poor review (1) to a (3) reflecting management care and reaching out to me to correct the problem. I would've given a (4) if it weren't for an employee's extreme rudeness at the location. White male with long blond hair and tattoos. He was very disrespectful to our group the first time we ever went. After discussing with other employees this seems to be a common occurrence for this dude.
Great sports bar. This place is no frills and a fantastic place to check out and watch a game.
Boardroom is the perfect, sticky, delicious-bar-food-fried, fast beer and shots football bar I've been to in SF. It's a serious Arizona State University football bar too! A-S-UUUUUUUUUU!!!!

I go here around once a week and just love the place. The chicken is perfectly cooked and seasoned. One time, one of the waitresses witnessed my clumsy attempt at trying to use utensils, knocking a piece of chicken on the floor. They replaced that piece of chicken.
Super casual restaurant on Columbus with freaking delicious chicken. All the sides are solid as well.
Chicken very dry.  I mean very very dry.  Salad fresh and veggie soup was good.  But the chicken, the main reason for Il Pollaio was dry and bland.

This is a good place to grab a casual meal, especially if you want a lot of food. I have ordered the chicken, combination salad, fries, and split pea soup at this place. While the volume of food is a good deal for the price, I was not impressed by the food. The chicken was juicy and flavorful, but not something I would come back for. The fries were fresh from the fryer, but were really bland. The split pea soup was unpleasantly thick and had a bitter taste.

This restaurant is famous for its chicken and salads. The chicken is pretty nicely done, the combination salad is also a good deal. The service is attentive without being intrusive. They should maybe buy more bottles of oil, we had to share ours with 3 others tables. The price is decent and affordable but I have to admit that I was expecting a price a little bit cheaper.

Il Pollaio is a North Beach institution, and unlike many of the other restaurants in the area, they have tons of regular local customers, like myself. The chicken is obviously the primary attraction. It's always super tasty, with a nice crisp skin, and pairs very well with the combination salad.

Come have dinner here and your palate and wallet won't be disappointed.... The chicken is done perfectly and it is seasoned just right.  It's convenient and fast for take out as well.  Dinner for two or three will not be expensive...

In this area, if you want a dinner for 2 out somewhere, you'll be hard pressed to find anything for $30 or under. It is full of touristy Italian places and expensive food. My boyfriend and I ate at Il Pollaio for under $30 AND we both had leftovers for lunch the next day.

The best chicken in town! This place is small, you can tell it is more local, waitresses know their customers, they are like friends with them! If it's your first time at this place it is a MUST to try their CHICKEN special with combination salad! Simple, reasonable prices and ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! I'm becoming a regular!
This place has amazingly tasty chicken.  My favorite is getting the half chicken and grilled onions.  You cannot go wrong here and healthy options abound here.

The chicken is soooo goood, but my boyfriend's chicken was not cooked all the way through and was red.  My bf told me over the phone to make sure they cooked the chicken thoroughly - I did not.  I brought the food back and my plate was thoroughly cooked, however his wasn't.  He's had several plates previously and almost every time, the chicken was red by the bone. Ew.  Other than that, the chicken is seasoned to perfection.
Roasted chicken as it should be done!
Chicken is amazing, price is right, service is prompt and the servers are fun to joke around with.
what i ordered... a whole roasted chicken
Quick service.

Amazing. But don't bother, this is a good secret we want to keep to ourselves! I love them so much I don't even want to share a review in fear of creating more of a crowd than there already is for this place....but I am here too often, infant in a car seat included, and I owe them one for their amazing customer service and quick accommodations, even when crowded.  Oh and of course that amazing food...speaks for itself.

Nice take-out and (small, oddly-shaped) eat-in restaurant specializing in chicken. Apparently they sometimes have rabbit too, which I missed. Cooked on a flat-top grill and heavily-spiced with oregano n stuff, the half-chicken was juicy and really tasty. The fries were steak-cut and not that crisp by the time I got em home, but still quite edible. And the coleslaw was really crunchy - you apply the dressing your own self right before eating. It was very nice.

I have been coming here for at least 8 years and I always have a good experience with the food and service. The food quality always consistent. You may have to wait a little bit on the weekend if you catch their on their rush time due to their limiting seating space, otherwise everything is alright.

Oh yeah.  I love this little hole in the wall.  Have been going there for years anytime I am in San Francisco.  The menu is small: chicken, rabbit, sausages or steak as well as salad and fries make us the most of it.  But man I have never had a bad meal here and it is cheap to boot.  Tell that inner voice urging you to order the salad to go away and order the fries instead (or as well).  They are always perfectly crispy and soft and hot on the inside.  Can't go wrong with the chicken here either or any anything else on the menu.

I came during lunch time on a Wednesday. This place is an institution and I know it has a lot of regulars. I witnessed that fact that afternoon. The waitress knew people's names and in general, their orders. She was not unfriendly, but businesslike. I ordered the half chicken and green salad combo with bleu cheese dressing on the side. My boyfriend tried the Italian sausage and ordered a side of fries.

This has got to be one of my favorite restaurants in North Beach. It's easily overshadowed by more well-known places like Mama's and Tony's Pizza, but if you're looking for more of a home-cooked or comfort-food meal, this place is it.
The best place in North Beach to get chicken.
Half chicken and combination salad are good.

Best grilled chicken in the bay area! Great portions, good prices, glass of good red wine for only $6, combination salad is delicious, sausages are yum and very friendly staff! It's just a hidden gem if you haven't come yet and you love chicken, come now! I don't know why but this chicken always reminds me of my summers in portugal! Oh and they do a boiled potato that is just sticky deliciousness with awesome olive oil. The most friendly employees and owners that offer excellent service. I have many fond memories of eating here with my dad. If you can't figure out where to eat and you want good food that won't cost you an arm and a leg, please come here! Bon appetite!
We have been going to Il Pollaio for years. Jose and Ana always made us feel welcome, especially when we brought our children.

Il Pollaio is mainly known for its grilled chicken, so that's what I ordered. I got the half chicken with fries. It was more than enough food for me and tasty. The fries were thick cut, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The chicken had a flavorful seasoning and was very tender. No complaints, priced right and tasted good. I would consider buying a whole chicken to go in the future and using it in salads or other dishes.
Chicken was tasty

Problem #1: I am surrounded by sandwich places when it's time for lunch. I decided I want chicken, not chicken chunks in a sub, not chicken slices between 2 pieces of bread and not chicken bits grilled inside a panini. I want to pick the bones out myself and tear off the crispy skin with my teeth.

Ahhhhhh, Il Pollaio. I have been ordering out from this restaurant every week and a half or so for the last couple months, but today was the first time I ate out here. Atmosphere is comfy-cozy, just how I like it, our server was very sweet, kind, and helpful, and the wait for the food was only about five minutes, which was awesome, because I was STARVING and couldn't have the bread, since I was celebrating Passover. "But what about the food?", you may ask. The food was AWESOME. The chicken is delicious (three friends and I got a whole chicken, large garden salad, and large fries), I had no garden salad, because that kind of salad is not quite to my liking, but my friends said it was great. The fries were lovely looking, and they were so good I felt less guilty about eating them. The only reason that this didn't get five stars is the fact that we had to wait 10-15 minutes for our food to be taken and our check to be given. I was so full, though, the wait just gave me a couple minutes to relax.

I was trying to soothe a hangover with some comfort food, and had wandered around poking my head into much too full and much too vacant restaurants until I found this restaurant that was juuust right, or so I thought....

Came here on a cold weeknight and my boyfriend and I were seated immediately. It's a very casual dining experience. Salads are huge and 2 people can definitely share a salad and the yummy fries. My boyfriend ordered the half chicken and devoured it in 5 minutes. So tasty! We had to order another! This is a local place and their food does not disappoint. If you're hungry for some finger lickin' chicken, this is your place!
Chicken, chicken, chicken, chicken, chicken.

Oh so good! The chicken was tasty and charcoaled. Even loved the bbq sauce. Also - the split pea soup was super yum - thick and smoky. And the combo salad was fresh and simple. Small locals feel to the place. Loved it.
BEST CHICKEN. Seriously probably my favorite meal of all time: half chicken, homemade salsa, combo salad.
I have been eating at il Pollaio for almost 20 years.

Delicious chicken.  Like, so good that I'd like to use expletives to emphasize my point, but have to avoid doing so.  The whole concept for this place is so simple and so well done, particularly for those times you're in the mood to switch off the bougie SF foodie persona and go casual with some food like grandma makes (if my grandma were Italian).
Decent food, bad service.

I've been coming to Il Pollaio for years. It's a nice little family-owned joint that serves up some pretty tasty food. The chicken is always great off the grill, with a little squeeze of lemon, but I generally go for their burger or their 3 sausages. The burger is good meat and I get it medium rare. It's kind of a longer shape than the typical patty and they usually serve it on a scooped-out piece of baguette or sometimes ciabatta(which I don't like as much). The 3 sausages meal is interesting because I guess you can get it as a sandwich on the baguette, but I've also gotten them uhhh...not as a sandwich. The sandwiches come with hella tomatoes, lettuce and raw onions, but I uusually take out the lettuce and tomatoes and eat that separately as my salad.

We have been bringing our family here well over 15 years. Everyone has their favorites, chicken, rabbit, combo salad, and they make a great burger and the best fries ever. You may have to wait for a table, but worth it.
i can't believe this is the first time i've thought of writing about this place.  i've been going here forever - well, about 17 years...

This was our final stop for the North Beach Food tour.  We were served an appetizer of the ham, tomato, and mozzarella cheese.  The tomato acidity counter acted with the olive oil and the cheese. Quite a delicious bite.

Maybe it was due to a long day and it being the Columbus Parade but the service was terrible. I would understand if it was busy but there were 4 parties or less the whole time we were there, with 3 employees as servers.

you gotta Love homemade Italian food especially if a Beautiful  Roman lady is cooking it from scratch for you , great fun service , and  rich portions , would not suggest to take a date but good for big groups and mingling with friends, dishes to watch ... croccanti melanzane ,margherita pizza and ravioli Romani ..

OUTSTANDING pizza romana and one of my favorite N Beach people of all time, ciao Romina :  )......this is how a lot of NB used to be, friends.  Good service, delicious cucina semplice ('foodies' might be disappointed b/c there is no pretension here).  Good beers on tap, lots of unique combinations of pizza, panini, pasta, and diverse menu.  Many locals know this is the place for solid pizza romana and it's not so in-your-face, let's make a lotta money as Tony's.  (Sorry Tony but a lot of us still miss La Felce and that space will never be as good).  Last night there were three or four local fellas at the bar, all of us were very happy, pizza beer Giants, and a pair of Italian tourists at a back table...they were also VERY happy, which says a lot (especially if you have lived in Italy and can understand their +++ comments about their dinner and the lovely feel of this place).  Nice experience there last night, grazie tanto!
As a true pizza fanatic I love many a kind o pizza.   So I went binging tonight to sample a few pies in North Beach, San Francisco.

As a North Beach local, and Italian native, this is one of the most authentic places around. Fabulous crispy thin crusted pizza that melts in your mouth. Romina the owner is feisty, full of personality and a true treat. I always recommend the Boscaiola, sauage and mushroom pizza (#1) on the menu.But seriously, this is REAL pizza, so soak it up and take a lesson from Cinecitta.

Amazing thin crust pizza and the owner, who works behind the bar, is very attentive and playfully nice. When we asked to make some additions to the pizza she happily agreed, anything to make the silly customers happy.  Great wine and food selection for a date. The food, even the pizza, is very light and won't leave you feeling like you need to be rolled out of here.
My family and I had a birthday dinner here recently and it was a fun and tasty experience! The atmosphere is very warm and cozy. The staff was accommodating and friendly.
What an amazing experience I had at Cinecitta!  I went there nearly a month ago for my sisters birthday, and I regret not writing this review until now.
Great food!!  Whole made sauce and pasta, this place is the bomb.  You go stay and enjoy the food, not a place for a rushed meal.
If I had to sum up my advice after eating here into one word, it would be this: AVOID!  Bland food, NO atmosphere, and a Groupon policy that's laughable.

I found the place during the time I lived in NB, shortly after it opened from 2005-08 . I only recently moved back, and have been a regular for the past year. The pizza is great, with a crunchy, extremely thin crust and flavorful sauce. I love the Trastevere and Porcini pizza. Another favorite is the fried mozarella (freshly made and not frozen!). The pasta and particular lasagna are outstanding as well.

I had a sausage pizza slice. Very generous serving! The owner learned from her grandfather in Rome. They make their sausage, as well as a sauce with very little, if any, sugar, I'm told. I had a very enjoyable time with the staff and other guests! I actually chose it because of its location, close to the route I was taking. When I arrived, there were a number of tempting places to choose from, but I just stick with the plan.  So glad I did!! Thanks, Cinecittà!

Wine was great! Salad and Alla Romano pizza tasted homemade. Amazing!  We used a groupon and weren't sure what to expect. Our waitress Romina (the nice blond) was awesome. Great suggestions for wine. Custom salad. We'll be back!
There's a reason why some businesses rely on Groupon.  Cinecitta is a prime example.
Not at all what I was expecting.
Great food, great hospitality.  If you like to order a variety, this is the place.  The crust is so light and non filling you can order multiple items.  I recommend this place!
Great friendly staff.
Quite simply the best pizza I've ever had anywhere. You can't go wrong here. The employees were super nice too. I'll he back again and again.

I am not a pizza connoisseur, and I avoid preserved meats like prosciutto.  This place made me a convert! The caprese salad was amazing! And the pizza was the best I've ever tried. The owner provided complimentary strawberries and fresh whipped cream as dessert after we declared ourselves too stuffed to take another bite - and she proved us very wrong indeed. :-)

Excellent food; Homemade right in front of you. Great wine selection picked personally by the owner. Fitting statement: No one is ever perfect, but this "angry blonde" is right up my alley. If you want great food and an excellent experience, visit this place.

My family and I went there on Monday April 21st to have some of the best thin crust pizza I have ever tasted. Unfortunately, we were met with serious attitude from the blonde lady who was working there. She walked over and pointed at another 4+ top table which I assumed meant "why didn't you sit over there?"  I responded with "we would've sat there if it wasn't for the "reserved" sign that was on the table."  After we were sat she dropped the menus on the table and walked away.
Best pizza and Calzone ever, with great wine recommendations. I'm definitely coming back!
My 4 rating means I need to come back. This place was good, but not a must to return to. I consulted my 3 friends during the dinner, and they all agreed.
The pizza here is amazing!!!  I also love the service!  Definitely go here for a delicious dinner!

Neat little place in North Beach. Good Italian food (kinda heavy) and it looks like there's a nice wine selection ,but it was St Paddy's Day so I decided to go for the wine instead. They seemed a little short-staffed when I was there with friends, but good experience overall.

This is a small "hole in the wall" type place. Our hostess was also our server, the bartender and helped cook as well. I think she is the owner and was very friendly, good with our kids and had a great Italian accent, throwing in some basic Italian words into our service. It was a great experience.
Owner is a total crack up who cares about her customers and makes the best thin crust I have ever had!

A small place with a huge heart.  Go in the afternoon to meet the owner Romeann ( not sure of the spelling).  She is sweetheart with a adventurous past.  From tinkerbell to world renowned shows this professional dancer will entertain you with her stories.  Not to mention her love of her former city - Rome.  A glass of wine and her pizza is a perfect afternoon date.
Was a very easy big group meal for a birthday but the food wasn't anything special. I think the one thing that stood out was the sausage and pepperoni pizza.
I ate my last Cinecitta pizza in 2006. It was so good I wrote a review 8 years later. End of story.
Can't take leftovers when using a Groupon and won't honor Groupon without a reservation even if there are no other customers!  Read on it actually happened.

Complete discrepancy between price and food. Don't go with kids or you'll end up ordering off-menu...$18 for spaghetti and meatballs is absolutely crazy considering the food was just ho-hum.  Plain penne pasta with olive oil was $14. Guess the pasta was hand made in Italy. Pizza was ok except for the nice black sheen on the edges...maybe that's how they ensure it was cooked extra crispy.  Overall disappointing experience.  Never should have strayed from Sodini's.

Romina makes us feel welcome here! We are a lesbian couple, one Italian, one Jewish. I enjoy taking my date here for authentic pizzas in the style of Roma, brings me back to my vacation time in Rome. I also like the authentic Italian owner's sense of hospitality and warmth which makes me feel welcome. Her accent is also charming!  Must add to the flavor of the food :)There is always some great house wines and Romina makes suggestions on what goes with what if you don't know any better. She's also treated us to some amazing desserts (lemon curd tart, volcano brownie. The "Di Pera" Pear Salad is just perfect, fresh, tart, and sweet.

After a show at Cobb's, buddy of mine and I stumbled across this hole in the wall. The owner was very hospitable and offered several nice tastes of wine (more than just a small splash). The fried mozzerella and fresh marinara was delicious, and the pizza I had was delicious as well! Nice quaint little spot to grab a personal pizza, that was about the size of a medium pizza at any other place. A small piece of Italy hidden in SF.

I have been to--and still go to--Cinecitta more than any other restaurant in SF.  I know that every time I go, I'll get great food, friendly service and no hassles.  It's nice enough to bring a date and comfortable enough to grab a bite on my own.  For two, split the Di Pera salad and the Diavola pizza.
Food was ok, the Caesar Salad was - eh. The rice ball appetizer was good, the pizza was yummy! The eggplant plate was burnt, and the service was friendly but sub-par. No need to come back.

The best pizza you'll ever have -- unless you go to Rome. Oh wait!  The mozzarella is flown in from Rome. Their pizza is super thin and crisp. Just order the margherita pizza and let it melt in your mouth and you'll know that this pizza was heaven sent. A true neighborhood find.

I take dance classes with Romina and she is an amazing dance/instructor so I thought I would try her rest. to support her.  I was so pleasantly surprised that the food is so flipping good!!!   I have been several times with several friends now and we all loved it.    The pizza and salads are my fav!!  So stinking good!

This is a good place for thin crust pizza and tables are always available although this is a small room. The middle aged lady is truly from Rome and lived near the Cinecitta studios hence the name of the restaurant. Salads are good as well. Some tables out on the sidewalk but it gets windy.
Great food. Glad we accidentally came across while in San Francisco. Great cheese fries and burgers.

Yesterday, the day after the Giants won the World Series, I ate here for a quick lunch. Since this eatery is at North Beach I decided to order the North Beach Cheese Steak. The meat I ordered was beef and the cheese I selected was provolone. I also ordered a side of fries, which were ok - nothing spectacular. The North Beach Cheese Steak was served to me piping hot. The aroma was addicting. I loved the crunchy, toasty bun - the ideal way of serving a hot sandwich. However I was slightly disappointed with the sandwich overall. I felt the grilled beef, along with the bell peppers and onions, was too soupy for me. There's a difference between a tender beef and a soupy beef. The juices from the grilled beef soaked the crunchy, toasty that resulted the bottom of the bun to be soggy. I've had better cheese steak sandwiches.
The food was great the service is better I had a wonderful time this was the best Phili cheesesteak ever had!!!!!..... Garlic fries r the bomb!!!!
Good burgers. Greasy, but not too greasy. Decent prices.

My boyfriend and his friends would rant about how good this place is, so they finally brought me and I can see why! You don't judge a book by its cover, the place is very small, you have to get lucky with parking especially on the weekends. The staff was super welcoming and friendly. My boyfriend & I were going to share fries, but the cashier gave us a free order of fries because we were "a couple in love" the food was great, and affordable! Fills you up for sure, looking forward to eating here again!
Please select below on how to comment:
Chili cheese fries.  Period.

Not sure if it was the free flowing booze at Mr. Bing's or the fact that I was starving and it was way after midnight but this was one of the greatest cheesesteaks I've ever had. Great people watching also if you sit at the bar.

Story: Staying at my friend's place in Chinatown I was craving some fries. Everything else closed down but this place and I believe Sam's. I heard Sam's fries weren't too great so I decided to check this place out. They are known for their cheesesteak, I refused an pursued on my mission to get my fries. The chili cheese garlic seemed appealing so I ordered it. I was kind of disappointed because I was expecting a crunch but I should have known better that it would be soggy.

This is the only cheese steak shop that my husband likes. :) He refuses to get any other cheese steak shop's food. If we go to SF, this is the spot we gotta stop at to eat. BEST cheese steak I've ever had. A few things to note: parking is ridiculously hard to find near it. Unless you're lucky, you might have to park farther away and walk to it. Secondly, I believe its CASH ONLY. There's an ATM there is the shop I think but they definitely do NOT take card.

My boyfriend and I went to dinner here and got the garlic cheesy fries and a small and a large Philly cheesesteak. The garlic cheese fries were amazing!! The cheesesteaks were really good too. Soft bread and good flavor, but there could have been a bit more meat for our taste. Good and quick service and well priced.
The only place that was open late by the hostel I was staying at.  Good cheesesteaks.

My favorite cheese steak place in north Beach. Very good price and delicious food. My #1 choice is cheese steak with mushrooms. The place is open until late (because all these girls from strip clubs eat there) so it's very convenient(not the girls but the time). I eat there at least once a week.

The best cheesesteak I will ever eat. Unless I make it out to Tony Luke's in Philly, then we'll have to see. I'm not sure if it's the juicy meat or the wonderfully diabetes filled cheese sauce, but their sandwiches never cease to make me a satisfied customer.

I have to give an update to this.  It has been a good run of 3 years since I found Buster's.  But it looks like they are under new management.  The chefs are the same I believe, but the ship is ran a bit differently.
Wow came back and the girl with hardly any eyebrows tried pocketing $15 of mine. Nice one.

First time ever Cheesesteak. It was served fast, hot and delicious! Had mushroom, onions and provolone, I am hooked. My husband had chili on his and he loved it. I "shared" his garlic fries, so good. Small space with a great cook, charming hostess and fun people watching location.

I was in Buster's the other day and ordered a philly cheese w/ bellpeppers and mushrooms. The COOK (wearing gloves) grilled my chicken. A guy came in and ordered a burger. The COOK flattened his raw burger and put it on the grill. Then he picked up my bellpepers and placed them on the grill. UGH! HEY COOK, YOU DON'T TOUCH RAW MEAT AND THEN HANDLE RAW VEGTABLES!!! I hope you change your gloves when you go to the potty.

This is a spot that you can never go wrong with. And talk about consistent? Everytime that I have stepped foot in there I walked out with a better experience than the last. So I pretty much tried everything in there that they had on the menu from their cheesesteaks to their cheeseburgers back to their chicken cheesesteaks. AND (because you know I gotta throw this in), they got some really good garlic fries. This is the best cheesesteak joint in SF hands down. Their cheesesteaks are well seasoned, and they are NEVER skimpy on the meat; which is where the Cheesesteak Shop on Divisadero messed up at because I have mostly been served bread out there, and that's for the birds! Anyone wanting a cheesesteaks should go here. Cool folks working there as well...

The absolute best cheesesteak I have ever had in my life! I've tried their hot dogs too but definitely loved the cheesesteak. They cook everything fresh And the bread they use is delicious. I always get the Phillapeno cheesesteak which is just a regular Philly but with jalepeno that gives it an extra kick. DELICIOUS.
The best Philly cheese steak that I ever had in my life.

The best cheesesteak I've had to date. I went with the California cheesesteak with chicken and mixed it up with half cheddar and half provolone, wasn't sure if I made the right choice with the chicken but about five minutes later I was very satisfied. My boyfriend had your traditional philly, I had a bite, it was alright but mine was better. We split a side of garlic fries, they were also very tasty, this places doesn't skimp on the garlic so be prepared for some greasy garlicy goodness! I'm not sure how the philly cheesesteaks was made so popular in California (we noticed quite a few philly steak places in the area) but I must say that this place had a better cheesesteak than what I sampled in Philadelphia; if you're in the neighborhood stop by and give it a try.
Best Philly cheese steak I have had in all of California!  Being from Philly I should know a good cheesesteak! It's the real deal! Fries were good too!
Great customer service. Everyone enjoyed their sandwiches.
Went there for a quick hotdog. It was prepared on the grill and it was tasty. Small size though.
Decent cheesesteak that fills my aching need for one ever since I left Philly.  Not as good as Jim's, but then again nobody is.
Best Phily Cheese stakes in the city! I love taking all my friends here! :) Its always really fresh and they have the best garlic fries!

Great for a quick bite which is exactly what I was looking for on this particular Sunday.  Decided to split the Cheesesteak large with provolone with a friend.  The cashier was all smiles and super friendly as she took our order and when the food arrived, it was split into two trays for us.  The food itself was delicious, you get to watch the chef from the bar stools as he whips up the delicious sandwich you ordered up.  If you are craving cheesesteaks, Buster's does a good job at satisfying that crave.
Best french fries in town!

first time in San Fran and was looking for something opened late, came across Buster's yelp and it looked good so we went and the woman who took our order was EXTREMELY rude and gave us attitude once we arrived to pick up our order because she failed to mention they were a cash only establishment! Needless to say I will not be returning to Buster's for mediocre sandwiches due to their poor customer service and lack of consideration. Skip out on being treated poorly and go to any of the other fifty hole in the walls spots on that same street.

I have been coming to Busters as long as I have been hanging out in  North Beach. That's nearly a decade. It is one of my favorite late night dinner spots. I will argue that this spot offers up one of the best cheese steaks in the city, speaking as a person that works in the food industry where cheese steaks are on the menu. The ingredients are always fresh, made to order, and is fast, while maintaining quality. The offer a variety of cheeses for your cheese steak or burgers including cheese whiz. I have introduced this to my friends from out of state and epicurean hubs such as Chicago who described the food as "fire" (good).

Grew up in North Beach and have been coming here for years.  The cheesesteaks are really good, but man I just discovered their burgers....Hella good!  1/2 lb. burgers there are no joke.  Good sized tasty burger fixed up just right with all the toppings and the bread has a really nice crust.  Perfect late night spot to grab some grub and that final beer of the night.
Jose gets down on the grill, always fast and cooked to perfection. customer service gets 10 out of 10..!!.. a must when on Broadway.

I been coming to busters for over 15 years and this is by far the best Philly cheese-teak place I have ever been too. Made just right with all the toppings of your choice. The only down fall is parking but who gives a f@@k this place is worth driving around the block a few times.
Wow! Amazeballs cheese steaks and the best fries I've *ever* had! This place was so delish!
2 consecutive orders 17 minutes apart with other orders done first. rude service serious attitude and their "system was down" so I couldn't get loyalty points.
I'm probably going to get crucified for this but I would be doing a disservice to this place if I don't say it.
Tried to go at 2:30 am on Thursday when it said it was open. It wasn't. Fix your hours.

Two words describe Buster's.....Deliciously Dirty. After an alcohol infused night we crashed this place at 2 am and I have never felt so satisfied. The mushroom cheesteak with bacon was amazing and the bacon burger was terrific as well. The lady at the register was really friendly and she also recommended cheesey garlic fries so why not! We left this spot unholy amounts of full, and I can't think of a better late night grubbery for cheesesteaks in the city. Wonderful experience.
Out of all my years in SF and I only discovered this place last summer.  That's an atrocity, but then again I rarely party in North Beach.  Since my discovery, I've been here at least twice a month.

Very good meal and great bartender.  Met some friends initially at the bar and the bartender was helpful and informative.  I went the wine route and really appreciated their well thought out wines by the glass.
Have been here 3 times now. Verbena has nice offerings and likes to modify their dishes according to what's in season.

I was taken there for my birthday.  The first thing I noticed was the low lighting.   I couldn't read the menu. I couldn't see how the dishes were prepared.  They should, at the very least, have a candle on the table.  I enjoyed the Little Gem salad and the Rabini.  The lamb meatballs had no flavor whatsoever.  The scampi was served whole so it was left uneaten.  Maybe the kitchen could slit the shell so it's easier to eat?  Would I go back or recommend it?  I don't think so.
I'm always excited when, as a vegetarian, I can eat at the hip, new restaurant and not have to settle for a $35 plate of mediocre risotto. Yay for the creative veggie options at Verbena!

If you're two women dining together, expect to be offered the worst table (next to the kitchen and bathrooms) in an otherwise empty restaurant. Service is intrusive and overbearing. On a positive note, the space is beautiful, acoustics are great and vegetable dishes are excellent and inventive (but price point is too high). Meat and seafood dishes are poor and need work.  You can have a good meal here if you're dining with a husband/boyfriend, stick to vegetables and don't mind the constantly in-your-face wait staff.   Otherwise, Polk Street offers friendlier options with better food.
De blah blah blah, and meh meh meh

Before I came here I told my wife "I don't get excited about food anymore, because I feel like I've had it all". I was wrong. I came here and was blown away. Chef Sean is the Bay Area's most creative chef.
Brunch review only!
As my co worker who frequent here warned me that it's a hit or missed depending what chef is cooking up that day, I arrived with no expectation.

Horrible--never got main course after 2 hours. When we asked where our food was, The waitress scurried away and didn't come back for another 10 minutes, telling us that our food was on its way. We could tell that meant another 10 to 15 minutes so I politely asked for the check.The manager returned and told us our food would be a few more minutes, at which point we alerted him to the fact that it had been two hours since we ordered our food.

Best brunch I've had to date in a new restaurant in Russian Hill. Unique dishes carefully prepared, warm service, and great wine/drink choices. Started with sprouted seed bread, a piece of warm nutty bread, dark and hearty, served with goat cheese. For the main dish, I had the corn pancakes with persimmon, fluffy and decadent. My friend went a little healthier with the little gem salad, cabbage and avocado, and claims it's the best she's had (I'm not big on lettuce, but this was quite good). They also have a fantastic wine selection, I chose the Hirsch Gruner, a respected producer in Austria, and it did not disappoint. The Bloody Mary was a solid interpretation of the classic. Can't comment on the decor, since we sat on one of the three sidewalk tables.

My partner and I came in for dinner on Halloween.  I was surprised to find Verena as one of the best restaurants that I have been to in SF in a long time.  Everything that we ordered was perfect.  The menu is vegetable heavy but not exclusively vegetarian.  The food was very creative and satisfying.  The service was great as well.

Been there twice now.  The second time was an accident because I forgot we already went and are not fans.  We just didn't leave because we had friends joining us and our second experience  was the same as the first.  Overall, the food isn't great and because of that the price value is really off because of the portion size.  I've now had about 8 different dishes from here and frankly, nothing was that great.  There are so many great restaurants in that neighborhood not to mention the city that it isn't worth going back.

Verbena is probably the most beautiful looking food per dollar you'll find in SF. Artistry, beautiful layering, great use of negative space. Amazing vegetarian selection - very rich and hearty to please a very meaty person like myself. Magical sauces you'll remember every detail of.

After several visits to Verbena, I'm still waiting to be impressed.  there has been a few odd staff incidents... It's such a pretty room, I'm hoping the food and service come up to meet the ambiance of the space.
Brunch review only!
This is a beautiful quaint by energetic restaurant with terrific service and some of the most unbelievable eclectic food I have had in a long time.
My fave new restaurant I went to recently.

A friend recommended we eat at Verbena a few days ago and I was skeptical after checking out the menu. The ingredients in many of the dishes seemed a little like the worst of "Chopped": make a desert that includes kale and mustard or an entrée with durian and Brussel sprouts. Fortunately Verbena's dishes weren't quite that out there but needless to say I arrived pretty skeptical.  But oddly enough, everything worked, to the point where you wouldn't even notice the components that made up the dishes if you weren't paying attention--everything was that good! Even the deserts, which are often most vulnerable to odd ingredients, were delicious.  We will go back, and soon!
had a fabulous birthday dinner in Verbena. All the dishes are amazing and beautifully done. Will definitely come back.
Wow, Wow, Wow!   This is my very first Yelp review ever.  The food was so amazing at this restaurant that I felt compelled to sign up on Yelp and give a 5 star rating!
I've now been here twice. The last time I came was with my parents on their latest visit to San Francisco.
Pricey, and the menu is limited.

I've been following Chef Sean Baker since he worked at Millennium  and later when he opened Gather at Berkeley. He is perhaps my favorite chef in the Bay Area. I like the way he cooks high quality, creative and flavorful food for both omnivores and vegans. I tried Verbena for brunch and didn't disappoint at all. It was in fact delicious. The frittata and the red corn pancakes were particularly outstanding. The Rose I had with my meal was also quite good.

I'll say first of all: beautiful space and design, excellent service, nice wine and drink selection. Other than that, our food was consistently disappointing. Our main entree was the corn cream in carrot juice that could have come of out a truck stop. No creativity with the cheapest ingredients one could possibly ask form (sweet corn and beans!) with zero flavor (except for the cheap sweetness of the corn).

Great date spot but a bit pricey for what you get. My date ordered a bottle of wine and they didn't have it so they gave us a discount on another bottle which was nice! We ordered the josey baker bread, one veggie inspired item (apples and cucumbers), two meat inspired ones(pork and chicken), and a desert. We shared all of our plates. It was just about perfect dinner with maybe one more plate for the hungry eaters. Cost was around $177 with tip.
expensive, but really delicious food and drinks with a bright, lovely environment perfect for a lazy sunday meal (brunch, to be exact).
Swipe right.
4 stars for the food, drinks, and atmosphere (big, high-ceilings) but the service was what knocked it down for us.

We were very excited to try out this restaurant and came for dinner. The place looks nice and intimate. And the service was very lovely. The only thing negative was the food. My husband had the chicken, it was undercooked. I had the air dried beef; i found many pips. Then we ordered the fig & chocolate dessert (with peanut butter). It was way too salty! It's unlikely we would come back

After walking 10 miles around the city, and desperate for a delicious cocktail and some appetizers, we stumbled upon Verbena in Russian Hill. Nestled amongst many other restaurants and cute shops, this was a great find. The cocktail list was of the savory nature, so my husband thoroughly enjoyed a old fashion. The bar tenders take the care and precision of making cocktails like a high-end speakeasy. The bar is complete with hard to find liquors and a thoughtful wine menu. The JK Carriere Rose was the best Rose I have had, highly recommended. Since, we only had appetizers, we don't have a ton to go on, but the breads were delicious, and the shishito and padron peppers in an Indian curry with cow peas were scrumptious. Just watch out for those hot peppers every once in awhile!

I love small plates when they're tasty and appropriately priced.  At Verbana, most of their entrees are small plates that sell at entree prices.  Nothing we had was better than average.  I live in the neighborhood and was hoping for better, but we won't be back.

wow. the food here is just amazing. we tried a few items originally but after a few bites, we went ahead and tried everything on the menu - the food was just that good. i have absolutely no complains on the food. amazing and delicious.

I dunno if others have found the customer service here to be as terrible as I have, but both times I've tried to give this place a shot they've done something to completely make me not want to ever go there.
I've been on a new restaurant binge lately, from Urchin to Aveline to Alta and I think Verbena so far has been my favorite because the food is really unique and executed perfectly.

Absolutely amazing!  We went here for brunch after we discovered that Sean Baker, the chef at Gather, is now at Verbena.  We had the squash and potato, mushroom and corn frittata and red corn pancakes.  Everything was superb!  The flavors in the squash and potato were what I would expect from food prepared by Sean Baker -- incredibly flavorful, creative and innovative.  The mushroom corn frittate was very tasty.  The red corn pancakes were the best pancakes I think I have ever had.  Five stars!!
Another solid meal at Verbena.
I know how quickly I write off starkly negative Yelp reviews when I'm looking at a popular new place, so I'm a little leery of writing this... but my goal is simply to be honest and balanced.
I'm not quite sure how this place only has 4-stars.
Hue L., our NYF, and I had our "monthly" dinner here last night.  8PM reservations on a Friday night.

Service was only fine.  Food was very disappointing especially considering the ridiculous prices.  $32 for salmon that would taste better at Street a few blocks away.  Ravioli that was extremely dry and lacked the cheese it was promised to include.  Very very upset that so much money was spent and the meal was so mediocre.  I brought a guest from out of town and I was embarrassed by my choice.  I have been here once before and it was only slightly better.  I won't come back despite living a block away. So sad.

Stumbled upon this while walking my dog and knew that it was going to be a great place when I saw it. I came back with a friend and we had a pleasant time. I was shocked by the low prices. The portions are great and the food is excellent. The service we had was also phenomenal. The server was very attentive to our needs and made sure we were well cared for. Previous SF Mayor, Willie Brown, was even dining next to us with friends. The whole place is very cozy, friendly, and a great spot to bring a date!

Where to begin. What should have been a fun festive  evening between 3 good friends turned into a dining fiasco. We have been celebrating one of many (over 20) birthdays together throughout the years. We were shocked at the horrible treatment we received from the staff at Allegro. Particularly our first waiter.

If Allegro means "happy" and "cheerful" in Italian, then the sign is on the WRONG restaurant!! Read the Yelp reviews CAREFULLY before stepping foot in this restaurant! There seems to be a common theme with LOST reservations and a RUDE Lorenzo (owner/manager/chef). Our experience matched many other Yelpers who have been disappointed. Suffice it to say, I would never recommend or set foot in this restaurant again. We have had so many incredible dining experience in the lovely city of SF. Why patronize a place that treats the customers so poorly?! Eek! Me thinks not!!

This was going to be my second time here. I'd loved the food the first time. When arriving at 9:10 they tell me the kitchen is already closed (the restaurant closes at 10). To top that they send me to a brother restaurant, when I arrive (and you know that walking in San Francisco is not great) it was closed for a private event. Not happy with the service!

Allegro Romano remains one of our "go to" restaurants when visiting San Francisco.  It's small, intimate, and has a nice location at the top of Russian Hill in a residential neighborhood.  I like restaurants like this that blend into a city feel vice being located in a sterile mall.  Reservations are a must as the restaurant is very small.  We had a party of four and arrived at opening.  This was advantageous as we had the pick of a few tables.  We chose a table near the kitchen and away from the main door - much quieter.  This was our second visit to Allegro Romano and the service was again over the top with both professionalism and niceness.  Yes, this  restaurant is somewhat pricey with a bill of $300 before tip for our party of four.  But hey, sometimes it's worth shelling out extra money for a treat that leaves four people smiling at a great meal and our special time together.

The worst experience at a restaurant I have ever had, in my life. This is coming from someone who rarely complains about restaurant service. I haven't been on yelp for a while, but I felt compelled to write this review because I am still shocked by what happened today.

This restaurant is INCREDIBLE. A rare gem in a city filled with amazing food, Allegro Romano combines incredibly warm service with extremely tasty food. The atmosphere is cozy and familial and the meal is rejuvenating. Thanks, Lorenzo. I'll be back.
AMAZING! Excellent! Cozy little neighborhood restaurant with authentic Italian food. Perfect.
I was so excited to try this place, but was very let down.

San Francisco turned into Rome the day I first saw this Russian Hill  spot. It seemed absolutely enchanting and I recommended it far and wide. But now after several visits the bloom is off the rose since  I have discovered as have others that Lorenzo, the host and owner, responds to messages and reservation requests only when the mood grabs him if you are not a celebrity  with your photo posted on his window He is mercurial to  a fault and rude in his disrespect for his patrons. The food is adequate, not fabulous and the last time we dined there we felt rushed as the staff went through the motions to usher us out for the second seating.

Had dinner here again last night and have to say this is one of the best places I have eaten at in SF. Full attention to detail, freshly made to order local and imported food with tons of flavor and incredibly attentive service. Last night, chef cooked a 6 course dinner with fresh truffles shaved into every course. My pallet was very satisfied!

This place is a small boutique restaurant located high up on Russian Hill. The people working at this restaurant are very attentive and want to make sure your meal is up to standard. The food was amazing and very tasty. My daughter loved her pasta with white truffle. My filet was very good as well.

Everything about this restaurant was awesome. If you like truffles, you'll be in heaven.  Depending on the season, they have fresh black truffles or white truffles. Pastas were made fresh and cooked to perfection. Great service, great food and nice ambiance. I'm going to become a regular!

We have wanted to try this place for a long time. Climbed up one time before and it was closed but this time we made it. We had early reservations so there were only a few couples dining at the time which made it seem less crowded. They seated us right by the kitchen door.

I came here looking to impress Italian guests and I was not disappointed. First to note, this is a small joint on a corner, off the beaten-path of all the big, elegant, tourist-trap restaurants found in Northern San Francisco. The look is simple, but the food is far from it. But as far as my reviews tend to go, I weigh the quality of the food and service first off. You can tell by any pictures that it is not an "elegant" place, though they try with what space they are given. It has characteristics of the owner, which makes it more his personal work, which I find enduring in restaurants that are "off the beaten path."

This was one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. We went for our 25th Anniversary. The restaurant was recommended by our son and his girlfriend who found it last year. It is a small restaurant, but we had no problem with reserving a table for four. The waiters made us feel like family and they gave us some complementary dishes to celebrate our Anniversary. We had several plates of appetizers and every one was delicious and easily shared. For our main course I had a filet and my husband couldn't decide between a couple of pastas so they made him a plate with both. The menu was large with truly decadent ingredients and we only wish we could have ordered it all. We shared some bites and there wasn't a single dish that was bad. We even got several desserts including a complementary espresso cake which was so rich and creamy and port that was liberally poured and enjoyed by all.  I will definitely go back. It's my new favorite restaurant.
I had Allegro Romano on my list for a while as I read all the wonderful reviews on food and service.

Please understand that this rating has nothing to do with the food. But if good service and honest workers are important to you, then read this. I was in San Fran for a weekend and called Allegro Romano for a reservation. The gentlemen who answered the phone said they only had a 6 o'clock reservation left. I told him I would take it. We broke our necks getting to that restaurant on time. When we got there, there was a line. He seated everyone that was in line. Then when it was my turn, I told him I had 6:00 reservations and gave him my name. He said one minute and left. I recognized his distinct voice and knew it was the gentleman I had spoken to on the phone. He came back and said, "I don't know who you spoke to but I can't find your reservation." Now, I am looking at the book and my name is written clearly on the book. So, I said, "you took the reservation and my name is written right there!!" And then he said, "well someone gave your reservation away." So I said "I thought you couldn't find my reservation." Then he said, "it's first come first serve." So I said, are you kidding me? "Then why did you give me a reservation?" He told me I would have to go somewhere else. I could go to his other property. I don't care who you are. I don't care if your food tastes like heaven on a plate. YOU DON'T LIE!!! What happen to accepting responsibility, apologizing, and maybe comping an appetizer for the mistake or something. What is wrong with people????

Took my Dad here with the hope of enjoying a comfortable, relaxed, and delicious meal and evening.  Enjoy we did! Service was great - warm, engaged and friendly staff.  I loved the location - in the heart of a purely residential area so you get away from a lot of the outside noise/foot traffic.
Italian food at it's best
Having tickets for Beach Blanket Babylon we needed an early dinner - this is definitely the place to be.

Wonderful recommendation from a friend of the beaten path that you have to try!  Top notch service with great ambiance!!!  The food is outstanding! !!  Make reservations on a weekend because it's small and intimate you dint want to Mia or on this place. So reasonably priced I couldn't believe it.

This was the best meal I have ever eaten in my life! The waiter, Ian, made the experience as good as it could get. I had the Caesar Salad with crab meat, the Scallopinni, and ended the meal with the absolute best tiaramsu you will ever find! Prices are great, food is phenomenal, and the service extraordinary!

Off the beaten path. Small, noisy and delicious. The food was amazing. Menu had much to please any palate. Nice to be away from the touristy restaurants and be right smack in the middle of a neighborhood. I would definitely suggest a visit while in the San Fran area.

After the long slog up the Jones Street hill, I was so happy that this place ended up being AWESOME. I was casting about for a well-reviewed spot that had reservations available for 7:30 pm on a Thursday and these folks fit the bill. We did not regret the choice for a second. No missteps, only happiness.

Been meaning to try this neighborhood spot for at least 10 years, finally made it for a very early dinner Friday night. Walked up the Broadway steps and in to the empty restaurant w/out a reservation. Lorenzo, the owner sat at the window table on his cellphone, a waiter stood around-- I asked if they could seat me for an early dinner out of the way and headed toward a table near the kitchen door---Lorenzo jumped up and showed me to the table, waiter hung around too.

This is seriously good Italian.The bruschetta is good, but the fettuccine with white truffle sauce...add chicken and call it amazing. The tiramisu is to die for. If you feel like ice-cream, you cannot go wrong with the the tartuffo. Lorenzo is so friendly and so is everyone else that works there. I just love this place. Can't wait to experience Tre Scalini in Italy!

Small and cozy corner restaurant in nice neighborhood.  Staff was very welcoming and attentive.   We ordered the Bruschetta alla Romana, spinich salad, bean soup  and Asparagus alla Parmigiana for appetizers.  All were satisfying.  Entrees included Fettuccine with White Truffle Sauce, White Truffle Tortellini in Basil Pesto Sauce, Linguini and Halibut, and Veal Osso Buco with a couple bottles of chianti.

Nice ambience and neighborhood feeling.   The is location is cozy, staff is friendly and for the most part the food is decent.  I would try this place for a nice quiet lunch or dinner if in the neighborhood but I would not venture all the way here if you're in the mood for italian food.

Go here for dinner and save yourself the airfare to Rome.  It couldn't be more authentic Italian.  Not only is the food beyond delicious, the whole atmosphere is understated romantic and sophisticated.  Perfect for a very special night out.

Good things come in small packages! The restaurant is very small and you should try and make a reservation but it is so worth it! Lorenzo made us feel like we were family. The food was amazing and the vibe was fun!!

Been here several times.  Very cute place with very friendly wait staff.  Good food too!  Nice pasta dishes.  We typically eat family style and share entrees.  This allows us to try a bit of everything.  We've had the fish & meat dishes.  Pasta is the best.
Awesome food, great atmosphere and incredible service!

There is something to say about a restaurant that stays old school. A restaurant that caters to the locals and is off the beaten path. There is a certain charm that comes with this philosophy, that is, if you can get your foot in the door.

I found this restaurant for our last night in San Francisco and it did not disappoint! We had called earlier (30 minutes) to make sure that they had a table available because there were five of us and when we got there we were seating right away! It is a very small restaurant with maybe 12 tables but it was decorated very nicely and would be perfect for a date night with red roses (tastefully) decoration the table.

My husband and I came here for our wedding anniversary in Feb. 2014. Very romantic atmosphere, soft candlelight, and classy. I enjoyed my experience here. Although, there was one thing that left a bad taste in my mouth. When answering that our special occasion was our anniversary they congratulated us by bringing out a plate of tiramisu, and then charged us for it. I just thought that was a little rude. If I am going to have dessert I'd like to make my own selection instead of having a server show up with a slice of surprise and then bill me, when I'd rather have something else. Other than that I enjoyed our celebration here.

I've been to Allegro Romano a few times and it never disappoints. I would say this is some of the best Italian food I've ever had and by far one of the best restaurants in the city. The experience is wonderful as well. It is a relatively small restaurant (10-15 tables), so the dining experience is very intimate. The waitstaff is superb, the owner is magnificent, and everyone there is just happy to be doing what they're doing.
I want my $10 cab fare back.

One of my all time favorite Italian Restaurants ever! We dined here on Friday and left it to our server to surprise us with appetizers and salads. All were delicious and fresh. Main courses were equally wonderful, followed by a dessert sampler and the famous house port. Great food, service and a very enjoyable experience!
I've stopped by for lunch and dinner half a dozen times... The precooked food is good and generally healthy (excluding the baked goods and desserts). The rest is terrible:

Stopped in after work today and picked up dinner. Roasted chicken with salsa verde was delish! Paired with wild rice and a vegetable medley dinner came to $16. It's pricey - but roasted beets, hello! Very grateful for the hard work that went into preparing great tasting, healthy food. Thank you!

AWESOME! AWESOME! AWESOME!  Alison and her team are the BEST!  We looked at many caterers here in San Francisco/Bay Area to cater our wedding and open house reception the night before.  From the first time we talked with Alison we knew she was the best choice.  Confident, reassuring, calm and good humored/fun.  She made the entire experience pleasant and stress-free.  The food was amazing, the staff was excellent and friendly and the set-up/attention to detail was fabulous!  Our guests are still talking about how great everything was.  Every detail was taken care of and we had a fabulous time because we didn't have to worry about anything.  The best compliment i keep getting is that many guests thought that we knew Alison and her team for years because they were so personable, friendly and really helped create a warm, fun environment.  That's exactly what we wanted and they delivered it all way above our expectations (and we have high standards.  I highly recommend you call Alison and her team for any event -- wedding, business, personal -- they are the best!
Alison is a dream. She catered my rehearsal dinner. Her food is fresh, delicious and imaginative. She is a pleasure to work with, responsive, professional and a total doll! You can't go wrong.

We just finished a fantastic meal from Square Meals. Four of us shared chicken, salmon, green beans, Asian slaw, and heirloom tomatoes. All very nicely seasoned and serving size enough that we had leftovers. GOOD, healthy food!

The pre cooked food they offer at their Polk Street location is good, but a bit overpriced. I once spent $50 on dinner for two without breaking a sweat. Needless to say, that was the last time I went there on a last minute dash to grab some grub.

Alison and the Square Meals team catered my wedding in April.  I interviewed a lot of vendors as I managed most of the wedding myself, and of all the people helping us out on the big day, Alison was the most responsive, friendly, flexible and fun to work with.

The food was just plain BAD. I stopped in and spent $50 for food that was terrible - most was inedible and had to be thrown away. The kale in the kale salad was greying all over and wilted - and the dressing had absolutely no flavor. The white bean salad tasted like paste. Despite being very hungry I had to throw BOTH of these dishes away. The Pork Chop was also thrown out after a couple bites - tough as wood and zero flavor. The turkey loaf was BLEH. The only thing that was actually eaten was the lasagna, and that was after having to season it heavily. I can't believe I spent $50 here. The only good thing we got were the cookies from Batter (which were excellent!) I couldn't be more disappointed. I will never go back and never recommend this place to anyone. I'd much rather order Munchery or Sprig - MUCH better prices and MUCH better food.
My  husband and I just had a newborn and a friend of ours was gracious enough to give us several weeks of dinner from Square Meals.

This is an excellent service, providing fine restaurant quality meals, delivered to your door.  I was very happy to be on the receiving end of a gift certificate for this service. I highly recommend it.
Great experience working with Chef Alison. I was always able to reach her via phone or email to meet my catering needs. She will send you updated invoices to get your order perfect.

Ordered Square meals again for another office luncheon. The food was AMAZING. The best office luncheon we have had in a while. What I love about Alison's food is that it is so flavorful, clean and well presented with generous portions.

Everything is so flavorful, fresh, and healthy. The flank steak was perfectly done and the Israeli cous cous was bright with saffron. I also had the summer root salad. Seriously, so amazing to have a well done and fast meal after a long day.
