I've been getting meals delivered from Square Meals for 2 months now and it's completely changed my evenings Monday - Thursday.  I love the food and I look forward to it being delivered.  It's perfect for someone like me who stays at home during the week and goes out on the weekends.  The quality of the food is awesome and the dishes always change.  I've never experienced anything like it.

This little place is gives you the following:   quiet comfort, delicious high quality food, simple process, half the wait time you get at a typical restaurant, for about the same price you would pay at a typical Polk Street cafe.  It's like a little dosage of pleasant eating in the face of the zoo of chaos that is SF dining.
Okay, so I've since had a chance to further explore the menu, and I have to say, the food is inconsistent.
Love the soup. Yum. Plus, Batter Bakery is also there? Win-win.

I love establishments that were made for lazy in domesticated people like myself. I had hoped a place like Lite Bite would magically appear, and Square Meals did the trick. You just pick what food you want and pay by item or weight. Tonight I had turkey meatloaf ($9) and .25 lb of lentils ($2)... My total came out to $12-something. Probably on the pricier side for the quantity you get, but at least you save time by not having to go to the grocery store and cook yourself a meal. I'll be back!
I like that they host a changing menu of wholesome food options. Everything seems cooked fresh that day and the cuisine falls into the category of New American 'gourmet to-go.'

I ordered the food delivery twice, both times, excellent yummy food! The first time was pork chops, which were very, very good. When I mentioned that I didn't get the stated sides, the next delivery ( meatballs) included two gigantic cookies as an apology. Very cool. This is a great, healthy idea for people who dont feel like cooking!

Takeout for two - $42.  My b/f and I were certainly not expecting that for our "hey let's grab something simple."  My meal consisted of potato salad, some veggie medley, and just a sliver of pot roast.  The b/f's meal - rice, beans, and lasagna.  Granted the price was steep, that's not the reason I'm giving them 1 star.  The 1 star is cause the food itself just wasn't good.  For that price, I want it to be scrumptious.  I'd even settle for really good.  For what it's worth, my b/f found his meal to be "acceptable."  I, however, wound up eating only a few bites and then sadly admitting it was not worth even finishing, despite being hungry and having paid so much.  I instead wound up dumping the rest in the compost.

The food here is tasty and healthy, I'm a fan.  Since I don't like cooking, this is probably the closest I'll get to a home cooked meal.  I like that it's in the same place as batter bakery too so I can get something small for dessert!

As a single girl in the neighborhood that does not cook, I thought I would be hitting this place up many weeknights. Sadly, not so. The food is just not good - and it's expensive. I have tried several different things, and I am officially giving up. I haven't tried the baked goods or brunch, but for a pre-made dinner to eat at home - try Lite Bite on Union.

We ate a lovely dinner here tonight. Although short staffed the service was friendly and efficient. We shared six dishes and dessert between the two of us and everything was delicious. The chocolate chip cookies are to die for...we will be back.

I have picked up food from here multiple times. Each time I have had good meals. A little over-priced, but still good quality. I stepped in last night in hopes that I would have the same experience. I was starving and happy to get home and eat after a long day. I warmed everything up as I normally would. I try to pride myself on eating healthy and was under the impression that Square Meals prides themselves on healthy options. Which leads me to why I am writing this review. I ordered the pork chop, brussel sprouts and cauliflower. After heating everything up there was oil all over my plate. The veggies were so drenched in oil that I could not even eat them. The pork was the best thing. But was so disgusted by the amount of oil on my plate I had to toss the veggies and just left with a $17 dollar pork chop. It had been a while since I have been here, and not sure if I will be going back.

Wife and I had a busy Vday and also a son and colleague from East Coast staying overnight so what to do to keep some romance in the day?  I  ordered 2 of each from their special Downton Abbey valentine's Day dinner. Meal came nicely packaged with clear labeling of sauces and dishes with final heating instructions.  Appetizers:  Crab Cakes w creme fraiche sauce  or Chese Plate with dried figs and fennel arugula salad.  Entre: Black Cod en Papillote with olives, herbs potatoes and Citrus Beurre Blanc or Beef Wellington with Prosciutto, Mushroom Duxelle, Green Peppercorns and Roasted Baby carrots.  Dessert: Bread Pudding (white chocolate caramel) or Chocolate Ganache Tart with whipped creme faraiche.  The meal was easy to prepare and serve in less than 20 minutes and was very good.  After the dish eaten the spices lingered tastily on the tongue as I sipped the last of the wine.  All very good  but the crab cakes and the Chocolate Ganache Tarts were unanimous standouts!  As I write this all are back to work but this was a great way to have a "night out at home".

I really enjoyed the food at Square Meals! The menu is pretty small if you're just going in for lunch (and are gluten free) but I got their tri-salad option. I loved that all the dishes were labeled to show whether they were gluten free or vegan. I was a little skeptical at first but all three of the dishes I sampled were AMAZING. I had zero complaints. The staff was also incredibly helpful. If you're in the neighborhood, I definitely recommend stopping in.

I am in heaven...someone lovingly prepared an entire week of meals for me as i try to empty my fridge before a long vacation...the salmon was perfectly cooked, not overdone after the reheat...same for the chicken pepperonata (wow, juicy chicken!)  And plenty of sides to keep each meal unique, like im not reheating leftovers nite after nite. AND they delivered to my office!  TREAT YO SELF...im so comin back to this pampering...cant help but pop open a bottle of vino with dinner. i feel so cushy, and the plate is so worthy.

Ehh, my roomate and friend were raving about how good this place was or is. I haven't tried everything yet, but not sure if I want to. I've had better flavors than this stuff. Seriously why I paid 17 for a take home meal when I could've gotten some thai or something is beyond me. Only because I hadn't had fish in a long time I got the halibut (was decent) and some mixed veggies. Seriously bonkers at how expensive the place seemed to be.
One of my relatives is now home bound. Square meals is a god send.
Expensive rave.

Bummed that I finally spent money in this pretentious, inept, and comically overpriced spot-- I'm afraid of encouraging them to stay open a couple of weeks longer.  I'll definitely brave the line at the Boulange from now on.
Such a well-rounded spot. Fresh ingredients that you can actually taste. The goodies...oh the goodies..probably the best chocolate chip cookie I have ever had (don't tell my mom!)

AMAZING!!!!  I ordered appitizers for my mothers 75th birthday party for 60 people.  They were GREAT.  I picked them up from the restaruant and they were all preparted with directions on how to heat and serve.  Everyone raved about the crab cakes!
One of my favorite places for brunch or just an on-the-go coffee.
Expensive but good.

I love square meals. When I lived in San Francisco I would go there all of the time, mostly for dinners throughout the week. It was always a quick and healthy choice instead of resorting to traditional take-out food.

My husband and I were so excited when Square Meals opened up in our neighborhood, hoping it would fill the void that Andrew & Co left when it closed last year.  Unfortunately after about 10 tries with this place, I think we're finally done.  The takeaway dinner is slightly better than average and, as others have mentioned, somewhat expensive.  I haven't tried the brunch dishes yet, but the baked goods are great.

Love the new shop!  Great place to stop by for a glass of wine and something tasty that is still pretty good for you.  If you need a light bite to go or want to stay and eat with some friends it is a gerat little spot.  I love that it is local and organic whenever possible.  I am also gluten free so it is so nice that they have a bunch of stuff that I can actually eat!

Delicious quiche. Fresh ingredients, friendly staff and a wonderful overall vibe, quiet on a Tuesday morning but a nice bustle in the kitchen as they get ready for the day. I could see myself coming back for the weekend brunch and the lunch selections look amazing as well. Only sadness is no espresso, but the coffee is pretty good. With everything else, I hardly miss my Americano. Come by and check them out; you will not be sorry.
Everything here at this sandwish shop is one of the best in downtown not only is meaty and tasty but is reasonable price and the bread is soft
Love the nob hill sandwich here. I usually add a few veggies. You should try it!!
Great sandwiches and coffee with really friendly staff.  It's a good local spot and if you order by phone and pick up you will avoid a wait.  The Italian sandwich on sour dough is my favorite.

This place is a delicious hidden gem.  Albert was so helpful and friendly.  We had the Hyde St sandwich and it was beyond amazing.  One of the best Italian sandwiches I've ever had and plenty for 2 people to share.  Highly recommended!!!!!

Great sandwiches! Fresh cut meat, fresh bread, and great sauces. If you're sensitive to garlic be sure to let them know as many sandwiches have a lot of garlic. It's not always quick but you won't be disappointed.

They have the best sandwiches- really great meats, bread and spreads. They also have greats bagels in the morning. Everyone who works there is nice and quick, you can usually find a table to eat at (outside too) or you can call in your order.
The veggie breakfast sandwiches are amazing!
I've lived 1 block away from this place for over 10 years and never knew about it...  Great food, great service, great prices, free wifi and blue bottle coffee.  No brainer :)

Tried this place out today and it was absolutely fantastic!! As soon as I walked in the guy behind the counter greeted and was super friendly. I ordered my sandwich and waited. The place was super clean and the sandwich amazing !! I also really liked how nice he was to everyone who walked in. You can tell a lot of locals come in here. I will definately be back !

This place is that great neighborhood spot that you have been looking for.  The staff here is warm and engaging.  After chatting with them for a few minutes they always end up suggesting some new sandwich creation that they have been working on.  It has always turned out good so far...The sandwiches are large, you could easily share them with a friend.  Relaxed atmosphere and plenty of windows for people watching.

This place is awesome. I came for the Burmese food pop-up. My buddy told me to meet at Hyde and Vallejo for Burmese... I showed up and was like, it must be down a block. Because this is a plain old sandwich place. But lo and behold, this sandwich place serves delicious Burmese food for dinner - curries, noodles, rice plates, samosas.
New management, now these sandwiches are very tasty! Great service and everything fresh. Highly recommended.

Great lighting and FREE Wifi. The wifi could be a little faster but it was free so I cant really complain. Went here for a quick lunch but also needed a boost. Their sandwiches are huge. I wanted the dutch bread but they happen to run out that day. They serve blue bottle drip coffee which is nice. The owner, Albert, is quite friendly and approachable.
Love the Deli for a good Sandwich and Blue Bottle Coffee.
Probably the best sandwich place in the city!  Sandwiches take some time, but wow are they good.  I'd say order before hand and pick up.  Try the Jonas.

Asian man making the super large and super dank sandos is ridiculously friendly and overall just awesome. (created an account just to give this place 5-stars because it is one of the only affordably delicious eateries on this side of the hill)

I was pleasantly surprised to find that now on Tues-Saturdays, Jonas serves Burmese food for dinner. We had a great meal whipped up by our own Burma super star, Ken. Great food (points for the tea leaf salad and the coconut curry noodles), without the lines of other Burmese hot spots in the city.

Holy WOW, this place has got it down. I got the spicy turkey special which was spectacular. The guys that work there are really friendly and nice. They also have Blue Bottle coffee which is a major perk :) One of the best sandos I've had in the city. Top 5! I'll be back!
I was nearly inside of The Boy's Deli, when, in an effort to expand my culinary horizons by trying new places, I made a game-time decision to hike it up to Jonas.
Whites out.

YUM! These sandwiches are HUGE (can easily share one with a friend) and a great value for what you get. The bread and meats are fresh and delicious, and the location is really nice. As many others have mentioned, you can grab a cable car right outside.  They can be a little overwhelmed depending on the staff and number of customers, but if you're looking for a bite, Jonas is a great choice.

One of the most ridiculously handsome men I have ever seen works here. Or at least he was working here this afternoon. I have never seen him before and my life has apparently been drab and empty until now. He smiled gleamingly at me  when I reached the counter (because customer service) and I was immediately smitten with his chiseled jaw and warm brown eyes and I totally forgot my order like an idiot preteen girl.

Albert makes a mean sandwich, that's for sure!  I tend to get thirsty afterwards due to the sodium-rich deli meat but still pretty great quality and fresh.  I usually don't have that much time to wait for my order, but on a good day when I have the luxury to sit down and wait for the order, it's worth it!  If you want faster service, might be wise to call in your order.
Very good local sandwich shop. Friendly service. The Cable Car is the best meatball sub I've ever had. Call ahead if you don't wan't to wait. A little slow but definitely worth it.
I was thoroughly underwhelmed by the huge sandwich ($9) I had from Jonas On Hyde. The Dutch crunch upon which the sandwich was built was stale and quite tasteless.
When your on vacation you eat out.
As far as sandwiches go, these can't be beat! The Hyde Park was delicious and can easily be split between two people, the service is that of a 5 star restaurant too!
These were big sandwiches, I need to go back a few times to really get a feel for this place. I shouldn't even be writting this.

Don't get into SF that much these days so when I had to spend a couple of days in town for work I wanted to find a great deli and Jonas on Hyde was exceptional. 5 star service and great sandwiches. Fresh mozzarella with prosciuto on a sour dutch crunch roll. Huge. Sat outside in the sun and watched the cable cars go by. Highly reocmmend!
I want to like this place. I live nearby, the owner is super nice, but I can't get over how long it takes for them to serve stuff, and they can't multitask when it gets packed.
3 star sandwiches and 5 star service. That basically explains this unpretentious sandwich shop tucked in my favorite part of Hyde St.

The BF just moved into the neighborhood and this was the perfect mid-move meal!  Huge deli sandwiches (had half for lunch and half for dinner) .  I got the daily special (spicy chicken with grilled veggies and jalepenos).  I took off a star because I asked for no cheese or mayo (boo lactose and EW mayo) and I ended up getting both. The guy behind the counter was so nice though and remade my sandwich really quickly and it tasted awesome!   I have a feeling this will be a frequent stop for quick, fresh, and delicious sandwiches.  Can't wait to try more!

Albert is the best! He is the owner and so nice and welcoming. If you can't decide which sandwich to get just ask him to make you one and list out some of your favorites! YUMMMM! affordable, great service and convenient... at least for me :) Oh and the blue bottle coffee has me hooked.
I'd go here everyday if I lived close by. Friendly staff, delicious sando's, and fair prices..
Awesome sandwiches, the Jonas is delicious!  the owner is also very friendly. Eat to the here!

Super friendly staff, great sandwiches, and good prices. Doesn't get too much better than this. There are tons of sandwiches places in a 5 block radius from here, but this one stands clearly on top of the pile for me. The workers are extremely nice and go out of their way to make you feel accommodated. Everything from remembering your name to your sandwich preferences, nothing is amiss. The sandwiches are very well made with a great selection of meats and accoutrements on fantastic breads. They don't hold back on the portion size either and it all comes together greatly. As for the prices, they definitely are on the low end for this neighborhood.
So its 7:30 am right now, i'm lying in bed waiting for 8am when this store opens up... what does that tell you?  :)  Breakfast!
Do yourself a favor and get the Hyde St.  Amazing!  The gentleman working there was very friendly as well. I'll be back for sure.

Found this gem while on a mini vaca last month.  BEST PASTRAMI SANDWICH  on sourdough we've EVER HAD!  And the coffee was  sooooooo GOOOOoooooOOOD!  We'll be coming back on our next visit to San Francisco. :)
Normally I'd turn right around and head back out the door after spotting an "84" score from the health department, but I was in a hurry and had a hungry IT guy to feed. He had to be kept on task.
Good coffee and great Carmel frappe!  The bagel breakfast are good also. Great place, highly recommend. The one thing to note is they are cash only.

This place has some very good coffee. I would also suggest getting me breakfast burritos. They are grilled and a little different from any other burrito I've had. They play Spanish music a little loud which I would not expect from a spot in little Italy but other than that it is very good.

Initially the counter server didn't seem to want to look up and notice me, but then was friendly.  But this is god coffee and amazing boscotti.   Sweet, crunchy, larger than normal boscotti perfect for dunking in a tall glass of Italian roast coffee.  Very cool old coffee house vibe.  Cash only.  Good for breakfast.
Guy working the counter was very rude and unfriendly.
Belgium waffles- yum. Large menu. Couple of 2 top tables on sidewalk.
Great place to relax after traveling all day! Great atmosphere and friendly service . I recommend

Lovely local cafe conveniently located between Columbus Ave and Lombard St ! Free WiFi, ample outlets, a variety of inexpensive food options, $2 draft beers and $3 wines from 5pm. Local cafe with chilled out tunes. The staff are smiley, nice and helpful. Diverse crowd.
Great service! The ice moka is delicious! A bit overpriced...but like everywhere in SF!

Lovely spot for a beer and a bite. Their wraps are quite tasty and filling. I chose the veggie Sinatra and ended up splitting it with my honey. The peanut butter cookie topped off a great relaxing meal. Take the time to sit and watch the people strolling by.

This place has gone down the hill much. I live 2 blocks from here and used to come here for coffee and sometimes bagel. Went there today to get coffee and a lox bagel. The bagel came out missing half of the ingredients on the menu and I got charged $1.00 extra for a splash of soy milk.... Plus the guy works at the counter is pretty rude.

We came to visit on July 20th between 11 am and 1145 am. My brother wanted coffee so we walked there after visiting Lombard Street. My dad (who is a diabetic and in need of a restroom) walked in with my brother and proceeded to walk towards the restroom. A bodyguard (seriously) blocked my dad from using the restroom until my brother paid for the coffee. He made us watch the whole transaction go down before letting my dad in. Is that really necessary? The bottom line is that we were paying customers. And it's just a restroom for goodness' sake! What did he expect my dad to do? Pee in the street? Give himself his insulin shot in the middle of the restaurant? BTW, the other stores said that we could use the restroom inside 901 Columbus Café. They are right but they don't make it easy. As far as coffee goes, it was mediocre. I was going to buy a mocha but didn't because I was pissed. My kids got chocolate chip cookies and they were decent. They would have been better if they were warmed up, which they didn't.

A simple deli, but with truly delicious food. Warm wrap sandwich (chicken, cheese, greens) with an excellent green salad. Fresh fruit cup, even the cantaloupe was tasty. And we all know how rare that is! Flavorful and chewy oatmeal cookie. My favorite part? The homemade iced tea. Black tea, unsweetened. Superb flavor. Savor it, because refills are not free (evidently thanks to surrounding businesses who abused the privilege).

Since we are only passing through San Francisco this time around I had to find a good cafe, NOT Starbucks, that was nearby the hotel. This place did not disappoint. Everything is made with care. The espresso was just what I needed and the wraps and granola with yogurt was an added bonus. Get a wrap! They were so good that we ordered more for the road. The employees are super friendly and entertaining. I wish had more time in San Francisco.

One of large handful of low key neighborhood places that are pretty low key where you can relax for a beer ($2 drafts 3-6), partake a respectable menu ranging from soup to sandwiches to breakfast. ..or slip into a great coffee and plant your self in a leather chair and chill.
This place was cool!
Crowded and noise everywhere , if you want to read a book and some coffee and want to have a wonderful afternoon , don't come here.

Ca$h only, lovely little cafe at the corner of Taylor n Lombard where you can conveniently point and laugh at tourists taking pictures with their ipads whilst sipping on some yummy coffee, eat a hearty bagel, drink $2 dollar beers during happy hour, and watch TV.

It's really hot in here (maybe because it was pretty warm outside), but the smoothie I had was good (strawberry banana). Cheaper version of the Starbucks kind. They also serve beer, which is cool. A huge menu meets your eye on the wall behind the cashier, so it seems there's plenty of dining options to choose from. If I'm ever back in the North Beach area, and needed a beverage, I'd definitely stop by again.

I walked in and looked at the menu for a while - at the salads because I'm gluten free.  Having chosen one, I asked the guy if there were any that were completely gluten free (it's the dressing that's the danger), or should I have my choice of salad without the dressing.  He did not respond - he just stared at me, still with his hands in his pockets.  So, I asked again and his response was that he did not know (and by his look it was clear that he did not know what I was talking about and did not care).  He then asked which one I wanted.  It was clear that he was not going to pay any attention to any ingredients and would be quite happy to serve items which poison me, so I left.

I work nearby and love this place, my new spot for watching Champions League and other football matches during lunch.  GREAT sandwiches and pretty large for the price --- I had the smoked salmon today and it tasted about as good as I'd make at home.  I love it when a cafe or restaurant serves food that tastes homemade.  Amazing $2 draft beer happy hour too yep TWO BUCKS.  Captain says go there.
Chill spot with outdoor seating, views of Coit tower, Lombard st, some cathedral thing, tourists riding cable cars, and $2 drafts.

Service wasn't very nice and cash only....being it at bottom of Lombard street you would think they would at least take Visa...but it's local, cute and quaint!  Obviously love the rainbow lights at the counter- prideful ! The open mic night was a blast and an added special touch.
We were here when we went to SF last time..walking distance from lombard street...

I was staying at a nearby hotel on a recent visit to San Francisco.  I saw a sign hanging above this cafe near my hotel proclaiming "HAPPY HOUR 5 PM - CLOSE WEEKDAYS 2 PM - CLOSE WEEKENDS $2 BEERS."  I thought: "Surely it's a very small pour?  Surely it's crappy beer?  Or surely there is some other catch?  This is too good to be true!"

$2 Speakeasy craft beer pints, 3 different choices on tap, from dinner until close during the week and from noon to close on the weekend??? Seriously, how do they stay open? I went here every night I was in SF. Simply the best beer deal in the Bay Area, hands down. I wish I lived next door.

Great local cafe right across from the North Beach Library and where Lombard Street meets Columbus Avenue. The coffee's are always smooth, never burned. Wi-Fi works well and couches and seating is comfortable for a place that just feels "chill."  Good crowd, not too hipster or yuppie; just regular folks. :)
I ordered a Maui smoothie and it was delicious! Also had an onion bagel, very burnt but still good! I will definitely be back to try some thing else! Awesome vibe & good customer service!

I really love the atmosphere in this place. It's comforting, warm, and quaint but still has the hip vibe of a typical coffee shop in the city. I'm also a huge fan of the free wifi and $2 drafts! Didn't have any food, but the nice young man next to me commented that his sandwich was excellent!
Extremely disappointing pastrami sandwich! One piece of pastrami
Damn good coffee and goods prices to match

The server is very rude since the minute he saw us. He made us wait next to the other Custer coz he think we're too slow.  He always says "what do you want next". Apparently his English is very limited but he has a big attitude. I asked for a hot milk, but he have me cold milk. I came at the counter and I asked him politely if he can warm my milk. He didn't answer for a few seconds and just smirking.  A couple seconds later, he took my milk and didn't say anything.  After a couple of minutes, he just left my milk on his counter.  I took my milk and it was only a little bit warm. I was looking for a manager but there is none. We were waiting for our meal for 30 minutes and is still not ready. Eventually  spoke to the elderly manager (that appears to be his mom )that her server was rude. Before I even explain the detail, she already said: "no he's not.  We have to be that way. " she eventually let me finish my story and later apologize, but I don't think she did anything else. I think this place has changed ownership and the new owner apparently ha no sense of customer service. Don't go to this place of you don't want them ruin your vacation mood.

Good little coffee joint.  We ordered a soy mocha and an americano.  Both were very good.  It has a nice vibe but I would make one suggestion.  Clean the tables because they are sticky.  Windex and a towel and then this place is even better.

I don't like to leave bad reviews, especially if I've only been somewhere once but I haven't had crappy customer service like this in a while - so please excuse the rant. I just stopped by to grab lunch and realized Columbus Cafe only accepts cash. I had some cash on me but not enough for what we ordered + tip, so I asked the cashier if he could just take off one of the items. he said he couldn't b/c he had already rung it in and told us to pull more cash out of the ATM machines instead.

Nasty nasty customer service. Went to order at the counter and found out its CASH ONLY. Tiny sign on their cash register. We didn't have any cash on us, only credit card. We apologized and asked to cancel the order (by the way order wasn't entered yet and no food made). He wouldn't cancel it and called it unfair. He insisted we pay??? What??? The order wasn't entered and we didn't eat or take anything??? I wasn't sure what's so unfair but ignored and went to another store. Places like this that demands cash only should be on the watch list for government tax authorities, let alone on the avoid-at-all-cost for most restaurant goers.
I couldn't get enough of this cafe when I was staying down the street in North Beach last weekend in San Francisco.
Favorite coffee shop in SF! Great prices! Cafe Ole is amazing!!! Heaven in a tall cup!
Cool atmosphere, really good/delicious coffee, and good service.
The cashier guy who works here is R-U-D-E!

The cafe I go to when I'm in North Beach.  They serve Speakeasy beers on tap (which I think are $2 at some times), have pretty decent coffee, and a laid back atmosphere.   They also have a TV for catching the game, if you're so inclined.

Oh my god the coffee; not only can they make a killer cup o' joe, they even do latte art, something I haven't seen since I lived in Melbourne. The ambience is awesome, chilled music, friendly staff and a homey feel to the place. Cookies are homemade and sublime and the menu looks awesome.
Love their pizza and salads. Super nice staff and atmosphere!

Za has lost our business forever.  We've been loyal customers since we moved to Russian Hill years ago.  I ordered pizza and salads 4 hours ago.  They never came.  At the 2 hour mark, I called and was placed on hold for 13 minutes and then hung up on.  At the 4 hour mark I called and asked to speak to the manager, who was incredibly angry and rude and told me he had "no idea" where my delivery was.  He didn't even apologize.  I'm still in a state of shock by his angry outburst.  I hope a lot of people read this review and take their business elsewhere.

I actually love the pizza.....is my favorite in the city the deliver service is horrendous. It takes about 1hr 30 half to deliver the pizza and when you call they always put you on hold for 20 minutes. Once they deliver they call you so you can go downstairs because the delivery guy is to lazy to bring your pizza to your home. Avoid the delivery  service is a nightmare.....great delicious pizza once you get it though...
Pizza here is amazing! This is honestly one of the only places I'll go in SF for pizza.

I love this place for what it is.  It is a casual neighborhood joint with delicious pizza and hefty portion of salad.  It is not gourmet but it is friendly and super chill.  It makes you feel like part of the block.
Saw 3 roaches in the corner and the wait staff was extremely rude. Would never come back here!
Its always a good thing and a bad thing when a place is packed.

Very nice place to have a pizza around the Russian Hill. Looks very casual, most of the orders made there are clearly take away & delivery, but there are a few tables available. The staff is very attentive & polite.
I have had them deliver a number of times and they are always very friendly and accommodating.
Best pizza I've had in the city so far! The owner is super sweet and the service is amazing! Plus hell and high watermelon on tap, yes please!
The food is good here and the staff is friendly and I like this place.  The yelp profile is misleading though as it closes before 1030 pm except on weekends.

Found myself here twice this week and it's only Wednesday ... It's a great neighborhood spot and good for both take out and eating in (although don't expect anything fancy when choosing to eat there). Haven't had a pizza yet I haven't liked, but the Salvador Dali is my favorite.
I've ordered Za in the past and the pizza always tastes great. The delivery service has been spotty in the before but nothing like what I'm experiencing  tonight.
I have lived in the neighborhood for years now and often walk my dogs around the hood and while doing so, we pass the many restaurants that:

THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED.  I ordered delivery and after an hour and a half of waiting I called to see where they were. The man on the phone said the driver called me four times and after no answer he left.  I had never received any calls and when I asked what number they had on file he read me me back my number that was incorrect.  Not a big deal, I understand that mistakes happen.  He apologized and said he would fix it and that the driver was on his way back and would arrive in 10 minutes.  After another 20 minutes the driver never showed so I called back again.  This time the man that answered told me that the driver never went back out to re-deliver, and that they never got my number wrong, that I was wrong and that he doesn't "need to waste his time on me".  I was honestly stunned.  Told them to cancel and refund, hasn't come off my statement yet.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS PLACE, THEY HAVE NO IDEA HOW TO TREAT A CUSTOMER
The scents that waft out of this tiny shop stop me in my tracks, every. single. time.  I don't know what they do, but their scent-style marketing works like a charm.
Great pizza.  My favorite in the city.  Dine is best option.  They also have beer on tap. Their delivery can be really slow and a lot of times they don't even answer the phone.
HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE / MEDIOCRE PIZZA.  Save yourself the disappointment and keep searching.
When driving around this Nob Hill area plus having seen

Got here at 9:29. The staff said they were already closing when their hours were til 10:30. A bit disappointing but they said we could order pizza by the slice and take it to go. Not my ideal form of customer service but what can you do. I got a couple cans of soda though as they were closing! That's customer service. Woo hoo! Pizza was good.

I was brought in by Za's great Yelp reviews and other online reviews, and while I expected their pizza to be pretty good, it was even better than that.  Sure, Za may not be a trendy high-end gourmet salon, and they're probably not VPN-certified, but they do a really fine job,  So many things that could go wrong went right here -- the crust was great, the toppings were fresh, the beer was cold, the portions generous, and the mushrooms were dry enough to prevent them from soaking the crust with water.  Plus the service was friendly and quick, and the prices fair.  We were even entertained with a football game in HD (audio on mute) while being serenaded with a great 70s country rock soundtrack in the background.  I felt extraordinarily lucky to have found a parking spot a few doors down; you may not be so lucky, as parking seems nearly impossible in this neighborhood.  I recommend you either move in next door, or ride the Hyde Street cable car -- but however you get there, you gotta try Za Gourmet.  You won't regret it.
Great place for a slice!! Or a whole pie!  Workers are super friendly so love eating here. Good beer on tap too!

They lived up to my expectations for awesome customer service! Our waiter last night made us feel welcome and had a great friendly manner and made the meal fun. The pizza was one of the best I've had with a thin crisp crust and great toppings.
One of the best pizzas I've ever had, but that may be because I had just walked up the steepest dang hill and collapsed at their front door. (We're Texicans from the flat muggy lands of Houston)
I've just been there with my wife and kids. We took the cable car at Powel Street and went all the way up until Hyde Street, super close to Za Pizza.

I am writing to recommend Za not only for its outstanding pizza, but its exemplary customer service.  I accidentally ordered the wrong pizza, and called thinking the mistake was not mine.  Instead of making me feel like an idiot, Za remade the pizza I actually thought I had ordered, and redelivered it, despite it being the height of the dinner hour, and with the Giants playing the Dodgers!  Thank you, thank you, thank you!

We've been in SF for 15 days and already went to Za Pizza twice! The crust is absolutely delicious, with just the right amount of crunchiness . The tomato sauce is also very special. It's fun to sit at the bar and watch the pizza guy work the dough. Today is our last day in San Francisco, we had to go back for one last slice. We had to drive at least 15 minutes to find a parking spot, but it was worth it!

Potesto pizza! We order their pizzas all the time in our office, but I finally go the chance to stop in for a slice after a long run. The place is SUPER small, and was packed, but one of the servers pulled a wire table and 2 chairs outside on the sidewalk for us - that's all we needed!  Also great for people watching since cable cars were going by during our dinner :)
Great place to get a slice. Good flavor and huge portions. Only thing I didn't like was how crispy the crust was, but other than that it was great. Some of the best pizza I've had in the city.

First time trying this place and I am not disappointed. I ordered the Salvador Dali and it so good! Delivery was pretty fast and the pizza was hot upon delivery. I wish I would've made a note to bring peppers but oh well I will definitely order again when I visit.

I've come here each time I'm in this part of The City. It's located right off of Hyde Street. If you have friends, family visiting from out of state, definitely come here on your stop to visiting Lombard Street just a few blocks away from here. It will literally take you mins to talk. You won't even notice the time.

Ok I'm sick of it.  This used to be my go to for pizza but they rarely pick up the phone anymore, and when they do they just put you on hold for infinity.  It doesn't matter if it's Friday night or the middle of the day; for Za hold = we don't want your order.

I love love love this neighborhood Pizza Haven. They make the best thin crust in the city, and that is quite an accomplishment considering all of the competition. The one thing that I love about them is they offer a great vegetarian option in the Moma. But my favorite is the Hawaiian (Turkey Bacon) pizza.  Their daily specials are excellent as well, and their very generous with their portions.  Find yourself ordering one-size down from your normal pizza portions. Overall I must say that this is one of the best pizza spots in the city, I can't declare one over the other because they are all soooo good!
Great neighborhood pizza place, and the best part ; watching the cable cars go by while eating.

Service wasn't all that great. Got put on hold for 10 minutes had to hang up and call back. When I went to pick the pizza up there was around 5 people in there, not busy at all, not sure why I was put on hold for so long. Also had to wait at the counter for another 5 or so minutes for someone to finally help me (again I was the only one at the counter) then the guy wasn't friendly at all.
Ordered the scalliono pizza & 2 sprites for delivery. They said it would be 45 minutes. 2 hours and 15 minutes later, a cold pizza arrived with 2 root beers.
Guys have great food and gave great advice to us tourist.   Obviously a locals location, and worth while for any and all
Great pizza. Great and friendly service. Anything lower than a 4 star is from a grumpy old sad soul who would complain about anything good and only vote for the bad.
Incredibly delicious pizza and amazing customer service.  Thanks for making our boy's 11 birthday so special, Brooks!!! We'll be back for more of that delicious pie.

I'm ashamed of how long I've lived on Nob Hill without trying Za. They are extremely nice - I sat down at the counter and began babbling at them about my history in the 'hood and how I'd always wanted to try them. They listened more than politely and made lots of suggestions. Somehow rather than just getting a slice I ended up ordering an entire pizza. The whole staff swung by at one point or another to ask me if I liked the pie. Loved the pie I did. The crust is not bready - it's crisp and just thick enough to hold up the toppings. You're best off folding the slice. The toppings are generous. I loved my custom tomato sauce / pesto topping with shrooms, and olives. Their generous amount of homemade pesto is out of this world.

5 stars for Food, 2 stars for Service. I will settle on 4 stars, because the food is really delicious and historically they've been alright service-wise... it's just of late it's been a bit of a downer. Did they have a management change?

Wow. Great food but they recently increased the prices beyond what I'm willing to pay for a salad from a short order establishment. $15 for a spicy tuna salad and 14.95 for a Cobb salad. Bummed because it used to be a go to spot.
My usual is a spicy tuna salad with no mangos and sesame seeds because I am afraid of getting seeds stuck in-between my teeth.  I personally think the salad tastes better without the mangos.
Blue Barn's sandos are the perfect combo of healthy and filling.
Wouldn't really say this is worth the price of $12 for a winter salad w no meat.. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but I think Plutos is a better deal up the street

We had dish called sheep - the grilled manchego cheese dripping out of nicely grilled bread was delightful.For vegetarians,replace meat with sprouts.You can also order in advance.will cone here for salads and soups.

Salads are tasty but quite expensive and the portion is twice what I could eat.  The reason for one star is during the past two months, I have tried to call in a phone order (even during non busy times), and NO ONE ever picks up the phone.  When I walk in 10 minutes later, the place is empty with four people behind the counter, so why won't anyone pick up the phone?
Their salads are too perfect ....i can't say more...so thankful that i found this place!!
I normally LOVE blue barn and go there frequently, but today I found a hair in my salad. I was so disgusted!
Amazing amazing salads. The "sheep" grilled cheese was a little on the greasy side. I definitely recommend the spicy tuna salad.
You know you're in SF when you walk into a restaurant that casually offers a 15$ salad. The sad part is that that 15$ salad is actually super good and keeps you coming back time after time.
Fantastic food. be prepared to wait. Be prepared to wait a long time. This restaurant does not answer the phone. You cannot call and place orders to go.

Kicken Chicken was very good.  Sat outside and only bothered by one homeless person.  It was very busy, and I was there late but everything was still very fresh tasting.  Looking forward to trying the salads.
BEST TOMATO SOUP EVER!

Terrific combinations of salads.  Super healthy, well priced, friendly service.  Only two drawbacks to this place, the line (I watched so many people walk up and then leave after then saw the line out the door) and the loud bar next door whose smoking section abuts the outdoor seating.  Beet salad I highly recommend.
Perfect weekend treat, and serious props to Caitlin for the expert menu advice re: chicken zinger.  Excellent customer service.
Yes ! Great for lunch ! Very good Salads, nice place, too bad they don't have that much sun :/ But the food is really good !

It's good, but not worth the price tag. You can go to a million other places (Mixt Greens, etc.) and get a comparable salad for much less. I paid almost $20 for a salad, and while it was quite large, it wasn't worth that much money.
I got the massive Arugula salad, which was practically bigger than my head.

I don't know how my sister managed to spent nearly $50 here on lunch for the two of us without ordering one drink.  I think she just eats a lot. She had two salads and some chicken curry and I had a very tasty chicken sandwich.  The location in the marina is a lot smaller and during the week it seems packed with unemployed marketing girls in lululemon tights so it's not unsurprising they seemed to have spilled over into the Polk street location as well.

Food is fantasitc but customer service is Rotten! Tried to call them about 5x to place a pick up and they would pick up and hang up or it would go to some type of fax noise. So we decided to scurry over beofre they close at 8:30P. When we got inside it was just a minute before 8:30P. We ran up to the counter to order a salad to go and the girl at the counter, Emily was very cold and said the kitchen closed! BY this time it was literally 3 Mins after 8:30P. Very disappointed we mentioned that we tried to call to place an order and she rudely said well we are busy and cant answer the phones for orders.  We even showed her on our phones that we tried to call numberous times ( which surprisingly she doesnt even know the restaurants own number! and she is the manager??). I am very disappointed in the customer service, especially since I eat here aboiout 1 or 2 times a week and we literally came into the reastuarant a minute before 8:30P.

If you haven't been, you're missing out!!! The food is delicious, and an adorable atmosphere. My main concern is the price and wait time. If it weren't so expensive I'd give blue barn 5 stars for sure!

Every Blue Barn salad I have had the pleasure of trying so far has been delicious! Each of the ingredient, from the salad leaves to the spicy tuna, has always been fresh and of the best ingredients. The mix of flavors in each salad has been crafted to make a great flavor. The vibe in the restaurant is fun and you can sit down to have a drink with your meal. The one downside is that the salads are on the expensive side.

The food at Blue Barn is actually delicious and you can tell how quality and fresh it is -- for food you get a 5.  Where you lose stars is the customer service and dealing with the manager (I'm assuming she's the manager since she's not in uniform).

The cafe takes a modern twist and oh what a delight it was to discover this place thanks to zagat's blazing scores. The cafe is pretty good sized, but even then it is not big enough because of the rush of people that are always in line waiting to get their hands on a delicious salad or sandwich. I walked in and then line was by the door, but luckily it went by relatively quickly (8 minutes or so). It has a come booths, normal tables, bar seating area, and high chairs towards the back. Its really welcoming, warm, and cozy thanks to the homely feel provided by all the wood decor. I think it was charming and if they had wifi, not quite sure if they do or don't, I could have sat there happily for a couple hours with my laptop.

Went to Blue Barn on Friday night at 8:45 hoping to grab dinner--they were closed. Went back the next night with a friend. We ordered a sandwich and a salad. We asked them to split the salad for two--they wanted $2 to put it in a 2nd bowl. Ordered an heirloom tomato salad--had numerous non-heirloom cherry tomatoes and minimal heirlooms-WTF? I asked for bacon on the sandwich--$2 for two slices--they refused to  put it in the sandwich, on the side only. I tried to pay with my AMEX. AMEX not accepted here.

No stars! Tell that egomaniacal pompous chef if i want to order a 25$ salad w/ no romaine in it i should be allowed to do so. Last time i checked this is America & i am saving your food cost while paying for it. Talk about wasteful! The Blue Barn Carbon foot print will prob be the size California if they continue with there lack of logic reasoning. Mind you i still eat here 4 times a week & get the stupid 25$ salad. But what a fucking jerk.
This place has great selection of salads and sandwiches. Their salads are huge and I have yet to finish an entire one. I have tried most of the items on the menu and have never had a bad meal.

Solid food at a reasonable price. This seems to be the place people go to after going to the crunch across the street so it can get pretty crowded (and full of Lululemon). I got the arugula salad which was really nice and refreshing and my friend got a buffalo chicken sandwich. My only complaint (?) was that I could have easily eaten seconds :) I filled myself up w froyo after, it's healthy right?...

So great to have this salad and sandwich option in the neighborhood. Although the waits can be long, the salads are worth it. They recently added kale as one of the greens options which makes it even better. My favorite salads is the Beets one. I am also a fan of the grilled cheese options... just make sure you call ahead for those because they take awhile.
Now I have only been to this Blue Barn location in the city, so the review is only for the location on Polk.

Amazing food! I ordered the cheddar grilled cheese with white cheddar, Black Forest ham, and spicy mustard on country levain. Also got a small bowl of their tomato soup that was simply divine. Their salads all look great too. My friend ordered the truffle sandwich and I tried it - was a little intense for me but still very tasty. The truffle sauce is pretty potent and in combination with the brie was too much in my opinion. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend for lunch!

Great salad and sando spot. Very casual. Large portions for reasonable prices. You order at the counter and take a number. They call your name or deliver to your number on your table. Service is average. There is a lot of choices and you can create your own salad with the U-pick salad.
Great food but get your operations together. Closed at 3pm on a Saturday? Seriously? Every time we go there, they are closed or have run out of ingredients. Seems like bad management.

Blue Barn is my favorite salad place in San Francisco!  I prefer the Polk Street location over it's sister location on Chestnut Street because there is more seating, and easier parking (slightly).  They also have a location in Marin.  All of the locations are decorated really cute and rustic...as if you really are in a barn.
The hype is true. It is, indeed, true. Indubitably.

Delicious salads! Pretty pricey though (considering the neighborhood, I shouldn't be surprised!). You can add 6 things for free when building your salad, but have to pay extra for each additional ingredient (can't remember if it was .50 or .75) you literally get a spoonful of each ingredient so it's totally NOT worth paying extra for. The food you get is really fresh and delicious though, but it's a hard pill to swallow to pay $9+ for a salad.

Yummy salads and sandwiches. I would definitely suggest getting sauces on the side (for sandwiches) though as they really like to pile it on here. It's good, but I don't want to be drinking my sandwich if you know what I mean!
Food is good, but don't go here if you want to customize or make your own sandwich. They don't allow that.

Unlike its cousin on Chestnut Street, this location has a slightly expanded seating area and you have a better shot getting a small group or pair on to a table. The rest is smooth sailing from there (unless of course the slightly elongated wait time or the slightly premium price on the meals bothers you too much as well - I'm ok with both since the food tastes so good).

I really like this place for dim sum. You order off the menu, not steam carts, which means if you get there right when it opens it can take a bit to get your food (they are cooking it fresh). Lots of Chinese here, but with the exception of a few obligatory specialties (i.e. chicken feet), not much on the menu that can't be enjoyed by everyone.
This place was underwhelming, especially for a city as full of great food as San Francisco.

Dim sum was good. Not the best I've had but good. Make sure to get there real early or later on weekends. Got there at 9:30a, half an hour after they opened and still ended up waiting 1.5 hours even though the door hostess said "20 minutes." Ok decor and ambiance.

This place is always busy. We arrived before 11 and their was already a crowd on the sidewalk. Waited about 30 minutes for a table for 6. The dim sum is delicious. The cha sui bao's are so good. I normally do not eat these during dim sum. The chicken feet, shanghai dumplings were all very good. We ordered everything on a laminated sheet. It took a while for our food to arrive. Once the food was ready everything came out all at once. Def recommending this place.
Food is good, always a line during weekends, good service. The environment is ok.

Came here a bunch of times over the years. I was the only non-Asian person there amongst what appeared to be almost a hundred diners! Definitely not your tourist Cantonese Dim Sum Restaurant. I was waiting with folks that seem to take a natural, genuine liking to me. The old ladies smiled, waved, patted my shoulders and said nice things in whatever English they can muster up. I wasn't trying for them to accept me as their own, but it felt good to know that people welcomed me with open arms. Literally! This goes for customers and their employees alike!

Like any Dim Sum restaurant, it's best if you can speak Canto. Knowing only Mando or English will make you feel like an outsider, and result in being confused. However, if you must speak Mando or English, you should know exactly want you want before you come here, and I will tell you what to order and give you pictures to boot. Lai Hong Lounge needs to convert its tables quickly, so the food comes out quickly, so you should also not eat slowly. Lai Hong is popular so service might be a bit pushy. You'll probably wait 30 minutes for a table by noon on a weekday.

What do you do when you have 5 people from your Moms side of the family visiting SF from Colombia, your mom tells you that you need to invite them to something, AND you are feeling the poverty of being a part time grad school student trying to pay your tuition and loans? Thank God for Chinese food!
Delicious ethnic delicacies.
Great food. Cart Dim Sum is only at lunch, but menu Dim Sum available at dinner. Best chow fun ever!

Really great evening dim sum.  The restaurant was clean and the staff very friendly when we arrived.  We ordered several dim sum, fried rice and chow fun.  All very tasty.  Pork buns and Shu Mai were tops.

This is a Great Dim Sum place on the edge of SF's China Town. I took a friend and my Chinese girlfriend to this place while visiting San Francisco and everyone loved this place including my girlfriend who grew up in Beijing and loves authentic Chinese spots. The food was extremely tasty and authentic and the only downside was the long wait (almost an hour) but I will definitely be coming back to try this place again and try some new dishes.
Wow.   Best Dim Sum ever..  Everything tasted so fresh.  Too bad we live in Southern California or else we would eat there every couple of weeks.

This dim-sum restaurant deserves a solid four star. Ever since Gold Mountain closed on Broadway, I've been coming here as a regular. It's a local favorite as Dim-sum is a must go, as for the dinner/banquet not so much. However don't be expecting the dim-sum karts so you can't see how your food looks since the descriptions aren't the best so the best bet is the pictures from different tables or yelp or course.

In my opinion, the best place for dim sum in SF, mainly due to shorter wait times (than its sister restaurant Hong Kong Lounge in Inner Richmond) and due to the most amazing pork buns! Would definitely recommend.

For my first experience getting dim sum, I have to say it was quite overwhelming. I have had dumplings/potstickers/dim sum in a traditional sense in a restaurant as a small order but this is entirely different.
Legit dim sum. Had a feast for 4 people and it was only 15 per person. All dishes are excellent but anything shrimp related are standouts. Baked pork baos are exceptional.

We got here at opening (9am) for dim sum.  There was a group already waiting outside and by 9:30am I'd say you would have to wait for a table.  We ordered wayyy too much food (40 dollars worth for two people), but I was feeling ambitious.  A lot of it was chinese noob friendly, but overall very good and generous portions.
Amazing dim sum on par with HK Lounge! Arrive early and grab a ticket, reservations are for parties of 8 or more (gratuity will be added).
IF A FEMALE SERVER CHASES YOU OUTSIDE OF THE RESTAURANT DEMANDING FOR 10% TIP, TIP HER AT YOUR DISCRETION.

Mm mm mm. Finally got to try some good dim sum in SF. We went right when it opened on a weekday morning. Obviously no line; there were mostly elderly Chinese folks eating and gossiping inside. They seemed pretty cool. I hope I have that much energy to wake up early for dim sum when I get to their age.

We asked what the wait time would be and were informed 30 minutes. We ended up waiting one hour; only to discover it's not a la carte but on order. Proceeded to wait another 30 minutes before our first couple dishes came out - but overall everything took like an hour to come out - no wonder the initial wait is so long!!

After walking through Chinatown on an early Saturday morning, my husband and I were hungry for breakfast. We saw plenty of dim sum restaurants but either the line was too long or the place was empty. Unable to choose, we opened the Yelp app to help determine where the best dim sum was. Somehow, we decided on Lai Hong Lounge.

Get the "pea shoots"....I could eat those every day!!  Also they have dim sum menu during the days and weekends, but also feature a separate dinner menu after 6p.  Recommend the huge Har Gao shrimp dumplings....they are amazing (but big!).:)

This is the BEST dim sum place in San Francisco. Because it's not located in the "touristy" center of Chinatown is why this place is a hidden gem. How can you tell? Well, two ways. 1) Almost all the customers speak Cantonese and/or Mandarin and 2) there is a LONG line... I went around lunchtime and waited an hour before I finally got a spot.

I think this use to be Lychee Garden back in the day. I LOVE dim sum and am hard on the reviews so giving this place 4 stars should say a lot. I love eating (good food) but hate waiting to be seated so when I plan to eat here, I arrive about 10-15 minutes before they open so I can be part of the first seating. Otherwise the wait time is over an hour. Ok, on with the food.
so far so good

very bad service for dinner， the food is ok， but it takes wrong order， after dinner we pay，the tip i gave almost 2 dollar，the waitress say u just gave 2 dollar，u need to give more。i gave more 1 dollar， she laugh and say  only 2 dollar，why i gave u 2 dollar。u take wrong order and bad sevice，why i need gave u more tip？why u always take care  white people than us？that is discriminate！！！！！！ very very very bad service 。 i hope i never come here to eat dinner！！！！i would not come again！
Very good food..the servers are are not too rude, in a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the best...i would give their servers a 6...
Very good food, it was kind of difficult to talk to the waiter but no big deal. The steamed pork buns were delicious and the dim sun full of shrimps

Food was delicious (fresh fried calamari, shu mai, singapore noodles) but service was slow and bad, hence only three stars. The place isn't your typical hole in the wall, at least they try not to be. They have white table linens but you get your typical paper napkins and avoid the bathroom if possible.. You get charged $1 per person for tea, even though my whole party (which also consisted of my baby niece) who don't even drink tea. You betcha I did pour that into every tea cup on the table. I had to ask three people for straws and then finally got it after 25 mins. So when the bill came I tipped with the bill based on what i felt was appropriate and told her keep the change, but the waitress had the audacity to ask me for another dollar for tip. She stood there and didn't budge, asking me 'you have another dollar?' Seriously? Now looking back I should've just taken the tip back and said just for that--none. Ohh well!

So I'm giving this place 3 stars. The food is 4 stars, but the price and wait time (which was double was 4 times what the hostess said) make this place less appealing. Also, they have no carts, so once you sit down it still takes some time before you're eating anything.

The amount of Chinese people eating there tells that this place should be good however our experience was not great. Most dumplings were sweet or rather tasteless and we tried half the menu to give it a fair chance.
I have been visiting this place once month for the last year. The dim sum is good especially the shrimp dishes. Their shrimp are really "bouncy or crunchy" not mushy like some places I've been too.
Amazing.

FYI in case you didn't know. Same owners as HK Lounge I and II but in chinatown. Same wait time though and place is a bit smaller. Went here today for some dimsum. We got there around 11 and what was a time estimate of 20-30 minutes turned into an hour. They set up a new table for us too but it was basically squeezed into a walk way but either way we got seated. Ordered the usual dimsum dishes of shiu mai, chicken feet, steam pork buns, etc. The wait for the food was actually a lot longer than what I have experienced in HK lounge so at least you know its fresh but it seriously took forever. Food was very good and quality was great. I think their dimsum pieces are bigger than the usual places so worth it but not evrey weekend type of place for sure.

Awesome food!  Went there for a family dinner based on a recommendation, and have to say it was a wonderful experience.  The staff was very hospitable and helpful.  We started out with their Pork Porridge, and it was so creamy and perfectly seasoned.  I've had congee at many places, and this was indeed one of the best I've had.  We were planning to do Dim Sum, and the staff helped us pick out all the right dishes.  We ordered BBQ Pork Buns, Shu Mai, Vegetarian dumplings, Steamed Fishballs, shrimp dumplings, and Pan Fried House noodles, and every item was delicious!!!  At the end, staff even treated us to a house desert.  Have to say it was a very fun evening, and all of us went away with big smiles and very full bellies!  Highly recommend this place!

Very friendly service. The beef short ribs with yams underneath were seriously just YUM!!! And so were the pepper fried Chicken Wings! It's not black pepper like I thought it would be. I forgot, CHINA RULES. LOL pepper on a menu in China means actual chili peppers lmao not black pepper like we use for everything here in the states XD. So the wings were toped with fried garlic, tiny diced red chilies, and scallions. SO, SO good! We also loved our meatballs and potstickers. The only downside (and the reason I always want to go for dim sum) were their xlb (Shanghai Soup Dumpling). Do not misunderstand, they were GOOD. But they were not GREAT. I have been lucky enough to have been spoiled with the most epic Xiao Long Bao known to man (OK, known to me lmao) but they were earth shattering. These were just good. I did love how they put their xlb in tiny cupcake-cups to save your juices from leaking out. That was AWESOME.

This was our first experience with a Dim Sum restaurant and it was perfect! The Dim Sum we ordered was not only delicious, the service was great, and it truly was an authentic Asian gem. If you want an experience away from "Main Street China Town" this is it. Highly recommended!

my family came here once and to be honest they charge gratuity 15 % even if your group is not 8 people. we were only 7 including babies. so be aware if your group is large. also they ask for tips. don't be surprise if you are walked up by a waitress asking for more tips. I would rather go somewhere else without having to have a rude waitress thinking she gave top service when we got shit service.

There's a sign saying "this is not fast food," by which is meant: this is possibly extraordinarily slow food if there's any kind of line.  I would only come back here for things that didn't require any preparation, like coffee and pastries.

I haven't actually dined at Caffe Sapore...yet.  But I wanted to give a big heartfelt thank you to the owner who generously donated a full spread of amazing appetizers to our fundraising event today at Fort Mason.  The appetizers were phenomenal and I can only imagine how good the dishes at the restaurant are.  I am planning to dine there soon and I suggest that you all do so as well.  I think it should be a priority for all of us to support businesses that give back to our local community and to our global community!  There are still some good businesses out there and Caffe Sapore is one of them.  Thank you Caffe Sapore!  Here is a link to our cause that Caffe Sapore felt was worth their generosity...

I felt like I should have apologized for bothering the guy taking orders and making drinks. Terrible attitude and needs a new job elsewhere. Only 2 people working so they switch between making food and washing dishes. Just a negative feeling here due to attitude.

Caffe Sapore is my favorite neighborhood cafe in San Francisco! I'm so lucky to live just a couple blocks away. Family-owned, with meticulously made coffee drinks and a full menu of bagels, sandwiches, soups and so many other options. And if you have a sweet tooth like me, the bakery items (chocolate croissants, apple turnovers, pie, to name a few) are delicious! Sapore draws a diverse crowd of locals and tourists, with Lombard Street (the Windiest Road) just two blocks away. The interesting art and the ambiance is worth hanging out for a while. Say hi to Lee and Elias for me!
We really loved the sandwiches and pizzas at this cafe. There were options for meat lovers and vegetarians in the group.
Let me start by saying this treasure of a breakfast place is run by TWO people!!
Great food,great drink,nice beer selection and a chill atmosphere,what more do u want
I got the soup of the day, which was black eyed peas soup. It was good enough. Could of used a tad bit more salt.
Great local breakfast spot.
Great cafe in the neighborhood with plenty of open seating. Perfect for work meetings or getting some work done in a quiet setting. Solid location, too!

Caffe Sapore is a quaint little neighborhood cafe with a good selection of food and drinks. Also the cafe is pretty clean and has good wifi connection. The only reason this Caffe Sapore is getting an "A-OK" rating is because nothing in particular really stood out to me. When I was ordering my food, the cashier wasn't friendly, and not a single word was spoken throughout my transaction. But, the location is in a very active SF neighborhood and I would come back again.

Such a sweet, bright, open coffee shop with great food and service. Cappys are perfect, the food is delicious (try the broccoli quiche, comes with a salad) and the people are wonderful. A new, favorite place!!!

Caffe Sapore is your friendly neighborhood cafe that serves up some decent sandwiches. The coffee though, was a slight disappointment. The brewed coffee tasted awfully sour. The cappuccino lacked brightness. The only saving grace was the extra thick foam.

I think the quiche is what they do best. The crust is on point. Caffe Sapore is the only place I will go for a quiche. My favorite is the mushroom quiche, but I recently had the asparagus quiche and that was damn good. My favorite is the last bite. The crust is perfect and has the perfect amount of cheese.
If I'm not on time, I'm early. It's a curse really. So looking to waste time and in need of a bathroom, I happen upon this place.
First time here. Staff was friendly. good vibes. Food was great! Our cashier, Mustafa, was very polite and helpful! I recommend the the Marco Polo. Delicious!!
Their Sapore bagel is a meal and it has this delectable Middle Eastern spice, Zaatar, lightly dusted on it
Cosy atmosphere, delicious bagels. Not cheap though.

I frequented Sapore for more than 11 years while living locally. The coffees are fantastic, breakfast bagels are fresh and creative, and focaccia sandwiches are delicious, too. It's a warm, neighborhood spot, where I made a few great friends. They play good music, feature interesting local art (available for sale) and are all around good people. The owner still works there making the food and knowing his customers - great place!
Great neighborhood place! Ordered two lattes and breakfast croissants and everything was delicious. Enjoyed sitting outside and the service was extremely quick and friendly.

In a neighborhood with cafes on every corner Caffe Sapore stands out as one of my favorites. Right at the foot of "Lombard Street" (the curvy part) this cafe garners a lot of attention as tourists who just finished seeing one of San Francisco's main attractions make their way towards Columbus Street. My being a local, and thus my usual disdain for the hordes of tourists that flood my neighborhood every day, doesn't stop me from coming to Caffe Sapore at least three times a week for coffee or breakfast.
This is my go to neighborhood Cafe. It's a nice little place to stop in for a sandwich (I love the chicken pesto) or pizza (artichoke one is amazing) and a beer.

I like this place for the atmosphere and the sandwiches. It's kind of one of those neighborhood places to go and just hang out, without feeling rushed. the vegetarian sandwiches are huge and tasty. i like that the staff seem like they enjoy working there, and dont try to hard. oh, but that means theres usually a wait, so yeah, bring some creativity with you.
Coffee and pie stop after walking up and down Lombard street. Very tasty Mocha Latte and a slice of Very Berry Pie.
if i come back here, i would definitely not order a sandwich. they are so saucy/running that it made the bread soggy.
Saw the Yelp and decided to try it out. Eating my bagel sandwich now...
Some of the best sandwiches I've ever had in San Francisco! I got the Odd Fellow and my boyfriend got the Toscana- both amazing. I will be returning here every time I'm in the city.

This place is a gem!  I have developed an addiction to the Sicily Bagel which is sooo freakin' tasty.  I love the staff too, very cool.  Nothing better than sitting outside on a nice day, people watching, sipping bellinis and chowing down on a delicious bagel.  Definitely one of my favorite SF go-to spots!

I ordered one of their salads and our kids had a pizza. The portions were huge and everything was delicious, yet healthy. The interior is rough, but very cozy, so I wasn't afraid of my kids "spoiling" anything. Plus, they had kids' toys in the cafe! All around win for a nice lunch with the family.

Been here a couple of times and I'd probably go here again.  Sandwiches and lattes are decent.  Friendly staff.  A bit of a walk from the Chinatown or Fisherman's Wharf area, so it's a good quiet place to sit down and have lunch.
Good food, good service. No complaints
Chai is not particularly good here; tasted kind of watery. I'd chill outside on a sunny day with another drink, however.

Love my neighborhood cafe!!!  The owner and staff are really friendly and the food is fresh and delicious.  Its a great place to take visiting family and friends for brunch, dinner or even a drink.  Great ambiance too.  You can hang out, focus on work or have a business meeting.
You walk in there, the atmosphere is warm, serene, earthy and in touch with the community.  The food is well prepared and delicious. House coffee is great quality and my bagel was delisssshhh.
Tasty coffee-

I am writing this review as I literally am laying in bed sick with food poisoning. I decided to stop in for a quick bite and ordered a pizza. The staff was friendly and the place had a good vibe so my rating is mainly about the fact that one hour after eating the pizza I started feeling really nauseous. All through the night I fought back vomiting,I had the chills, rolling around moaning in agony, not to mention the explosive diarrhea. Its been a truly awful experience and I'm a pretty tough guy, but this was most likely a freak incident based on all of the wonderful reviews for this place. It seems like a really cool neighborhood spot, unfortunately I ordered the wrong thing.  : X

Caffe Sapore is the quintessential neighborhood cafe.  Literally everyone around Lombard and Columbus stops by here.  The librarian, policeman, shop owners, the owner of those big white dogs you see walking around North Beach, and the techies from the tower on Taylor St.

I love the friendly staff, the delicious mochas, bagels with fresh ingredients, and overall atmosphere here at Cafe Sapore...and of course just like most fellow yelpers mention, the free wifi ain't too shabby either :) I live across the street from Cafe Sapore, so I find myself here every day and always look forward to spending a few hours by the window reading, people watching, or getting work done. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good cup of coffee or sandwich.

Don't know how I missed this place until yesterday!  Friendly quick service, good soy lattes, vegan sandwiches, vegan sweets.  Nice atmosphere, free wifi without password.  No soft seating, however.  I'll let that slide in this case.

My husband and I had breakfast here today. We tried to go to Capriccio, but they were closed, and we're glad it worked out that way. He had a breakfast bagel sandwich with some really nice ham and fresh tomato, plus egg and cheese. I had a delicious cranberry bran muffin, which the gentleman behind the counter kindly offered to heat up. My husband had a nice Americano, and I was glad to have some coffee that tasted good without any doctoring. The service was friendly, and we found this place to be charming. I'd gladly go back.
Patricia was the best! She recommended the best fish. We enjoyed appetizers to shashimi and maki rolls. Definitely will be returning.
Excellent quality sashimi and some of the best miso soup I've had (try it with enoki mushrooms).

Extremely pricey sushi with non-existence customer service. The staff and chefs were overwhelming cold and extremely unfriendly. Sushi was not memorable and even if it was, we were too, too much in dismay by how poorly we were serviced to notice if it was any good at all.  It felt like they thought they were doing us a favor to charge us $95. Considering how many other options we have in the city, I recommend selecting another spot that appreciates your business....go to Elephant Sushi literally around the corner for a much better experience and sushi.

Customer service was horrible, very pricy for mediocre sushi. Very cold dinning experience. Upon entry I felt as if they did not want my family to even dine at the establishment. I'm really surprised they are in business and even more surprised they have regulars as I noticed while I was waiting for my meal.
I don't know if I came on a bad night, but this sushi was not good and very bland. The server did not take our drink order for 5 minutes.
We were trying to go to Elephant Sushi across the street, but they were closed on a Monday so we walked in here and got seated at the bar right away. No wait! +1
Good Sushi!
Incomparable sushi!

I was introduced to this place by a fellow sushi lover.  I had been looking for a good sushi restaurant where you can relax and have a good conversation with a friend for a while, and I'm so glad I finally found one.  The service I get may be somewhat biased as the friend I go there with is a VIP there and we always get served directly from the owner at the sushi bar.  Please sit at the bar and get omakase if you want a proper sushi experience (true for any sushi restaurant in my opinion).
This place is amazing!  This is THE BEST sushi in San Francisco!  The food always fresh and delicious. The customer service is also the best!!
I've been to this place a few times now. Best sushi I've had in SF, by a very long shot. Beautiful interior and even more beautiful sushi. Everything is always very fresh and flavorful.

Recommended here by a friend.  Been here 4 times during my 10 week stay in San Francisco.  The selection of fish and the the quality of the fish makes me so satisfied.  My favorites are the uni and scallop.  I like white fish and normally I prefer hirame, but changed my mind as I had the most delicious seabream and kanpachi here last night.

Really great sashimi here. Had the Uni (nigiri) - the market price was $10 from California or $20 from Japan. Enjoyed the Russian Hill roll and Double Hama roll. Super fresh and delicious - some of the rolls were really pricey (up to $20) but I think the quality definitely matched the price.
Nigiri that makes you slow down and appreciate gotta tasting food.

I have mixed feelings about this place. My first experience was excellent. The sashimi was delicious and the service was good. My second experience, however, was awful. I sat at the sushi bar and ordered various nigiri. I asked the uninterested chef for recommendations and he scoffed, "Salmon?" I told him I don't like salmon; he didn't care, respond, or even look at me. I decided to let it go. I add soy sauce to my wasabi while I wait for the waitress. The chef seems to think this is unacceptable and asks, "What's going on here? What are you doing?" I'm confused. I look to the other chef for clarification; so does he. He starts to make fun of me in Korean, thinking I don't understand every sinword he's saying. I just sit in disbelief at this exchange. Here I was, paying over $70 for sushi, and they were making fun of me right in front of my face. I took the sushi to go. And I don't plan on going back.

I have been to Okoze 3 times now. It's by far my favorite sushi joint in Russian Hill, not to mention one of my favorites in San Francisco. I come back for their uni. So far, I've tried the Mendocino and Santa Barbara uni. The MP has been around $10-11 for 2 pieces of uni. For the high quality uni, I would say this is a great deal. I've brought other friends here, both fellow uni lovers and uni newbies, and they have all had positive experiences here as well. On a night where I'm willing to drop more $$ for my meal, I'll go for the Hokkaido uni, whose MP goes for double, but that also means I'm getting half the amount of uni! If you've ever doubted uni or want to try it for the first time, come here.

Okoze is great!  They are very generous with the fish on the sushi rolls.  Each bite of every roll we ordered was an unforgettable experience with the buttery fresh fish and just enough crunch to satisfy and awakens the taste buds.  Highly recommend the Crispy Copper Salmon Roll and Ninja Roll.

Girlfriend and I tried to go to elephant sushi around the corner, but the wait was an hour so we gave this place a try since we were still craving sushi. We walk in and usually we pick the bar cause my girlfriend likes to order with the chefs and also can see how they're making the sushi. We saw the reviews here was 4 stars so we felt assured.
In short, get the $50 sashimi moriawase or omakase. Nothing else is worth it.

Great sushi!  Amazing food with great flavor and lots of options.  We had the veggie goyza which could have been a little more flavorful but still delicious  We also ordered a number of rolls that were just amazing.  It's definitely worth a visit.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the service could definitely have been better, but overall it was an awesome experience!

Had several excellent, dine in experiences here. One of the few sushi places I'd let the chef decide. Also, (usually) possible to get served after a couple minute wait unlike most other top-rate sushi places in the city.
This is my favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco.
