way over hyped.  Sushi is good, but not worth a 4 star rating.  Saw many that said that Elephant Sushi was too crowded so came over here.  Let me say, wait for Elephant Sushi, well worth it.  The Fatty Yellowtail was at best regular yellowtail.  Service is kinda slow due to lack of staff.  Wasabi was week like it was sitting around for some time. Overall the price was decent considering the amount of food and drinks we had. Going back to Elephant Sushi tomorrow no matter how long I have to wait.

Loved the sushi here! Our table ordered a wide variety of sushi, sashimi and rolls. All were fresh, good cuts and tasty. Highly recommend the Japanese butterfish. Pricey at $22, but worth it. It's easier to get in here than the sushi bar down the street where the wait can be 1-1 1/2 hrs (Elephant). Great 2nd choice without the wait! Yum.

I've been to this location twice and can say I had a pretty good experience each time. I am now a fan of sashimi over warm rice because of SugarFISH. They make it taste so good! Sushi were fresh and service was excellent. The servers are very attentive and knows exactly when to deliver each dish. As mentioned in all my SugarFISH reviews, you cannot go wrong with the TRUST ME set. It's perfect and will definitely satisfy your sushi palette. Parking in Russian Hill is always a bit of a pain but there is a lot that is located west of 7th and Grand Ave. for 5 bucks.

This was a restaurant I had wanted to try for a long time, and I was left very disappointed. This was 3- star sushi at 5-star prices. What was good? The squid Tempora (appetizer) and Saba (Mackerel) were both pretty decent. But the rest was mediocre or worse. Fried scallops were soggy instead of crispy. Salmon skin roll a bit slimy tasting. The  service was also a bit off and slow. The waitresses didn't seem to have assigned tables -- so first one came to take our order, then the next, but with no concept of what had been communicated previously.  -- and food didn't show up for a very long time (a half hour for an appetizer). This was a special occasion -- I don't  get to drop  $60/person on a meal every week -- and quite simply, that money felt a bit wasted.
Consistently Great sushi. Probably the best in the area. Never disappoints. Only downside is that it's on the pricier side.
I have been coming here for years.  We have since moved to the east bay but come here especially to eat here. Jason the owner and head chef is a true master.

The sushi was good, but the prices were exorbitant for what you got. The fish was fresh and tasty, but I have had far more remarkable sushi in the city and the prices are not justified in the quality. Also, I felt like some things had a weird tang to them - the pickled ginger tasted "off". We ordered this pickled vegetable starter- what a waste of $8. They give you about 3 slivers of random pickled veggies - I love veggies and pickles but there were just awful.
Small place. Great fish. I love monkfish liver and sashimi!! They are fresh and delicious.!

We made a reservation and ended up sitting at the bar, because we love the sushi bar. The waitress was snippy, she made us wait a while for the menus, and when I asked if they had menus (nicely), she said 'of course we have menus, I'm bringing them to you, just wait a minute'. I was like, 'whoa, lady!'.
The quality of the sushi was excellent! Extremely fresh, good cuts and chef recommendations were fantastic. A little pricey, but worth it.

The fact that Okoze has a lower rating than Elephant Sushi, makes me really question the intelligence and preference of Yelp reviewers.  I'm going to do my civic duty and tell you to try for yourself.  Ask for Omakase at both places and decide for yourself.  Yes, Okoze's Omakase will easily run you $100+ per person....but when has money ever been an issue in the City, especially when it comes to raw fish.
Food is still very good and a solid 4 stars.
Absolutely amazing, sushi melts in your mouth.
Whenever in a sushi restaurant, I only order 2 things - Fatty Salmon or Toro=) This place offers many kinds of Toro, yay!^.^ happily taking all the fish fat haha

I have never had such great Hamachi sashimi. This place had very warm and intimate vibes. The waiting staff was very accommodating to my group and I. I would recommend the tsunami for a more Americanized roll and any sashimi for the best fish around! Cannott wait to go back.

My favorite local sushi spot. Have been going for years. A wonderful intimacy to the decor and service, and a unique creativity to rolls and presentation. Being next door to Swensen's can't hurt either!

Date night success! The sushi here is SO fresh and melt in your mouth delicious!  The miso soup was probably the best I've ever had, the kampachi volcano was amaazing (raw fish wrapped around avocado with ponzu sauce).  I ordered sake sashimi and it was SO buttery delicious that I literally could not stop raving about it for days later.  This place is definitely on the pricier side for sushi, so it's not somewhere I would go for a casual dinner, but it is definitely up there in terms of best in SF!

Had high expectations for this place because it was always packed whenever I passed by it on the cable car -- and there were stellar reviews. Unfortunately the food wasn't consistent so I have to give it 3 stars.

I am hooked on Golden Deli in the SGV in Southern California and my standards are based on their deliciousness. That said, Aux Delices is a suitable substitute between visits to LA. It's not as delicious, the portions are smaller and it's more expensive but what can you do?
Amazing Service and huge variety of vietnamese dishes the waitress was very helpful and very nice about the food great quality and taste like heaven definitely I will come back

very tasty and conveniently located on polk street. make sure you know exactly what you want when you order to go, being very clear about your order. i wanted an order of imperial rolls and wanted clarification as to how many rolls were in each order. we went back and forth about there being 4 rolls and how thats how many i wanted...ended up with 4 orders of imperial rolls.

A year ago I would have given them 4 stars, but those days are over.  The service is awful and the food isn't much better.  There are 5 employees, and there were only 7 tables, but we still waited forever for everything, including the bill.
This  place is actually pretty good. We were debating between here and lemongrass but figured Vietnamese was a good change.
You know, Aux Delices, you aright after all.

Boss. Fucking. Food. Me & the bf always get delivery. I always get the tofu vermicelli. So good, I could eat it twice a day (and have, shhhhh). Bf gets the chicken and we both love the fresh rolls. Yum yum yum. Please give it a whirl. Delivery takes a while but it's accurate.
One of the PHO places in SF!!! Can be a casual date night spot, especially on a rainy / cold day!

Stopped in at 5:30pm on a Saturday after a long day of volunteering at the chocolate festival. Only 2 other tables were there so sat right down in the front. The service was friendly - although I don't think the server was too happy that we each just ordered one item. I had the glass noodles with shrimp and crab - they were delicious. Daughter had garlic noodles and they could have been more garlicky. She liked her apple cider and I loved that they had a stout beer on the menu - that surprised me. I'd definitely go back and try many more menu items.

We ordered online and picked the food up on the way home. It was ready, hot and packaged securely, at the advertised time. The food was very high quality! We had a soup, a noodle based dish and one other item that I can remember. It was light and fresh, delicately seasoned.
All I can say is yum, yum and YUM! Amazing food, incredible service and the best Vietnamese iced coffee ever with the best presentation and preparation.

Really like this place. Can't go wrong with their food. Just ask for the special and I'm sure it won't disappoint. My favorite is their crap asparagus soup. I've had this soup at other Vietnamese restaurant and I must say that this restaurant has the best one. Parking can be difficult so plan ahead. The staff is not bad either.
The imperial rolls were AH-MAZ-ZING!!!! I'm visiting from LA and these rolls brought me back to my visit to Vietnam 10 years ago! soooo tasty!  a MUST try.
Good food across the board and nice relaxing ambiance.  Its my favorite Vietname place in the neighborhood.  Take out is quick and reliable too.

I've only had the chicken pho in chicken broth & spring rolls here, but I really like them both ... Make sure to add sriracha, bean sprouts, jalapeños and lime to the pho. it's definitely my go to on cold nights. Feeling under the weather tonight so calling in an order now!

this is kind of a "MEH" "Americanized" Vietnamese restaurant..the restaurant is very cute though and seems to run by most Vietnamese people, however I think that I have had better Vietnamese food at some "hole-in-a-wall" Vietnamese places...we ordered Vegetarian Sweet and Sour soup, the soup was actually pretty good, however, in Vietnam we generally eat soup with the meal, it's not as an "appetizer" like American cuisine, usually in Vietnam during a meal, we have 3 kinds of dishes, one soup, one vegetable and one meat, and we eat everything together, so the set up of soup as an appetizer here is kind of weird to me already since after eating a big bowl of soup, I am kind of full and not really thrilled for other dishes...However, the soup was good, so I was looking towards to the main dishes.
I like this Vietnamese restaurant. It's on the more expensive side of Vietnamese places, but not too overpriced. I particularly like their noodle salad and have been taking out from them.

This is a family run Vietnamese restaurant located on Russian Hill. When I came here with a friend a few days ago it was very busy but we were seated quickly. I don't know much about Vietnamese food beyond pho, so I wasn't sure what to to order. The menu was pretty user friendly and I ended up ordering a glass noodle dish with veggies in a garlic and ginger sauce. The dish itself wasn't to my liking but it was well cooked and the vegetables were fresh. My friend had the pho and I tried it and it was good.

This place seems so cute and is right in my neighborhood so gave it a try last night with two friends.  Got in shortly before 9pm without a reservation and enjoyed a great bottle of wine and some appetizers which were the highlight of the meal.  Our waitress kept pressing us for our dinner order without giving us much time to review.  She apparently got annoyed and sent in "the closer" who was the definition of rude.  He wanted our orders and he wanted them now.  Not even 5 minutes after they were placed our meals showed up.  We weren't even halfway through our apps.

Excellent family run restaurant.  Went there for dinner tonight.  The sampler platter of appetizers was delectable.  The green papaya salad was just spicy enough and the shrimp topped it off.  The garlic noodles were delectable.  The cubed filet beef with onions was so tender and savory it melts in your mouth. We also had the vegetable curry which was  perfectly seasoned with the veggies cooked just right.  To top it all off the service was impeccable which always my pet peeve.

Boyfriend HAD to have some Pho on a Sunday evening and nearly everything good was closed. So here we are. Clean and delicious. Also not located in the scarier Tenderloin area where most of the pho places are.
Caramel salmon in the clay pot was delicious and went well with brown rice.  Grilled pork vermicelli noodles were good, too.
Have only had delivery but always delicious, fast and piping hot. Imperial rolls, garlic noodles, crispy chicken, and beef with lemongrass are my favourite.  Incredibly tasty!

This place really hits only high notes on multiple levels.  Not only is the food amazing, but the decor is on point.  The atmosphere is also very comfortable, but my normal routine is getting the Pho for takeout at least once a week!.........It may be the best in the city.
This place is a good place to hit when you want to go to an asian place after 9pm. Not all of the dishes were amazing.

Ugg - Never ever eating here again.  Order the Papaya Salad with Shrimp on Thursday  6/12/14  - and have been sick all weekend.   Ordered take out  - and between the 4 of us - 2 got food poisoning. The common item was the Papaya Salad.  On top of that - who ever was taking the orders was fairly rude and didn't like answering my questions.

Expectations were high as the place was pretty packed at 8 PM on a Wednesday.  My eating partner in crime and I had just arrived in San Francisco after being in Mexico for a week.  We were incredibly excited to finally eat something Asian.  Expectations went even higher when a regular there had reaffirmed that this was the best Vietnamese place in the city.
Excellent food and excellent service! Really liked the atmosphere as well. Highly recommended.
kinda bumpy reception as the hostess wasn't sure to where to seat us two.

No good.  I ordered Ca Phe Sue Da (the iced coffee that drip-brews on your table), and Grilled Pork with an Imperial roll and fried rice.  I got what I ordered, but not what I wanted: the pork consisted of 3-4 thin slices -- there was probably more pork in the Imperial Roll than on the plate.  Speaking of the Imperial Roll, it had a strange musty taste, as if the wrappers were stored in my grandmother's basement.  The fried rice?  Bland and soggy.

Great local Vietnamese place. The food is really good and there is rarely a wait. We often get takeout pho from here which is always very good. However, the decor is a bit old school. I think if they made the place trendier they'd get a lot more business.

worse pho broth ever, heavily watered down with no taste whatsoever.  Save your money a drink toilet water you will be better off.  Not sure how this piece of dog shit vietnamese place stays in business
We were here last night, dinner for 3.
This place has become a take-out staple for my fiancè and I.  The food is very good and always ready for pickup within 20 min of ordering.

I used to live a couple blocks from this place and it was my go to whenever I couldn't figure out what I wanted for dinner.  It's great for take-out and for eating in.  I've since moved to the Inner Richmond, but we still make the trek over and hassle with parking just for their crispy chicken.
Service consistently awkward/ bad , food consistently good . Just be in good company for the good food !!

My go-to place for solid Vietnamese cuisine.   Even though the service is pretty limited, the ambience is pleasant and the food is flavorful.  They have a wide variety of dishes including plenty of vegetarian options.

This restaurant was AWESOME.  The first good sign was the wait once we got there (8:30 on a Saturday night).  10-15 minutes and they were quick to get us seated and had great recommendations.  Whatever you do, get #27.  It's a pork/shrimp sautee in a caramel sauce and it is by far the greatest flavor in the history of ever.  We also got #43 which was a flank steak with a garlicky sauce and peanuts and it was delicious also.  We started with the sampler platter and I had the sparkling lemonade.  All were great!  At the end of the meal, our bill was under $45.  That is pretty dang good for San Fran prices, and this is coming from a South Carolina girl.  If you're thinking about it.. Just do it.  You won't be sorry.
Food = Outstanding
Stay away from this place at all costs. They just don't care about you or your order, and will rip you off in the process.

It's surprisingly great! I passed this place many times and decided to try it today. I ordered chicken plate as recommended by the staff here. It took a while and I was getting a bit impatient. But when they brought the food. It was totally worth the wait! Great taste - I am pleasantly surprised!

What a great find! In The City with my Husband at Dinner time is never a good thing as we've had so many bad food experiences together, we really didn't have much hope in finding somewhere so were pleasantly surprised when we found North Beach Gyros. Thank you Yelp!

Delicious food and reasonably priced. The interior is attractive and bright, with both tables and booths. Unfortunately, there are very few outlets for computer work (but they offer free wifi), so the lovely woman working there kept my mug of hot tea full as I sat at the table by the door. She was incredibly kind, and I appreciated the gesture immensely.

Let me warn the reader. The baklava is dangerously addicting. As good as my grandma's. And, of course, the Middle Eastern food here is top-notch. I eat here all the time. Service is excellent and friendly. Ask for co-owner Apo. He loves his restaurant & the food of his land; he is passionate about his venture. Don't think twice; you will be VERY satisfied. Again, WARNING, the baklava here competes with the pleasure of sex.
I'm so glad I found this place. I live in North Beach and this is one of very few places in the neighborhood that has delicious and very affordable food. Plus, the portions are quite large.

Great little place with amazing, fresh food and a wonderful staff. The hummus is well flavored--you can really taste the chickpeas (instead of a surfeit of garlic like I've had at other places); the pita is warm, fluffy and tastes homemade. The wraps are delicious as well--the bright notes of parsley and other veggies balancing out the richness of the meat. They don't yet have a beer/wine license but you can BYOB and sit outside. Highly recommended!
I'm addicted to this place. Its healthy, fast, delicious and consistent with a charming and attentive staff.  I ordered delivery recently for the first time and it was lightening fast and perfect.
Come and taste yourself. Great staff!! I'll be back next week. Mixed grill and lamb kebab.
Fight to the finish.

After getting food to go from this place I feel obligated to let the world know. This is the worst meal I've had in San Francisco. And I'm convinced these positive reviews are plants and fake. If not, I am seriously questioning the taste of everyone who gave this spot 4 stars as they have obviously never had decent Greek food. (I miss you chicago) We got the hummus, order of spanikopita, chicken gyros plate and beef/lamb gyros plate. I opened up the spanikopita and they looked burned. Like they were black and extremely charred. Took one bite and it tasted like ash. No joke. I looked over and my gf was digging through her chicken gyros plate looking for an edible piece with a distressed look on her face. I popped open my lamb gyros plate and was shocked to find the majority of the piece had huge veins/fatty tissue. There was barely any edible meat. It was all fat. The rice on each plate was literal mush. And to top it off this place somehow found a way to screw up hummus. What we got was bland and almost play dough like in texture. Pita bread was ok though. We gave everything one bite and boxed it back up. Some might say we caught them on an "off night"... Fuck that. The food their employees knowingly gave us looked terrible and tasted even worse! Inexcusable! I've never had a bad meal in this city until trying this dump. I'm still looking for a good gyros spot in the city aside from oasis but for now oasis is still the tried and true king. Avoid this place at all costs
Authentic. Legit. Eat here.
This place reminded me of the halal guys in New York, but in SF! I loved it...

I had been eyeing North Beach Gyros since they took over the retail space at the corner of Powell and Union. I live right up the street, so I was hopeful to finally have a Falafel spot so close to home.

Food was decent, but do not order delivery from this place. We called, placed the order, and were told it would arrive in 20 mins. We were also told that we could pay the delivery guy with a credit card. Almost an hour later, no food. Called to check status and were told the guy was on his way. When food still hadn't arrived after 20 more mins, we called again and were told our order had never been placed. Ordered again, verified again that we didn't need to pay over the phone in advance. We ordered 2 salads and some hummus. Once it finally arrived, we discovered they didn't take cards and the guy said they would just call us later. A few hours later, they called couldn't figure out how to take a card over the phone, then tried to charge extra for items we didn't order. They finally figured it out and then hung up on me. Not worth the time/frustration.
Really good food. Gyro and babaghannouj very tasty. Nice to have this place in north beach. Friendly staff.

Super flavorful, fresh yummy food and a friendly staff that make you feel like you are being welcomed into their home.  We are gradually working our way through the menu and find that we have a new favorite every time we order.  So glad these folks are in our neighborhood.  :-) Yippee North Beach Gyros!!!!!

You can't get bad food here. Salmon, chicken, lamb, beef, kabob, wrap. This is a neighborhood GEM . Introduced this place to a good friend last night and she swears it's the best dinner she's had in a long time ! Try it, try it, try it.

Came here after a day of hiking in Angel Island.  Thankfully the place was pretty empty, as we were starving.  I got a vegetarian wrap and my husband got the falafel and we got a baba ghanoush to share.  Prices were very affordable.  Wraps were HUGE-I ate half of it and was absolutely stuffed.  Baba ghanoush came with fluffy pita bread.  My friend got the gyro wrap and dolmas.  Dolmas were very good and came with a side of tzatziki sauce.  In a prime location near Washington Square Park.  It was such a nice day that we took it to go and had a picnic at the park.  Really good fast Arabic food.

Tried out North Beach Gyros when I was in the area.  Got there Sat around 11am and had the place to myself for the longest time.  Order with the cashier and get a number, good then brought to you, you can sit anywhere it's very casual.
NORTH BEACH GYROS CORNERS THE HUMUS MARKET

Really very, very good Turkish/Arabic food in a slightly improbable location.  Dropped in for lunch, found delicious and tender kebabs, nice, fresh hummus, fresh hot pita straight from the oven, fluffy rice as a side dish, tasty salad with a balanced dressing that had good balance of the oil and acid---and friendly and casual service.
This place is legit! Everything I have tried here has been fresh and delicious and I eat here at least 1x week.

I have developed a serious Mediterranean food addiction.  I love the gyros or donners (depending on the Turkish or Greek influence).  I also am a fan of the salads and the rice.  Their yogurt dipping sauce is great as is the hummus.  The lamb is very tasty too.  A great place to go for a weeknight meal when you don't feel like cooking.  Prices are reasonable too. A well deserved 5 stars.

Really enjoyed our meal, great tasting cuisine.  The baklava is outstanding, it was recommended by others in the restaurant and so glad we tried it.  The Shish Kabab, Baba Ganoush, and Falaival were also great.  Very authentic, understand the owner is a Turk.  We'll be back.
Rating: 3.5 Stars
On the hunt for gyros, my friend found this North Beach corner store that used to house Iluna Basque.  Had the beef and lamb combo plate (
Wow.  So glad we stopped in before heading home up the hill.
This is second time here the food is always good love you guys by the way love the falafel best falafel !

Hm... When it first opened, I was ready to heap praises on this place. The first few grilled salmon and swordfish wraps I are were fresh and delicious. Alas, over the past few weeks, something has changed. The salmon is definitely not as fresh, and it is REALLY pink... Almost an unnatural color. I wonder if they switched to canned fish? I have no proof, and the people who run the place seem very nice, so I don't want to make empty accusations, but that is my suspicion.

As per usual, I ordered the food via Grubhub. I've been working on two papers and preparing for finals, so I'm not getting out much!! I ordered the spanakopita, the appetizer combo, the Mediterranean veggie wrap, and the lentil kofte. The food was okay. I'm really not that excited about it; I've had better and I've definitely had worse. For one, the spanakopita had a strong egg taste, which I did not like because I hate eggs. I have never had a spanakopita that tasted like that.

I got the lamb and beef gyro plate. It was pretty greasy and fatty and didn't taste that good. I would say this in the bottom 10% of all gyros I've ever had including street gyros from some questionable looking sources.
Awesome food!!! A hidden Mediterranean gem in North Beach- Kofte kabob is like homemade.  Turkish owner is so friendly.
I had the gyros platter and it was phenomenal. Great serving size and well worth the 13 bucks!

I'm very excited that North Beach Gyros is now open in North Beach! I walked over there today for lunch and the food is excellent. It is not too expensive and the views are great. I will definitely be a regular here.

We had a lamb beef gyro and a veggie gyro. Both were ok wraps. Dripping all over our hands and meat was really low quality. It had a after taste. I have had gyros before they are not as blend. If you like meat then go elsewhere. Try chicken gyro if you want to experiment.
Went to north beach gyros had a debate with my girlfriend over the pronunciation of gyros,she won,I paid:(

Beautiful restaurant, nice paint on walls by hand, open view, great service and food was very tasty, I ordered swordfish kebab plate and appetizer combo plate with pitta bread ( nice & warm). I recommend this place :)

I got some takeout here and was quite pleased! I ordered the salmon kebabs, which didn't actually come in kebab form but was excellently cooked with just enough buttery flavor -- not so much that I felt gross afterward. I had the salad on the side which was fresh and crisp. While I was waiting at the restaurant, the owner (?) was extremely kind, noticed I was cold, and offered hot coffee. he also included an order of their rice pudding, which I normally don't like, but was an excellent, lightly sweet way to finish off this meal.

Babaganush, Cacik, and Sautéed Eggplant were soooo delicious! Beef shish kebab plate was another great choice. Our friends got Mediterranean mixed grill plate, their plate was empty by the end, so I assume it was great.

Two percolating fountains house the fresh filtered water that sits next to a table of dozens of clean plastic reusable cups, which is somewhat odd to have in the front of this small restaurant space. The velocity at which the water is delivered into your cup is magnificent. The water pressure and temperature are equally refreshing and you are quickly back to your seat. The yogurt sauce is quality, falafels are too fried/hard, hummus is very good (but also very garlicky). Nice addition to the neighborhood. Food is good, not great... But adds a much needed alternative option to a pizza/pasta/bar food heavy neighborhood. The water situation at this restaurant is almost worthy of an additional star, it is absolutely glorious.
My favorite Café in San Francisco!
Great croissants / breakfast sandwich.  OJ is the best I have had in SF.  Service can be iffy, this isn't a place to be in a hurry.  Wife loves the breakfast sausage and said the coffee is decent.
Make it red.

I am always wary of Italian restaurants in North Beach. And since coming back from a trip to Venice and Rome recently, I was even more skeptical. My son and I came in here tonight because there were no barkers on the sidewalk and Yelp gave it four stars. This was pretty much the worst Italian food we have ever eaten. The minestrone soup was tasteless and beyond mushy. The salad had slightly wilted greens and sad yellowed tomatoes- and there are still bright red juicy tomatoes at the local farmers markets right now. We ordered a plate of cooked vegetables that were bland and had been perhaps frozen? The meat lasagne was soggy and had a slightly burned and almost tomato-less sauce. My son loves lasagne and has enjoyed lasagne everywhere- In Italy, at diners, frozen dinner lasagne and public school lunch lasagne. He could not eat this. My linguine with garlic, olive oil and red pepper was the only decent dish served, but the Parmesan cheese I had to ask for was a joke.
Enjoyed my delicious clam chowder soup & prosciutto sandwich with homemade bread. Also hot chocolate that was so yummy  also homemade. Will come back!!

My experience here yesterday was the worst in 25 years of going here. Rude service people served me a half espresso in a small cup, when I asked for lemon I got a wedge on old lemon. They told me they make cannolis with mozzarella and riccotta, I guess this is a tourist/central american cafe now?
I've eaten here for years and it's always been good, but today I don't know what's happened? Did they sell the place or what , because the service was not just terrible but almost non existent.
The service was really nice. We had the tortellini with Gorgonzola sauce and the antipasti salad for lunch. Perfect portions and absolutely delicious!
my favorite coffee in SF!  I've been coming here for years and I am never disappointed   grab a latte, sit outside, and enjoy a little north beach :)

Recent trip to SF with my Pops called for a Puccini visit-reprise! After hoofing it from the parking garage, my dad needed to use the restroom, I began to put down my things at the outside cafe table (it's a seat yourself place), my dad headed for the restroom. The lady snidely remarked how "the bathroom is  for customers only." I told her we were regulars and we're planning on having lunch. She smirked, almost chuckled and threw her hands up and said "I'm just letting you know you can't use the bathroom unless you order something." She was not even the owner, just a waitress. As if there isn't any competition in North Beach?! Plenty of other great places to eat! What a wench!

As a taxi driver in SF, I rely on Yelp to help me find good restaurants that are open late. I found this place on yelp that said they were open till midnight.  The reviews looked good so I found a parking spot, pulled over, and logged out of work. I was all excited to get some good food and I walked in the door at 11:05pm.  Or at least I tried to walk in.  There was a chair in the way that said they were closed.  I stood there and when I looked up at the staff, the guys kept just shaking their heads at me at the door. I said something about them being listed as open till midnight and they wouldn't even respond to me with words, they just kept shaking their heads "no".

Had breakfast here with my baby. Customer service was good. Food was good and food arrive fast. Quality was their for the price asking for. Good hot chocolate and coffee size. Overall had a good food and would come back here.
Great cannoli, made-to-order even though it was 10 pm in the evening! Cappuccino was good, as well. Highly recommended

As a North Beach local, Cafe Puccini has an awesome location on Columbus for ambiance, but its a sub par tourist food option in the neighborhood. Half the SFPD hangs out here on, so there must be something to love. But the few times I've been here, besides the Italian posters, you'd think you were eating at Denny's.

Been coming Cafe Puccini's for many years now and have always enjoyed their pasta, cappuccino's and desserts like the fruit torta's, tiramisu and biscotti and have always thought this place as a 3 1/2 - 4 star place, not anymore...

Walking up Columbus looking for an Italian dinner without a wait. Puccini had a table so in we went. Service was quick and friendly. We had the seafood linguine and the veal parmigiana, small salads to start. Food was very good and we had no room for dessert.
Been coming here since I was a kid and my family since it was open, great spot to grab a cappuccino and kick back too eat italin desert. Morning , noon or night
Been coming here since 1982 & I still love it.
Best place in North Beach. Authentic Italian food with a simple touch.  Amazing cafe as well.

my wife and I ate here a few months ago with some friends for the first time.  THE FOOD WAS FANTASTIC 5 STARS pizza, dessert's, pasta, chicken parm and etc.  I don't know what happened in the last few months but our meal was terrible.  the chicken parm tasted burnt, chewy and previously frozen.  our Caesar salad had a bunch of lettuce ends, tomato and artichokes.  the salad was not even tossed.  I don't know what happened but bring back the chef from that night and servers.  unsure  if we will return

There are so many different cafés in North Beach that it can be overwhelming to pick one worth your dollar. Well this little gem is definitely worth it! I ordered a classic chicken parmigiana but I actually only expected a mediocre meal. Turns out the food was DELICIOUS, even on a Monday night! It came with a fresh salad, penne pasta that was cooked just right, chicken was perfection, and the sauces were yummy. The ravioli was also excellent! Good portions. Service is okay; it could be better. I will come again!

Cafe Puccini is not a bad place to stop by for a plate of pasta or a couple drinks, beer is very reasonable and the wine is decent. Had a couple of pasta dishes that were good but not great. Not bad and the price is fairly cheap for north beach (entrees are mostly under $15, drinks are 4.50 to 6).

I came here with a friend and the service and ambiance is amazing! Came here around 10pm and wow they're Fettuccine Alfredo is the best I've tried anywhere. I got to share it with my friend. Their chai latte is amazing as well! I will  definitely be coming back here.
I got booted out based on a 60-min policy after buying food and drink. There are 10 open tables. This is especially lame for a self-proclaimed European-style cafe.

I am Italian and love this place! you might think that there are a lot of good Italian places in North beach, but that is not the case! However I would recommend caffe Puccini. I have tried their bfast, lunch and dinner, and they are all good. The coffee is really good, and strong-the Italian way, and the pasta is good and comes in big portions! plus, it's cheaper than all the other places around.. :) recommended!
So,

Rating on the vanilla chat only.  I really enjoyed it. Very tasty and light. The spiced chai was nice as well but the flavor of the vanilla was more to my liking and desirable.  The place is quiet and very relaxing if you are dining inside. People watching here is fun since it is on a busy street

I'm sitting in caffe as I write this. The food and service is excellent! Ordered cannoli, mocha, cappuccino, pasta, ravioli. Walter was our server and just 110% great! I would definitely come back! Thank you Caffe Puccini!
I feel like the reviews are fakes or I was or the twilight zone. I had a macchiato, and while the first sip tasted good, and the foam
If there were a negative star, I would give it to this place.
No better place to enjoy North beach on a hot night!!!  Also some of the best pizza in town!!!!
the restaurant is just okay. But, it was the only cafe opening when I arrived in that area. Great location and average price. The brunch is good and the server is fine...
Had a great egg, ham, and cheese on focaccia bread. Very delicious and hardly anyone here! New fav cafe!
Cute restaurant in little Italy. The food was great. We ordered the pappardelle, linguine fruti de mare, and pizza. Prices are good. Would come again.
Loved this place , Small and cute , salmon was delicious !!! And expresso is fabulous
Fettuccini Alfredo with pesto was delicious.  Great service.  Reasonable prices. Will definitely be back.

Planned to eat at Molinari's, but they're closed on Sunday.   Walked up and down Columbus reading menus and trying to choose a place for lunch.  Decided on Caffe Puccini, because they had a variety of sandwiches, as well as pasta.  Sandwiches were delicious with good meat.  When Graziano Lucchhesi, the owner, came to take our empty plates, we started chatting.  He works every day, makes everything from scratch, and takes pride in what he serves to his customers.  We're Italian too, so we talked about the way our parents and grandparents used to prepare food and how it's becoming a thing of the past.  This was our first visit, but he said he has regulars that come every day.  When we were there, an older woman was writing music, while she drank her coffee.  Bet there's a story there.  When she was finished, the waitress helped her into a cab.  That's something you don't see in the suburbs.  We will definitely be back.
I had spaghetti carbonara. Others had veal parmesan.

The lasagne was amazing; so fresh and not tomato-y. Just perfect!  We also had the chicken fettuccini and a chicken parm sandwich. Never heard of lettuce & tomato on a chicken parm, but that's ok; pulled it off and yum!  Moist and delicious.  And this place has the best Tiramisu ever. Nice guys, small place, good people watching, great value.

Overpriced, matron will blame you and her staff for mismanaged orders while offering no pathway to rectifying the situation. Miscommunications happen, but that is not the way to handle them. Will never stop here  again.

We were visiting from the East coast and Yelp brought us here. We showed up as soon as they opened at 5pm. We were fortunate because their Happy Hour specials were absolutely amazing. Usually happy hour menus are the offerings are the rolls you wouldn't really want to order, but do because they are so cheap with too much filler and not enough fish. That was NOT the case!  The selections on the whole menu were delicious and incredibly fresh!

I live in North Beach and am a bit of a regular at Katsu.  I am consistently pleased with the quality of the food, across the board.  Everything is expertly prepared with generous ratios of "fish to filler" (unlike many places that attempt to bring food costs down, such as Sushi Hunter just down the road).  The interior is not particularly fancy but is appropriate and quiet enough for good conversations.
Best sushi I've ever had. The temperature, texture, flavor, presentation, and service was amazing. Hiro, our server, was incredible!!

Coming here is like coming home and putting on your favorite robe.  The whole neighborhood goes here and even if you go alone, you often find interesting people to talk to.  When I'm working late, I have them deliver.  Katsu has outlasted every sushi place that comes up in North Beach because he serves the freshest fish at the best price.  He's also deeply knowledgeable about Japan, life, and San Francisco.  It's a cozy atmosphere.  If the TV show Cheers was a sushi bar, this would be it.
Arrived at 12:10

4 stars for dinner service. The sashimi and sushi is fresh, the rice in the nigiri perfectly seasoned. Non-sushi items worth checking out include the grilled Hama neck and Japanese curry rice. Fairly efficient service.

Very cute place.  Great service, very attentive and friendly.  Sushi was the best I've had in the city so far.  They had an item that I haven't been able to find elsewhere so was very happy to see that.  Will definitely go back.

Totally stumbled on this place by accident, and it remains in the top three sushi places I've ever been to. Totally cute, unassuming and fairly priced, service was quick, sushi was good and the atmosphere was charming. I will go out of my way to eat here again.

The worst service I received in weeks. At the time, it wasn't particularly busy yet no one came to take the order for 25 minutes. 25 minutes. If not half an hour I spend walking there I would probably leave.
This spot has delicious and fresh fresh sushi. Stopped in here while strolling the neighborhood and it was such a treat

Great sushi place close to little Italy, I love to come here before going to Cobb's for a comedy show. Make sure to start off with the spicy edamame, they have it for about $3 on the afternoon special menu that you can order from until 7pm. Tried the dragon roll, smoked salmon roll, and California roll. No complaints, really good. Server was very nice and accommodating!

I love this place. The fish is always fresh, the chefs and servers are nice and there's rarely a wait (and if there is, it's short). If you're looking for something fancy or you like super creative rolls then this is not your place, but if you're looking for comfortable atmosphere and solid fish I would definitely recommend stopping by!
Sashami = The Best! I don't think I need to say more. Excellent job!

The first time I visited I really liked this place.  Second time not so much.  The chef didn't seem to care a lot about making the sushi.  The nigiri were shabbily made, rice started falling apart as soon as you pick it up, fish cut up in random shapes and not very fresh, hastily put together.  Staff are very nice but there are just much better places to go to.
Delicious! The sushis are very fresh, which is critically important for me.
Ehhh. Nothing special. Nice people though. The green tea was my favorite part of the meal. I guess the food wasn't as good as I'm used too. Great location from our flat on mason street.
Convenient and good sushi spot if you are looking for a sushi place in North Beach!

Vacationing from out of state and I've been obsessing about finding a good sashimi/sushi bar.  After looking at reviews we decided on North Beach and it was delicious.  Cute little place with a friendly and helpful staff.  My boyfriend had never had sashimi before and he was impressed and thought it was delicious!  I recommend the combination lunch and the seafood lunch.  The ikejime nigiri was delightful.  A lot of food for a fair price!

If you love sushi then this is the place to go.  It's small, it can get crowded but the sushi is first rate..  Sushi plate as selected by the chef was amazing..  12 pieces of the freshest nigiri sushi possible.  Yellow tail, salmon, butterfish.!!  And the uni.!! Wonderful.!!  Amazing texture with a sweet/salty taste the is hard to describe..  Friends had sashimi which was outstanding..  Other dining with us had a roll with amazing crab and avocado.  Service was excellent.  Very cordial, attentive but not overly so..  This is a sushi restaurant so be prepared for items to arrive as they are made not all at once. Some guest's meals will come sooner and others later.   All-in-all I have to say this is one of the best nigiri sushi places I've been.  I will be back for sure.!!
Been coming here for over 10 years. Good ole reliable Katsu and his sushi. Everything is great. I generally get the Hamachi Kama and poke with sake and a beer for Katsu.
Friendly service. I sat at the bar and chatted with a couple of folks from the neighborhood. The sushi is simple but excellent.
Best time I've had in this city!

Is my Japanese food fix in the neighborhood. Sashimi is fresh. Tempura is crispy and the batter is not thick. Fish collar is grilled perfectly, meaning not dried. They used to have Aji sashimi and u could fried the bone. However I think they took that off the menu. Wish they have more local Japanese food like fried soft shelled crabs but it's still a great jap restaurant in the neighborhood
Got takeout from here, and it was simply mediocre...

I went this restaurant with my family and their bible teacher, we order California Dinner , Seafood Dinner and Rice Cake, it was very good , and the Rice Cake Sushi w/ Spicy Tuna - $8.50  very fresh.California Dinner ( 15.95 ), Seafood Dinner( 16.95 )   both include miso soup, green salad, riceIt was kind of a weird experience.  Would definitely go back as the elements of the meal were good and fresh,

This spot is the spot. My reasoning is simple, see attached. If you are looking for blue fun the was murked literally moments ago - or - a restaurant with  some overly contemporary bull shit interior, this is not your spot.

Visiting San Francisco and the Marriott Fisherman's  wharf recommended the place.  So happy we came here !   Perfect spot to end our busy day of sightseeing . Great service , cozy place, not near the touristy sights but walking distance from our hotel.  The food was awesome ! Started with Unagi salad... So delicious !  Then had an array of sashimi . So fresh... Melted in my mouth .
You know you want nigiri. You came to San Francisco for the food, right? Of if you want the Kung Fu Dragon Spicy Hamachi Tempura Roll, this ain't the place.

Overall 4 stars - 5 stars for the service and 3 1/2 for the food.  The food was not bad but it wasn't stellar either - I'm not an expert, just an enthusiast for sashimi and the fish was fresh but the salmon somewhat fatty for my liking.

Had a three choice combination lunch on a Thursday around 12:30- the chef was a bit flustered due to some mishap with a massive takeout order that was returned. My order was placed juuust before the return kicked in and he cut off other patrons.  It was kind of a weird experience.  Would definitely go back as the elements of the meal were good and fresh, just a little jumbled due to his situation.
To the folks who gave this place a high review: you lied (or got paid to write a glowing yelp review).

This was our first dinner stop for this year's SF trip. We checked into our apartment in North Beach and headed on over as it was a short walk. Getting there pretty early for dinner (around 5pm), we were the only ones there at the time but we didn't let that stop us since reviews were decent and they had Happy Hour going.

No wait on a Wednesday night for 2. This place proves that San Francisco is definitely not a sushi town. If you've ever had good sushi before, then you know this place is mediocre. Haven't been anywhere else in the city but definitely not dying to go back here

This place is great for lunch. Their lunch specials are very affordable, $10 for a 2 piece lunch combo and just over $12 for a 3 piece special. However, you can't really get real sushi as a lunch combo which is why I gave it only 3 stars. It's more bento box style, but the spicy chicken is good and so is the veggie tempura.  Got a spicy dragon roll on the side which was great but over $10 for one roll is pretty over priced. I'd probably go back occasionally because it was good, just not the best sushi I've ever had
Great prices (especially happy hour), amazing service, and great rolls. They dont overdue their rolls with sauces; they keep them simple and classy.

Caught their happy hour by accident that was 5-7pm and ordered Cali, Mango, & Spicy Tuna rolls. They were all very delicious and fresh. Also ordered two carafes of hot saki. Got great service, but the best part was when they brought a 24$ bill !!! Seriously? I think me and my girlfriend will be back very soon, at that price maybe even again tomoro.
Great decor, great service, great food! Went here with a group of 7 on a Saturday night and we were seated very promptly. The servers were very friendly.

We ordered to-go sushi rolls from here(California real crab, Rainbow, Rock'n Roll and Spicy Tuna) California roll and Rainbow were both delicious, fresh and tightly rolled. The taste of Rock'n Roll was also very delicious. But Rock'n Roll and Spicy Tuna rolls were so loosely rolled that we had very hard time eating them :(

Katsu's Sushi on North Beach is very good.  His fish is fresh, food quality is overall great, and portions are generous.  My faves:  Hamachi Kama and Rice Cake Sushi (crispy sushi rice, avocado and spicy tuna)
One of my favorite Japanese restaurants in the city. The fish is always fresh and the staff is always friendly and knowledgeable.
Exquisite Italian food. I can't stress how difficult it is to find a gem like this. It's like I stepped right back into Rome.

Amarena is my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco. It's so cozy and romantic and the food is amazing. The cuisine is authentic northern Italian. The owner Paolo is very friendly and really cares about his customers. We celebrated here after our wedding and it was a perfect meal! The dishes are delicious. I especially like the butternut squash ravioli, the lamb with blueberry reduction, and the pappardelle with local wild boar. Also be sure to try the excellent tiramisu. All the pasta is made from scratch.
great lil italian place in russian hill.  great for a date night, quiet atmosphere
Best homemade pasta my boyfriend and I have had in SF. Cozy ambiance. The gnocchi rocked at $16.
Delicious from start to finish. Great taste for price point. Best Italian I've had in San Francisco. A must go. Dessert was also amazing.

Man. Went here the night I proposed to my girlfriend, and was taking a risk, because I've never been here before. I couldn't have picked a better spot. Perfect little romantic spot, and the BEST butternut squash Ravioli I have tried in SF, and the 2nd best pasta I've ever had. And server was on point.
I was very excited to eat here. I'd looked at the menu online and was pumped.
Classic example of overpriced uninteresting Italian. No real pepper on table, shit papery white bread, super greasy pasta dish, couldn't finish. Lacked freshness. Lacked authenticity.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while and when Elephant Sushi turned us away from dinner, we decided to give Amarena a try. The restaurant was pretty empty at 6pm on a Sunday so we had our pick of tables. We ordered the beef carpaccio and grilled veggie platters to start, both of which were good. Mains: my friend had the chicken, which he said was very tasty; another had the cheese gnocchi which they also said was well done; I had the boar ragu which I scarfed down because it was so tasty and flavorful. The pasta portions were neither small nor huge, and the price is in the mid-range for SF ($20 for the boar ragu). The only con- the table bread left something to be desired.

Had a great evening at Amarena. We had the carpaccio, the pappardelle with wild boar ragu, and one of the specials of the day. Everything tasted fresh and authentic. I love Italian food and Amarena did not dissapoint. The owner was also extremely nice to us. We had difficulty finding a parking spot anywhere near the restaurant so the owner let us park in front of his garage across the street!
What a cool little Milanese restaurant tucked on a quiet corner away from the bustle of Polk St. The service was friendly and attentive and the food delicious. I loved the decor and ambiance.

The food was great, the atmosphere was tight seating and the pricing was so-so. We had the heirloom salad, mussels/clams in wine sauce, boar pasta, veal, a bottle of wine and tiramisu.  The service was excellent.

I actually really enjoyed my experience at Amarena. It was a Saturday night, and I wanted to take my sister out for a birthday dinner. She felt like pasta, so we made early reservations for 6pm. When we arrived, the restaurant only had a few other patrons: an older couple that was probably in their 70s (early bird special anyone?) and a young family with a small child.
This is one of the cutest little authentic and affordable Italian spots we've been to in SF. Fantastic wine list, great menu choices and lovely atmosphere.
Just had dinner here and I was not too impressed. I think that the food is decent, but overpriced.

Really disappointing. I've lived in the neighborhood for 5 years and have only eaten here twice. The first time the food was fine and the service was bad. This last time the service was fine and the food was bad. With so many great Italian restaurants in the neighborhood (Pane e Vino, Contadina, all of North Beach), I'd skip this one.
The service and atmosphere alone may keep me coming back here :) Lovely, attentive waitstaff and cozy, intimate setting made for an enjoyable summer evening.

You definitely need a reservation here if you want to eat on a Friday night.  Luckily we had one but still waited 30 minutes.  Our waitress was great but some of the other service was a bit spotty, we had to ask twice to have our wine bottle brought from the bar to our table.  I will say they rectified each little hiccup to our satisfaction.
Went here on a weds night.

My favorite Italian restaurant in Nob Hill/Russian Hill. I always take my out of town friends/family here when they visit. The service is amazing and the food is delicious. It is reasonably priced and has a great atmosphere. Everything on the menu is so well done... The butternut squash raviolis are the best.

I've lived in this neighborhood for several years and never tried this place. The food was delicious... definitely 5 stars. But the service was randomly spotty. The hostess was great, the busboy was great, but the waitress was hit or miss. Making my overall rating 3.5 stars.

Not worth going to. Italian is so commonplace. Don't waste your money on this place. The environment is bland. We had leaves and flies falling on us all night. Nothing to write home about on the food.
Food was pretty good!

After waiting outside in the cold at the Nob hill cafe for 45 mins and seeing the hostess seated smaller groups who came after us , we were so upset that we left.  That was a bad recommendation from Fairmont hotel.  Walked back to hotel and they recommended another Italian restaurant on Larkins.  This restaurant had no wait at 9:05pm and the pasta are so delicious that three of us finished our plates.  This is an awesome Italian restaurant with reasonable prices of food.  You will not be disappointed .
Food and sangria were delicious!!! Good service. Only silly thing is they make you pronounce the name of the dish properly in Italian when you order. Definitely will be back.
Cosy, little italian restaurant with friendly staff. Pretty good red wines and the lasagna was also a winner.

Solid neighborhood Italian restaurant. I ordered the Lasagna and it was cooked to perfection. We also had tomato, cucumber and onion salad that was fresh and spiced just right. We also ordered the ravioli with butter sauce and they were just the right amount of rich, and the pasta was cooked perfectly. Nice restaurant and very good service.

Found this cute little Italian restaurant on a Sunday evening after walking up from the wharf. They let us come in a few minutes before opening so we could rest our weary feet. We ordered a bottle of white wine to start us off, and then had two of the salads. The beet salad was a tasty combination of sweet and savory. The bread that started off the meal was a hit with my mom who worked in a bakery for a few years.
Neighborhood secret with some of the best pasta around... Gnocchi and Butternut Squash Ravioli keep us coming back... And the waitstaff are so attentive and often hilariously friendly.
Butternut Squash ravioli was fantastic! Not an overly sweet dish like so many other Italian restaurants usually make it. It was fresh and savory and awesome with white wine on a summer night :-)

Worse italian in Russian Hill.  Italian is the easiest cuisine in the world to prepare, however this place still hasn't got it right.  Its amazing that even in SF crappy restaurants some how manage to survive.
Cozy little neighborhood joint that knows its way around the Boot.

Great food, even better service.  This is the best kind of neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Close quarters, yet still feeling private, relaxed and intimate.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and the servers are very friendly.
Awkward service.  Mediocre food.  Great ceilings and ambience.  Good location.  Hey they have a coat rack.
Got a bottle of barbarello wine, so good! And the pasta with boar meat was amazing. The dessert was not so great. They said the ice cream was gelato, when it was obviously just a scoop of Dreyers.

Came here on Thursday for date night and had a great time. The waitress was funny and super helpful in ordering food and wine! The boar pasta and seafood linguine were outstanding along with the spicy cucumber salad. You can't go wrong! Finish your meal with a nice cup of cappuccino!
Amazing food and hospitable service. The atmosphere is quiet and calm and would be great for dinner w Friends, family, or a date night.
There is only one word to describe this place: FANTASTICO! What a wonderful restaurant. I have been here many times yet am positively surprised over and over again.
Let me start by saying this was the perfect meal. There were 3 of us. We had:

First the food was not bad.  However, we had reservations here for Valentine's Dinner.  We had looked over the menu and felt good about this place.  Wasn't cheap, but wasn't $$$$$ either.  WELL, we feel ripped off like the other couples sitting near us.  First, NO MENU for this evening.  You had a choice of Steak, Fish or Vegetarian.  They did not show the price for dinner on the menu they gave us - or as a matter of fact - gave anyone else.  It included the appetizer, main course & dessert.  When we got the check we almost fainted.  The bill was for $85 per person + $3 for a can of Coke.  The service was not great.  They did give a long stem rose to each couple.  But, a $200 dinner where the food was not hot, we were hungry when we left, and we had not cocktails or wine.  This was a definite case of BAIT & SWITCH.  Even when we left we looked at the menu outside and nothing about the $85 per person for not great food.  If the meal was fabulous, then maybe, but it was slightly adequate.  IN GOOD FAITH, I CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT OR IT'S STAFF!  I feel completely ripped off and I'm hungry and it hasn't been an hour since the meal.  Very disappointing!
So delish! They are very friendly here with seating upstairs and a clean restroom.  I had their fried chicken and mashed potatoes and gravy and it totally tasted tantalizingly homemade!

Uh oh, not so good on the second or third round. Hours are hit and miss and so is the chicken, bone dry and overly salty.  I had such high hopes for you all.  Was there a change in ownership?  Definitely a change in the quality.  Please bring back that fresh and  tasty that I had back in May.
The drum stick was juicy and good.
IT'S ALL ABOUT THE DRUMSTICKS

Its been a few months since this place has opened and they have done nothing but better things. They keep it simple but they are starting to have what seems like daily specials and new daily deals. Not only is North Beach one Pisto's Tacos, HRD Smokin' Grill and now another simply easily, tasteful and hopefully long lasting places in the neighborhood. I wish them the best and who ever said that the girl that works there is gorgeous is 100% right. She might make the food taste better.
One of the best fried chicken places in San Francisco. You have to try it if you love chicken. Hands-down I rate this place a five star.

It's a great location with an upstairs seating area for watching the world go by; the fried chicken is huge, very juicy, never ever dry, has the perfect crunchy coating and a bright, peppery taste; the gravy is deliciously fatty and thick; the mashed potatoes are well seasoned and have the potato skin; as of 10/5/14, the prices have dropped a little, so it's an even better deal. It's pretty good southern fare for a San Francisco restaurant!
Owner - you should not have put in the heat lamp. I'd rather get it normal from a mysterious drawer.
I absolutely love fried chicken, so I really wanted to like this place.  We got thighs and drumsticks (after all, dark meat is always superior to white meat).

Who doesn't love fried chicken? I ordered a chicken drumstick for $1.50 and I was surprised by how huge it was! It was definitely much larger than your typical drumsticks from other fast food restaurants. The drumstick was very crispy,juicy, and hearty. I also order a small corn on the cob for $2, which also very big, tasty, and buttery! An upstairs dining room provides plentiful seating with a scenic view of Columbus Avenue. The food was delicious, service very friendly, interior clean, and the prices were an excellent value. Kudos to San Francisco Fried Chicken Co. for your awesome business in the North Beach neighborhood. I look forward to trying more of your excellent cuisine in the future!
Found my new favorite late night stop.  Delicious, affordable, open late, and takes card.  So glad it's nearby.

YUM YUM YUM! And that's what I have to say about their mashed potatoes and gravy, as I'm sure you've read already. I could definitely say more, like how I would come back just for that, or like how I already have, but that's okay. You get the point, right? It's bomb!
I bring all the asians to this fried chicken place. only place to get some good mash potatoes around here.

The food here blew my mind!! Chicken was juicy, tender, and crazy flavorful. Gravy was out of this world. Mashed potatoes were perfect and the green beans were delicious. It was so good, I took five more drumsticks to go for my roommates!! And they are open late?? I'll be back, no question.

Needed a new place to eat around here, being as I've worked around here for 3 years and the new edition of fried chicken in an Italian neighborhood, is pure genius. The mash potatoes are the best and if your order to go they butter and salt your corn for you. Better then any KFC I've been to and it's all made fresh everyday! They have free wifi and upstairs seating area where you can sit and people watch! The music is great and the vibe is so mellow! I can't wait to come back
Low prices. Good portions. Good flavor. They've already played two of my favorite songs. Love love the mashed potatoes, and its one of my favorite foods. So glad i found this place!!
OMG - simply go here now - while I have yet to try to really do the "fried chicken circuit", this surprise in North Beach has inspired me to start to do that funky chicken walk...
We tried today and their chicken are big and not fatty.  Fresh and juicy.  Nice staff.  Super yummy.  Also love their cole slaw and green beans.  I will always go back!
This chicken is bonkers. It's really great. And the mashed potatoes can hold their own, too. This place is a new favorite.
I grabbed my coworker from Tennessee to visit this joint.  I mean, he's a fried chicken expert by birth, right?

Came here on a Tuesday afternoon and had their daily special which was 4 wings for the price of 3. Was skeptical as I am of fried chicken places that aren't in the hood but it was delicious. The chicken was nice and juicy and it was nice and simple. The staff was very friendly. The upstairs seating has a beautiful quiet view of the street below. Definitely worth checking out.
Got a thigh and some coleslaw, and had a good meal.

Coming from the south, I'm always in search of great fried chicken (at least subconsciously). Their fried chicken is really plump, flavorful and not too greasy. Huge fan of the mashed potatoes which are incredibly delicious. Also, really love that they sell you fried chicken by the wing/drumstick/thigh/etc as it makes it really easy to grab a bite on the go. Highly recommend!

Chicken was yum as well as the mashed potatoes and gravy. Didn't care for the cole slaw. Service was friendly. Chicken are sold individually, ranging from $2 for wings and drumsticks to $6 for chicken breasts. Wish they had family meals.
Really good chicken, not sure what the angry reviews were talking about.. So it's not cooked to order, but they make it right here so if you catch them at the right time, it is!!
Stumbled on this place and it looked promising so I stepped in: good decision.
Dry. Old. Cold. Soggy.
My heart dropped when I saw the guy reach under the counter for my fried chicken. No, there was no secret fryer under the counter.. It was just pre fried chicken.
This place gets a 3.5. It's good fried chicken - moist, tasty breading, etc. but I have a few gripes about this place:
I really love this place fried chicken is awesome. It reminds me of the Memphis. You must try the mashed potatoes and gravy.

So. The sides are pretty good: I had the beans, which were very nice, and the mashed potatoes were nice as well. The chicken itself (I had a thigh) was not bad, and I didn't mind it not being crunchy as others have lamented here. My big issue with it is that it was room temperature when it was pulled out of the warmer for me. Also, it was a bit on the salty side, as others have also mentioned. A nice hot piece of chicken would've been nice--maybe they'll figure that out in the future.

Whoa, I would not be surprised if my blood-pressure went sky high after eating at this place.  Many of their food items are extremely salty, almost to the point of being inedible.  The prices for the chicken are by the piece ($2.00 to $6.00) - wings being the cheapest and breast pieces, the most expensive.  Not worth the price, considering you can get a whole, cooked rotisserie chicken for $5 at some places, for example.  I'm not one to waste food, especially after over-paying for it, so I will have to re-purpose the chicken I got and incorporate it into another dish (maybe make chicken salad or chicken soup out of it).
Had to write this after our boss ordered from here for a loooong work weekend.  I had to go visit and check it out myself because the food is just that good!  So here's the scoop:

Last Monday, my wife and I were hanging out in NB and my wife said, she wanted to try this place. If you know my wife, you don't ever talk her out of eating fried chicken. She is a fried chicken connoisseur. So, we go in and my wife orders a thigh and drumstick. She starts eating her first piece and looks happy. As she starts on her 2nd piece, she whispers to me that its not very hot, but she finishes it. When we leave, she starts to tell the cashier, you know the seasoning of the chicken is really good, BUT (now, I knew this is where I should of pulled her out the door) it was COLD. She proceeded to explain that the chicken was like being at a picnic where the chicken just sits around all day at room temperature. I think instead my wife giving her opinon, she should have asked? Where was the chicken fried - at someone's house? because litterally when your handing the money with your right hand - they are handing you the chicken in your left hand. My wife's advice - don't eat here unless you like room temperature fried chicken!!!
Best fried chicken in all of SF!! No lie.

Been said to find what you do real well and do that. SFFCCo has done just that and in North Beach to  boot!!! Nothing but a pile of bones left on my plate. Potatos and green beans were great sides ... I'm a cream gravy skillet scraper kind of guy but was not disappointed in the gravy either ... Hope they find a spicy chicken version to add to the menu ....  Nice nice people from top to bottom, great service ....
I love fried chicken and have have it at any opportunity.
This is one of the places that I really wanted to like.  It's a small shop in sf that isn't a chain and serves a simple menu.  Unfortunately, it is just meet my standards for fried chicken.
Not bad.
The chicken pieces are really big and meaty.  Unfortunately, that's best part.
As far as sandwiches go, I have to say this place is pretty bomb.
Eating sandwiches from here makes my pants tighter, in more ways than one. Closest thing to a Publix sandwich in San Francisco.

The Molinari Special was probably one of the best Italian meat sandwiches that I've ever had in my life!  The two Lyft rides that I used to get here from SOMA was well worth the trip.  Inside, the place is an old school deli with a large long counter with a huge glass display of all the meats on offer.  They  have the number dispenser thing near the front so make sure to grab one before ordering.  The sandwich list is listed above the case and make sure to grab your bread from the sealed bread case, I got dutch crunch for me.

I have been several times and each time this place is great. Great food, Great people, and the prices are reasonable. Go early and make sure you make the best choice on your sandwich the choices are many and the combinations are vast. The good thing is that you cant go wrong with any of them. Some of the fun is watching the newbies navigate the Number grabbing and bread selecting process. Hands down the best deli in North Beach.
best Italian sandwich in the city
Wow. The north beach sandwich is amazing. On par with little Lucca and Ike's, although the dutch crunch was a bit harder than I expected it to be.
love love love love love!!!
Classic Italian deli. Fresh meats and cheese, good bread (picked yourself from a wooden box), fast service, and a tempting wall of Italian wines.  Nothing fancy, thank goodness.

Absolutely delicious sandwiches. The guys here have the best ingredients and are pumping them out all day. Interesting how they have you choose your own bread but it really makes for a great experience when you walk in and it's a little busy. Grab your ticket and peruse the shops a little. Check out the cheese and grab yourself a drink. Everything is good so just go for it.

We stopped by here on the way home and got some sandwiches to go. Great sandwiches, fresh cheeses and deli meats. There was a small wait but the service is friendly and helps with selections. The roma tomato and fresh mozarella sandwich was awesome! You can eat outside the Deli or take it to go. This is the best deli in San Francisco.

This place is delicious, but can be confusing. We did not realize until a person waiting explained to us we need to grab a number and a roll of bread from the bread bin. The food is amazing each sandwich is sliced per order, tons of antipasto to choose from, and there are some many of bottle of wines. I went with one of the Moscotos from Italy. I can definitely see this place has be around as long as it has.

We trusted our Yelp friends and they were right!  Showed up early for lunch, picked out our bread and got two italian special sandwiches.  Delish!  Really great sandwiches.  We would definitely go back again.  Nothing better than a good italian deli sandwich.  YUM.
I don't eat beef and pork, but the sandwiches here are still amazing.
Well, the Yelpers have done it again. I was searching for a great sandwich last week in SF and this came up with really good solid tips and reviews. So, off i went.
If you love a great sandwich...this is the place for you.

The sandwiches are very good, but what truly earns this place 5 stars is the Italian market within. It reminds me of the great Italian specialty stores of the east coast. While the sandwich is not the best in the city in my opinion, the availability of Italian specialty foods is! A must visit for any SF resident or visitor!

Hands down one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. When you first walk in, there's a bunch of meats hanging and all different types of meats and cheeses in their fridge. You pick a number, go to the back and pick a bread. They're pre sliced for the sandwich and the breads are fresh. You wait until they call your number and pick the type of sandwich you want.
The quintessential old school, family, Italian delicatessen.  A North Beach institution & tradition.
This is a divey, (somewhat) dusty little deli that just happens to have awesome produce and sandwiches... it's a must if you're in the North Beach area!
Five stars from me! If you've got a little bit of extra time to wait in line on a Saturday (they close at 6 pm on weekdays), Molinari is a little slice of heaven.

Renzo special on Foccacia. A good sandwich. Perhaps I was expecting a bit more considering how much talk there's been about it, but solid regardless. A couple of funny dudes in there, fu*king with all the clueless euro tourists.
Amazing sandwich. Prosciutto to die for.

This review is long overdue as I've been getting sandwiches here forever. The best lunchtime sandwich for my money in San Francisco any day. This is an old school joint, beloved by many and a San Francisco institution. When I don't have to take clients to a fancier establishment for lunch I always stop by here. Sometimes you just need a good sandwich for lunch instead and this place never disappoints. Anything on the menu is great, but I always get the Luciano special. Hot panini with sundries tomatoes, prosciutto, cheese, lettuce. Perfection on focaccia.
Most amazing sandwich I've ever had! Freshly cut rare roast beef, first place I stop everytime I come to SanFran!

Fantastic fresh pasta made on Fridays.  If you call Vince ahead of time, he'll set some aside for you, as they run out.  Slice spicy sausage into their homemade meat sauce, and this dinner is so easy and a home run every time!  Love this place.
Hands down, best deli in the city. Classic Italian is always my go-to. There is almost always a line, but is it ALWAYS worth it.

These people have no respect nor knowledge of sanitary rules. They grab the salami or whatever with NO glove NO tongs, they slam the slice  in your sandwich and then with the SAME hand they grab the money and on they go to the next one...
Came here last Monday, and really enjoyed it.  Needed a place to grab a late lunch after going up Coit Tower, and a sandwich sounded like just about the best thing ever.

My friends and I came to Molinari's for some good old fashioned sandwiches.  They have a variety of meats and cheeses to choose from, while also offering some side dishes.  The interesting thing about this place is that you literally choose your own bread.  You go to the box with all the bread rolls, pick the one you want, and hand it to the guy to make your sandwich.  The South Beach and Molinari's sandwiches were good and hearty, but we all agreed that the bread itself was stiff and a little stale.

There are some things in San Francisco that are unique.  Molinari Deli is one of those places. The signature Charcuterie is one of the best in the country and rivals that from Italy. The little Italian deli cranks out fantastic sandwiches, like the Renzo Special. Fresh ingredients, and quick service make this a classic. Get a soda and take your Food up to Columbus square to.eat or take it for later like we did.

These people are terrible at returning phone calls and Joe is a two faced typical 3rd generation wannabe!  He lacks respect, and would be nothing more than a shoe shine boy in Chinatown if it weren't for his mommy and daddy giving him the place!  In another 15 years, it will be a another Chinese dump anyway!

Came here on a food tour. It was one of our stops and I am sure glad it was. I went back to purchase a pound of perfectly sliced and flavored salami! Get a number as soon as you walk in, grab some bread and pick your sandwich! Great food, great service.

My favorite deli by far! They have the best sandwiches here. They work with a local baker so the bread is brought in fresh everyday and you go choose your roll and give it to them and they make you the sandwich or your choice. I have had both the south beach and north beach sandwiches and they are both so good ! Try to come before he lunch hour craze because it gets crowded.

This is what a deli is supposed to be. When you walk in you feel like you stepped into a little deli in Rome or something. It's such a cool place. They have a huge display of fresh meats and cheeses and you can kind of scope out what's going to go into your sandwich before you order.

Very tasty. DUH. Just go try it out already. Don't forget your bun. Mozarella is unsalted for all the salt fiends out there; if you so choose that option. Take your salt. But what fresh mozarella isss salted? I should've known. Very good sandwich.

the sandwiches are ok less meat than I would like. so I suggest buy the meat and chesse and bread  separate and throw it together yourself . it would cost about the same but a lot more meat and chesse..

It's a good Italian deli but seems more like a place to go because it's a landmark.  The premium Italian cold cuts are really good,  no doubt about it. The bread leaves a bit to be desired unless you happen to literally get a fresh batch. The wait is nuts at lunch... Even on a Saturday afternoon, I waited 30 minutes from door to sandwich.  There are numerous places equal or considerably better in New York City.  But this is San Francisco. I would come back if seeking a good deli sandwich but would not go out of my way. I am being somewhat generous with four stars.  But the staff is friendly and they also have great sides.  For sandwiches,  the North Beach Special and Sausage Sandwich are great.

Dont get me wrong! The sandwiches are deliciously fresh and tasty.  However I do not like that people get their own rolls in the case.  Doesn't seem the most hygenic to me.  And when I was there yesterday I noticed that after ringing someone up and touching the money, the worker simply then used hand sanitizer gel instead of washing properly with soap and water before making the next sandwich.  Also, when I bit down, there was a hard pebble of a sort in the sandwich, and it hurt like hell.  Coincidentally, I see the health department score of 72 on their yelp site... YIKES!! Given that, I won't be back.

It was nearly empty when we walked in at 10 am on a Thursday morning, which is the way I like it. We got enough for a picnic - typical antipasto - mushrooms, artichokes, sun dried tomatoes, mozzarella balls, seafood salad, olives, cheeses. Their olives were delicious and the cheeses were excellent - great variety. The seafood salad, not so much. I had high hopes for it, but the marinade was sour and offputting. We ended up throwing it out, which was a shame.
Don't know how I haven't written a review for this place yet...
Happy days indeed. I feel likeI'm sitting at a café in Paris by the bay. Delicious! best in the wharf
Came here because I saw the good reviews and sure enough I had a great experience. Food was great, service was great, price was right. I would go back again.

Lots of choices even for the pickiest of eaters. They have the basic eggs and bacon kinda meals to dishes that you wouldn't find at your local Ihop or Denny's like the Dungeness Crab Benedict. Ordered it and loved it. Our server was great and the food was delicious. Will be back next trip to SF!
Where's Chachie? I looked and looked, but saw no sign of him or any Happy Days theme. There's nothing in the decor; there's not even a jukebox.
What a find !
Made reservation. Was told there were no tables and had to wait 10 mins. Fine. Then a walk in comes and is seated before us! Very unorganized. Food is ok, nothing special.
Very nice people.  Breakfast was delicious! Walking distance from Marriott.  Will go again when I'm back in town.

I had a great experience here.  They do not have zoned serving areas so all of the waitstaff was attentive.  We went midweek later in the morning so there wasn't a full restaurant. While we were looking over the menu different servers visited us three times to see if we were ready.  During the meal we got checked on a couple times.

Great breakfast place near the Wharf. Decor isn't much but the food makes up for it. Omelets and coffee were delicious. Workers were super friendly and always kept my coffee cup full. I didn't have to ever ask for anything.

Great place down by the wharf with outdoor seating.  The food is good and hearty, and the service was friendly and good as well!  We had the veggie breakfast burrito and it came with green salsa, pico de gallo and sour cream, very good and filling!

We came to San Francisco for the weekend and had some terrible luck with restaurants since we got here. We stumbled upon this place, and thank god was did!! Everything was absolutely amazing!
