The french toast was perfect cooked and my boyfriends strawberry Belgian waffle was beyond beautiful and delicious. If you are ever in the area looking for a breakfast spot, this is the place to come! Not a long wait at all

Nice little diner just off the noisy main streets. Wonderful omelettes, good coffee, friendly staff.  One staffer  chased us down for a block after my husband forgot his cell phone. Can't beat it anywhere!
Nice cozy brekky place.  Great service with a smile!  Flavors are on point - eggs were stellar.

Expensive for what it was. Tiny coffees for $3. Mediocre hashbrowns. And my English muffin came out a good 10 minutes before the meal so it was cold by the time I ate it. So not worth $40 for two ppl. My boyfriend on the other hand liked the place.
Great service, friendly staff, yummy food! We came here on a Saturday and I was expecting our food to take forever but it came out quickly! Would definitely come back if I lived in the area.

Really good breakfast and very fast service! The owner is very nice and very helpful, and everyone is nice. The owner even came out and moved an umbrella to give us some shade. It was a great place and great atmosphere!
We typically come here every time we are in San Francisco. Small place, great food. I highly recommend the smoked salmon eggs Benedict. Delish!
Good basic diner food. Great menu bc lotsa options.

This place has the best breakfast in San Francisco! The food is fresh, good presentation. The place is clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We will definitely be coming back next time we are in San Francisco!
Such a great find while visiting SF. Attentive and friendly service. My coffee cup was never empty, and one of the best breakfast burritos ever.
Good food is not normally enough for me to want to review but the OUTSTANDING service and welcoming atmosphere makes this place great. So happy to visit this spot!

You've taken the Cable Car to the wharf and now you need breakfast.  Look no further.  No frills American style breakfast with a friendly staff.  Eggs, hash browns, pancakes, breakfast burrito, or anything else one would expect at a diner.
We have eaten here every day we have been in San Francisco. Everything on the menu is delicious! A great outside dining experience. Fabulous staff, they all are very attentive and personable.

Family of 4, one in a wheelchair.  Very hospitable.  Servers friendly and quick.  Breakfast meal was just right.  Well prepared with generous portions with everything ordered.  Coffee was good.  Couldn't find Joanie, Staff apologized.

2nd time back here for breakfast. Conveniently located across courtyard fishermen wharf. Quiet and the coffee is good. Looks like a local favorite. Familiar customers talking shop with staff. Nice place. Portions are large. Prices are comparable to places like Sears fine food on Powell. Photos everywhere of their dishes for tourists. Had the sausage egg and cheese bagel with hash browns. Love how they cook the hash browns, making it thin and crispy.
Skip the line at Hollywood Cafe, come to Joanie's. Great, fresh food. Friendly service. Two thumbs up.
I've been coming here for a couple of years now and it is still amazing - Joanie and her team continues with top-notch service and amazing food!
Where to begin..
This diner is located in a great area close to Ghirardelli Square, so makes a good place to start your day if you're out walking about.

Every time I come to this place, they always welcome me! The service is excellent and they make the food perfect every time I go. I had the chocolate waffles to go and when I opened it, I was surprised how great it was and I couldn't finish it but I wish I could have
Love it here. This is my place for breakfast when I'm here. Great service and great food!

My experience was not a pleasant one, the food was not good... burger came and the bun was soaked and I couldn't hold it in my hands, hash browns was thin, and tasteless ... I'd not come back... Disappointed

I had a Bacon omelet with American cheese. It had a slightly unusual flavor which I couldn't identify. My wife thought it had a slightly chemical taste, but I felt it may have been from the bacon flavoring... whatever it was it wasn't very good. The Hash browns were good. Blueberry pancakes very good. They used plenty of blueberries which was nice.  On the down side, they only provided a little pitcher of syrup.  They readily brought more upon request but why they thought that an ounce of syrup was enough for a full stack of pancakes, I can't imagine. The biggest problem was the toast. It was cold. I am not talking just slightly warm...I mean it was downright cold, so much so that the butter would not melt!  I suspect that they simply timed it wrong and let it sit for way too long.  Anyway, think this place has potential.  It was nice inside and the staff was very friendly. They just have some work to do.

Don't let the name fool you.  This isn't a tourist place.  This is a great, neighborhood diner focused on diner foods with huge portions!   Near many of the hotels in the "Pier 39" area, worth the short walk.  The staff were extremely friendly and the food was very good.  The breakfast was large enough we weren't hungry until dinner that evening.
The service here was good, the people were very nice and the food arrived quickly. And the coffee wasn't bad either.

My husband and I shared a Ham and Spinach omelette.  We chose the hash browns.  Everything was cooked "just ok" but the flavor was "just like Denny's".   Based upon the high ratings, we were expecting so much more.  Perhaps we just ordered the wrong thing, but when we compare the omelette and hash browns to our favorite "Los Gatos Cafe", it's would be like comparing Spam to Kobe Beef.

Food is amazing! Had breakfast here and you can not go wrong. Held us over until dinner but funny thing is we didn't feel grossly full just ate good food that was able to keep us full! Definitely recommend!

This place had friendly staff.  It seems to be a little family place.  It was packed the entire time we were there.  My husband had a Spanish omelette and enjoyed it.  I had eggs Benedict and thought it was decent... Not wonderful and not bad.  My English muffins were a little tough to cut through, but the meal tasted fine. My potatoes seemed salty but I don't eat a lot of salt to begin with, so it's possible it was just more my taste buds.  My husband said his potatoes were fine and didn't seem too salty.  They kept our coffee and water full and even offered my husband the staff's flavored creamer when he asked if they had any.  It was a good place to decompress and grab a quick meal after traveling all day.
My wife and I had a great breakfast here. The staff was super nice and really accommodating with our food order. The portions were huge and were done really well.

If you're a true foodie this place is NOT for you. We came looking for a good breakfast and decided to give this place a try even though it was in Fisherman's Wharf. Sizes we're huge but quality is poor and there is way better breakfast places a mile closer the city. The crab meat tasted canned and the crappy coffee was $3! Take the walk and try something like Mamas in Little Italy!
Great place to have a cappuccino and watch the world go by. Try their cheesecake and gelato too; makes for the perfect coffee break!
Went there for dessert and coffees.  Great capoucino's and homemade tiramisu was good but I think mine is better. Great place to have some espresso and chill.
We had breakfast here, and were able to sit outside right by the street. The scrambled eggs and ham bagel was delicious, and hubby loved the ham, cheese and poached eggs on a muffin.
Very cute Italian cafe that's perfect for:
Pleasant morning stop for a latte and the best scones around. Genuinely nice guys behind the counter leave you with a smile.
Come for the coffee, stay for the dessert.
Nice cafe with inside and outside seating.

Living in the neighborhood, I tend to avoid Columbus, but Cafe Greco is one of my exceptions. This is my go-to for working remotely. Free WiFi, plenty of tables inside and out, friendly service, great espresso drinks, and a good food menu. The bagel with cream cheese and tomato is my favorite--they add olive oil & spices to the tomatoes first which makes it delicious! Great place for working, reading the paper, or people watching. They'd get five stars from me if they accepted credit cards.
Great place if you like choking on tobacco smoke--yuk. You should be able to pick up a case of lung cancer in one evening.

Great tiramisu avg cookies very busy and make sure to have cash. Good news is they do have an ATM if you need it. Good atmosphere lot of seating inside and out. Felt very disorganized to order and who to order with. Sometimes it was they guy bussing the tables and others it was the guy filling the orders. Very disjointed experience. Probably more like 3.5 stars. Cookies were dry but if you had coffee they were perfect more like biscotti. Want to come back and give them a shot at lunch rather than just deserts. Menu looked great

Came very late at night for a coffee chat and some dessert. Love how it was open on a weekend so late at night! Coffee was supposedly Illys which I love but I thought it tasted just ok. I had the cheesecake and was kind of disappointed by lack of flavor/how fluffy it tasted. Also tried the fruit tart and was very disappointed by how hard the crust was and how bland it was as well. Maybe it was because it was late at night but overall the cafe was messy and nobody bothered to clear the table/clean any of them so when we got there we had to wipe it down and bus it ourselves. Liked it because it was open late at night but wouldn't visit if I had another choice.

I walked in and it smelt like Europe. Absolutely wonderful coffees and delicious cannolis!! Loved the big windows and classical music. I wish I lived in San Francisco so I could become a regular. **They are cash only**

Was looking for a good panini in this area and ran upon this place, which had very high reviews. I have been to other similar establishments nearby, and am therefore comparing this panini to their next door competitors as well when scoring.
Great illy brand cappuccino. Ok Cannoli. But the service isn't as bad as people are saying. Maybe be nicer to them? Or be prettier? I don't know.
Still my favorite gather-your-thoughts, work-on-your-side-projects, catch-up-on-work spot in SF.
Good coffee. Straightforward service. Definitely recommend. Grabbed some coffee with a friend and sat out in front to people watch and catch up. Great place to hang out. Also has free WiFi.
Pros: This place has an awesome breakfast menu, so it's perfect for early work - eat and then focus on your laptop with the huge coffee beverage you chose from the looong list of options :)
The desserts are nothing to write home about, service is mediocre at best.  Tiramisu... Well, I've had better. If you have a favorite place to have dessert at, go there... If not... This might be ok.

Did you say illy? I was sold!! Their espresso here is just outstanding. Even my cappuccino was just out of this world. The guys who works here I think their "AiTalian?" Either way, my friends were frothing over them; especially the tall, dark and handsome one!! They should wear tighter pants, it might get them bigger tips!  Werk it ya know!!

I was led here by the reviews and I was really hoping for some great coffee but upon asking the guy what was the difference between a couple things on the menu he started joking with a couple of his coworkers. I ordered a cappuccino and got more of a latte even though I was trying to avoid all the milk. the coffee was ok and the outside atmosphere was probably the best part of my experience here.
Living in North Beach, a good double cappuccino at Caffe Greco sitting street side is one of my favorite past times. Sinfully delicious you'll never want to leave.

My fav cafe during my entire SF trip!!  The guys working there are so much fun, happy, friendly to all the customers in line!! Extremely accommodating, and quick!  Finding friendly service in this city was actually quite a challenge so these guys were very refreshing!! Cute little sidewalk cafe and the food was very good. A must stop if you need a friendly face during your trip!!!

I'm all about giving people the benefit of the doubt and avoiding bad reviews, but this place earned a solid one star for its horrible service. The barista said, "what do you want?" Made my drink, slammed it on the counter and threw a spoon at me. No exaggeration. Apparently this place is "too popular" to care about the everyday customers that keep them in business. Go to one of the other cafés in the area where you'll at least get a smile with your order - life's too short to deal with a-holes :)
I've been coming to Caffe Greco for the past 5-6 years and I can always count on a great cup of Illy's cappuccino!

My favorite place for relaxing on a weeknight evening for a warm drink and some people watching. While I do like the coffee, I usually order the hot steamed milk, sometimes with almond syrup. It makes me feel all cozy and comfy while we sit outside an watch the world go by. The staff is super friendly and very efficient. I like that you can also order wine and beer if you so desire.
Still good deserts but horrible, unfriendly service. Mean, never smiling, arrogant men. Still they don't even bother to give you change; they drop coins into the tips cup themselves.
It's been while since I've been here but nothing has changed. Still love their tiramisu and lattes. Awesome place to people watch too!

We love this place! The best latte I have ever had. And we love the egg sandwiches. We came here every morning of our vacation.....even though we had other breakfast spots picked out. Glad we went here first!

Caffe Greco was the perfect finish to a lazy Sunday. They have a pretty large indoor seating area as well as some tables outside. This cafe is unpretentious, down-to-earth, and offers a solid selection of sandwiches, desserts, and coffee. I would love to come here in the afternoon for a cappuccino and some people-watching.
Tiramisu! It melts in your mouth!

Walking all over North Beach, Chinatown, and Union Square. I'm tired and looking for a place to veg out and relax. So walking around Columbus and looking for a nice coffee shop then I come across Cafe Greco. I've been here before and had a seat inside. Atmosphere is okay inside and a little hot. So today we've decided to try the outside table. Outside seating are all two seat tables.

I was in  San Fran for a week and this was my spot, total European feel, and really the best cappuccino i've ever had. Just going there and enjoying a cafe on the street makes you feel like your in Paris or Rome!
best coffee hands down. expresso made to perfection.  I dont know what blend they use but its good.
Love love love this place. The customer service is exceptional. Every time I come to Caffe Greco I feel welcome. Great caffe latte, nice place to relax and enjoy.  My favorite caffe.

Our food was simple, fresh, and delicious. The prosciutto, mozzarella, and roast pepper panini was crispy but not tough and bursting with umami. The mixed greens were well-dressed in a tart vinaigrette, but those who like subtler flavors might want to ask for dressing on the side. The latte was foamy and delightful, a perfect start to an afternoon of walking the city.
First time here. The service was ok. I went here for dessert with a friend and got something called sacripantina cake. It was pretty good but I have nothing to compare it to.

This place has a nice feeling of a city cafe, unfortunately their cookies are so dry absolutely no taste to their desserts. The coffee was so so but people come here because they are open late. Italian caffe with horrible desserts. Buck up guys...

I don't believe in charging tax when it is cash only. I just don't agree with it. Also, I think I got ripped off. I don't know why two orders of coffee is supposed to be more than 10 dollars when on the menu it is supposed to be like 7 dollars...... :) I asked about the price but the cashier just looked at me and did not say anything.
Love this place. Great coffee, great food, great outdoor seating. This is my happy place.  The staff is wonderful as well and tend to remember you, even if you are not a consistent regular customer.

I really enjoy Caffe Greco! The fact that many locals keep coming in tells you something about an area that can get touristy. The customer service is always really friendly, there is ample seating inside and out (something you don't often find in North Beach) and the drinks and food are delicious! Makes me really miss living in Europe, because it does have that type of vibe.  The only reason they got 4 stars instead of 5 stars is that it's a bit on the pricey side.

Living in the Russian Hill neighborhood has its many perks and one of those is the ample selection of restaurants, cafés and lounges to choose from. Polkers Gourmet Burgers was recommended by many and so I decided to try it out for breakfast one day. The food ended up being beyond satisfying, the environment relaxed and the Sunday bottomless mimosas a delightful surprise.  It appears to be a busy popular place often with a line waiting out the door. But with specials every weekday, large portions of home cooked goodness and the World Series on their tv it makes for the perfect spot to hang out. Since then it has become a regular dine out spot. Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

Was I little early for an interview across the street so I decided to stop in for lunch. Great choice. Ordered the wild mushroom and Brie burger, it was great cooked exactly how I wanted and nice and juicy. Guess the only bad thing was salad a little over dressed,but other than that a great lunch.

Overpriced!!! I ordered the crab Benedict for $15.. My eggs were completely dry and cooked all the way through and the toast was completely burnt. My buddy had French toast and bacon; his bacon was barely cooked. Booooooooo

This place has the best French toast I have ever had in my whole friggen life. We also had the breakfast burrito and the eggs Benedict are both really good as well. But the neapolan French toast was to die for!!
Came here for Sunday brunch and really enjoyed it! We came around 11am and were seated immediately, although the place was full.
The food is ok, the service is sometimes ok, but slow.  The worst thing was that the coca-cola served to me in a glass, tasted like it had been washed with bleach.
This place pissed me off so bad... The food is decent American food but the server we had was infuriating.
Nothing incredibly amazing this place. Decent food with pretty average prices. Food is tasty and fresh, but nothing with that 'wow' factor.

Crispy chicken sandwich is incredible. Get it with curly fries on the side and drizzle ranch on top of everything. You will not be disappointed. Burgers are all good too. The cod dishes could use a bit more flavor.

Updated my review after the latest visit... the burgers have returned! After the remodel a year or so ago this place became all fou fou and got rid of the epic burger selection in place of small dishes at double the price. While the prices still aren't cheap, the burgers they had before have returned to the menu! Habañero burger, among others.

Love this neighborhood joint. For dinner, you don't have to wait very long- if at all. Brunch is a different story, expect a wait. The burgers are always delicious and juicy. One of my biggest pet peeves is ordering a "medium rare" burger at a restaurant and getting a "medium" burger instead because of either fear of serving meat on the rare side OR just a poor cook. No worries at polkers- burgers are aways juicy with the perfect amount of pink. Surprisingly good wine selection. Beer selection small, solid- don't expect to try anything new, expect your "go tos" on tap.
Ordered the all american burger with curly fries.  Clean place, friendly staff, didn't wait very long for food.  Simple and straightforward, I dig it!
Cute place, great brunch! But don't order a burger. Not sure why but burgers aren't their specialty! Salads are yummy also!
It's hard to get brunch on a weekday, but this place had it and it was pretty good and the portions were pretty hearty.
Great staff, friendly service and a good basic American style dinner.  I go here regularly and the food is consistently good.

Having gone here over on and off over the course of 20 years, I was excited when the place changed menus. However after going here a several times since, each time the food has gotten more and more surprisingly blase.

Me and my friend were walking by today and decide to try this place. It was nice and not too busy. Food was pretty good, I got their spicy Habanero Burger, medium rare. It was a good one, pretty spicy, juicy and yumm. Curly fries and onion rings were good too, love the ranch dressing, my friend got their Bacon & Blue Burger, this one was good too. Only thing I didn't like about this place, their glasses smell pretty weird, water has a taste of some chemicals, I don't know what was that but it didn't taste good. Also, if you want to have a quick lunch break, this is not the place. They take pretty long to take your order.
I don't know what my deal is but I can't get a good meal here. Friendly service, yes. Good meal, no. I've eaten here a handful of times and each visit I hoped my pov would change. Not today.
So.. I know alot of people like this place. And I'm always up to go here for brunch. Standard eggs, pancakes and brunch food.

Was walking down Polk and my friend suggested to head in for brunch. I've never been so figured why not give it a try. Sat down and was pleasantly surprise by the old dinner vibe. Secondly, it was great to see that they have bottomless mimosas. They make the mimosas really well. Perfect combo of champaign and OJ.
This place is filthy. They have consistently had a very low health score. Currently it is 79 out of 100.  Eat at your own risk!

This restaurant is adorable, and has fast service and kind people. My mom and I were exhausted after a long day of driving to get to San Francisco. When we arrived, we faced a Nasty hotel concierge who couldn't even give us a nice place to eat. We ended up wandering around the neighborhood and stumbled on this restaurant. It was great. So many menu options and a "diner feel", clean environment. Would definitely go back-- and they serve breakfast until 3pm! Who doesn't love all day breakfast?

Every so often you crave a Burger but feel guilty about all of the bad things in it.That's where a Veggie Burger makes perfect sense. Polkers USED to be good but recently we had their Veggie Burgers and they tasted like !@*&%#@!?:(!!! Honestly, they were THAT bad.It would make a Vegetarian switch teams. That bad. Their onion rings were soggy,pasty and pathetic. I think Polkers makes their money on weekends with their Brunches instead of their " Gourmet Burgers"; they should really change their name"......Polkers Eggs,Pancakes,Mimosas and Mediocre Other Stuff".
Cute restaurant on Polk Street where you can walk in on a Friday night and get seated without waiting 90+ minutes. This is key if you're familiar with the area.

Live down the street and have never had a good meal here.  Something about the place is just off.  There are several better burgers within a block and it just seems like their burger should be better if its in the name of the restaurant.  Breakfast is decent at best.
Best burger I have had in a long time!

Finally found a great burger in SF! Really tasty. The only downfall is the plating: they put a mini frying basket with french fries on the plate (really cool idea, very nice touch), which takes out a lot of room and you feel like you can't really eat your burger. Of course, I remembered to MOVE the basked on the table after fighting it for the first 10 minutes... Hahahaha. Anyway, compliments to the chef!
Used a Gilt city voucher for this place so it was a steal!
Food is pretty good, but the service is better.  Came here for brunch and the bottomless mimosas are what keep me coming back.

This place used to be great, but now not so much.  The food is very blah - nothing special about this place at all.  I used to compare the burgers and sandwiches to Squat and Gobble, but this place has fallen far behind.  My friend ordered the fried chicken - everything was very dry and the biscuit was a hard, dry rock.  My veggie burger fell apart instantly and I had to eat it with a fork - average flavors.  The salad was pretty whatever - better bang for your buck across the street at Blue Barn.  All in all, disappointing that this place has turned for the worse.
Really good Bottomless Mimosas with your breakfast/brunch.  Can I say more?

Love this place, great atmosphere, good food, big screen tv to watch my favorite sports teams, and they just renovated the tables. Fun to bring friends here to chat and have coffee. The waitresses are nice.
Just had a great breakfast here.  Excellent bacon and the hash browns are something special.

Update: The burgers are back! The good fries are back! Let there be joy and light, because the burgers and buns are roughly the same size! I have found though that if you want a burger with just a smidge of pink or medium well, ask for it to be cooked WELL. Medium well comes out medium rare. But hey -- I am SO HAPPY the burgers have returned!

I used to love this place the sauces and dressings were AMAZING. (buffalo Sauce, lemongrass vinaigrette) but they have changed recipes and taken some of the best menu items off the menu.  I like the new look but the food is now standard, smaller portions and more expensive. I've worked in the restaurant industry for years I understand changing a menu but you cannot disrespect your regular guests by taking off certain menu items that patrons who have been frequenting your establishment for years have come to love. Service is excellent which is why I gave the extra star.

Breakfast this morning was super.  Had the regular eggs and bacon.  Bacon crisp and plentiful, eggs perfectly cooked.  Toast served with homemade jam slightly peppered, plentiful and sinfully tasty!   The service is impeccable!!!  Only reason for four stars is the coffee could have been stronger, and the tap water is not filtered.  I am going back for dinner!!!  Keep this kind of restaurant in San Francisco!!!  Yum, yum.

Seriously? First the owners say they're making changes, then the sliders get taken off the new menu and NOW they decided to take away happy hour. Honestly, I come to Polkers for Nikki, Luanne and Cas and all of the other awesome wait staff and for the good deals and great food. My favorite thing on the menu were the sliders - now they're gone. I did review Polkers with 4 stars and now I'm changing that to 2 stars. No bueno to take away a perfectly good happy hour that wasn't costing Polkers that much to begin with...thanks, Owners. Y'all aren't in touch with your business or customers at all.

I and my employees have been Polkers fans for several years.  We have had many lunches there and have always enjoyed the quality of the meal and the ambiance of the restaurant.  Luanne and Niki are terrific servers and cater to our every whim.  They always greet us warmly and treat us as if we are family.  My favorite lunch is a half Caesar with either salmon or chicken, all chopped up.  It's always done exactly right.  Every now and then I will indulge in a juicy hamburger which is juicy and "drooly" that I have to wash my hands before leaving the place.  Try it!  You'll love it!!
Can't say I was the hugest fan. The crab in the omelette I ordered had a very tough texture and was kind of tasteless. I'm wondering if it was stale. But the waitress was very nice and kind to us.

Love this place! Great staff and food. The chicken quesadilla was delicious and the new menu is amazing. Ive recently had great service by Rob. He really made the experience by being incredibly nice and personable.

My husband and I used to visit this café really often BUT ABSULETLY NOT ANYMORE!!! He greets us well most of the time and have conversation with us while he makes the coffee BUT if his wife is there he just ignores me every single time. Really! Can you believe this? He barely takes our order or talk to us if his wife is there with him. This is really unprofessional. It really made me feel weird! I felt like I'm doing something wrong and I shouldn't be there.

My husband and I stopped here and split a panini (Delicious!!!) so that we would have room for cappuccinos and cannoli.  Seriously - the BEST in North Beach.  We were so impressed that we plan to keep returning and work our way through the menu. (Look for it on the chalkboard near the ceiling) Cavalli Cafe is definitely worth the stop!
The Cannoli left me speechless! Tastes like heaven! Filled in at the moment of order. The espresso is also excellent.
This is a husband and wife run cafe. They run the place themselves 7 days a week and has been doing it for the past 9 years.  Super nice people.

I came here at the suggestion of a friend who declared "Cavalli has the best espresso in San Francisco." He was right! Not only is the coffee just like what I get in Italy, Santo, the owner is very friendly and accommodating. He shared with me the history of Cavalli, which has been in SF for about 130 years, but he also made me an excellent panini.

I am Italian and moved to San Francisco 10 years ago. Since i found Cavalli  3 years ago i don't miss Italy anymore. The whole menu' is worth it to try,anything will transport you to memories of Italy  and, if you never been there, it will give you a sample of the flavors of Italy.
Free wifi! Best cappuccino!! Wonderful tiramisu! Very nice staff :)

My wife and I visited this little cozy cafe after visiting Alcatraz. We initially came for a cannoli and coffee but ordered 2 sandwiches, 1- tuna and 1- caprese. We met Santo who owns Cavalli. He was very friendly and courteous. Our sandwiches were served on a beautiful black slate board with a skewered olive. Both were fantastic and flavorful in taste. The flavors complimented each other and one did not overpower the next. The bread is crusty and homemade. Great texture and bite. Our cannoli arrived next and was presented just like my nana did when I was growing up. The first bite of the shell brought back the aroma and taste of my childhood. It was a perfect cannoli. Thank you Santo.
This little place has some fantastic paninis, I had the one with mozzarella and the one with prosciutto and they were delicious!

This place has so much Italian history for the city and the neighborhood for the last 130 years.  The caffe, tiramisu, and cannolo are amazing. This place really brings a european vibe not a place to work but enjoy life and talk about the day. I cant say enough about this place to my friends and family, but last if you are up to it feel free to parla italiano when you order as it is part of the Cavalli Cafe culture.
One of North Beach's hidden gem for the most authentic tiramisu!
This place was my usual morning coffee stop while in SF. Great coffee, good service. A must if you appreciate a fine cup of coffee.

This place has one of the best Cannoli. It is not on display, they make it right in front of you. I like that it is not super sweet as in other places and you can taste how fresh it is. Coffee is great too. Will come back and try other deserts.
Very good Italian vibe, great fresh cannoli. If you're in North Beach you should definitely go there for authentic Italian pastry.
Best Home made Tiramisu and freshly made Canoli.
OK, fasten your seat belt.  After reading this I hope one will send a message to Cafe Cavalli that racism is a horrible social cancer and should not be tolerated.
This cafe has the best atmosphere and coffee around little Italy! Not crowded at all, the service is good and their ice mokas are great!
Great coffe, expensive but worth the visit! Staff is great and the place has italian music and decoration telling the history of the traditional store. They only accept cash, which is not a problem.

I'm Italian and Cavalli has the best Italian coffee and desserts I have found in the U.S. Cavalli also serves the only cannoli made fresh on the spot that I have seen in the U.S. or even Italy these days. Anytime I come to San Francisco I make sure to visit this excellent café.

This place has become one of favorite spots for a coffee break in North Beach.  Granted it does help that you get a free coffee with any dessert purchase when you check-in with the yelp app.   How can you resist?
best cappuccino in north beach i have had so far.  always consistent and good service as well.  Cash only but theres a BofA atm next door in case you forgot.

My favorite place to sit down and have a cappuccino. I lived in Europe for a couple years and this is where I come to deal with my nostalgia. I selfishly hope this place remains relatively undiscovered.

Great place to have coffee, dessert and people watch! I think this was the third stop on the North beach food crawl back in February with Rodney H. After having 2 meals, the only thing I could stomach was dessert so we ended up at Cavalli cafe. We got the following and went upstairs to have a seat.
Really, nothing special. I have been there 1 time and what I remember is just the super HOT weather due not fans and of course.. NO AIR CONDITIONING. The service is ok..
So elegant and authentic. I come here to feel foreign and kindle my imagination about Italy. Really tasty desserts.
On a weekend trip, I was looking for a coffee and small bite for breakfast after mass in North Beach.

Stopped by here on a hunt for coffee after a long touristy day, and we decided to give this place a try due to the great Yelp reviews. We were greeted by a very friendly man who made our coffee orders promptly after ordering. He mentioned that they also served desserts, and it didn't take much convincing for me to add on a tiramisu to my order. Ordering that tiramisu was the best decision I made that day, it complemented my coffee well and was on par with some of the best tiramisu I've had.

When we visit San Francisco's Little Italy, we are in search for the atmosphere and taste of what we love most about Rome. To visit a local favorite cafe in Italy is an ageless tradition for it's patrons and we love to experience THEIR way of life. Their favorite cafe is a place for conversation with friends or a quick "ciao!" as you toss down an espresso and go on your way. There isn't WiFi, it's not office space like so many coffee places here in the U.S., it isn't a library to work on your thesis. Even though I don't live close enough to A. Cavalli to be considered a patron, it has become our go to place for cappuccino and Tiramisu.  Here is why: over the years, we have taken groups of friends to for "progressive dinner" adventures thru Little Italy. Even though we have our favorite places, it is fun to see others try various dishes from many of the NB area. For dessert, we buy one tiramisu from 6 or 7 of the area's pastry shops. Then bring them back to our place for blind taste testing. A. Cavalli wins EVERY time. As for the customer service and atmosphere, it is like taking a short trip to a beloved place far away and I love it. Thanks to the owners for keeping it real.
Cute spot

The tiramisu here is beyond heavenly.  It melts like a cloud in your mouth.  it lives up to its name, which I believe means "lift me up" in Italian. It is so delicious, it really does make you happy!! I have tried tiriamisu all over san francisco and this is the best.

Came here once for their tiramisu...I don't understand all the favorable reviews, it was just nothing special. I didn't get that wow factor at all...maybe it was because the shop was about to close so we got last dibs, or perhaps it was the shitty company I had. Who knows, but I did not feel compelled to come again.

Absolutely loved the cozy welcoming space. Extremely simple menu of high quality ingredients. Desserts are just tiramisu, panna cotta, chocolate mousse, affogato or cannoli. Sit up stairs to have a view of coit tower or sit downstairs to watch soccer. The owner and his family are hard at work, you can watch him cracking eggs for his tiramisu when he's not making coffee. Amazing service, delicious food and spot on coffee. HIGHLY recommended.
Time: 3:36pm/60°F cloudy
Delicious Italian coffee! Most tourists blow by this cafe on their way out of Chinatown. They are missing out on the best coffee in San Fran!

Whenever I'm in the city, I have to stop here for some amazing dessert and coffee. I'm a big canolli fan and always try them wherever I can fine them. Cavalli serves the best canolli I have ever had. It is made fresh and to perfection and I absolutely love the chocolate chips that come with it.

Given all the rave reviews I was super excited to get to this place and try the famed tiramisu but boy was I disappointed. Not a single hint of coffee flavor. I also ordered a latte which was so weak I doubted that there was even a full espresso shot in there. Both items were fine, but definitely nothing exciting.

Cavalli Cafe serves far the best coffee in San Francisco! If you are a real coffee lover and understand a little bit of the coffee industry then this is the place to go - Italian owner Santo and his team serves perfectly prepared espresso, cappuccino, caffe late and much more.
Really cute cafe with great desserts :) cannoli and especially tiramisu
Great place. Very reasonable prices for the coffee. Nice atmosphere in the evening. Pleasant hosts.
Feels like being in someplace in Italy. Excellent espresso. And the owner is a Napoli fan! Grande Diego!

I live a few blocks away and had high hopes that this might finally be a place at this location that sticks around.  However, in two visits I have been quite disappointed.  II sat at he bar and had drinks once and had dinner on my second visit.  The service is downright amateurish, including the bartenders.  This place needs some adult supervision, as in an onsite manager. Each time I wanted something I had to practically wave my arms to get attention.  I ordered a drink during happy hour (a Moscow mule) and no one had any idea how much it would cost (one time it was $5, another $12).  The bartenders seemed to treat the customers as an annoyance.  As for the food, well, in a word it mostly sucked.  The "hand rolled tater tots" were huge masses of potato which just tasted like mush.  Almost everything on the menu was fried and bland.  Whoever is doing the menu is not much of a cook.  Sadly, the food across the street at the Rogue is better and that's not saying much.  I don't see myself going here again.

Went to The Square for Sunday brunch with some out of town friends. I picked The Square because of the buzz around it and the rave reviews of the food. I was sorely disappointed (!) for the following reasons:

"The Square" is an apt name for this place, as it describes both the ambience of the place and the personality of its proprietors. They are no doubt rookies who just got into the restaurant/bar business, and they are PARANOID.
Awesome drinks and breakfast. Apple
Absolutely love this place. Came here for HH 3-6pm on a Sunday and got a killer deal on a $6 burger, $5 tatar tots (which were amazing) and $2 coors. Helluva lunch for under $20 for 2 people!

Third time here. We came for brunch on a Sunday morning and had hoped for the same brunch menu as last time. Nope! It changed. We were sad to see the fried chicken with biscuit and gravy gone from the menu. I ordered the farm egg sandwich and my husband got the pork belly hash. You know its bad when you say the fries are the best thing.
Square is a good word for this place.

No stars! Second time trying The Square and didn't even get to order due to wait staff. I've not seen service this bad in SF! It was Sunday at 1pm and the place was virtually empty. Walked out due lack of service. Hope you have deep enough pockets to keep this 'white elephant' alive. Good luck!

I went to The Square back in July, but I can honestly say it was one of the best meals I ate while visiting America. Service was flawless - not bothersome, but perfectly attentive. Our waiter was happy to explain the dishes to us, and make recommendations where required. The food itself was amazing - well put together and thought out, and reasonably priced. I can't really remember the dishes given I visited so long ago, but for the record, we dined from the dinner menu.
Strong food choice, beer selection is solid. Great neighborhood spot. Great lighting.

A friend and I wandered in on a Sunday evening for drinks and a snack.  We enjoyed one of the best whiskey sours ever and an amazing persimmon salad.  The salad was pretty spectacular and kind of overshadowed the tomato flatbread and spicy chicken wings, but they were also very tasty.  The tab for four drinks and our appetizers was reasonable, and the kitchen sent out a donut-like dessert sample to sweeten our experience.  I'm really surprised this place isn't packed.  Great bar, good food, primo location.  Check it out, and leave a drink for me on the board by the bar!

We ate at around 10:30 on a Saturday morning, and there were only two other couples in the restaurant- normally this would be a bad thing, but we seated ourselves, and after a couple minutes someone came by and took our drink orders- coffee.  My boyfriend was in zombie mode because he hadn't had his coffee yet, so he was kind of ticked that they didn't have any brewed and that we had to wait about 10 minutes for a couple cups.  The coffee was very good- but he was already cranky so it was hard to enjoy.
Had drinks and appetizers with some friends here the other night. The food was great, prices were pretty decent, atmosphere relaxing and service amazing.
The food was 3 stars, the service was -3, so that's how you get to zero, but that's not an option.
Food - great veggie burger, which tasted more like a fritter and had delicious accompany sauces.  Large portion sizes.

We came here because it was the closest restuarant near us that was sit down after walking mile from our hotel. The prices are very reasonable. The ambiance is nice and the place looks clean with cool decor.

Drawn in by the House made whiskey Ginger. Well... Very smooth and refreshing. Nice, as I am walking to Bart. Yes it's long walk but who cares with a whiskey ginger under the skirt. Cheers. Nice casual chill atmosphere.  Cushy stools wooden tables, a great place for regulars and first timers. As soon as we walked in they poured water and took our order.  It felt like we were old friends. Nice! When we are in the city we will be back. Thank you.
Had to stop and try the Ginger whiskey.   Nice smooth refreshing drink. $5 come in and try it.

I'm still standing by my verdict on the dinner entrees not being impressive. I've gone back again and this time had the cheeseburger. Not only was it one of the most poorly formed burgers that fell apart after one bite, there was something in the bread or meat that gave it an overly sour flavor. It also was overcooked, no where near medium rare.

Finally a place that might actually make it in this location! While I do miss Washington Square Bar and Grill for some things, Square is definitely an improvement across the board. The food was really good and reasonably priced. We had the pork belly with egg, chips and dip, pretzel, bone marrow, beef tartare, ribs. All were delicious and I'd come back again as there are still many items I want to try...
The food and service were both excellent.

Yes to the Square! I love that Lil Italy circle but that circle definitely needed The Square. Very inviting. Came in. Read the chalkboard. Seat yourself and order at the bar/counter. Nice selections on the menu. Cool bartenders that made a good ass Old fashion. The food was good. I had the flatbread and fries. My cuz had an awesome burger. So happy that they were open late as many of the good places to eat over there stop serving food early.

The one thing that stood out for me at The Square is that the wait help is extremely well-educated about their menu and extremely well-trained. I usually get this kind of service in restaurants of James Beard award caliber. We ordered the Trumer Pilsner, Bundaberg Ginger Beer, Grilled Beets, Pork Belly, Pappardelle Pasta, Cavatelli Pasta (lamb), Pork Chop, and the Peanut Butter Cake dessert--all for $119 before tip. My family raved about the food, but my daughter ended up eating my Pappardelle Pasta because the lamb in her Cavatelli Pasta was too gamy for her. I did not care so much for the Cavatelli Pasta. l am rating The Square 4 stars because my family said it was one of our most memorable meals while in the City. Personally, I would rate the food 3 1/2 stars with service at 5 stars.

This place is a self service restaurant with $16 burgers. No service, plastic cups w/ paper napkins, sub-par food, no atmosphere and no customers (see the pic I uploaded take at 7:30pm on a Wednesday night).
I thought this place was solid.  We ordered:

I happened into this latest incarnation of the old Washbag because I was in search of a good breakfast.  While the menu was not quite what I was looking for, I spied "Pork Belly Hash with Eggs and Calabrian Chile" on the menu.  Now how can a person not order that?  In getting the breakfast (which was great) I learned a lot about The Square...

My friends and I tried The Square for brunch last week and it was an all around great experience! Friendly staff, good ambiance... $12 bottomless mimosas, strong and good fruity drink choices. Smoked salmon was beautifully presented with edible flowers on top; fruit bowl with fresh house made cream - mix of berries, melons, and what the waitress told us were ground cherries; beignets were light, but big and served with warm honey; donuts with chocolate sauce were dense. I got the pancakes which had fresh blueberries in them, berries and flowers on top, served with house made butter that made me say wow when I tasted it (so rich!) and house made whipped cream... I'm a sweet feen but no syrup was even needed for them they were that good; best pancakes I've had in a long time! Sampled my friend's pork belly hash: fresh peppers, onions, eggs, all good! Only bit of improvement would be to put fresh potatoes in there (they were the freezer bag kind). Over 60% of their products come from the restaurant-owned farm in the Santa Cruz mountains too; they're doing the "farm to table" thing well! We'll be back, definitely for brunch, and maybe for dinner too!

Disappointing. Quite expensive for submedocre food. Everything was boderline flavorlesss. The seafood for 2 people dish was laughable, but the price wasn't funny. Bland and seafood for one, not 2. Spend your money at Park Tavern a block away instead. Same style, same price point, executed way better.

Dumb and Dumber!  What happened to this place from the owners of Sons & Daughters?  The chef owners were on the cover of Food Arts recently about sustainable and foraged ingredients and this is their work???  You knew it might be trouble when nobody bothered to confirm your reservation as well no need as there were 5 tables at 7 on a FR night!  No service for a long while and then it was like service by committee...very casual and nonchalant.  The beef tartar was a mushy ground mess as well under glazed pork belly.  The pork chop was so dry I left it uneaten.  The steak had a mush of wet salad in a sweet sauce which was gross.  Pastas had no toothiness and flappy.  Skipped dessert...ran out of there.

Brunch was delicious!  The tortilla in my ranchero eggs had just the right crisp, and my friend's mushroom omelette was a revelation in how good unusual wild mushrooms can taste. Much of the food is from the owner's own farm in Santa Cruz, which is super cool. Great attentive staff too.
Decided to check the new brunch spot in Washington Square.  Loved the dark, distressed wooden floors and rustic walls...but - is this just starting to become the norm in SF?

Decided to try The Square as it was new to North Beach and the location is so convenient from downtown -- easy walk post work. The food was all good but prices were really steep. There were two of us, we split an app, a salad an entree and each had a glass of wine and the bill was $100 which seemed pretty high to me. Like I said the food was good but it was nothing to rave about.

A great addition to Washington Square - food, service and ambiance are all on high standards. Being Italian, I really appreciated the "al dente" pasta, it's a rarity on these days. It tends to get hot inside, so you may want to pick a colder night to try it. Albeit it serves breakfast as well, I feel it's more appropriate for dinner.

Review is for drinks and dessert: Jackson behind the bar was incredibly welcoming, generous and friendly, and the friend whom I went with and myself want to go back to visit The Square mainly for the chance to run into him again :) He gave us a taste of nasturtium-infused gin (omg sooo good) and some other mixers he's been making from scratch, and was very knowledgeable of The Square's offerings (we had the ice cream sandwich and the grilled strawberry dessert, both were delicious). Excellent bar service, I'll go back again!

Absolutely exceptional food and service! Lovely neighborhood restaurant with a great atmosphere! Most of the ingredients are self-grown on the biodanamic Dark Hill Farm - wonderful concept! Constantly changing menus make this place a location to come back and back again. Amazing restaurant in the North Beach Neighborhood
Review is for dinner. The bread and butter is amazing, asked for seconds, and that was my favorite part of the meal. Everything else was decent:

Like most reviewers, I think this place is great potential. They still have some kinks to address. Also, I should Say that I am a fan of the former Washington Square Bar and Grill. The wash bag had a certain comfort level, order a well-dressed cocktail and drop your cares at the door ambiance, that its followers have not re-created successfully.

Came here on a weekend night. Was a little apprehensive of the prices since the restaurant looked pretty new and like a lot had been put into the decor. Surprisingly everything was reasonable, especially for SF. I ordered the burger and a beer, my friends got some of the other house favorites. Everything was spot on tasty. I'd classify it as high quality comfort food a la San Francisco. I would definitely come back here again the next time I'm in SF and get adventurous with my menu choice.

Nice atmosphere. Great brunch, though it took awhile for our food to come out. The beignets were amazing, as was the pork belly hash. The Square Breakfast was really good too. Excited to come back to check out their dinner menu.
Found out The Square was opening its doors to the SF brunch scene - so we decided to go check it out this past weekend. Really glad we did.
DeLicious.

Me and my friends have been here multiple times and we absolutely love it!!! The food is homemade, always very fresh and flavorful and servers are professional and attentive. Cozy small place in the heart of North Beach area that serves delicious homemade pastas and they have great wine selection too.
We happend upon the caffe yesterday, as my favorite place wasnt open for lunch.

I gave again this ''place'' a chance to keep myself as a customer but they mess up again. Really Poor Poor costumer service and the food was ok, I used to go there often, but now I really decide to take this Poor Place with this umprofessional people who doesn't care about their costumers, if you go you will see, and if you see you will understand what Im saying.  If you don't care about the costumer service then go, but if you care and like to have fun with your girlfriend in a good environment , then go to a different place around there. Good luck.

Great choice for authentic selection of Italian food, be in gnocchi, pizza, appetizers, or delicious deserts. Quiet and elegant atmosphere. One of our regular stops when visiting San Francisco even though there are numerous alternatives.
The short: An okay but definitely strange dinner on short notice.
Disappointing!
We had a really good experience here. We stopped in without ever knowing of the place or hearing about it. It just happened to be on our way to our final destination.
Great location and outdoor seating is perfect for a sunny day. Get the mussels. I loved them.
My roomie and I came here on a Sunday around 10:30am.  We waited around 10 minutes and were then seated inside.  The restaurant is on the smaller side with outdoor seating which most people vie for.

Service staffs are awesome, but food and business is lousy. We order the clam and mussel dish for appetizer. The clams were okay, but the mussel was disguising. It was dead prior to being cook because they had such a foul smell. Any cook would know dead mussel. We told the server to just replaced the stinky rotten mussel with clams. He brought it to the kitchen and brought back exactly what we had except with the mussel removed (nothing replaced). It's frustrating when business doesn't admit their mistake. The chef here is most disappointing. It's definitely for one time tourist stop. I can't imagine with the options in the city, any one would return here.

My friends and I met to have brunch here last week.  I had eaten here several times before and actually was the one who decided on the meeting spot, so I was embarrassed by what a terrible fail this was.  We were seated at around 1:45pm, but our waiter didn't take our order until just before 2 (which is the cut off for breakfast orders).  Neither the hostess who seated us or our waiter mentioned that the time for the cutoff was approaching, and the waiter actually took our brunch order.  There were 5 of us, we all ordered alcohol and side orders and some of us order 2 breakfast dishes, so it was quite a large order.  About 10 minutes after our server took our order, he came back to us empty handed and told us that they were no longer serving brunch!  He didn't bring us menus to look for something else, he didn't bring us our drinks, not a free appetizer to ease the pain, nothing, just looked at us.  We were all upset because we had been seated before 2, and he could have taken our order sooner if there was a cutoff to be made.  He said sorry as if he couldn't have cared less, so we got up and found another restaurant that would serve us.  It was the strangest experience that I have ever had!  We all couldn't believe that he didn't make any attempt at all to make the experience better for us.  He just stood there watching as we got up and left!  And we were starving, and this would have been a big order with a big tip.  Such a horrible experience that none of us will ever return.
Nice restaurant and their breakfast pizza was the best. Their ambience was ok but the food was good.

The wait is never really that long here and when the sun is shining, it's the primo spot to have mimosas and eggs. The staff is attentive and efficient. Stop by if you are in North Beach and try the gnocchi or any of the pastas. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, it's all yummy.

Prior to comedy shows at Cobb's, my girlfriends and I usually hit up Columbus Cafe for some lubrication, and then Golden Boy for some saturation. I was late to the party, and my girls had made the classy choice to head to Caffe Delucchi and bought a bottle of pricey white wine.

Best crab Benedict in the city! Very fresh with the perfect amount of hollandaise. Service was slow and took forever to get a refill of my coffee... But I'll give them the benefit of the doubt with 1 woman working in the front at 10am on a Monday.

I have been to this place before since its my fiance's fav place to get beef bolangnese. This time, I was not impressed. We originally had ordered a dish to go but then ended up finding parking there so decided to eat in instead. I also ordered  the warm spinach salad which they were nice enough to accomodate with the sauce on the side. That was not an issue but seems that they decided not to provide us the same service as if we decided to eat in from the beginning. They just kinda seated us and then let us be. We didn't get bread like they usually serve and barely gave us a water refill. It was pretty clear when we were ready for the check but we had to flag them down for that. not impressed.

We had tried breakfast with an amazing Bloody Mary and lunch with delicious Panini.  This was out first dinner and we were not disappointed.   I enjoyed the tomato basil soup which did not include cream.  My guest ranted about the gnocchi.   Would definitely return for another visit.   We chose it for dinner before seeing Beach Blanket Babylon.  Perfect location!   Nice patio seating for people watching.   Small interior but cozy.

The breakfast BLT was excellent but huge! Definitely a dish for sharing. Servers were fast and  friendly. All the breakfast disses were pretty standard fair (eggs Benedict, egg scrambles, etc) good basic breakfast options

Ate lunch here with a friend.  We both had the chicken fettuccine alfredo, which we both agreed was very good.  Service was unremarkable.  The place is a bit touristy but that's life in San Francisco.

I'd have to say, I was pleasantly surprised with my experience at Caffe Delucchi. I was in the city over the weekend for the SF Giants Half Marathon and we had just picked up our race packets from the expo and were in search of some good pasta to carb load. Thanks to the handy dandy yelp app, we were immediately directed to Little Italy. Upon arriving we were able to find parking close by at Washington Park. There were so many restaurants to choose from so we decided to take a walk and Caffee Delucchi was the one that caught our attention. A nice little corner bistro/cafe with the plenty of outdoor seating. As we entered we were immediately greeted by the hostess who brought us to our table. They have a great menu and judging from what everyone around us was ordering... the real star of this place is the breakfast which is served until 2pm.BUT, we were here to carb load so I decided to go with the Linguine Vongole served with fresh manila clams and shrimp in a white wine, garlic herb sauce. The pasta along with the seafood was cooked perfectly. The seafood was fresh and the portions were hearty. I am definitely hooked on this place and I plan to return soon to try the breakfast dishes and the panini's. I highly recommend Caffe Delucchi if you are in the area.
Caprese salad was good. Spinach ravioli was perfect, might have chosen a different sauce next time instead of the mushroom. Price is reasonable.
Great menu selection for breakfast. Artichoke hash is really tasty. No wait to get in which now surprises me. Service is great. Prices reasonable

I came in with a friend on a Tuesday afternoon, around 1pm, thinking that this place would be good because it looked busy. However, I think we came on a bad day or something because the service was terrible!! Here's why..
Mamas had a 2.5 hour wait so this place was a fantastic surprise. Great service and delicious breakfast!!
Went to this place after our 1st and 2nd choice were packed. Bloody Marys and anything you eat for breakfast are amazing. I had Huevos Rancheros. Best gourmet huevos I've ever had. What a gem!

Great food, service and atmosphere!  The Bruschetta was just ok but the entrees more than made up for it.  The Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo was to die for.  Homemade fettuccine noodles and a silky smooth cream sauce kept me wanting more.  The Gnocchi with Bolognese Sauce was perfection.  The Potato Gnocchi was very light and the sauce was rich and meaty.  Top that off with a bottle of Montecucco Rosso wine and I'm as happy as can be.  This restaurant is a small piece of Italy tucked away in Little Italy, San Francisco.  You must try it!

the food was ordinary (I had what was represented as an Italian sausage omelete, but truth-in-advertising would have described it as a tomato omelet with a few bits of sausage), the coffee should be represented as boiled water (though admittedly I like strong coffee), the service was clueless (they brought the toast as we were finishing breakfast)
A fine Italian establishment.
We came here for breakfast. We ordered mushroom pizza, Benedict crab cake, and coffee. Recommend all of them!
I came for late dinner 8:00 pm.

One of my favorite brunch spots in SF. There are many options in North Beach (places that are fantastic and hard to get in and a plethora of touristy Italian places that are begging you to come in as you walk down the street). Caffe Delucchi is neither- fantastic food with no crowds or wait. What a find! They have the hard to find outdoor seating. They take reservations on
Good service, but comparable to 90% of Italian restaurants in San Francisco: overpriced, not really authentic Italian food and relatively small menu
Let me start of by saying that I usually hate giving bad reviews, so you know this place deserves it.

Walked over to Mammas and saw the line reaching down the block, so we used our phones and found this place. So happy we did. Wife and I shared a breakfast pizza and Gorgonzola polenta with poached eggs and bacon. Food was great. Service was excellent and we had a seat next to the open windows on a beautiful Friday morning. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast/brunch who doesn't feel like waiting in line for an hour with tourists.

Wonderful blueberry pancakes. Right up there with the best pancakes I have had. We came here on a Sunday morning after waiting in line for Mama's for all of 2 minutes before realizing that there was no way the wait could be worth it. We walked down to this little place and we were seated right away. The restaurant was fairly full, with a few open tables. The service was okay. I found in all of San Francisco the service standards are extremely low but this was one of our better experiences. My companion ordered the pulled pork polenta and liked it.
Came in Tuesday morning and had a wonderful experience. Michael and Melissa were attentive, friendly, and made my dining experience one of the best I have had in the city.
Summary: A cafe in North Beach worth battling the tourists for.

I've only been here for brunch, but it's become a regular weekend option for a calmer I-need-food-maybe-one-mimosa brunch (not a full day give-me-all-of-your-mimosas brunch). I usually get the artichoke hash benedict which is different but delicious. The polenta is a little bland though I'm usually too full from everything else to have more than a few bites. The regular benedicts are good too, and they have some crazy breakfast pizzas that I've seen but haven't tried. Haven't heard of anything bad so far!
Pretty good italian food. The pizza was my favorite, the risotto was so-so. Mussels and clams were very good too.

I took my pasta loving boyfriend here last Saturday and we had a blast! I've been here several times over the years in a group or a couple and it just has the best atmosphere definitely a San Francisco restaurant landmark. I made a reservation through open table for 9:30 on a weekend and I was seated promptly. Our waiter was attentive and quick wish I could remember his name. We decided to eat inside since we didn't know how cold SF would be that night, but I'll take an outside seat next time cause of the perfect people watching tables and warm heat lamps. On to the food, we started off with the Italian potstickers basically a tasty meatball dressed in a potsticker so good! We had the kenwood Chardonnay with all the fancy decoration, for dinner we had the ravioli which is a must! It still manages to be a casual place that serves til 2am while keeping the Columbus North Beach Italian charm, we will be coming back!

This wasn't my first time here. I had visited with a large group of coworkers after an event in the city and they took very good care of us and were able to accommodate our group of 12. I had also visited with my wife one afternoon for drinks and appetizers.

My roommate has been here so we decided to get some coffee and dessert.  We were seated outside, and our orders were placed promptly.  We started with garlic bread with cheese, and our desserts came in afterwards.  She ordered tiramisu, and I got the orange creamsicle cheesecake.

This is one of the first places I ate at in SF and I keep coming back for more. Nice atmosphere with outdoor seating to people watch on a busy street on Columbus. Food is decent, good pasta, good calamari, portions are good.

This place is full of lies and crap. Don't believe their wait time. When I first put my name on the list, the waiter said 10-15 mins. Twenty-five minutes later, I checked in and she assures me it's another 5-7 minutes. Ten minutes later, I check in with her again and she tells me that it's going to be another 20 minutes. WTF? There's nothing I hate more than a hostess that lies about an estimate wait time to get my business. SHADY.

I really liked Calzone's! I got the fettuccine with asparagus/chicken/tomato, and it was really yummy. My friend liked her lasagna, as well. I'm not sure why other users are claiming that this place is "overpriced", because it's not. There are many "overpriced" restaurants in this city, but Calzone's is not one of them. Friendly staff.

Recommended by a SF native and we loved it.  No reservation for 5 on a Wednesday night -- seated right away.  Great service.  House red was terrific.  Had the gnochetti with sugo, which was excellent.  Others in the party had the filet mignon calzone (says it's one of his favorites) and crab fettucini -- both excellent.  Even the two who ordered salads, raved.  Don't hesitate -- visit today!

I had my birthday dinner there last night. I called to make the reservation two nights before for a party of 35! To my delight I found out they have an upstairs area that is great for big parties & it was available. The person I spoke with on the phone even sang me happy birthday which was super sweet. The food was delish & all of my family & friends had a great time! Thank you Calzone's for making my birthday magical.

Here visiting and read great things about Tonys. Unfortunately, I stopped by and it was closed for a private event. I kept walking and decided on by Calzones as it has a fairly appealing outdoor seating area. I ordered the "cremini" mushroom pizza and a glass of wine. The service was great. Fast and friendly. The pizza was mediocre at best. The crust is cracker-like and dry and I love thin crust. The cheese lacked the nice salty flavor you crave from pizza and the mushrooms were definitely not cremini. They were your regular store-bought button mushrooms. For the $30+ I spent on both items, I'd say very over-priced and sadly underwhelming.

WTF is with the no phone orders and you don't have an online ordering option? That is total BS. I called just now after over a year of ordering take out and they said I have to come in person and order. Totally defeats the purpose of take out, I might as well eat at the restaurant if I am going to have to wait. Step your game up Calzone's. I know you cheap asses make a ton of money off that location! You're letting your neighbors down.

Always great food and service here. Had the pizza margarita and the Italian pot stickers. Both were excellent as always. Peachy loved it. House Chianti very good. Food served fast and always with a smile.
I love this place.

We made reservation for 7:45 on a Wednesday evening. After a five block walk from our hotel we arrived on time and were seated immediately at an outside table held for us, yeah!!  Service was prompt and the food was delicious.  Get the OUTSIDE seating, it is a scream.  Inside is good as well, the large sliding windows open to project a wall-less front.  As a side note, I left my very expensive jacket on the chair. A block away our waiter came running with it: he was not hard to miss with that big smile and white apron!  He ran back but I followed to the restaurant to insist he take $20. Well worth the prince of my unique jacket! Go here! It may be a wait on the weekend, but well worth it!

Outdoor seating area was clean and comfortable - great people watching!  Prices for entrees and drinks were reasonable - considering the area.  However,  $7 for 4 smallish pieces of garlic bread was crazy.  Calzones and pizzas were good - fresh veggies on the veggie pizza - including shaved asparagus.  Wish I could give it 3 1/2 stars.
Once again Calzone's didn't disappoint! Service was absolutely top notch and we enjoyed the patio on a calm Indian summer night. The house chianti and cheese plate were a delightful snack!

Came here for my birthday recently and ate here with a few friends.  We ordered some appetizers and dinner with wine.  The friends I was with were so nice to recommend this place.  We got there and were seated quickly at a nice table.  Our waiter was a nice looking guy with a strange voice.  Anyway, he took our order but before the appetizers could come out, he had the salad come out first when I asked to be brought out with the meal.  Anyway, I asked him how long he had worked there and he responded that he'd worked there 17 years.  Anyway, I had to remind him to give us an update on our appetizers.  Then, later another server came to our table and one of my buddies asked if they did anything special for birthdays/people.  The server said no.  Was strange that being a restaurant they don't sing, give a complimentary slice of something.  I personally wasn't looking/expecting anything but when I heard this server said the restaurant didn't do anything for birthday patrons, I suddenly was disappointed.  Anyway, the food was OK.  Nothing to rave about.  My birthday dinner experience was OK.  Not sure if I'm coming back. Especially since there's so many restaurants in the area.
This is my #1 favorite place to eat in the city. We have a blast sitting outside to eat while enjoying the nightlife of SF... pure entertainment! The food is amazing and the service is always great.

Went here with my partner for breakfast and the waiting staff was very rude. We left after we paid for our coffee. It may have been because we were a gay couple but they gave us the nastiest glare when we walked in. Blatant homophobic discrimination is a terrible customer service strategy. Also, the coffee was barely drinkable. If zero star rating was available that is what they would get. Don't go here.

Just had dinner here tonight with my friend and his parents. Had calamari for the appetizer and pizza for dinner. Everything was good. Really nice atmosphere too. The hostess was really cute as well. Tried to get her phone number but all I got was "thanks for coming in." Rejection with a smile. I'll be back soon haha
I love coming here. The atmosphere is really nice, sitting outside on a warm night is great and the pizza is bomb!!!!

Delicious. Cool atmosphere and lots of stuff to look at inside. There is outside seating as well as inside; upstairs too. I ordered the homemade raviloi and it was the bomb.( if you don't like mushrooms I would not reccomend) my boyfriend got the homemade lasagna and loved it as well. Pretty big portions and great service. I will DEFINATELY come back here:)

Came here with my boyfriend on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't crowded so we got seated quickly(chose to be inside so we could sit across from each other). The staff here was very friendly, got our orders quickly, and came to fill our cups a few times throughout our meal. I ordered the chicken&mushroom pasta while my boyfriend got an Italian calzone. The servings were pretty decent and the food was good. It is a bit pricey, but overall a nice place to eat.
Stopped here with my husband last weekend. We were hungry after walking around the city all morning. Wasn't in the mood for Italian but we saw this place and decided to stop.

Sat on the heated sidewalk which was manageable in late August. Corkage is very inexpensive- only $5. We had the calamari which was just ok along with the garlic fries. The short ribs were absolutely skippable- under-seasoned and over-cooked. The crab fettuccine was decent, but would've been better with a lighter sauce. Service was a bit slow as we had to ask for our water, food, and the check. Maybe because we were on the patio? Overall, just ok.

This place doesn't deserve its current rating 3,5. Apart the decoration which is really nice, the service is unfriendly, particularly with kids. The menu is incomplete for an Italian restaurant and the food is not good, not even warm. You have many other places that deserve a visit. Definitely not this one !!!

There are a plethora of Italian restaurants in North Beach/Russian Hill.  Some are authentic (or claim to be as "Our chef is from Sicily" proclaimed one restaurant hawker), some are trendy (to see and be seen), and some are crowded.  I found that most were terribly overpriced, and according to my wallet,  Calzone's is in the same category.
Met my expectations. A little pricey for what I ordered, which was the calzone burger.  Fine experience.

Food and service was extremely average.  My husband ordered lasagna, it was cold and not appetizing at all. I got eggplant rollatini, which was very oily and not what you would expect. Would not recommend.
Amazing pizza and filet minion calazone!! We sat outside and enjoyed people watching!

We started our North Beach night here.  It was crowded with happy patrons so we knew we were in the right place.  The servers were nice and friendly.  It's a great place that is would recommend you visit if you are in the area.
We were walking around Columbus wanting to try a new place in North Beach. Always seen Calzone's but never really had the urge to walk through the door. Well today was our day.

Our experience was as good as it gets! First, I loved being able to reserve a table on Yelp. Two clicks and done. Great! Second, we arrived early and were seated right away. What?! That never happens. Third, we got one of the sidewalk tables; wide awnings with over-head heaters. Nice! As avid people-watchers, we were in heaven. What about the food? I'm glad you asked. ;) Amazing! The pork and beef sugo calzone was to-die-for. The chicken alfredo with spinach and almonds was delicious. We were satisfied, but not over-full. Perfect. Spent the rest of the evening walking it off around Little Italy. Calzone's, we'll be back.
Great Italian food, fantastic atmosphere. Ideal place to have a good time. Good service. One of my favorite in North Beach.
This place is amazing.
Service was slow, food pricey (given the quality) it was average at best. We had the lasagna calzone and were not impressed. I will not go back...  Too many other choices in the area.

Don't overcook the pasta.  Al dente should not be a new term. We were early in the Dinner Hour and the pasta tasted like it was in the pot for a while. Add more fresh veggies to the meat sauce.  Mushrooms?  Zucchini?  Who am I to tell you how to cook?

The calzone offerings are wonderful. My party and I ordered three--Italian, Lasagna-style, and Filet Mignon. All were equally delicious, with the seasoning being just to our tastes. Every bite was gleeful, and sad at the same time because we were getting closer to finishing. Couple these things with a great ambience and great service, and it's an all-around satisfying experience.
Excellent restaurant ! the place is well decorated, you fill like in Italia. The food was incredibly good especially the Italian calzone and the tiramisu. The service was quick and friendly.

We made a reservation a couple of weeks in advance and confirmed a couple of days in advance for dinner July 4. We called a half hour to re-confirm and a snotty girl informed us "it is first-come first serve tonight."
My boyfriend and I stop by every time we're in the city. Consistently good service and great food. Try any of the seafood pastas or pizzas. Try to walk if you can,  there may or may not be parking.

Went here on a date night for our anny. Made reservations and luckily we made it on time. No issues being seated right away as soon as we entered the door. Prior to coming I added it was our anniversary.

I came here Sunday night for my birthday dinner, we had a reservation for 9, arrived early and were seated. The service was great! I didn't love the seating, since we were seated by a window that people just stared at us while they walked by. It really wasn't that bad.

My husband and I were on a  trip to our new home in Hawaii when we stopped in San Francisco so we could visit his family. A few of his childhood friends wanted to take us to the Stinking Rose while we were there and I had such a fun time. I had never been to San Fran before but was instantly head over heels for the culture and spirit of the city.

What happen to this place? I came her a couple years ago and had a great experience. Came here last week after making a reservation on Yelp through open table. Checked in with receptionist and was seated within a couple minutes.  Everything ordered was off. Bread was not the same as years ago. We ordered the Bagna Calda and it was overdone. I also ordered the 40 clove chicken but it was skimpy and overcooked. Mashed potatoes tasted like instant from a box. Garlic ice cream tasted like it was freezer burned with ice crystals over it. Overall I will not be revisiting.
On a trip to the city we took the stinking rose to the test. Just looking for a quick bite, we went for the roasted Garlic in a hot tub bath and had some cocktails.

One of the best restaurants I've eaten at!  The atmosphere is great.  You can actually have a nice conversation while eating.  The food is fabulous!  I'll definitely go back if ever in San Francisco again.

I love garlic, so this was the place to come.  Started with the Bagna Calda "Gralic Soaking in a Hot Tub" large soft cloves of garlic roasted and served in an olive oil bath, very good on the well made focaccia rolls provided.  Went on to a small order of mussels with drawn butter.  The mussels were very garlicky duh, and were also loaded with large soft garlic cloves.  Both of these dishes were satisfying.  Split the Arugula salad which came out way to fast.  It was a healthy portion.  The salad was well made, but the arugula was not as spicy as I like.  Main course consisted of the lamb shank and the short ribs.  Bothe were very good, well cooked tender and falling off the bone.  The protein was accompanied by garlic mash potatoes and creamed spinach, both of which (especially the creamed spinach) had a made in a military mess hall feel to them.  Acceptable but still not on spot.

Came here on a Friday afternoon for lunch.  1:30.  Crowd already dissapated?  Should have taken that as a sign but I'm still glad I tried it so now I can check it off the bucket list of restaurants to try.  Wasn't great, wasn't bad. Just so-so.  Expensive for what you get. Too many good restaurants in close vicinity  to come back here again.

This place has a nice ambience, no doubt. I wish i could give half stars because I really can't decide on three or four. But the truth is, restaurants are for food and the food I had was a little disappointing. I've always heard such raving reviews about the "famous Stinking Rose" but everything was just...average.
