The bread at the beginning was good, but the garlic pesto stuff they give you with it was wayyyy too garlic-y (I get that it's a garlic restaurant but taste is still a factor!) I had fondue as an appetizer, which was super cheesy but had great flavor. Unfortunately, it wasn't melted or hot enough when we got it. For an entree I chose to add prawns to fettuccini with a garlic and some kind of herb butter sauce. The prawns weren't really cooked right, they were all rubbery! And the pasta didn't have enough sauce on it. The herb flavor in the butter was forgettable because I couldn't really taste it. I'm glad I tried this place. The house Chardonnay was pretty good. For one hundred dollars and everlasting garlic breath...this place is more of an experience than a restaurant you would want to be a regular of.

One of the top 5 best restaurants in the San Fransisco area...I have been here many times and each time the food is the best and the service is outstanding , I would recommend that you make it a must eat at place when you are in the city ...
I brought the switch up to the manager and he tried to deny it but once I explained the difference in taste and texture and showed him I knew what I was talking about he never denied it.

Let me start my review by letting Frank Reyes, the business manager, know the date and time of my experience so he won't ask after reading my less than flattering review. Nov 9, 2014 and we were seated to eat at 6:00. Our waiter's name escapes me but he appeared to be hispanic and was husky with dark hair and a beard.

This restaurant came highly recommended by Facebook friends, and I feel that we weren't disappointed. Although I don't tend to eat a lot of Italian (especially not gnocchi), I was very happy with both the food and the service.

Having bday dinner with wife, not sure should I recommend this place or not. Reason? No one come to us and ask if anything is ok or not after we meal is served, but the waitress went and ask the table next to us to offer offer service(we r Asian, not sure it had anything to do with it or not, next table is white folks, same to the table behind),ask if they need to refill water or not when our cups is empty, what is going on here?!?!?? So it ruined my bday mood..............
We really, really enjoyed this place.
VISITED: ~early May 2014.

Had a cool "garlic experience" ... Made a reservation for three via OpenTable on Yelp = so easy! Upon arriving at the restaurant, there was NO wait = perfecto. The place wasn't all that busy for a Monday night.

It was crazy busy with a lot of people waiting to get seated when we arrived for dinner. We made reservations online prior to coming but we still had to wait about 20 min. Glad service was friendly and prompt. The Zuppa di Pesce was excellent.  The BBQ Garlic Chicken Pizza was okay.

I can't believe this restaurant received such great reviews! My party of four all ordered different items and they were all sub-standard. First of all we made reservations several days before and when we checked in the guy wrote us on the list with a 15 minute wait. I heard him tell the people in front of us the same thing.

Great menu. My prime rib steak was literally like BUTTER. My garlic crab was big and filling, my mash potatoes infused with garlic was the best! I loved my entire meal! The garlic shrimp was tasty beyond expectation and the appetizer garlic dip stuff was HELLA bomb!

Garlic galore! Very tasty dishes, quick service...and needless to say garlic is in EVERYTHING (so you can't go wrong if you're a garlic fan). Caution, if you take leftovers home, which you will probably do since portions are very generous, be prepared to pop in some baking soda in the fridge at the same time--the smell the morning after is overpowering!

Though the place can give off an "Applebee's" style atmosphere because of the all wall art, I can assure you that both food and the service are spectacular. They offer OpenTable reservations, however anytime I've visited the reservation wasn't required (I still do it to avoid having to wait for a table). The Stinking Rose has a spectacular bowl of spaghetti and meatballs (not on the menu, just ask), the meatloaf is awesome and the roasted garlic in olive oil is a classic but the mediocre bread leaves a bit to be desired. Don't skip the garlic ice cream, you'll be pleasantly surprised.

I'm going to edit this review when I go back because I really feel like I didn't pick the right meal. I'm not willing to give up on getting the perfect garlic meal! It's a bit pricey, but even with being a little disappointed, I still thought that the pasta I got was really good, but not nearly as garlicky as I was expecting. We got a pizza, that was pretty good, too. They have this great selection of hot sauces by the entrance, and we took two of them home, one of them was from the Pain is Good Batch (something like that) and it is now one of my favorite hot sauces.

Went on a Saturday nite...and it was hoppin'.  UCLA was in town to play Cal, so there were more tourists in town than usual...mainly hitting up the strip clubs across the way.  Parking is a nightmare downtown, regardless of the work on the Chinatown/North Beach muni.  I would Flywheel, Uber or Lyft it there...or take public trans.  Reservations are a must year-round for this spot!  Great decor and atmosphere....waiter and support staff were johnny-on-the-spot with everything.  The table and chairs could be cleaner...a bit sticky.  Food was great....garlic is awesome anyway.  Sadly didnt make it to the dessert round yet again.
Try the pasta soooooo gooood! Great food we can't stop raving about it definitely going to be coming in next time we visit the main land

Service was great, overpriced food. Waiters and bus staff are excellent and attentive to your every need.  The food though is overpriced for the small portions that are served. A great tourist spot, but as a  local I doubt I will be back.
i will start off by saying that this review is based on service and hospitality, not food, as we did not have the opportunity to eat at the restaurant.

A long line and a little bit expensive, but it was worth it. Seafood was fresh and their prime ribs were nice and juicy. Waiters took a little while to get to us, but hey, they are really busy at night. Overall, their service, food and the restaurant in general was great.

Came in tonight for dessert and drinks late night and sat at the bar.  Yaneth, the bartender was SO sweet and helpful.  Carelle also hooked us up.  They both gave us little samples of the pickled garlic, garlic wine and the chopped garlic oil with bread to dip.  They went out of their way to make our short experience a pleasant one.  These girls were amazing!!!

The food is good, especially if you like garlic. My meatloaf was so-so, but the spinach it came with was great. The other entrees my party had were tasty. The birthday celebration put on by the employees was fun.
Whenever friends from out of town come to visit, and they want to visit North Beach, I have to take them to the Stinking Rose. Garlic + good italian food = AMAZING!

Great restaurant.. I don't even know where to start. Me n my husband make reservations all the time n one time made it 15 late. When we got there, they took us right away(10 mins). Drinks there are reasonable.. But let me start with the food..not big fan of the bread, but the spread is bomb. Double shrimp double crab (what me n hubby get to share) is the best seafood by far in the city, the garlic sauce cannot be any better and the butter lemon sauce is perfection..definitely recommend this place to every one who loves garlic

I have wanted to try this place out for so long and I know that sometimes they get very busy and you should probably make a reservation, but I got lucky on a Thursday night and got a table right away with my two spontaneous girl friends. :)

Cool concept. Seating area was really cool, booths with striped curtains. Ordered the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and got incredibly sick that night. I am a garlic lover and was so excited for everything to be extra garlicy but to be honest, it's not as garlicy as everyone makes it out to be.

The food was good but the service lacked a little. It was a Saturday night so they could have been busy. I liked the booths and how it makes the dinner more intimate. The parking want too bad and I was able to find parking within a couple minutes.

Let me start by saying the service here sucks. Harsh, abrupt, rude, and unhelpful to say the very least. Food used to be good here but unfortunately this place has taken a long long trip down hill since the good old days. The prime rib (which used to be their signature dish) was flavorless, dry, and not cooked properly. Everyone at our table asked for medium and they all came well done. The meat was bland, bone dry, unappealing to taste and touch, and ridiculously expensive for the lack of quality.  Will not be back again.
My boyfriend has this strange obsession with garlic and onions while I just am not fond of it at all... I went with him anyways as he was done with midterms and needed a treat.

Boy did my breathe kick for days after... but it was worth it. All I'll say is that the prime rib was solid. I ordered it with trepidation that I might not enjoy it as much as HOPR but quickly that doubt vanished with the first bite of the main course. Not only was the prime rib legit but the accompaniments (garlic mash & creamed spinach) were a pleasant surprise. AND the food heated up well the next day! My wife on the other hand didn't care too much for her pasta dish but I would come back without caution. Stank breath or not... I'm coming for that prime rib!
Amazing food and awesome experience!!
Despite being my boyfriend's favorite restaurant.. I found this place to be outdated and serving heavy meals.

name: The Stinking Rose - A Garlic Restaurant

reviews.text: Came here after visiting the fishermen's wharf and returning a bike at a garage right next door.  This place has a good mix of both Japanese and Korean food.  We ordered the special ramen ( which is the tonkotsu ramen) and some sushi.
I am not very impressed by the food quality. The taste and the freshness of the food are just average. But just to be fair, I only had lunch there. But I suspect dinner would be much better.
Friendly staff. Really fresh fish served and farmer's market fruit as a side. A must have is the marinated red snapper special.
Decent japanese food. Nothing really stood out though. The tonkatsu was softer than I expected and it looked similar to my friend's oyakodon.

My husband and I were both satisfied with the Japanese/Vietnamese food choices. He had beef pho and I had a sashimi plate along with miso soup and a salad. My husband said the pho was wonderfully comforting and full of flavor. My sushi was fresh, though the cuts were quite thick. We had a lot of fun watching the sushi chef and had a ton of fun with the wait staff. At one point, I dropped my chopstick. Our waitress came over and said in jest, "That is it. You are done! No more soup for you!" She then graciously got me another set of chopsticks. I didn't go with a five star review because my mind wasn't blown, but if we lived here, we would certainly become regulars!
To be fair the food was decent.   The quality of food was not worth the cost though.
Great sushi! I went in alone but definitely wasn't lonely. The staff helped me select a sake and some amazing rolls. Very fresh sushi, great service, great company and good prices!
We only had the ramen, but it was completely underwhelming.  Completely flavorless.  I guess you shouldn't expect too much being in a touristy area.

Fake Asian food bothers me. I worry that most of the world goes through life having subpar bento boxes and sushi. I'm not exactly sure why Grandeho's has a stellar Yelp rating, given that there is much more decent Japanese cuisine in San Francisco. Food aside, Grandeho's does seem to be a family operation and the service was very attentive and kind.
Great, Great, Great Sushi.  Super Fresh Fish and the home style service was the best.
Gosh I was so disapointed.

The sushi chef was fabulous! Such a friendly kind man who created delicious food! I had sushi and ramen and I was not disappointed. If the sushi maker didn't have his day off today(Thursday) I would have been back there tonight! Delicious, and very friendly people!

It's a decent place if you're craving Japanese food, but it's by no means great. The selections are pretty limited, and the quality of the food is just what I would expect from a tourist location. The service was pretty slow, even though the restaurant was barely half filled. Overall, a solid "meh".

Delicious sushi and great service. I am picky about sushi and sake and service, and this place met all the criteria. Fresh scallop sushi was excellent along with the other nigiri sushi and maki ordered. Hot sake was great and not expensive. Very attentive wait staff. We called ahead and our table was ready for our group of 10 when we arrived.

I guess I'm spoiled when it comes to Ramen and Udon. The noodles here in both soups were over cooked and the soups only had ok flavor. We ordered a spicy ramen and when it came out with regular miso broth they apologized and took it back. They brought it back two minutes later with a dash of red pepper mix on top. The salad that came with my sons bento box was amazing and the soft boiled egg was cooked perfectly. The service was great and the bathrooms were amazingly tidy. However our bill for four of us with no dessert, appetizer, or alcohol was over a hundred dollars. With so many amazing places to get ramen in SF don't waste your money here.

Good ramen, but they were so stingy! I'm used to ramen around the $10 price range, but they only gave me 1 piece of meat on my tonkatsu ramen. A few of my friends ordered ramen with a few more ingredients, but their ramen came out the exact same as mine.
Cool cozy little place just up the hill from the Buena Vista.  Cool location and great food!
After a long day biking from Fisherman's Wharf to Sausalito and then taking the ferry back, this was a great way to end the journey. It's also next to the bike shop, so how convenient!
Menu is simple but the food has a clean, crisp flavor. Our party of six were well feed and in my opinion the prices were not bad. Definitely recommend.
Probably the best sushi I have ever had! Incredibly fresh, cozy place, and reasonably priced. The owner could not be nicer! My new favorite sushi spot!
Food was fantastic!  Super fresh! Service was great! Family owned! Highly recommend!!

Stumbled upon this cute little place by accident and what a surprise. After a day of sight seeing on the Pier with my urbane and hip daughter we were both pleasantly surprised to find a place to eat on the way back to the car. The place was clean and pleasantly relaxed, a rewarding respite to the other places just a block down the street. She ordered the Bento Box, well presented and generous helping for one(I ate the leftovers). I ordered the special Ramen and was presented with a pleasant mix of ingredients well balanced and tasty. I thought pricing was very reasonable for the area.  Good service in a very relaxed atmosphere. A must do after a day around the pier. Have recommended it to my best friends.  Don't miss out on this San Francisco hidden gem!

I traveled to San Francisco for business but also wanted to try the food! I chose to walk everywhere so when I was running low on energy from the insanely steep sidewalks I stopped in Grandeho's Kamekyo. The food was good and the fish tasted great and very fresh. My phone was also low on battery and my only source around the city so thankfully the waitress charged it for me! Great food and service. It was a little spendy for the food I thought but it is right next to the beach so I'm sure tourists look for a close eatery regardless of the money. See my photo for the food presentation!

After reading the reviews... I was looking forward to trying this restaurant.. After hiking up the huge San Francisco hills to get here.. Lights were out, and there was a sign on the door that said they are closed for the winter... Its only Autumn! Fail!!
Cons: Expensive & food is lacking

The restaurant was very good. It had a very solid menu and the sushi was all very good; the spicy seafood was good; could have actually used a little more spiciness. The clay sizzling pot special was okay - it was a bit bland and the rice seemed overcooked. The staff were all very friendly and respectful and the bathroom was very well kept. The Udon soup was very good and well done. We will be back. We brought out of town family; they were used to very greasy Chinese and mediocre sushi and they didn't appreciate it as much as we did. The

me and the fiancee played hometown tourists yesterday, but we couldn't pull the trigger on chowder in a bread bowl so we ate just far enough away from the pier that the real tourists thought they were getting a non-tourist experience.
Some of the freshest sushi I have had. If you like it plain and simple nigiri is the way to go, this place is great.

We made a bad choice walking into this place. We should have known better because it was completely empty during the dinner, happy hour rush time.  The Sushi chef has no personality.  The food was not to brag about, and for the price it makes it for a very disappointing experience.  :(

The cost of the food is ridiculous compared to other Wharf eateries. I used to eat here two times a week with coworkers, but now the prices are sky high (three of my fave dishes nearly doubled in price) and splitting a check is like asking for their firstborn son. I've found awesome alternatives for half the price. See Darren's Cafe
We actually ended up here as an alternative to a bar -- and of course, I suggested it, as I hadn't had dinner yet :)

Excellent food!  I had a bento lunch box which had enough food to feed at least two people.  I choose the lemon tofu (spicy and delicious) and sashimi (melt in your mouth tuna).  My husband had a spicy salmon roll and crunch roll - both were amazing!

Excellent! Many of the reviews raved about the hamachi, and it was the best sashimi we tried.  The Alaska roll was delicious too. The service was awesome, with a very friendly and attentive staff. I was pleasantly surprised at the end of our meal with a small orange peel bowl of fresh fruit.  A neighborhood gem, great experience!
Awesome Sushi.
Me: "Is the owner Japanese or Vietnamese?"  { I'm not eating sushi served by a Vietnamese or phô by a Japanese. That ain't right. }
Japanese, Korean and Vietnamese all served in one restaurant?!?!  Doesn't get any better than that!
some of my dishes were excellent and others were salty and oily.
The sushi was so so, the Hamachi Kama was good, and the dessert, fried banana with mango ice cream was HELLA good. I would go again just for dessert, but I would go to other places for sushi.
Awesome sushi with really great yellow tail. Good kimchi too.

Best homemade kimchi and grilled Saba I have taste around Fishermen's Wharf. Friendly service and they even gave a free nicely decorated fruit  dessert for my boy. Happy boy= Happy dad = satisfy customer as long as serving great food! Will definitely come again when we visit SF
We had seen this was highly reviewed on Yelp and seemed to offer the ambiance and drink selection we were looking for last Friday to continue our Halloween pub crawl. However, we were mistaken.
BEST MACARONI AND CHEESE I EVER HAD
La Folie Lounge is absolutely fabulous if you want to grab drinks with friends/date or want a peek/sample of La Folie's food.

This place is fantastic. The deviled eggs, truffled popcorn, lobster mac & cheese, and lobster croque monsieur are all amazing. The atmosphere is romantic and swanky. You can order off of the regular La Folie menu as well.
I hope this place never gets a Michelin star b/c it certainly doesnt deserve it. Gary Danko out ranks this poser in every aspect so take a walk down the hill, you wont regret it.
Good service, ambience and wine. The Mac and cheese was perfect - not too saucy or salty. Burrata and truffle popcorn were also great.

Having just moved to San Francisco from San Diego I have made a large list of my must try places in the city based off various recommendations.  When my best friend from home texted me to meet her for drinks at La Folie Lounge, I was pleasantly excited as this was a place on my list! My fiancé and I met her and the guy is seeing at the Lounge around 6pm and grabbed a table by the window, when we first arrived the lounge was not crowed just yet, but by the time we left around 8:30 it became packed.  We enjoyed two rounds of drinks, all which were of a nice quality and the atmosphere added to a joyful evening where you could carry on a pleasant conversation without having to shout as you do in some places.  We enjoyed a bowl of the truffle popcorn and my girlfriend and I watched it being made from our seats and just wanted more! I am excited to go back and try out the other wines and cocktails and even some bar bites.
This place is one of those few, rare, perfect bars that has everything - EVERYTHING - you are looking for on a weekend night:

I recently moved to SF and live one block away. I find myself visiting the lounge more frequently then I probably should but the staff make it all worthwhile! Whether after a long day of work or before going out on the town on a weekend, this a great lounge for a more sophisticated atmosphere. Jay has changed my life when it comes to vodka and how I drink cocktails now. Graham is always great to chat with. Aaron brings a whole new meaning to the art of creating beautiful plates. This will continue to be my "regular" spot as long as I'm living in SF. Thanks guys for always a great experience.
Special night out; amazing service and food. Special touch meeting chef/owner Roland!

One of the only (possibly THE only) lounge a lady can get a good drink around here! When I think of Polk Street, memories of bar golf and game day come to mind. Well now, thanks to La Folie, when the girls and I want to catch a chic drink and dress up a little, we can count on them! Jason (bartender) was vibrant, fun and passionate about his craft. I didn't see a drink on the menu that spoke to me, and he was able to make me the exact drink I was craving. It was delicious!

Funtastic wine bar for adults who want to chat, catch up, share foods and all in a great ambience. Truffled eggs, lil sky high burgers and a Ahi tartare that sent us swooning made for  great after work meal. Stars galore for the attentive waiter/bartender who never let us down. I must return to savor their Creme Brulee!
Just went here the other day with a friend. Great ambiance to hang out and relax or even have a date. reasonable
Great for glass of wine with a friend (not group/friends).  Sometimes hard to find seating and hard to hear, but great intimate setting with great service.
Makes great drinks, but they are a bit on the pricey side.  The cheese selection is awesome and the ability to access some of the tasty bites from next door is great as well.
Liked this quaint / swank lounge next door to the restaurant.

Small but fancy bar on Polk. You can often find a diversity of age groups here which I like, but it is definitely on the older or lets just say more refined crowd. A nice change of pace for the typical Polk street bro fest.
I love the seating here--lots of comfy couches. Good date spot!
Put your fancy pants on and spend a little money.

This place can be a nice change of pace from some of the more divey bars up and down Polk St.  It generally seems to be a little bit older and nicer dressed crowd.  I used to really like this place when you could get the Foie Gras sampler from the Restaurant next door, but with the ban in effect, that's gone.
Cozy lounge next to La Folie restaurant - this is the perfect spot for an after dinner drink. Or stop in for truffle popcorn. truffle lobster mac & drinks as an appetizer (or dinner!)

There's "intimate" and then there's sitting so close to random people its hard to have a private conversation.  I expected a little more than just a hodge podge of couches for people to sit around. It felt more like I was sitting at a Occupy SF demonstration than a lounge. Some structure, please!
Pluses:

We dropped in for a pre-dinner drink at the restaurant portion and it's nice small lounge. Solid drinks and if you don't want to pay for the full experience at La Folie they do have bar bites you can order. I can say if this place hits capacity it wouldn't be so loungy. But if its mellow it's a nice spot. Decent cocktails but they do charge high end prices for the cocktails but I didn't feel like the cocktails measured up to that level. Otherwise it's a very nice place.

I like it here. The first couple times the truffle popcorn smell overwhelmed me but I've grown to tolerate it. I love truffle but it needs to be used sparingly or it becomes too pedestrian! Nice lounge, good wine/champ, great people watching or for a romantic sip at the bar.
I'm new to the area, but friends insisted on La Folie for our Farewell to Foie Gras dinner - we couldn't get a table in at La Folie, so we settled for the Lounge instead - great choice!
food 5* service 1*
Last night, stop #2 of Foie Gras Fest was the La Folie Lounge for their Au Revoir Foie menu (yes I stole the name from them, couldn't help it).
Expensive as hell!  If not for the foie gras, this place is just too expensive to come back!  The drinks were okay and expensive.  The ambience is loud.  People are dressed very nicely.

This place was wonderful. So wonderful, in fact, that we made anther reservation for dinner for later in the month before we were done with our dinner. The service was excellent and even the bus boys were informative. We arrived 40 minutes early and they easily accommodated us.

Came back here again, this time my sister treated me for my birthday.  Ate less this time since we at least got to try a lot of the items in the menu we wanted to try before, but everything's still good as ever.

Truffle Popcorn was AMAZING! We couldn't stop eating it. The Moscow Mules were also quite delicious. It is a great little spot with nice servers and comfy seating (kind of open seating so you may make some new friends while you are here.) Drink prices were pretty normal for a nice place in San Francisco.
La Folie Lounge.  I could be here every week.  Truffled popcorn, gougeres, deviled eggs and yummy cocktails.  All this after dinner!  I am coming back again and again.

Wow, this place is a gem! My boyfriend and I were headed to Gary Danko for our anniversary dinner and since we were running ahead of schedule he proposed popping into the neighborhood lounge at La Folie. Being that we were dressed up and hadn't tried La Folie (the lounge or restaurant), I was on board! Knowing the pricing at La Folie and having looked at the restaurant tasting menu, I half expected lounge prices to be a pretty accurate reflection of that.
If I could give this place zero stars, I would. The only reason I am giving it one is because Yelp doesn't allow for zero stars, and the truffle popcorn was really good.
My galpals and I scored a small table! Do NOT come here with more than 4 people. It will be impossible to find a seat.
A wonderful, but somewhat slow experience.

I'd been to the restaurant years ago but the Lounge is new since I last lived in SF.  Great place to stop for very good higher-end cocktails, decent wine list, and surprisingly good nibbles.  I imagine the crowd differs on weeknights vs. the weekends but overall I was impressed with the cozy space and would stop here again. Good date spot.
$140 for 3 small apps and 4 martinis.

We walked into La Folie for a drink before a dinner reservation across the street. The interior really lacked personality, a few lounge seats gathered around coffee tables overlooked the cute neighborhood through the picture window. The walls were adorned with what appeared to be calendar photography and while dimly lit the place didn't feel very intimate.

Im just a poor art student who one night stumbled upon this small establishment one night. I had just been bar hopping around columbus, and wanted one more drink before i went to go meet some friends at a different place. I noticed this place out of the corner of my eye and i had a quick look at the menu. My eyes immediately noticed   this place served sausage rolls.

Melt! is exactly what it purports to be--a French style cafe that does a reasonable, cheap fondue streetside. Great place for a girl's meal or a funky date, tasty but not fancy. I've been a few times, and will go back.

My goodness. This was my first time ever trying fondue and I fell in love. The lady behind the counter (sorry I forgot her name) was extremely courteous and helpful. We went on a Wednesday night and it was a few other folks in there enjoying their food. My date (who shall remain nameless) dropped the bread bowl and we all had a good laugh. The price is pretty cheap also. We spent $62 on 4 hard ciders, the cheese fondue,  and the sausage wrap.

Each year on my mom's birthday (she passed away few years ago) I go somewhere special for dinner. Since she loved fondue, I thought Melt would be a good option. When I called to make a reservation, the man who answered accused me of continually calling and hanging up. Then, when I explained I had never called before he said very angrily, "yeah right - whatever - just come in and use your groupon." I did not have a groupon, had not called before and his rude, poor customer service added insult to injury. I decided not to eat there and don't plan to in the future.

I stumbled upon Melt when strolling around on a Tuesday evening before the dinner rush.  It was quiet with just a couple guys drinking wine at the bar.  We were lured in by the sign on the street advertising the roasted garlic and brie plate.  It was a great pre-dinner treat with a glass of wine apiece.  The price seemed reasonable, the wine was good, and the brie and garlic plate was tasty.  The restaurant was tiny and cute, they advertised live jazz music later in the evening that I'm sure would be delightful with a glass of wine and a cheese plate.  If I had more time in the city I'd be interested in returning to try the cheese fondue - yum!

What was I thinking?  Was I really expecting a real Swiss fondue?   Well. I'm sorry to tell that wasn't the case,  I guess that for the local crowed that haven't travelled to Switzerland. They re happy.  I mean the quality is there ok ambiance during lunch. But the owner wasn't caring less that we where happy or not.  Won't go there again too many greater places around.

Had so much fun at Melt and the food was very good (except the fondue). There was a cool jazz band and everyone got into the music...dancing, singing.  We ordered and then order some more: sausage roll (really small...more like an appetizer) and melted cheese sandwich with a simple salad. This was perfect, so tasty...but we were still hungry so we ordered a small savory fondue. I've had much better fondue...there wasn't much flavor to it and a bit grainy. The bread was soft so it fell apart in the hot cheese...you really need a hard crusty or toasted bread for fondue. It was nice that it came with apples and grapes too though. We won't order the fondue again but we will be back...it was super fun and delicious otherwise!

It was mid-afternoon on a Saturday, and it turns out that's an awkward time to get food on Columbus St. in North Beach. Most places either close between lunch and dinner, or they just serve dinner on weekends. We just wanted a snack and a drink within walking distance of the hotel. Our first choice and second choice places were both closed, so we wandered further down and found this place.
We had a great time at Melt! Wednesday night at their weekly open mic. The food and beverages are delicious and the owner John was so friendly!

I bought a groupon for 4 and took my best friend and her boyfriend there for her birthday thinking wow this place is cool its in my hood and the site is awesome it has foreign cinema nite and the last tine i was there they had a 4 page menu
Make a reservation-- seating is very limited and the dining area is small

This place is pretty damn pricey for what it is. I wouldn't return without a Groupon, and DON'T come with the intention of having fondue as a meal.. that isn't fair, haha. This is one of those places where you come for the experience, so let's leave it at that (I doubt most people have fondue pots)
I came here once cuz I love cheese fondue and I was not impressed. The place is cramped.  The cheese and oil or whatever it was were separated in the pot... disappointing

My wife and I were wrapping up a wonderful weekend in San Francisco and were looking for some wine and a light bite late on Sunday evening.  We started out at Sweeties for a couple of drinks which was a great little dive bar with cool guest dogs, but not really a place for food.
My girlfriend and I cashed in a Groupon for some fondue at this place.  Everything tasted great, but the service was horrible.
This place is so awkward at night, with terrible musicians trying to sell their album. During the day, the food is nothing special and the owner is a massive tool

Grabbed a large fondue special Groupon. Hubby and I enjoyed a traditional Swiss fondue for lunch, complete with grapes, apples, and a large bowl of cut up bread. Oh, and a bottle of wine (which we brought home).  I love a good fondue, and while it was good, they were a little heavy handed with the wine in the cheese - for my taste.  Hubby thought it was really good.

I am writing about a very bad experience I had trying to redeem a Groupon at this establishment. My husband and I were very excited to have some fondue. We arrived at approximately 7:30 and sat ourselves at a table. There was one man working and he didn't even make eye contact when we came in. We sat there for about 15 minutes, and my husband walked up to the counter and asked the man working for a menu so we could order some fondue (we used the word fondue, specifically). He was very rude to my husband and said "it's going to be a while". At this point there were only two other tables with guests at the restaurant and one of them had just received a plate of fondue. We sat for another 15 minutes and my husband approached the counter again. At that time, the man said "I told your husband it would be a while". We told him we had picked out a fondue and that we were ready to order. He then said, unapologetically, that there was no fondue left and that the kitchen was closed. We expressed our disbelief, given we had been sitting for over 30 minutes with clear intentions to order fondue and that this was never told to us.
I don't know if anywhere else sums up North Beaches old guard more than this least assuming wine and cheese spot in the universe.

Discovered this place on Groupon after The Melting pot wouldn't let us use the groupon voucher on the ENTIRE valentines day week... When that's exactly why we bought it..Ridiculous... That's a whole bother review in itself.....
Cute place with delicious fondue & friendly staff. We tried the Scrumpy Welsh Rarebit, followed by the chocolate - great stuff! Will definitely be back soon!

Ducked in here one late afternoon with my sister and her beau to grab a glass of wine. The ambiance was lovely as there was a band who was playing low key music at a volume you didn't have to scream over. It was the right kind of vibe when hanging out with family and wine.

I went for a free comedy night that they have on Monday's, it was ok. As expected, some of the comedians were actually pretty good, some were pretty bad. The fondu looked pretty good, but we didnt try any. Drinks were very reasonably priced. I would recommend popping in to see what its all about if you're in the area and looking for a free comedy show.

After talking with the guy who answered the telephone tonight we opted NOT to eat at Melt and WILL NOT be going there in the future.  The staff is FRIENDLY and COURTEOUS at Matterhorn and that's where we'll go.

Went here through Groupon. No problems using the groupon! The food was good but their menu is limited. The portions were decent too. The only reason I wouldn't go back is the location. My hubby and I don't care to go to Russian Hill because of parking.
It might just be the fact that I LOVE meat and feel incomplete without meat during my meal, but I just wasn't satisfied. In comparison to the Melting Pot, this was place wasn't the greatest.
Purchased a groupon for the desert fondue, as my boyfriend is not a cheese fan, and I'm glad I only paid $10 instead of the supposed $20 that it was worth or I would of been highly unsatisfied.
Purchased a Groupon deal for Melt and am glad that we did because full price would not have made me happy!

Only came here because I thought we got a good deal on groupon. We came on a weekend during the day. We received no acknowledgement that we were there. They have dirty table cloths. A woman wearing a back pack came to took our order. We had no idea she was even a waitress. Their bathroom was disgusting. Their fondue was just ok. 2 stars for the free live jazz.
It was ok. Did not live up to the reviews at all. We tried to order 3 different things and they were out of all of them. Not worth a second visit.
Two stars is actually being too nice... More like 1.5.

I decided to burn off all my calories I had been eating on my business trip by walking back and forth from the Fisherman's Wharf to the convention center.  This little place caught my eye several times on the walk, and I had to stop in after I read the menu.

The king (Me) says: melted cheese with bread is one big fat ohhhhh hell yeah. The service was kind and generous. The groupon made it even more  worthwhile. A glass of mulled red wine made the chilly night easier for my San Diego sensitive genes. Stout cheese fondue was flavorful and creamy. Jazz was played very well. Smallness of restaurant made it cozy.

The guys who  worked there were really cool and helpful and the fondue is made on a butane burner right up front.  I could have used a little more flavor as we got the swiss, but I was overall still pretty happy.  The had a good selection of beer and wine.  We opted for the large which came with two salads, plent of bread, apples, and grapes.  They cut the apple right when you order to it is nice a fresh.  I would like to go back and try to rarebit.

Went to Melt for the first time for a date with my boyfriend. We had really been looking forward to eating here because we love fondue and it's only a few blocks away from our apartment. Though, after this experience, I will never go back & will make sure none my friends do either.
Great atmosphere and food. I bought several Groupons prior to a trip to San Fran and this was one. Cute little place. I recommend you try the dessert fondue with the house red wine.

Not sure why so many people are whining!   The service was wonderful, staff attentive and it was semi-busy on the fourth of July.  Melt! served me the best french onion soup I've ever had in my life- it is one of my favorites so I've had it at a lot of places!  The soup was flavorful and full of stuff!  No watered down soup here.  I have never had fondue before but my husband and I choose the small Rarebit.  We were pleasantly surprised that the meal came with a side salad for each of us.  The fondue tasted great and it was very fun to eat!  We couldn't even finish all the cheese and bread.  If traffic/parking was better, I'd come here a lot more!  I can only imagine how great the chocolate fondue must be.
Waste of time.

Went in at 7pm on a Friday night, surprisingly when we got there it wasn't that busy yet! (Yes! Beat the crowd!) i decided to not order the cheese fondue and just went with a tuna melt sandwich, brie and roasted garlic plate, and the chocolate fondue for dessert.

I was here for the Monday comedy show.  Never heard of Melt before but I am coming back for the fondue. It smelled so good. And I asked the audience how it was. They loved. So this should count as 30 reviews. And this place is super charming in looks and vibe.
Decided one day why not try to use eat 24 and order me up some Indian food.
fried food is awful.

Worst bar in San Francisco and the entire SF Bay Area for that matter. If you want to be treated like garbage and sit at a bar that has the occasional roach walk by or actually on your beverage, then this is the right place for you. The staff is rude, sarcastic and under the grand delusion that they are the only bar in the city so you'll get service when they feel like it
We wandered in here one day late night. Who knew you could combine an Irish bar with an indian restaurant? However, it totally works.
Kennedy's stinks of Indian food, beer, sweat and.. life generally.

Not sure what to think about this. Looks like a very open culture pub, not much Irish though. The Indian ood was ok and the beers can in time and tasted fine. The place seems to get a lot locals which makes it more like a home pub.
Chicken Tikka Masala. Whole wheat naan. BOMB every time.
Kennedy's is a perfect juxtaposition (word of the day!) of Indian food with an Irish pub. You can see the merger in things like their curry fries (yummm).

I was surprised by the quality of the Indian food.  We shared chicken curry (amazing), lamb khorma, and a shrimp dish (with lots of chopped spinach).  The curry was really, really good with just a tinge of heat.  Loved it.  The khorma was good but not as good as the curry.  The shrimp (wish I could remember the name) was good but the spinach was a bit overpowering for me.  We also had a couple different nans that were great.  I would so gladly eat here again as it was the best Indian I've eaten in the States (sorry, it's nowhere near as good as UK/Ireland).  We arrived at 1830 and had a couple $4 Guinnesses.  Sweet!  Bummer that they ran out of Guinness when we tried to get a second round.  I mean, how does an Irish pub run out of Guinness?  Kennedy's is really eclectic inside.  An Irish pub with a LOT of on-tap beer, a great Indian restaurant, and pool tables/video games all in one place.  Very strange mix of stuff but it works.

Having been going to Kennedy's for many many years. They have great beer selection and sometimes offer really good pitcher specials. They always have local games on, the back deck is a great place for weekend afternoons and the food is fantastic as well.
" Why you got to be so rude, I'm human too..."

It's an Irish pub with a great selection of beers and a curry house with decent dive bar Indian food.  When you're catch'n a buzz and in the mood for something different it doesn't get better than that.  There is no table service.  You have to go to the bar to get your beers and walk up to a cashier to order your food, but they will help you bring it to your table.  For being in the city it was very reasonably priced.  We got 2 orders of vegetable samosas, Onion bhaji, Paneer Pakora, Paneer Masala Dosa, chaat (can't remember what kind but it was awesome), and one other item.  All of the food was only around $40!  It was my sister's birthday so they also brought her out Galub Jamun, which are cheese balls deep fried in honey syrup, with a candle on the house!  The staff was awesome and totally friendly.  The place itself it just cool.  It's a good size, with cozy bar, dining area, other eating areas with pool tables and air hockey and a patio.  You can just hang out all night.  By the way, they only accept cash at the bar, but have an ATM on site.  You can use your credit/debit card to purchase food.
Back for seconds little house dine in ;)
Cool place. Indian food, games, pool, sports games.  Odd though, I thought it would be super busy on a Friday night but its not. So its easy to get drinks and grab a table. I would come here again.

The Indian place inside Kennedy's has gotten way better. I ordered a chicken wrap the other night and it was some of the best Indian in the city. It's a total surprise. The guiness is usually pretty good. And the people can be pretty cool also.
Do not expect a classy, Pacific Heights joint.
Average Indian. Probably quantity over quality (but that seems the American way). Big beer selection. I would eat here for convenience only.
Good beer selection. Great happy hour.
"Meh. I've experienced better."
Umm why did it take so long for us to come here!!!
If 'dirty and stinky' had a face, this restaurant would be it. If you're a least bit concerned about hygiene, please don't even look there.
I love that they serve Indian food at an Irish bar! I ordered the vegetable wrap and ate in the bar while enjoying an IPA. So good!!  Great location and great service!
Every time I come to this place,  I have to see this short rude Asian bartender. I love the food here, but hate to see this guy.if they have good bartender I will give this place four stars..
Great butter chicken!

I have been going to Kennedy's for years and love every aspect. Cheap pitchers, TVs with sports and news, foosball AND pool, and the icing is that you can order amazing Indian dishes before 1am. Can be dive-y but have seen a few suits play a mean foosball match. This place is for everyone.

Indian cuisine is not my favorite cuisine, but this restaurant serves really good Indian food.  I was pleasantly surprised considering it's a pub as well.  I remember trying to get here a couple of years ago during the Giants run to the World Series but it was full to the rafters.

An Irish pub with Indian food. I know it sounds weird, and it is. However, they have a huge selection of beers, 2 for 1 for happy hour. They have a large bar, TVs, pool, big buck hunter and shuffleboard. As for the food, it is actually pretty good for cheap Indian food. They offer
Mediocre food. Good beer.
Small divey spot, with an Indian restaurant growing out of its middle.  WTF?  Anyhoo, its a solid choice for the beer list, happy hour specials, and location right across from bimbo's.

Where else other than San Francisco would their be an Irish Indian Pub fushion curry house open at midnight? I don't know but this place is great. I came here around 2 years ago, no idea why I'm just rating now. I'll update soon when I come back, but all I can remember is the live atmosphere and the spicy ass curry that I fell in love with.

We stumbled upon this place while wandering around North Beach, actually in search of another Irish bar in the neighborhood. Since we had been walking for a while and my Florida legs have not quite yet adapted to the San Francisco lifestyle, I needed a break - and a beer. We were pleasantly surprised to find that not only was Kennedy's a bar with an impressive beer list but apparently also an Indian restaurant?! Very odd combo, but I was game.
I'm a big fan of indian food but this was awful experience. Horrible service. Bad food and food poisoning after.
I wish I could give 0 star to this place as I believe 1 star is way too much for this place.

The food here is surprisingly good, considering it's actually a bar that serves Indian food. We came here for lunch on Sunday and the restaurant was empty, so I don't know if that is typically the case.
My shrimp tandoori wrap was so good I wanted to marry it.
Awesome beer selection for reasonable price.
An Irish Pub with Indian food... okay, why not??  Only in SF!

The bartender was great. The customers were awesome. The guitar player was enjoyable. What more can I say? We had a great time at this bar while visiting San Francisco!  The pours were heavy and the price was reasonable. Will definitely visit again if we are ever on the west coast!  Great time!

It's a place that's easy enough to have something to say about it. I've been to this place enough to feel like I have a solid opinion developed. The first time I went here I was confused and now when I go I am just accepting of the slexyness to be had here. Let me tell you about the disorienting aspects first and then maybe we'll get to the good stuff.  I wouldn't say there are things that are sour about this bar (and especially because I like sour things I don't want to use that word..speaking of which, NocNoc in the Haight always seems to have a sour beer available I'm pretty much guaranteed to like). I wouldn't say things are pushing it, even. Just a little disorienting for the sake of being confusing and, well, disorienting. Not in a "WOA did you see that over there?" Or "Isn't it weird humans have ears?" kinda disorienting way, just in a more....."I don't get it" sort of way. But then, I'm not super into playing pool and watching televisions at bars, so maybe it's me with the issue. Anyway, for your reference, there's lots of standing room, and in my experience, sitting down to have a drink is somewhat disastrous because there's not a lot of comfortable places to sit and it's hard to hear each other at that. There's a decent smoking section outside that makes this place look poppin'. So you walk in past that patio, a big huge atm, and into the actual bar area and theres a kick ass selection of beer. I highly recommend the Heretic Red Ale. The Red beers here are always good. It's dim lit, it can take a while to get a drink. The bartenders have never done me wrong though, they are working quick, sometimes it's just crowded. TVs all around with sports on. This place is pretty good for big groups, there is a little something for everyone looking to be somewhat rowdy. There's barstools around the bar and then in the back there's some large round tables besides the pool tables and a TV, last time I was here on Friday they were playing 300. Between the bar and this back area is a spot to order Indian food. There's also this funny room with lounge seating opposite the spot to order food, although it is more brightly lit than anywhere else. I think people sleep behind the bench seats sometimes - there's a ratchet mess behind them full of junk. I've only had the food once and I still haven't sat specifically in the designated dining area that is also a part of Kennedy's. I split an order of fried shrimp and smosas (erm...not my choice..) which were kinda dry but got the job done as far as bulky fried drunky food goes. The orders were pretty big, we ended up sharing with our table. Nothing about this place is sexy, but there's plenty of sloppy (more slexy: slutty/sexy than sexy). It's an interesting neighborhood, and, as other people mentioned, the ingenuity of indian food + irish pub is kind of striking. I've only met really standard characters here, standard in that bro-y sort of way, but what can one expect in North Beach? Oh, and my friend was standing in the smoking patio smoking a j and someone who works there (owner? maybe?) was standing there and sort of gestured for him to gtfo. I liked how he was chill about it but still held his ground. I've been other places where friends just get kicked out.

Dinner here does not disappoint, portions are of a generous size and are extremely tasty. Staff were friendly and attentive. Very reasonable price for the exceptional quality if the good, a return visit is in order

Came here for dinner when I first moved to sf. It was pretty disappointing, their breakfast burrito had almost no flavor yet the guy at the cash register told me it was one of their better items. The friends i came with were similarly disappointed, and we all got different things. Definitely not a place I'm interested in going back to

Seemed like a great little spot for a quick and casual breakfast. The breakfast sandwich was surprisingly bad - I would have rather had a reheated one from Starbucks across the street. Such good potential but bad execution. Get it together Crave!

I've only been to Crave for breakfast and it was delicious! it's a great place for a casual meal, nothing super elegant, but there waffles are great! and so are they're cookies! It's a cute place inside too!

Very poor job with breakfast. Got our simple order -- scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, and an English muffin -- wrong twice. They sent out the eggs alone, then hastily added some fatty, flabby bacon after we asked, then added the english muffin after we asked again. At that point the eggs, which were strange -- whites and yolks scrambled separately -- were cold, the bacon was flaccid, and the muffin plain. Didn't touch. The huevos rancheros was just fine, which brought them from 1 star to 2. Definitely won't be craving this place again.

We made the amateur mistake of attempting to get into Nick's Taco Tuesday on the night of a World Series game. Needless to say, we were relegated to Crave after waiting around for 15 minutes. It was entirely empty for dinner, which is unsurprising because it looks more like a lunch spot. I'm not a fan for one reason: Crave simply serves bad food.

I came here for lunch. For being a Sunday, it wasn't packed like other places - there were plenty of tables available. You order first at the counter and get a number. I was in the mood for a breakfast sammie, so I ordered an egg sandwich with the low fat cheddar and a sausage patty and the whole grain bread - sounds healthy! I was given a number and went to our table. My sammie took a while to get to me - I can't imagine it took that long to make. And there hadn't been any people in front of me, so it couldn't be that my order got backed up. And there weren't very many people eating inside the restaurant, so I find it hard to believe that they couldn't find me at my table, with my number visible.

The food is good but they screw up orders way too often.  If you order chicken sausage you'll get regular sausage.  Order wheat and you get white.  It's annoying - getting a breakfast sandwich order right just shouldn't be that difficult.

The girl at the counter basically ignored me and continued to chat with her coworker when I walked up. When she finally turned around, she barely greeted me and was extremely unfriendly during the entire transaction. My order was dine-in and they prepared it to-go instead. The coffee here is gross and the food is overpriced for what it actually is. There are plenty more options nearby that would be much more satisfactory and worth the money.

Man I've been coming here every so often for the split pea soup. The people here are nice and welcoming. I've never written a review because I feel like it should be reserved for good things to say. I'm always happy to come here and spend a little time. Thank you guys for being such a wonderful home welcoming staff.

I am eating at Crave regularly and i like it a lot ! Good food, good quality, original, reasonable prices. The Lamb shawarma is one of my favorite, so goood ! Also the persons working there are friendly, always nice. I recommend :)

Awesomeeeeee breakfast sandwiches!  The basic light is my favorite: egg whites and reduced-fat cheddar on a fresh wholegrain sandwich thin.  It's filling but doesn't make you feel sluggish like some greasy breakfast sandwiches do.  (Who wants to nurse a food baby at 9 in the morning?)  On the other hand, for times that you want to indulge, try the breakfast burrito.  By default it is filled with delicious chorizo, but you can switch it up and get pork, bacon, or black beans instead.  Wash it all down with a delicious Ritual iced coffee :)

I had a really great experience here today.  I am...how do you say...in between jobs...and needed to send out interview thank you emails from somewhere other than my apartment.  I started walking up polk and walked into crave because the people who worked there looked really nice and would be cool with me hanging out on my laptop and ordering some lunch and a beer.  Crave exceeded my expectations with good food, a great selection of beers on tap, and most importantly really down to earth, friendly employees.  Thanks for being humble and nice in a time in San Francisco where that seems to be forgotten.  See you soon!
This is a great place to know about for an easy, casual meal. Setting and atmosphere are informal (ordering at the counter). Some good vegetarian options, including the "Morocco Your World."

Since I live in the neighborhood I have given this place many chances to change my mind about the lackluster food and service.  I was in this morning only to find one employee hosing off the front of the sidewalk and telling me they were opening late (8:30-9:00am).  I thought they opened at 7:00am?!  Where is the management?  Food is always super salty and just plain unpalatable. It's unfortunate since I like to give small local businesses my patronage.
Breakfast is no good. Overall, you can make the same thing better at home for WAY less, with like 2 ingredients, well, except for the breakfast burritos - those are darn good!
Had the breakfast burrito, which was a lot of food but was pretty wet. The coffee was hot and big, but tasted a bit sour. All in all not a terrible experience, but could have been better.

Good food with a side of snarky attitude.  I've been here three times and the third will be my last.. Which is a shame as the food is overall pretty good... But I feel like I am bothering them when the have to take my order.  I feel bad for anyone having to deal with Cameron in any front of house service.  With an attitude like his he's lucky to be employed... In the interim though,  Crave lost a local customer.

LOUSY service.  I ordered a tuna sandwich, then waited. And waited. And waited. At least 15 minutes. The only 2 other people in the restaurant had already been served - the staff was doing nothing! When I finally went to the counter and asked about my sandwich, the cook snapped, "I'm making it now!" A few minutes later, he dumped it on my table and walked off. No "Sorry for the delay," just attitude.
The pastrami sandwich was disgusting!!!  And the cup of fruit was soggy, the grilled cheese was like any other basic grilled cheese. Will not be back.

Came here for lunch on a Friday around 2pm. The place was pretty empty and plenty of seats available. I ordered the tuna salad sandwich, it was made pretty quickly and was delicious! Just the right amount of everything between the bread - tuna, mixed greens, tomato and dressing. Service was super friendly & they carry coconut juice in the cooler!

This place rocks!!!  Everything I've had, as far as food is concerned, was excellent; especially the Beef Au Jus (sp?) sandwich.  In addition, they have outdoor seating for three, 4-top tables.  Finally, they have wine and beer, so there's no better place to watch the world go bye, after Friday's work is done
Lamb shawarma was out of this world.  You can tell they use quality ingredients and take their time to prepare your meal.  It was almost too much time to prepare a meal.

I still go to Crave, only because the food served is rather good, especially for the price.  I am still amazed, though, by the continuing disconnect between the less than well trained FOH employees and the more than competent staff in the kitchen.
Service was awesome but all of our food was cold... I ordered a French dip and the cheese wasn't even melted..... Fail.
Our hotel was pretty close by and we came here after realizing that other places in the area did not open until 11.  Instead of waiting around for a half hour, we popped in here.

Really disappointed in this restaurant.  I live nearby in Pac Heights and was somewhat excited to see another sandwich/salad restaurant on upper polk.  I went in for the first time with my partner and were made to feel uncomfortable by the two workers behind the counter.  I'm not much for begging people to accept my business nor am I interested in persuading workers to be friendly.  The food was fine....nothing great but nothing bad....but I couldn't get past the unfriendly service.  Since that experience, we've chosen Polkers, Bell Tower, Boulange, etc. .......all better alternatives.

This used to be a great place for lunch.  We went today and found it to be just awful.  The shrimp sandwich had very few shrimps.  The bread was stale and the dressing tasted like rancid old oil.  I hope I don't get sick.  We also had the Morocco hummus sandwich.  We could hardly find the hummus.  It was so meager.  Not a pleasant or satisfying lunch.  Plus, the people who work there are not very friendly.
Great food, cold beer, super fast service! Very relaxed atmosphere, fresh tasting ingredients.

Everyone was raving about the Chorizo Breakfast Burrito and how good it is. (We are five native San Diegans) So I tried it, and it was bland and mushy. Asked for it "extra spicy" and it had no flavor. Not gonna crave that ever again.....
Food is good but service does have a major attitude, as others have stated. It's close by so we just order and pick up.

The cook making our sandwiches was more friendly and hospitable than the woman who took our order. She seemed annoyed that we came in 20 minutes before they were closing. She never smiled and didn't even say thank you, when against my better judgement, I put a tip in her till for our to go order. I will not be back.

The yellow fish sandwich was okay but my goodness that lamb shawarma was like biting into a sandwich made of salt. I believe they make decent food but this one shawarma has left a terrible impression!

I really hate to do this. We have been eating here for so long, since they opened. Used to be wonderful salads, sandwiches. Staff was always somewhat surly, so maybe 3-4 stars but an honest, good meal for breakfast or lunch. Ate here at least 20 times before things went south. It all started when the big dude that did the cooking left and they clearly were unable to replace him. Meanwhile, the surliness by the register workers has gone through the roof. Our last visit, we ordered a beet salad and the eggplant/hummus sandwich -- like we have many many times before.
Great service great food. It's Russian hill so don't expect parking to be easy but it definitely worth it. I work in the area so I don't need to worry about parking

Service was friendly, but the food wasn't good. We got huevos rancheros and mac and cheese. The eggs were overcooked and the dish lacked flavor. The tortillas were cold and a little tough. The mac and cheese was runny and also lacked flavor. The door was open and bugs were flying around the inner entrance, too.

Absolutely terrible service. My order took over 45 minutes for a simple sandwich and my friend's order still wasn't made after over an hour and fifteen minutes. We followed up multiple times with staff about the status of our food and were repeatedly ignored. Finally, my friend asked for a refund since it was clear they were not in a hurry to make her salad. Days later I noticed they also charged my credit card double for my sandwich and I've heard of this happening to multiple other people at this location.

I am not sure what is going on in my neighborhood these days but lately it seems that hiring, tude, tatted, hipsters is all the hype.  This spot is still my fave but I really wish there were more nice people in the service biz in my neighborhood.  I wonder if the owners are just paying these young things crapola and because of that we get crapola attitude.  Also, since customers actually do come in perhaps a mix of music might make being there a little more inviting instead of being forced to listen to someone's favorite cd.  Variety is the spice of life.

I had such a terrible time walking in this rat hole! REALLY, REALLY RUDE services.. Waitress was unable to even find us seated at the front window counter! Then when she finally did locate me she just loudly plops my plate with my food so loud next to me I was shocked. FOOD? Garbage! Not even worth the mention here.. other than to say fk you Crave! Never going back again.. first and last time. There is a reason I do not walk to Polk to eat... and now there is yet another! What a funny name? "Crave" it is the last name you should have here. Unless you mean by eating here I will crave another place! Done!

Came in here on a Friday early evening. Attracted by the vibrant look of the place and the diverse menu. I ordered the marinated tofu ban mi  and a soy latte after having a good conversation with the guy serving me. The service was prompt and welcoming. The ban mi was delicious and the main reason for reviewing -  wonderfully marinated meaty tofu, fresh crunchy vegetables, fiery chillies with just right amount of fruity Mayo and coriander. A real treat for the taste buds and not a dish I regularly find in SF. I will be back for more of this and I'll also probably try the burrito as someone next to me just mentioned it was tasty.
Sandwich with a side of MAJOR attitude is definitely not what I wanted for lunch.

My fav Thai place anywhere! This quaint, fairly priced restaurant consistently serves delicious noodles and veggies to me, perfectly spicy, and does so fast and with a good attitude. I crave the flat noodles here! The best deal and one of North Beach's best meals usually without a long wait. They're awesome!
I would have loved to give this place more stars because their food was very flavorful and rich. Well spiced thai food.
Great portions and attentive service. The duck curry was delicious and filling. Very well priced considering it's in a touristy area. The crab ragoon was excellent too.

Last Sunday, after church, when we cross the road, my kid sae the Thai food, she want to try it, so we went inside, because it was 11:30am, so not too much people, After the waitress take the order, we still waiting about 25 minutes.

Really good food with big portions at good prices (the dishes that are labeled spicy are actually spicy so be careful). And the staff was very friendly. Happy we chose this place over some of the more expensive places nearby. Would definitely come here again.
Great Thai food for a great price in a major metro city!  Definitely highly recommend when in San Francisco!
I've had takeout and delivery from here and both dinners have been delightful. When I ordered takeout
The food is spicy and has incredible flavor! The service is wonderful, and the location is awesome. Thai tea is a little small, but good. The shrimp added to any dish is the way to go!

We had lunch here last week and were very happy with the service and food.  The 11am-6pm $2 Singha beer is a great deal.  The restaurant seating areas were clean, the server was friendly and helpful and the food was good.  I would recommend this restaurant is you're in North Beach and want Thai.

I thought this hole in the wall might be good because the well meaning and nice people who work there seemed "legit". I am my companion order the pumpkin squash and pad Thai and two different soups. The pad Thai was lame...not awful or even bad but just boring and mediocre. My lunch partner didn't get chicken pumpkin he ordered, he got prawns instead. He was unimpressed. All in all a ho hum experience...definitely not worth going out of your way for and many better Thai places in town.

Went here with my family. Food was okay until my sister found a fly in her soup. I don't have a lot to say except while going to the restroom I cought a glimpse of the messy kitchen and swarm of flies around the food

I was in the city on Monday and what a salad I had here. I had my heart set on another  place but I was so hungry that I saw the menu and went here instead. I ordered the Tuk Tuk salad which consisted on lettuce, egg, tomatoes, fried tofu and warm peanut sauce. I'm not sure how the fry the tofu but it was light and crunch on the outside and soft in the center. Anyway it was a nice lunch for $6.50. You cant beat that!

I love this place (especially their green curry) but I just got delivery and after tipping, the delivery man looked at me and said, "what, this is it?" Had to shut the door on him. If this is how they treat their customers, I'm definitely not coming back. And I wish I could take the tip back!

I'm a Laotian girl OBSESSED with flavor and spice. This place ALWAYS hits the spot. Best Thai food in town, seriously. I would highly recommend this place to anyone that wants authentic Thai food. My favorites are the beef noodle soup, pad thai, pad se ew  and panang curry. But honestly anything you order it EXCELLENT!
Ordered for delivery. Delivery was fast however the food was pretty bland.
Fairly priced, standard Thai menu.  It didn't knock my socks off, but it didn't disappoint.  Service was great, and the food came out very quickly.

I opened the door to this very small (just a few tables) shop in North Beach to find myself assaulted by a head-rush of incense -- I think we used less in college. I don't know that I've ever smelled that much incense in my life, and certainly not in a Thai restaurant. That said, we're not allergic, so on we went.
Very solid thai food spot if you're in north beach. Great for takeout.

Decent food, decent prices. Just good. Nothing spectacular. But a great spot if you're in north beach and craving thai. Their sign is super cute gotta give them that, you can't miss it.  Thai iced tea a bit overly sweet. Gra-Prow was alright. Theres alot of places that are better, but in this specific neighborhood this is the place to go.

Great little Thai spot inside north beach. Reasonable prices and great food. I love eggplant so I get it pretty much every time. The fried rice was great too. Really appreciated how the food wasn't drowned in oil but still tasted great. Inside is nice but small. Liked how it was an open kitchen and you could see the wok in action and see they kept things clean. My go to Thai spot for a quick bite
My friend and I ordered two dishes, which came out lightning fast! Awesome because I was hungrier'n a mug.
I love the food here, but be ready to be patient with the waitresses. You might have to remind them to get your food, give you more water and do the smiling for them.
Tuk Tuk Thai Cafe, "Tuk Tuk my money."

Delicious! I tried the Panang Curry and the Pad Thai, seriously delicious. Snappy service, great price, no complaints aside from the sticky rice seeming reheated. But we were the only people there, so it makes sense. Thanks!
I'm sad to have to negatively update my review of this neighborhood spot which i liked so much when i lived in North Beach.
Yuuuuummmm! Got the Chicken Larb - mint was super fresh, dressing was delicious and they have Brown Rice which makes my day!! Price was very reasonable, service is great and big portions! Love it!
For my lunch came here for the first time had some good food here. The place is so clean and good atmosphere.
Came here Tuesday afternoon for lunch; had fried rice with pork and egg (#45) and thought it was solid. Attentive service and nice spot.
They use skippy Peanut Butter for their peanut sauces.
I ordered delivery and WOW was I pleasantly surprised!
Small little place and not the nicest inside.  Also seems to be some heavy traffic right outside of the window...perhaps a bus or trolley stop so don't expect an intimate meal here.
Good food although I was expecting plate to have more heat to it. Flavor was good on my Pad Num Prig Poa and service was excellent.

Nothing fancy but delicious. And right next to Rogue Ales pub, where I went before and after. So perhaps that enhanced my enthusiasm over Tuk Tuk, but we thoroughly loved the 3 dishes we got: Pad See Ew, Pad Thai and fried rice. It was so good. Waitress was nice. Food came fast. No complaints. And for anyone who wants a real inside look at the kitchen, the path to the bathroom goes right past the stoves and prep areas. I know...

Our go-to Thai take-out dinner option.  We order the Chinese sausage fried rice, Pad See Eew, Stir-fried Chinese Broccoli, Tom Kha Gai (soup),  and the Tod Mun Pla fish cakes religiously.  They are always good.  We sometimes vary with duck curry, pad thai and specials.  Very affordable prices considering North Beach location.

I was in Thailand for 6 months and their menu offers some pretty authentic dishes. With that being said, they didn't taste 100% authentic, but the food was still delicious. My boyfriend got the pineapple fried rice dish, and I got pad thai. Very impressive portion sizes  - we both had leftovers, and we usually scrape our plates clean. The service was prompt, kept coming by to fill up our waters (at least 3 times, very attentive), the waitress was nice, and our food came out in a decent amount of time. The food we ordered isn't to die for, but was definitely good and I would definitely go back to try out the rest of their menu.

The employees here are nice, so I give them props for the efficient and kindly service.  The food is acceptable, but I don't think it's any great shakes.  Having gotten both take out and eaten inside, I've had a few experiences here so far, each time trying new dishes.  It'll get the job done and it's good, but there is better thai in the area I think.  King of Thai is a better value...although this place has a more convenient location for those of us that don't live over in Telegraph Hill, hence my repeat visits.
Food is good, service is okay. If it wasn't for an annoying incident that I am about to describe it would have been a four star.
A decent lunch meal, and affordable.

I love pumpkin curry! Usually I get it at one of my fave places in SOMA but today I tried Tuk Tuk for the first time and their pumpkin curry was delicious. It had a perfect mild spice to it. Loved it! Will definitely go back
A Cute small time restaurant to stop in for a quick cheap bite to eat.

This place is a trek to get to since it's right smack in between Chinatown and North beach. The only good thing about this place is the calamari and maybe the Hong Kong style noodles but also, they open pretty late for club goers.
Rude service! Went in here with a party of 8 and the restaurant did not close for 3 hours.

Went with my wife, she had a noodle soup I had sweet and sour Schrimps.  I loved it and she did too. Service was really good, very prompt and very polite. This is probably how the restautants look back in Bejing but I wish it was more clean, it felt a bit dirty, hence the 4 stars. Would I go back? Absolutely.

The location is conveniently located.  However, worst Chinese food I have ever had in Chinatown.  Slow serivice, duck feet were sour, some clams served unfresh or bad, fried noodles were not evently cooked.  Please watch out, if you must try stay away from traditional Chinese dishes and go somewhere else.

I really wish there was an option to not give this place any stars at all. The service was horrible. What I would expect is a smile no bad looks and just serve us. My friends ended up getting sick. That's two people throwing up. The place is filthy. When we were leaving we were nice enough to leave $3 for tip. Bill was $38.35 we gave her $41.35 she counts the money in front of us and says there isn't enough. Says that we owe her a six dollar tip. Forget that!! She didn't deserve it. Won't recommend this place at all. Don't go!! Trust me!!
One of my favorites in all of Chinatown San Francisco. Authentic and delicious. Service is good and friendly. Go for the crab, it so goood. #chinatown #sanfrancisco #dungenesscrab
Ummm can you say FOOD POISONING! I should have walked out when I saw the pigeon walking around inside with no cook or waitress fleeing him out, only giggles in response.

After hitting up China Town, my parents and I were starving and decided to eat somewhere nearby since the BNB we were staying at was in Pacifica. On the way back to the car, my Dad spots this place adorned with the photos of the owner with various hosts from Travel Channel and Food Network (ie Samantha Brown and Andrew Zimmern), plus the Zagat stickers from 2011 - 2014. I checked the reviews on Yelp and it had 4 stars so it must be good right? So we decided to eat here.

Fried oysters were inedible....UGH.  Calamari was not up to par. Ginger beef was good, but such a small amount!!  Servings, overall, were small.  Mediocre experience and over priced.  Try another spot.

I came here from Long Beach, ca. Bombass food freal. I don't eat shellfish but my ma absolutely loved the giner and green onion crab ! ($42) and the portion was HUGE. They season all of their dishes very well. We also got the chinese brocoli with cod fish and beef chinese noodle. All delicious !!

The reason why people think Yuet Lee serves good Chinese food is because it's 2:00 in the morning and you find yourself in North Beach, drunk and hungry, and desperate for anything greasy and oily that would help soak up all the alcohol.  So your options are limited at this hour of the day as is your judgment for what good food is, and Yuet Lee happens to be one of two Chinese restaurants opened (the other is Sun Hong Kong further down Broadway, which is even worst but at least much cheaper).  I've eaten Chinese food all my life and all over the world, and there's no other reason to eat at a place like Yuet Lee other than that.  Its prices are outrageous.  The food is mediocre at best, super greasy and oily and will likely give you the runs later.  Don't get caught up with all the celebrity photos on the wall, most of them have no idea about authentic and good Chinese food, and don't pay an average person's price when they go out to eat.  They're just playing tourist when they come here, don't get trapped!
The family and I ate dinner at Yuet Lee the night before attending Outside Lands in Golden Gate Park.

I haven't been to this place in a while, but I remember loving it so much when I lived in SF. I ate here several times. This is the kind of restaurant that does stir fried things well. And deep fried things, too, for that matter. Also, the lobster is good.
Loved the clams. Didn't care for the salt and pepper squid because I thought it was too salty. Food came out super quick. Place is kind of ghetto, but it makes the place seem authentic.
Delicious Chinese food, a must go. Best thing is you can pay with credit card with an order minimum (I believe) of $10.
They say they're open, but when you try to place an order they tell you they're not open and give you an attitude. Completely unappreciated and disrespectful. This place is terrible.
open late. good salt and pepper calamari. cooked well, seasoned great, nice light crispy breading
The service was excellent and quick. The food was delicious. It's small but homey. I recommend the Peking ribs. They are awesome.

The food here is a bit pricier than most simple Chinese restaurants. The service is quick but a bit hostile. The food was pretty good. But I would definitely head to Broadway Cafe before heading here since their prices are more reasonable for the same type of dishes.
I have been coming to Yuet lee since 2010.

I was feeling a bit hungry because the Moroccan food I had for dinner didn't seem too satisfying.  It was good cuisine, a belly dancer put on quite a show and all, but it was finger foods, you know?  So I made the trek to Chinatown, specifically to Yuet Lee, for some no nonsense, old fashioned comfort food.  I had a Tsingtao beer, plain won ton and clams in pepper, black bean sauce.  The food hit the spot!  I left full & with a grin on my face.  I'm just a simple Chinese man....
Im from LA so when everyone told me to go to Chinatown I figured it doesnt matter where u eat...
Loved the salt and pepper squid.  Great pan fried noodles too.  The braised pork chops rocked too.
