My favorite Chinese seafood restaurant. (Well, to be fair, the only Chinese seafood restaurant I can ever remember going back to, but that's besides the point).

The food is outstanding and I have now found a new favorite place in Chinatown FINALLY! The other reviews about the staff being rude is a bunch of bullshit, maybe certain customers need to check their ego's in at the door. The hours are great also for a late night bite.
Good food...but if they are going to be this way about prices (see picture)......then I can't recommend......it.
So delicious! Love the salt and pepper calamari, beef chow fun, and the sweet and sour pork chops! Everything is so good actually. LOVE!

I was visiting from NY with some friends and stopped here after reading all these great reviews. We wanted to eat light but just could not stop ourselves, it smelled amazing in there with loads of pictures of all their meals hanging around. I found myself exponentially hungrier with one glance.
Good food, but service is horrible. The waiter will harass you if you don't leave him more than a five dollar tip. The cups and plates were dirty. I wouldn't recommend this place

When we first walked in, I was a bit hesitant in staying. It looked like your typical hole in the wall Chinese place with sticky tables and dirty floors. However, plastered all over the restaurant walls were photos of Eric Tsang! One of the funniest Kungfu actors in HK with their restaurant's chef! If that guy can eat here why can't I? Ambience aside or lack there of, the food was a different story!

I've been coming here for 30 of the 38 years it's been here and it's just as good today as it has been over the years. Where else can you get a tasty meal at 11:30pm. They don't have the friendliest of people but at least they are consistent.
For the money, this was the very best of the Chinese establishments since the 70's, and usually had decent service.

This place is great. They open really late, which means that a lot of people who work late can come and eat. Another thing is, their stuff is fresh. They truly care about their welfare of their customers. I learned a lot Yuet Lee by a local High Schooler's video. Visit " Multimedia: Yuet Lee" for more info. The owner is reeaalllyyyy nice!

AWFUL! HORRIBLE SERVICE! They have two waitress both with glasses but WATCH OUT for the younger one with round face and short hair as she is extremely rude as she is blatantly told me that I don't tip her enough which is over 20%! also the foods is overly priced!

I've heard so much about this place I had to give it a try while staying in SF for a night. My first impression walking in was that it was packing at midnight and the customers were not all Asian, surprisingly. Usually these restaurants are just filled with hungry Asian people who are either coming from the bars or just hungry asian people who stay up late.

So with both Yuet Lee and New Sun Hong Kong offering classic Chinatown late night bites, how does one decide on which business to frequent?  Service at both are as you'd expect from late night C-town restaurants, brusk and to the point.  So do you go with the restaurant with the green trim or the one w/ the yellow trim?

Came here today for a work meeting and the food was mediocre at it's best. Some dishes were way too salty while others were too bland. We ordered the roasted pork clay pot and it was very watery and salty. I've never had a clay pot like it and was completely disappointed. Probably the best thing I had was the beef chow fun. Something I want to note was that we found a hair in our soup.. Our server took it and brought us new bowls. NO BIG DEAL! but the chef was screaming at her! That poor woman... She returned with a new bowl of soup with red eyes and a red nose. It was evident that she was crying and I felt so bad. No one should ever cry at work. Best believe we left her a big tip.
I enjoyed my lunch experience here.

You don't really go to a Chinese restaurant and expect great customer service.  And this place did not disappoint.  Bad service and the  food was mediocre.  Tips were optional from my understanding.  I normally tip well above 15% if they deserve it.  I felt that they didn't deserve anything but I still tipped.  As my partner and I were leaving, the waitress stopped us and pointed at tip and said "That's not enough tip."

I can never get enough of this place. Yuet Lee has been around for over 30 years. This is one place I always have to go to when in Chinatown even during the late night. My friends and I always end up going to Yuet Lee after a fun night out. The food is so good. Love getting their salt and pepper calamari, Peking spare ribs, fish, clams, their soups, chow mein and so much more. When I go there I never have a problem with their service.

This has been our go to favorite Thai in the city for decades. Last two times it's been just terrible. Tonight we had the green curry, pad see Yu and veggie egg rolls. Everything was flavorless at best. In fact neither of us could even finish our plate much less get seconds. Terribly disappointing.
I had the green curry with prawns twice. Both times it was really good. Nice little neighborhood restaurant. Also the pino gridgio was good. I will definitely go back!
This place was horrible.  It has this smell.
if you're a fan of green curry, this is your place!

This was our first time dining here and our expectations were met. The staff was friendly, attentive, and the food was great. We ordered the green curry with salmon and sweet and sour pork- we especially loved the green curry.  Price was reasonable and we will definitely be back!
This place is a total RIP OFF. I got an entree with shrimp and vegetables. It came with carrots and 3 shrimp. Not even enough for two people. Total rip off. Super expensive too.
The Fried rice salad was awesome. It's not on all of the menu's. Highly recommend it.

Maybe it's 'cause we're from the Seattle-area and we're used to terrific Thai food (even in our suburban neighborhood and even as far north as Mt. Vernon).  REAL Thai food, not Chinese-like Thai food.  Daughter, from Japan, however, agreed that this restaurant was sub-par.
The food here is absolutely amazing! It's the best Thai food I have had so far in San Francisco.

This is only my second time eating Thai food, but this place is great. It is a small little shop and has both a lunch and a dinner menu. We had the prixe fixe menu lunch special that they offered. It started with drinks and then the appetizers. The best of the appetizers was the Thai Sticks. Then there's the soup. Prior to this my one experience with Thai soup was Tom Kha. Here I had the Tom Yum soup,  and it was FANTASTIC!! (I even got a second bowl after our course was over) This was followed by the main course of Pad Thai (kind of sweet and no real spice) that was pretty good. The dessert was a scoop of what I believe to be homemade Ice Cream. I'm not sure what the actual flavor was (it stated Vanilla Bean on the menu) since it had peanuts and what tasted like some caramel drizzle,  but it was so yummy!! If ever I am back in San Francisco,  lunch will be here at least once.

A real gem in upper Polk!  I eat there any chance I get.  All dishes are prepared fresh, healthy and delicious.  The owner, Toi, is always on site to make sure all runs smooth.  Great food, atmosphere and service.  A MUST try!

My favorite Thai place in SF.  Very extensive menu.   The Lemongrass Chicken Savory is my go-to dish!   The pad-thai is also great.  Not too sweet.   Food preparation is quick and service very friendly.

For being a Thai restaurant on one of the most popular streets in SF you would think it would be good or at least decent! I didn't know pad Thai could be bad, or chicken skewers. Save you're time and money. There are much better restraints in the city
I'm not sure if there is a change in management, or the chef, but Lemongrass is NOT what it used to be!!
The menu selection was great and I have no complaints about the service. The atmosphere was perfect for a casual night to catch up with a  friend. Good prices for quality.

This is a cute small neighborhood restaurant with very nice Thai decor. However, the staffing is very low (probably family run) which leads to long wait for food and possibly other things. I came for lunch one day last week while in field assignment nearby. I was seated and at the time there was only one other table occupied, and I believe they already had their food. I ordered a tom yum beef noodle, and the wait seemed quite long for a noodle item for a place that wasn't busy. Also, while I was there, a party came in waiting to be greeted and seated, and apparently nobody did for so long such that one of them went to the kitchen calling for a staff.
Authentic feel, friendly staff.  Menu has a variety of Thai dishes.  Ordered Chicken Basil with Thai Sticky Rice.  Nicely seasoned, spiced well.
For sure rivals any Thai you think is the cities best. I come or order from here regularly and it really the best. Pad Thai to die for.

I have lived in this area for a long time and have eaten some really good thai food and some ok food also. This was the worse I have eaten. It was a lot of cut uncooked vegetables in a little bit of soup. The curries were watery. The rice was also kind of uncooked. The only thing that was good was the service and they get  my star for that.The ladies who served us were really nice and friendly. I just wish the food was also as good as their service.

If you've eaten good Thai food, this place is really not that good. One of the members of our party came close to saying that it was some of the worst they'd eaten, but that might be a bit of a stretch in my opinion. To be fair, service was really pretty good. Food came fast, and the waitresses seemed generally nice. They probably kept this from being a 1 star review.

We try to get to San Francisco at least once a year to escape the Phoenix heat.  When we go, we MUST hit Lemongrass.  Love the neighborhood, the atmosphere and the food.  We've enjoyed everything we've had.  We always get the pad thai and a second dish.  Very good food - very good prices.  Can't wait to get back there.
My absolute favorite Thai restaurant in the city. So close to home, great food & cozy atmosphere!
Neighborhood gem.
Food was ok, sweet & sour soup was yummy, but my main dish was a bit bland. Service was prompt and friendly.
Not the best place to go if you need to eat a gluten free dinner as the servers had a problem understanding what you are trying to tell them about celiac problems.
Nice location, staff, very decent portions, quick service, all of that.  But the food is just not flavorful.

Good taste, yet I can't shrug off the feeling being taken for a ride if a seafood combo comes with veggies and 9 pieces of shrimp (after we asked for more seafood.... increasing the # of "seafood"(shrimp only) from 5 to 9....
If you are looking for fresh ingredients & authentic Thai flavor you must try Lemongrass Restaurant!
I've only done take out here and never have dined-in.  Food always arrives hot and fresh.
Sometimes the reviews might not be that great but you just got to try for yourself and see if it really is THAT bad.  In this case, it really was THAT bad.  Or at least my dish was.

First time here. Hands down...best meal at a restaurant ever. Crispy Rice Salad, Lemongrass Chicken and Tofu with Crispy Basil. The place is small and got crowded as the evening went on. Good service, friendly and attentive wait staff. $60 included one other app, the above mentioned dishes and two teas. Well worth it. My only complaint? It is in SF and not my home town!

Our neighborhood go-to place. Food is always great, friendly staff, cozy atmosphere. Order several dishes to share. Pumpkin curry is my favorite. Their delivery service is prompt and perfect for when you want to eat in.
I walked in and I thought I was no longer in San Francisco. Definitely a place that stands out against the crowds of restaurants in the neighborhood.

It was the very first time my family went to try this place for dinner, we are all so pleased with how excellent the food taste here. The staffs were very nice and checked in on us regularly throughout to make sure we have water or if there is anything else we needed etc.

We came in to town from Fresno, Ca having had super long day out and about and all we wanted was to find a nice restaurant close to our hotel for dinner. Well we found it! Lemongrass was a nice smaller restaurant where we could got great service and wonderful food. After spending a ton of money at two other food places in San Fran earlier that day and getting the worst customer service possible with barely any portions of food Lemongrass was a breath of fresh air!!! The portions were nice sizes for two of us to share two different dishes and some "adult" beverages. We had a table by the window which we found enjoyable to people watch while we waited for our food. It was a very nice experience for us.

Yummm. Came here the other day for lunch and ordered one of their specials. I got the eggplant, peppers, shrimp and brown rice. It was really tasty, came out quickly and service was prompt and professional. There is nothing outstanding about the interior and decorations of this restaurant, but the food speaks for itself.

Sorry, it's just bad food.  Have been a few times over years.  Tonight final try.  With a dozen people in my party we ordered many dishes.  There was not one that I'll remember.  Taste just doesn't do a service to Thai cuisine.  The pad thai noodles clumped, the sauces were watery, quality of chicken poor.  Service was fine.  Packed in tables made me feel like I was on an airplane.  Aux delices across the street much better bet and consistently good as this place has been consistently bad.  Entire table agrees with this review.

Pleasant people, pleasant decor.  Service a little too attentive if anything - kept having to fight off having our water topped up every 30 seconds in the drought and my wine glass was whisked away with a sip still left.  Papaya salad was not bad.  "Three Delights" was dull but adequate.  Gai Yang - marinated barbecued chicken - should be moist and bursting with flavor.  This was dry and tasteless and about half of it was stone cold - obviously the result of uneven micrwaving.
I've been coming here for over ten years. It's consistently good! Great place for date night. Fantastic spring rolls!

I went there for lunch today. I rate 3 stars because the pad Thai was good the waitress nice, but it was so cold inside I had to keep my coat on. Plus someone was painting the front door at 12.30 with the door most likely open, so you get the awful smell while you eat plus more cold. It bugged me that they would paint something at this time of the day when people are actually coming to eat !!!! Wtf ??
Lost all of my love since the Starbucks acquisition. From service to wait times to food quality. Sad they sold out...even though I probably would have too.
F word.
love la boulange pastries.  the macarons, financiers, croissants etc are awesome.
the quality of the cashier service is hit or miss (there's an older man and a young blonde lady who are bomb) but the quality of the food service has been significantly declining.
So lucky to live by one of these. Warm staff, picture perfect pastries and a surprisingly extensive hot food menu!
I only had a chocolate croissant but it was as good as what I have had in Paris. I like the outdoor seating also

I used to LOVE la boulange. It was my post-gym go-to brunch place on Saturday mornings for at least 2 years. After the Starbucks acquisition the service went from OK to terrible (waiting an hour for food only for it to come out wrong), but I put off writing a review because I loved the food.

I love: almost everything here to eat or drink, the atmosphere, the coffee, the sparkling wine bottles at a very happy hour, sitting in the sun, customers smiling and chatting with staff... such a nice vibe - it reminds me of my days in France.... the pastries are so amazing - and so is happy hour!  It just makes me feel happy to sit inside or outside at this La Boulange.  Plus the people that work their genuinely care and are amazing when it comes to customer service.  It is probably the only cafe or coffee shop on Polk in Russian Hill between Filbert and Broadway that does not provide any type of Wi-Fi so customers do not stay for hours and you actually can get seats and tables for conversations, dining, relaxing, and reading.  This is also my favorite La Boulange - all windows, very social and happy vibe, relaxing, and the food and service really are tops!  It is not about working online all day, it is about enjoying life there.  5+ stars!  I keep saying it - but the staff is so great here!  Thank you to La Boulange de Polk for often bringing a smile to my face!  Yay you!  And oh those pastries!

Wow!  Homemade granola, yogurt, fresh fruit drizzled with honey!  Even though this wonderful breakfast contains 740 calories, it is worth every bite!  And, for lattes, they even serve almond milk!  Thank you La Boulange de Polk!

Coffee served in bowl?  Wow, that's so original in my book!  This is our fave place to eat breakfast when visiting SF.  Locals seem to frequent this place, posh neighborhood.  They have very friendly service, great pastries and egg dishes, the fruit danish is a must try.
Ugh... Why does this place always suck? No wifi... Disgusting Mac & cheese (that took 20 minutes).

Great food and snacks and pretty quick service! Sandwiches were delicious (though slightly pricey) and very filling!  It has a pretty decent sized space, so if you're in for breakfast, lunch or just a coffee, you should have a place to sit, easily.
I love this spot for having my coffee and deserts.

I came here with a group of friends on a Sunday afternoon.  The weather was great, so we decided to sit outside.  I ordered the Boulange Club and my friends ordered the Lobster Sandwich, which seemed to be the restaurant special.  Everything was delicious!  I really enjoyed the atmosphere as well.  I'm not too into sweets, but the pastries looked tantalizing.  Perhaps I'll try some when I come here next.

We discovered this little eatery during our most recent trip to SFC.  The staff is friendly and the food was delicious.  I tried to tell my husband we've been eating their pastries because it's owned by Starbucks but honestly, the pastries here is much better.  I assume the pastries are either baked on site or a nearby location and Starbucks is getting their pastries from a central location.

To start this off. I hate this place with a passion. I heard all good things about this place from several people. So I decided to try it out. I ordered the French toast which was about 10 dollars. The food was just horrible. It was so soggy it felt like I was eating mud.  Plus the amount of food they give you is ridiculous!! For 10 dollars you get half of a French toast and a small bowl of pre-packaged fruits. The only aspect I liked about this "restaurant" was that the waiters were respective and always had a smile on their face.

This location has stood the test of time for me; it's been three years and I still come here weekly so they must be doing something right.  I don't care that it's a chain now and it's owned by Starbucks, nothing changed and it's really become my "old reliable".  Mostly I love the coffee and brioche French toast!  Smoked trout salad is really good too, as is the open faced smoked salmon sandwich.

There is definitely crack in the La Boulange scramble, because it is so delicious I can't pass this place without going inside to get one. Definitely crack. Or maybe just lots of butter. Mmmmm, butter.

What a great experience today. It started off rough when I ordered a chicken sandwich with no dairy or egg and then I received a chicken sandwich covered in a sauce with dairy. By this time I had driven 15 minutes away when I noticed that there was dairy and then I called the store. The store manager Olga was SUPER helpful, she told me that I could come back and they would make the sandwich exactly as I needed considering my allergies. I accepted. By this time I came back to the store and it took me another 10 minutes to park so I called in and said that I'll just move on and not eat my lunch. Olga went over and beyond and made sure there was a gift card for me at the front desk for the next time I come in. I am so appreciative of the customer support and I felt that she genuinely cares about her customers and the restaurant. Thank you and I'll be back! :)
Amazing pastry choices! Well done (as expected)!

Well here it is, six months onward from my last review of this place.   I'm no foodie, and so the food seems OK to me... if they ever get it right.   But they are still relentlessly snatching failure from the jaws of victory.
Grab an outdoor table in the afternoon sunshine and enjoy 3 delicious sliders for $6 during happy hour. Wine, chai, coffee are all recommended, take your pick.

Yes this is a chain but one of the best I have ever encountered. The staff goes above and beyond. I had a lot of questions about what to order and two staff members chimed in and answered all my many questions. Really appreciated this, especially because most people would get annoyed- especially when there is a long line.
The incompetent bus boy ruined my afternoon lunch. The 15 minutes I have to myself every day. This guy literally made me want to vomit on myself and leave.
First, they had no bacon. Then, they "lost" my BLT. Finally, they gave me a chicken and bacon sandwich.
I'm in love with La Boulange!

At best, La Boulange de Polk is a great laid back place to stop for lunch or a quick snack. At worst, it's somewhere you'll swear to never eat again. Having been a regular here for about a year, I can honestly say that I'll probably never be returning. I've personally witnessed the standard in quality of food and service plummet to the point where you'll wonder why you just paid 10.50 to be ignored and served a soggy burger. The worst is that the staff don't even do table side service, they take your order at the counter. So I wonder why no one can at least be a little attentive rather than talking amongst themselves behind the counter. I'll give it 3 stars just because it was so good at one point, but whoever is managing this place should be ashamed of themselves.
First of all, I've been a regular at this La Boulange for about a year or so. I've always found the staff to be cheerful and welcoming, creating a relaxed, enjoyable atmosphere.

McDonalds on Van Ness is cleaner. I have eaten here three times. Tables are always dirty and I have yet to be able to get a fork. Seriously? Toady, 30% of the tables were open, all dirty with food, plates, spilled coffee, etc. I stood by holding my number waiting for a table to be cleaned so I could sit. The service person eventually brought my food, set it down on the closest dirty table and started to walk away. I asked for a clean table and a fork (since there were none out). He pointed to a slightly less dirty table and told me he could get me a fork, but they would have to wash some so it would be awhile. Now sitting at a dirty table eating my omelet with a plastic spoon. This place SUCKS. Should have gone to McDonalds.

I feel like La Boulange has gone down in quality. A lot of their meals are simply heated up, or sloppily served, but still decently satisfactory. The feel of the place is on par with a proper French Bakery (in America) and I prefer their Mocha over that of Starbucks or anywhere else. The service is fine and it makes for great people watching if your into that, but again the quality of the food leaves a small bit to be desired.

Quinoa salad with chicken is the BOMB! I could eat it every day!! Their French toast is pretty good, too. I hate drinking the coffee out of their big, bowl-like cups so I order the coffee to go, problem solved. A good spot for a quick bite and a pick-me-up.

just got off my shift and i was treating myself to a macaroon, and i won't bore you with the details but the next I knew Christine gave us an impromptu lesson in creating latte art ! what nice people!

Prices have changes with new owner Starbucks up 15%. Plus they now serve coffee in paper cup instead of mug. The local niche feel is changing which is a shame. While the quality is still there, I am not a fan of chains!!

I do not typically like chain bakeries or cafes.  But I love La Boulange and today for the first time went for lunch to the one on Polk.  (Usually we go to the Columbus location closer to where my son lives.) So today my husband and I took 2 friends to the Polk location since we were going to a gallery down the street.  He ordered the Onion Soup and it was delicious.  Best I have tasted.  My sandwich was great.  My friends loved their club sandwich.

Cute little bakery with real good coffee and pretty good pastries. We got a bunch of different things to munch on while we were waiting for our car to be done at the shop. The canneles de Bordeaux were delicious and not a lot of bakeries in the city want to make them. Their Lemon turnover and quiche Lorraine were excelent. But their French Macaroons were terrible. Your can tell they were made probably 2 or 3 days ago. The shells were wet and sticky and they stuck to your teeth like a caramel. Not what i was expecting when i bite into a french macaroon. I like the crunch of the macaroon and the soft center that is chewy. Oh well, I know now not to pass on the french macaroons and go straight for the canneles!

My favorite go to coffee shop after working out on Polk St. I love the free tasting they offer and it always entices me to get a pastry with my coffee. There is always a line but it goes by quickly, so be patient and wait.  There is some outdoor seatomg and a ton of indoor seating. This is the perfect place if you want a light bite and to catch up with friends or read a book.
Only place where I found while wheat croissant...and loved it...also the ambience is nice...many organic options too

Delicious food and really helpful staff! They even have a container of Nutella to use. I said how I wished I had some bread to eat it with and a server overheard me and brought me toast for free!! Cute, convenient, and delicious!
First time here and the happy hour special was great!!! I had the salmon slider and the chicken and provolone slider..both fantastic   Highly recommend for lunch if you're in the area!

Thankfully the quality of La Boulange remained the same after it was purchased by Starbucks. But they need to start offering some Gluten Free options. Most of cafés these days have some healthy options (nut bars, bran muffins). It's Bay Area after all and people are a bit more health aware here. I give it a 4 star, it's a good enough place especially for Chai Latte lovers.

The warm sausage sandwich on toasted green onion foccacia bread is to die for. It's so filling that I often order just a half sandwich. I guess I've been ordering it for 47 years and it's still wonderful and tastes the same as it did in 1967. On rare occasions I order the meatball sandwich which I guess is equally as good but even though I'm an experimental Gemini, I seem to end up with the sausage version.
I think this place has amazing character.  I love the meatball sandwich and sitting outside facing the park.  On a sunny day it is the ultimate North Beach experience. Love it.

I was at the bohemian cigar cafe we ordered I/2 hr later the waitress tells us she forgot to put in our order she laughs about it as her and co workers are drinking behind the counter she brings us the wrong drinks as we were still waiting than she's behind the bar eating toast and licking her fingers (gross)  finally our food comes after 45 mins ,it was only a tuna salad and a panini that was burnt we were the only ones eating. So it wasn't busy Never apologized asked if everything's ok. Never going back.

Amazing meatball sandwiches!! Got a table outside by Washington sq park with a view of cloit tower...not too shabby!! And amazingly not rammed full of tourists like some places on Columbus Avx although that may change on weekends...worthy of my 1st yelp review! Had to write something about this place, loved it
An epic meatball sandwich. No words to describe the experience. Simply incredible.

When you drive by Mario's and there's a parking space right outside, you have to take it. Then you must go into Mario's, grab a seat at the bar and order a beer and a meatball sandwich. They serve it on Liguria green onion foccacia and toast it in the oven. That sandwich is one of the most delicious things that you'll ever eat: the perfect amount of sauce, cheese and meatballs nestled inside the best toasted foccacia. With pepperoncini on the side.
A native San Franciscan took me here years ago, and I have been coming ever since.

Came here for lunch today with some co-workers since we work really close by! It's a cute little cafe with a catchy name and I've been wanting to try this place! I ordered the breaded eggplant sandwich while my coworkers ordered lasagna, chicken salad, and polenta & sausage. After taking a few bites of my eggplant sandwich, I ended up opening it up so I can add in some salt & pepper. It was a little too bland for my taste, in which one of my coworkers agreed also. As for the breaded eggplant, it was thinner than I thought it would be! If I do come back, maybe I will try a pizza instead next time!
Oh wow!
I liked the way the place felt at first. I was hoping for the whole in the wall quality meal. Well looks can be deceiving.

Is this the most amazing Italian food you've ever had? no. Is this most amazing service and experience in SF? Probably not. Is this the perfect place to perch on a warm Saturday afternoon, sipping house wine and people watching in the park while listening to mellow blues? YES!
Gem of a find.  Small and friendly, best lunch experience I had on my entire San Francisco trip.  The pastrami was beautiful...
The holy grail of meatball sandwiches. A+ for atmosphere as well. Among all the great spots in North Beach, this place is certainly a top five destination.

Came here with my boyfriend after seeing the great reviews. We saw a few reviews that warned about the service but thought, well if the food is good who cares. After an hour and a half of waiting (with people who came much later than us receiving the same food we ordered) I was ready to get up and leave. The food came right then and I thought this better be as good as the reviews mentioned. We got a meatball sandwich and a pizza and let me tell you, it was mediocre (and I was starving so that says something). You could go to literally any other Italian cafe in this area and have something better that doesn't take an hour and a half. Oh and I forgot to mention, the servers were pretty unpleasant. Needless to say, I suggest you avoid this place.
This place has really gone downhill! It used to be one of our favorite places when we lived in North Beach but now the service SUCKS!!! We had a horrendous experience last weekend.
Food is very nice - A little overpriced for the sandwiches and 'weak' italian soda's, but it is San Francisco after all.

This used to be a great cafe overlooking Washington Square park. However, as other reviewers have noted, the 'hipster' staff appear to see customers more as an annoyance. Service SUCKS...especially if you grab a table outside. We waited 30 minutes and still had not ordered a drink. When I went in to order the food myself the rude barman said "I won't take your order  - that's why we have a waitress". When I questioned waiting 30 minutes, he said. "We'll get to you when we are ready". At that point we left.
Good sandwiches worst service ever.

A North Beach institution.  Back in the day, Food & Wine magazine put the breaded eggplant sandwich @ Mario's on their list of "the 10 things you MUST eat in SF."  This was way, WAY before 7x7 magazine came out w their first list, since 7x7 magazine didn't even exist then.  I had to mention this because there are so many newbie "foodies" out there that actually don't know that there were lists like this & that there was a thriving food scene in SF long before "the 7x7 list" ever appeared.  Even worse, there are droves of people that use "the list" as the deciding factor on where & what to eat in this town.  And that's just sad.  SF has been cranking out exceptionally noteworthy food forever, & Mario's has been doing it from day one.

So many good memories here. Been coming for 20 years. It' that kind of place.  North Beach might change, but Mario's does not.  The food is limited, but who cares because the sandwiches are the best you're going to get, the venue is so inviting it makes you want to sit there all day reading a paper and watching the people wander through the park.
SUPER hipster, but a damn good sandwich.
This is the best meatball sandwich I have ever had. That's an aggressive statement, but totally true.

A Iconic sandwich and cocktail pit stop while wandering through North Beach. The place has an alluring smell from the years of caked on grease on the one deck oven that sits at one end of the bar. It's a nostalgic smell that always delivers memories of foggy & rainy days in North Beach, where we ducked in here to escape the weather and have a drink.
Mario's was great.
As good as it gets!

The food is really decent, and the location can't be beat.  The wine selection is a joke, and served in juice cups.  I get that is authentic, but they could do better.  Drinking bad wine out of a crappy cup doesn't work.
Sandwiches on focaccia are the best here!  Veggie or Sausage are my favorite.  A little messy, but well worth it.

My husband and i love this place.  it is very relaxed and has the feel of a place that has been around forever, which it has been.  In a good way.  I always get the breaded eggplant focaccia sandwich.  We have been going to this place since before they had a menu.  the sandwiches are just as good as they have always been hot, toasted perfectly.  My husbaND likes the eggplant pizza.  Together with a glass of wine or a beer on tap it makes for a very easy dinner on the nights we are too lazy to cook.  thank you, Mario's! Don't ever change.

Great little cafe in north beach.  I'm a little sentimental because this was the first place I went to when I moved here.  It is in such a cool little corner location.  It makes you feel like you're in a little cafe in Europe.  Such a cool vibe.

Tried this place about four times now and have mixed reviews. The sandwiches taste great, but on the pricy side for not coming with chips or a salad...they need to improved their customer service, it takes them a while to get to you for being such a small place...I will continue to go there when I'm not in a rush, the paninis are that good

You can't beat the adorable atmosphere with rickety wooden tables and a view of the park. Get the chicken sandwich (add tomatoes if you like). Their mustard has a delicious kick to it - watch out if you're a little sensitive to horseradish-esque tastes, but it's SO GOOD! Cheap carafes of wine as well. It's not the most amazing, droolworthy, tell everyone you see meal in North Beach, but sometimes you just want to grab a leisurely sandwich in a really comfortable, cute, pleasant atmosphere. Go!!! Perfect weekend afternoon stop.

Some of the best sandwiches in the neighborhood! The bread comes from the focaccia bakery a few blocks over, by far the best bread I've ever had so it adds a lot to the sandwiches. The grilled sandwiches are the best, my favorite is the chicken #1. The guys that run it are super old school and refuse to do any substitutions but you really wouldn't want any!
Good for coffee, paninis and sandwiches are pretty disappointing.
Oh my!  I was temporarily transported to Florence last night when I scooped a spoonful of their housemade tiramisu into my mouth!  Heaven pure Italian heaven on a plate.

ridiculous service!  the espresso was awful and asked for a refund.  the Italian sounding barman said it's a perfectly fine espresso and "you must pay 2.75" !no offer to make a different one or compromise in any way.  plain nasty experience.  after all we are on vacation Mario,  so please take it easy- your espresso is bitter,  watery and gross!

I used to love this place,  but wow the service has become terrible.  I came in this week and it took me 20 minutes just to get a drink while I was at the bar!   After that my sandwich was completely burnt.  We go in today for a drink with a big group, we were there for literally one minute and the waitress started yelling at us for being in the way.   POOR SERVICE.  It's really too bad, lot of potential but poor service.  I unfortunately have to recommend that you stay away from this place until they right the ship.

After having the meatball focaccia sandwich bookmarked for ages I think that I waited to long to finally try it. Not because I've been missing out but because so many good sandwich shops are now in business. So whereas the meatballs were tender and the sandwich was okay, it just wasn't great.
Former "Old School" now a "hipster faux school" joke.

So I've just come down from a walk over Telegraph Hill, and I'm thinking a little dinner would be just the thing, and there's Mario's, and so here I am writing a review while I finish my wine and reflect on why this is one of my favorite comfort food spots.

always a great espresso served right and the tiramisu always perfect.  The lemon ricotta cheesecake was not on the menu due to Mario's widow broke her arm a couple weeks ago.  This is the kind of place it is.  I have been going there for years.  Always a treat and the current staff was really nice.

I happened to be walking by a couple weeks ago and decided this place was worth a shot. They had some interesting looking pies, and I figured I'd try something different. They had a pesto pizza with garlic and mushrooms that was decent, and a veggie pizza that turned out to be pretty bad. The flavors just didn't go together and it actually tasted kind of sour. With two slices costing me about $10, i felt pretty ripped off. Looks like I'm going to have to find another pizza place in San Francisco
Good service

The shameful thing is that a pretty good pizza is made completely undesirable because of the atrocious customer service.  The employees (specifically the woman running the register) appear to be living in some sort of warped world where discourteousness, indifference, and dereliction of duty are a good way to run a business.
Very tasty pizza if you buy the slices, delivery service isn't that good. Also what i lke about this place is that it is open late its a big big plus.
I may have found the fountain of youth again.
They stuff the To Go slices in brown bags. Makes for a rough, greasy walk. Can we get some actual pizza boxes?
yuck this place sucks .overpriced too and nothing like pizza in ny
Best pizza I've ever had - MUST TRY
Hot. Fresh. Slice of Pizza.
Ordered a large veggie combo, lose the olives, add sausage.   Guy said then it ain't a veggie combo anymore.  Yup he had me there.

Went here again last night and ordered pizza by the slice. It was wayyyy better than when we ordered delivery.  I actually really enjoyed the sauce on the plain cheese. The pesto with spinach and sun dried tomatoes was also amazing.
We love the potato pizza its the best and this place plays great  music and friendly staff

The Buffalo wings were cold, the pizza was cold, they forgot to deliver the ranch dressing for the wings, and the croutons for the salad (despite my asking him to repeat my order). When I called to say what was wrong with my order, I was put on hold for several minutes. When the guy got back on the phone, he said, "we'll take off the ranch [which was included in the price of the wings], and try to deliver it right next time." He got off the phone before I could tell him there won't be a next time.
Escape from New York is solid pizza. They don't skimp on the toppings. My favorite is the potato garlic which is yummy. Not the healthiest of meals but you have to indulge sometimes!

WTF never ever ever order from this place! We ordered and they made us wait an hour . it came out, and they refused to sell it to us. Is this real? Two hours later no pizza. I used to love this place. Order from This is only a place if you want to be completely ripped off. Someone call Better Business Bureau
$4.15 for a thin slice of pepperoni pizza.  It was a bit greasy and salty.  Meh.

Why pretend to be something you're not? "Escape from New York" don't expect to walk in here and hear any music aside from east coast rap with staff who look the part as well. Honestly, it makes for a nice change given all the artisan/hipster vibes most places in the city have. I can appreciate a pizza place that's rough around the edges. The pizza is par and they have a very popular potato pizza which my gf loves. Prices aren't cheap but are in line with the area. If I'm having a pizza craving and want to grab a few slices to-go, this is my joint.

pizza ready to reheat and go. I had the veggie  and my bf had the hawaiian slice. the slice was huge and the crust was kind of dough and hard. But the  sauce of the pizza was delish would return again for the quick bite and other choices of slices to go.
Great pizza, great music, and a wonderful staff.
Over priced! $30 w tip&tax for a medium supreme. .. I've had better frozen pizza. Big disappointment. Expected better

My favorite pizza in the city.  I'm just wondering why they only put out one container of red pepper, parm cheese and seasoning.  We always have to hunt for it at the outside tables or asks the other customers if we can use it.  It would be nice if they had a second set that stays at the counter.

SF has a severe deficit of "walking around pizza" -- that is, pizza that is best consumed while avoiding eye contact with other pedestrians on a crowded sidewalk.  There are probably better sit down places (Little Star, etc.), but if you're on your way from point A to point B, this is the ideal companion slice for the journey.  Minus one star because it could be cheaper.
Love the pesto pizza and love the low price.
OK pizza.  Only a few options that were fresh out of the oven.

escape doesn't have the greatest of pizzas but then again i'm not a huge pizza fan. the only reason why i'm giving this place 4 stars is because they always seems to be open when everything else is closed, the staff is hilarious is you catch them when its slow and there always seems to be at least one slice of something that is tasty.

It does the job as far as drunk food goes. But I can get the same quality pizza for $1 in New York City. I ordered a slice of the pesto garlic potato. I normally love all three ingredients, but something was missing. Finally, it dawned on me: meat! It needs chicken or bacon to off set the garlic and carbs. Plus, the crust is flavorless and sits in your mouth like a hunk of cardboard.

Going from 4 stars to 1 star may be drastic, but this place just doesn't cut it. $35 for a pizza with two extra things which didn't come on it. The phone guy rushed my order rudely and when I called back he was poised to have them argue with me about it. The point is - if a person can't even tell the extras are there even if they were (and they were not) then isn't something wrong here? There is nothing distinctively good about this pizza or the phone guy. Don't pay for what you aren't going to get.

"Thinner crust" pizza is more accurate than "thin crust" pizza. Too much dough for me. Ordering online is great and the delivery was fast, so you get an extra star for that. But sadly, the pizza itself is disappointing, it probably works as a last resort but probably not something I will order again.
EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. I. HAVE. ATE. THIS. PIZZA. THE. BOTTOM. IS.......

Always great customer service!! Every time I come to SF, I have to order from here. Their pesto chicken and applewood BBQ chicken are the BEST. When I go into the store, it is always clean and the managers/owners have always been more than accommodating when it comes to my children (I have 7 so its hard to find someone who can tolerate the activity).  Highly recommend to everyone!!

I like it when I need a quick bite. The slices are pretty good and I usually get the super combo. A whole medium pizza will set you back about $24, but it is easily at least two meals if not three. Sometimes it seems like the staff isn't very organized as they've mixed up my order a couple times.. but whatever. If I need a pizza fix that is close to home, this is the spot.

My coworker won tickets at a radio station and they served us lunch from this place. I do have to say that the pizza was really yummy. I like that the crust is not too thin and not too thick- just right. My favorite is the hawaiian and the combo.

I swear to god this happened and I guess it's a San Francisco thing but I just went there to try and grab a slice or two and all the slices were old (whatevs, I can deal) and/or like a farmer's market vomited on them (not as dealable).

I enjoyed the service here, which is unexpected for this type of restaurant. I've had the Hawaiian pizza (good) and the potato pesto pizza, which was highly recommended but too much potato (and I usually love potato). A solid meal for under $6.

Escape From New York Pizza is our go-to delivery option at home. The fact that this location is so close to where we live (just a few blocks away) means we get our pizza that much faster. I like the fact that the crust is more substantial than what you'd get in New York. (It is "*Escape* From New York Pizza" after all.) The ingredients seem quality, and overall it's definitely better than average pizza for San Francisco (though you do pay for it).
If you love "meh pizza", this is your joint!

This is my favorite delivery pizza in the area.  At first I was not a huge fan of how much sauce they used on their pies, but I have learned to simply order with extra cheese and light sauce.  Delivery is always prompt, and I like that they have the system in place that remembers your address by phone number for returning customers.

I keep trying to find a good pizza in San Francisco .....Dam ? I just tried escape from New york and it will be going in the trash .I paid 24 dollars and I prepaid the tip its not the drivers fault that this pizza was terrible .I was in Detroit recently and had pizza from three different places and they were al pretty dam good but why is it I can not get a good pizza In San Francisco ?????
I love this place.

We ordered delivery from Escape from New York Pizza and it came relatively quickly, which is a huge deal (as you know) when ordering food. The pizza was delicious (as pizza goes), but not outstanding or different in any way.

Small place but big flavor! My husband loves a good meal w meat but he was pleasantly surprised (and stuffed) after our delicious meal. He had the tacos and I have the portobello. Even our appetizer of hummus was fantastic. Worth a stop! Everything is extremely fresh, farm to table & non-GMO. Can't beat all of that goodness!

Only recently discovered this gem and had to post my first YELP review ever to spread the word. The music was FANTASTIC -really talented musicians playing Bolivian music (as well as Carlos Santana) using esoteric instruments had folks dancing. The place is quirky, the service was great, but THE FOOD IS MEMORABLE! Really creative dishes with unique flavors, you don't have to be a vegan or a raw foodie to appreciate perfectly prepared food presently beautifully. The deserts have no added sugar, they don't use wheat, BUT DON'T LET THAT SCARE YOU AWAY! You won't even notice because the flavors and textures are so wonderful. This is not bland, healthy food, this is DELICIOUS, beautiful, HEALTY FOOD! Try it if you like delicious and different.
I definitely love this place.
This place is so amazing.  The food, the service, and atmosphere,  the live music and the desserts.... a new favorite for sure!

Such a fun neighborhood gem! They have been there a long time, they are both musicians. It's actually a cultural center so I love eating here to support them. Besides, the food is delicious. Organic, South American cuisine? Always yes!

Excellent food but a totally bizarre atmosphere. We can in at 9PM on a Saturday and we could not tell if the place was actually a functioning restaurant. Just one table had guests (one of them was a dog that had no indications of being a therapy animal but it was just chilling and causing no harm). No one greeted us at the door for about two minutes and despite being nearly empty they still had to set a table. There was a stage and the website said live music nightly but nothing was happening during our visit.
Great food, great service and lovely owner who has been vegan for years. We enjoyed the raw vegan sampler and raw zucchini pasta, both were amazing. We are so coming back tomorrow!
The food was excellent: 5 star.

The food itself was very good. And while I usually reserve 5 stars for the most incredibly mind blowing food and service, on occasion the full experience can bump my rating into that range. Pena Pachamama falls into that category for me.
Carolina Lugo's & Carole Acuna'a Ballet Flamenco returns to the Pena  November 29 & December 6,13,20,21,27,28 at 6:30  pm. Saturday night was sold out and the show was really hot.

We had such a great evening.  Left before the dancing started, but the early music was outstanding.  Guest violinist was amazing.  The food was pretty good.  LOVED the raw housemade buckwheat crackers with guacamole.

Hands down one of the best vegan places in the city. It's rare that I finish my plate at any eatery but here I wiped my plate clean. It was that good. The staff are warm and accommodating. Will be back for sure.

Pena Pachamama is a South American restaurant located in North Beach. I stumbled upon this place a long time ago and after eating there an upwards of 50 times, I can honestly say I have never had a bad meal here.
So we had two dinner specials and a pitch of sangria.  The dinner special is $39.95 for one small plate and one dinner plate with musical show.
Amazing food good service and super fun live show. Definitely check this place out if you're vegan/raw.

An entirely adorable and wholesome experience! I came here with my "healthy" girlfriends for their vegan South American cuisine (pretty rare find, no?) Loved the colorful folk decor, cave-like bar area, generous helpings of vegan grub. Every once in a while, it's good to pretend you're vegan, and Pena Pachamama makes it pretty fun & painless. Cashew cheese covered yucca fries, anyone?
This place is great! Delicious food, great service, and warm, unique ambiance with live music. I can't wait to go back.

Like taking a one night trip to Bolivia!  Great food, music and dance show.  Kale chips are a must try, but really everything we had was good and the menu is vegetarian/vegan heaven!   Intimate, romantic setting.  Can't wait to go back!

I just love this place and anytime my family visits I bring them here because the shows are great and we are Latin.  The entertainment is definitely better than the food, but I love that its Vegan and their Kale chips have to be the best I've had. I just can't stop eating them!   Love the Sangria too.
Amazingly talented artists. They are a family that worked their way up to convert their home into a sizzling Latin getaway. Food is delicious, dance floor is tiny but welcoming. Loved it!
I have been there several times and was not too impressed with the menu, but at least they had some chicken and beef on the menu.

I'm a hardcore vegan. And it saddens me when places like this exist because non-vegans are lead to believe that our kind eats this absolutely flavorless and greasy mess. First off, please keep in mind that most ingredients used to flavor cooking are ALREADY vegan, so I'm flabbergasted as to why their food had ABSOLUTELY. NO. FLAVOR. None.
I love the idea of being vegan, eating more raw foods and having hearty foods as healthier foods.

I found this place on groupon. After reviewing some of the photos my fellow yelpers posted I was sceptical. my boyfriend and I went on a Wednesday night. We called in for reservations and accommodated with no problem.  We arrive well before our 9 PM reservation and was seated not even 5 minutes of arriving.

Heeeelp, i have been robbed! I am deeply disappointed in the dinner+ flamenco combo. The tickets are 19$ per person(!!!!!) without any food. The owners seemed lovely, i respect the dancers and their talent but the service was beyond horrible and the food portions were small and forgettable. Probably I'm spoiled by Cafe Gratitude and Gracias Madre, their dishes are amaaaaazing.
Interesting place to spend Saturday night! Flamenco performance was pretty good; food is delicious if you a vegan...and I am not; sangria is enjoyable.
Vegan, Latin fusion

Fun experience, definitely different.  Great building, wonderful entertainment, although there was a soloist that belonged somewhere else.  I didn't understand why she was singing some corny 90's song in the middle of the show.... still scratching my head about that---for a moment I wondered if we had paid for Karaoke.

I came here for a show, sangria and few shared plates. I was truly super excited to try this place and listen to some latin/world music. While the music was OK, it seriously lacked the zest that I was hoping for.

This restaurant is such a gem. Every vegan/vegetarian in the Bay Area needs to be eating here regularly.  The service is top notch, the food is superb,  the entertainment is fabulous and the owner, Quentin Narvia is marvelous and sweet.

Just discover this amazing place! Best vegan food, small stage for music and speech, light vibe, traditional and cultural set up. The owner came personally and talked to us, gave recommendations on menu items and lots of smiles! Such a great person. Food server sharp, friendly and extremely efficient. Menu with lots of variety and everything me and my girlfriend had was just beyond what we expected. We will definitely come back to discover more on this incredibly delicious menu!
Wonderful family owned place. Mostly organic, with wonderful vegan and raw options! The shows are fun, the entertainers make you feel like family. It's a great dining experience.

We were here on NYE for a party.  The food was pretty good.  We were there for a private party, so the food was buffet style.  The people that work there are nice.  The upstairs "speakeasy" room was fun when our party moved up there.  I can't say what it is like on a normal night, but NYE was fun there with the live music and samba dancers.

I've been wanting to check this place out for the longest time and finally got a chance to watch the flamenco show and dinner tonight. It's a small intimate venue, with a cute stage and really close tables. My friends and I shared some tapas (chicaron, yuccas, kale chips, tamales etc which were all really tasty) while watching the dancers. They were all delicious and we were glad we shared, serving sizes were just right to share

I went with my wife for a concert. It was practically empty, but we had a great time. The live music was wonderful. The food and sangria were great. They have great vegan and vegetarian options, too. We especially loved the kale chips. Would highly recommend and would definitely go again!
SO GOOD!

This place was cramped and did not have proper seating. the show they were trying to upwell also wasn't great, they had some old women performing weird noises. Due to improper seating of the place it was impossible to see the performance anyway(It had lot of footwork and only front tables in the table could see that). The sangria's served were tasteless and so was the food. They overcharged gratuity without my consent because I was using groupon. The worst part was that because I was using groupon they did not give us the seat we were asking and were told that they give preference to those customers who pay full amount inside the restaurant. Just wasted $100 on this place and spoiled my date.
Love this place, just goes to prove music, food, culture....can recreate home... had  alot of fun.
Thank you for inviting me, it's a wonderful place. The food oh my god. Tasty and delicious. So happy to meet you.

This place is a scam! Do not purchase their tickets! They make you order two drinks and food and watch old women dance. Just be honest with your service....simple.  I am very disappointment and ashamed of an establishment like this. People want to come out and enjoy the evening , not forced and scammed into purchasing things that they don't want. The food is so-so, straight buzz kill. Never again.
Fearful that this would be indeed a tourist trap, I was delighted to find that it was not at all, and had an excellent dining experience.

This place is a joke. Mediocre food, TINY portions and VERY high prices! Will not be back for sure!!! Disappointed. There are much better Italian restaurants with much better food around. Trust most yelp reviews.

A very consistent 8/10.  Rose Pistola is not the best Italian in North Beach, but it's close and (most important) very reliable/consistent.  This place delivers time and time again, both on food quality and on service.  I have had just about everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed (though rarely blown away).  Try the scallops and the octopus--both are real treats.  Perhaps my favorite thing about Rose Pistola is that it is easy to get a table, even on short notice, and it's quiet enough to be able to talk to other people.  I have become a bit of a regular given the convenience and consistency.

Burrata was good, the atmosphere was better than the food really. It was relaxing and pleasant the gorgonzola pizza needed some truffle salt and maybe shred the persimmons for a more balanced texture. I would eat here again.
I booked a 1,000 pt table here - received a call saying 'looking forward to you dining this evening' and then I received 100 pts. .
Nice atmosphere but slow service and mediocre overpriced food. Coffee was sitting on burner for a while and a bit watery, also $3 which I found excessive
I had lunch there; a total of 10 of us on a very, very slow Thursday.   Have to agree with most of the reviews:   Good (but not fantastic) food; TERRIBLE service.

I enjoyed my seafood spaghetti and my friends enjoyed their personalized  pancetta and pesto pizzas. But I feel something was missing. I can't put my finger on it. May be it was the lack of warmth and the Italian friendliness that one expects. May be it was me in which case it is unfair to give this restaurant a so so rating and I should go back and give it another try.
I came here with a  friend for lunch during the week. We got there pretty soon after they opened, and we were able to get a great table outside. The ambience is nice, and our waiter was great.

The first time we came here was for my wife's birthday back in June and I made early reservations because we were going to watch Beach Blanket Babylon after dinner. Upon arrival (6ish) the restaurant was not busy at all with open tables everywhere, so we were dumbfounded when we were seated right in the middle of the dining area with bench seating. How conveniet (sarcasm here) that the next couple that came in with no reservation was seated at a private two seater table by the window (the color of their skin was probably the ticket to those seats). From there service was ok (the bus boys/table setters were more available and convenient to get some attention and service). As for dinner and the food it was ok also. The only thing memorable was the anti pasta prosciutto appetizer otherwise everything else was over salted or just flavored with olive oil. Overall a 3 star rating but I'm not giving that.
Very Nice host. She did all her possible to find us a spot for us and our stroller.
Very good food, the pizza are excellent, very light, best pizza on wood oven I have ever eaten. The service is a bit slow and cold.
So-so service and overpriced for decent but not great food.

After much struggle with parking, we figured out a spot and decided to check out another place in the area. Sadly the wait time was ~ 1 hour plus so we crossed the street and thought to give this place a try.

Very nice looking restaurant and bar.  Came here for a very special occasion while visiting some friends.  Came and checked-in with hostess at the front of the restaurant.  We requested a table for 4 people.  The young girl was very nice and friendly and told us it'd be about 10 to 15 minutes to wait.  This sounded good so my buddy went over to the bar to get a drink while we waited.  Not even 5 minutes into our waiting the hostess comes up and tells us that the table she promised us is not available and won't be available because they're over booked for the evening, WTF?  I saw something really strange written on the wall and I wasn't sure how to react.  I told the hostess I was very disappointed and I didn't understand how what was true 5 minutes ago, was suddenly not true anymore.  I told her I was going to go all over the internet and write about how this happened to us.  One of the things I knew wasn't an issue was how we were dressed because we were dressed right for dinner and no different than anyone else already in the restaurant.  I WILL NEVER EVEN COME TO THIS RESTAURANT AGAIN.  IF THEY DON'T WANT MY BUSINESS, I'M SURE THERE'S MORE RESTAURANTS THAT WILL.
Had the spaghetti with seafood sauce. The sauce is good and rich, more seafood than spaghetti... but I didn't mind because it was so good!

Service was okay and food was mediocre. The plan was to stay for drinks after dinner but after the server forgot one of our dinner items halfway through our meal, we decided to take our money elsewhere. The bread was bland and they didn't offer any oil and vinegar to accompany it.

Went to this place for lunch. My server was Damien, he must've been out too late last night because he acted as if we were annoying him with our business. I was willing to look past that, but then the food came. I ordered a pizza- what came out was a cheese crisp sprinkled with onion and almost no sauce. When addressing Damien about this issue I was extremely polite, he came back with no answer to the pizza and asked me to order something else. He then brought the manager out who asked if I would like to try anything else, I once again said no thank you. Damien then ignored us until we got up and found him to ask for the check, he stated, "we both checked on you" with annoyance in his voice. The overall feeling was that the place had horrible staff and was not backed up with good food. I would not recommend this place to anyone as they don't know how to cook Italian food and are not respectful to customers. If you don't believe me ask for Damien as a server.

I tried antipasto vegetarian sampler with grilled vegetables literally soaked in olive oil.As main course,I tried ravioli with asparagus sauce.The service is top class.I also enjoyed swaying to the cultural italian music while having my lunch.Great place.Crowded.Great vibe.The dessert menu  is one of the most elaborate I have seen lately.Will come again to dig the dessert.
They have really good seafood entrees and a good selection of wine. The service was pretty great and fast too. I would come back.

Not bad, but nothing knocked my socks off. The food was good, timing of wine,  appetizers & entrees was perfect. I feel that just like anywhere in North Beach, the food was overpriced. But the atmosphere made up for it. Lovely little tables, good lighting and we had some live jazz music playing.

My husband and I wanted to listen to some live music over dessert.  Perfect find!  We had the bread pudding with nectarines.  Beautifully presented and tasty.  We were seated at a long community table.  The trio (saxophone, bass violin, and percussion) was nearby but perfect in volume.  We could still hear each other talk but the music was audible and soothing.  They played slower and faster pieces, kept the mood sublime. The live music is scheduled from 9-11:30 PM.

I sat at tables outside and the heater was off, I do not know if it was not working or it was not turned on to lower the PGE bill, either way it was a bad idea. To fight the bad weather I ordered a hot dish but my pasta was barely warm, nearly as cold as the weather.  Service was pretty good though, I think the waiter's name was Javier or something like that. I will come back to the restaurant, but I will probably wait till next season or until the sun arises

Bad service, waited and waited for water, no one has refilled our glass even they walked by and saw our empty glass. We also ordered two pot of teas and was never asked if we need more hot water refill. Service should be more attentive when they charged a $$$ price. Our waitress did not have the intention to check on us. She also forgot our breads. Food was medicore, so bland. ordered the seafood spaghetti and they gave me angel hairs instead. I did not like the red sauce on my spaghetti either, was lacked the fresh tomato favor compared to other Italian restaurants. My husband ordered the whole branzino, he didn't like it at all. He said the fish was so bland and needed more seasoning, did not come with any sauce for the fish either. The fish was not cooked all the way through or they did not clean well the inside of the fish, there was blood in the center of the fish, $37 before tax for a bland undercooked fish. Disappointed on our first visit.

For customer service and kindness!!! Didn't get to eat there but had a great customer service experience. I was a distressed mom with 8 month old on our first trip to SF. I asked to use the restroom for my daughter's diaper change and they gladly showed me the way!!! Thank you so much for your kindness...will try food next time for sure

In the interest of full disclosure, I used to work at Rose Pistola, but it's been a long time.  I was lucky to find myself in the neighborhood the other day, about 30 minutes before closing.  I sat at the bar and tried to pick out the familiar faces.  One bartender I knew, and he was great as usual, and the new bartender was super friendly and helpful.

What happened here? It was with fond memories of exciting, succulent meals at Rose Pistola in years past, that we happened to have a dinner here again.Was this place sold in the meanwhile? They serve barely enough average quality food at high prices.  Strictly "corporate" .

We spent three days in San Fran and ate at Rose Pistola twice!  Delicious brick chicken and grilled Salmon along with tasty beet salad.  The Sunday brunch menu is tasty and so fun.  The restaurant is fun, open kitchen and tasty!  Thanks for the great meals!

This was amazing. The ambience was both relaxing but lively and elegant. I got the salmon and my boyfriend the chicken dish. It was fantastic and I basically licked the plate clean. Everything was made to perfection and even the appetizers were delectable. I would come back in a heartbeat

Rose Pistola is a large,  Italian-themed restaurant and bar with frontage on Columbus St. in the heart of North Beach.  Food and service are dependably good, so if you want to try something new, it's worth a stop. However, it doesn't stand out in the crowded Italian cafe scene. If you're from out of town and want to have a memorable North Beach meal, there are better choices.
Bad service, horrible food, and overpriced.

While walking through North Beach, my boyfriend and I decided we should stop at one of the restaurants so we could give our feet a rest, sip on wine, and enjoy the beautiful weather while sitting at one of the tables outside.  We decided to try out this place, since it was the first place we saw an available table outside, but it really worked out! After ordering our wine, we asked the waitress if we could get a meat and cheese plate made for us (since it wasn't on the menu), and the next thing  you know- she comes out with a cheese plate filled with four different cheeses, a meat plate filled with four different kinds of meats, and a couple of slices of focaccia bread! We were more than pleased by the service of this place. I would definitely go back here.

I have lived long enough to have figs on pizza, and it worked. Rose Pistola offered up a prosciutto and caramelized onion pizza on a cracker thin crust and added figs to bring some mellow sweetness. It definitely worked.

Every dish was excellent. We tried 4 different appetizers (the standouts were the tuna tartare and the fig pizza--an unexpected salty/sweet surprise). My steak was perfectly done and my friend's risotto was delicious. Our waiter was well-versed and very helpful in assisting us with our wine choices.

We stopped in here late on a Saturday night because we heard the live jazz music. The wine and cocktails were decent. I also had the prosciutto San Daniel with arugula, figs, and almonds. The figs were warm and sweet and the prosciutto came in a generous portion. The experience was good enough to make me want to come here again for a full dinner next time we're in the city.
This place was fantastic. I'd give it 5 stars but my only complaints were minor: the service was a bit slow & all of the windows open in the front made for some chilly dining.

Been there several times. I just love this place. The food and service are wonderful, and the location on Columbus is charming. I am especially fond of the zucchini chips, and was disappointed they didn't have them at my mid-winter visit. They said they only serve things that are in season, at their best, so no zucchini for me. So, they are serious about only serving the best. I'll be back soon for the zucchini chips!
Bummer.
The Real "Fab Four" set out for dinner on a Saturday Night in North Beach. We were in search of Good Ambiance, Good Food, and Tasty Wine.  Enter Rose Pistola!

Rose Pistola always exceeds our expectations! We have tried the Vongole this time and it is definitely worth it. Had their rib-eye steak as well, and even though we requested for a medium-well steak it was still cook to perfection! Very juicy and yet so crusty. Our server, Michael was very attentive! He has great customer service.. And he is very entertaining.. Two thumbs up to you guys!

What a gem! Never noticed this place before and decided to give it a try. Got the turkey on Dutch crunch. Great sandwich and the lady making the sandwiches is a very sweet lady. She gave me a cup of her chicken noodle soup on the house. Some of the best I've ever had.

Such a great little place.  As other reviews mention, it is just one extremely sweet Korean lady who handles everything from phone orders, making the food, customer service, etc.  Affordable, delicious, where you actually feel that your food is made with care.  I just wish it wasn't cash based only and that it was open after working hours.
Now that's a pastrami sandwich! Meaty, with just the right amount of fat and spice/bite. On A fresh ciabatta roll with all the fixins'.

Excellent choice for lunch in North Beach when you're looking for something other than sit-down Italian.  The proprietor is so friendly.  Order inside in the tiny deli and she brings the sandwiches to the sidewalk tables.  Very affordable! Fresh bread from a local baker.  And the sandwiches are bigger than expected.  We had chicken salad and turkey club.  So good.  And the proprietor came out with additional napkins and an offer to wrap anything we didn't finish.  Perfect.
Genuine lady, young, makes the sandwiches. She is so sweet and knows her customers by name.
Very tasty sandwiches, served by a lovely lady and at a great price! Take the mozzarella with tomato and lettuce!
Greatest, nicest owner ever and sandwiches that never disappoint! Turkey delight is sooo messy and soooo good. An adorable little bedroom-sized shop that will make you very happy.
I only bought a drink here but I wanted to write a review because the owner is a sweetheart. Five stars!
Most fantastic sandwiches!   Every sandwich is made "with love".  Great selection.  Prices are good.  The prices on Yelp might be wrong. But the food is totally awesome!   Friendly service each time.
Sandwich was even better than I expected, and the owner Young is such a sweetie.

Everything about this place is the best. Including but not limited to the food and service. The woman behind the counter may just be a cherub visiting earth. Turkey delight on Dutch crunch all day every day, son.

Very good sandwich (Young's Chicken), and the owner has a heart of gold. We chatted for a while and she gave the mailman a free drink when he came through. It took me a while to order and get my food (about 25 minutes) but I had nowhere to be.

Though this place is no bigger than a 10X10 bedroom, it is an absolute treasure! Me and my lovely fiancé got the pastrami melts all the way on ciabatta--it was amazing! The bread is so fresh and the owner told me she gets it from a local bakery that has been in business for 100 plus years. The owner is such a kind and sweet person. Makes me want to move here a become a regular
Oh my, had a training in Fisherman's Wharf. Not exactly my favorite part of the city, for lunch, but this place is definitely a find.

This small little sandwich shop is delicious! The experience was almost magical as the woman who makes the sandwiches is just so happy and charming. If you're a hater don't go here because you'll probably melt when you enter the place.
Overrated deli. Limited selection of sandwiches and breads and slow service with only one person working.

The owner of this shop is simply the nicest women I've ever encountered. The store is small but it's great to just grab a sandwich and head up to Coit tower or to a local park. My sandwich was phenomenal and I will certainly be back!!
The lady who works here is so sweet and kind! The Italian hero was delicious and the mix of the honey and Dijon mustard was really good!

This is my favorite sandwich shop in North Beach. Owner is a super sweet, old Korean lady. Hands down on the turkey delight and pastrami sandwiches. Pasta salad is also very yummy. This place gets very busy, especially during lunch hours. Be prepared to wait 10-15 minutes for your order. If you don't want to wait, call in your order.

No longer in San Francisco, but this was one of my favorite places to eat when I lived there. The turkey delight is definitely one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten and Young consistently makes it super tasty. Not that Petite Deli needs another raving review, but I'm gladly giving 5 stars for this one woman sandwich making superstar of a place
this lady is very sweet. i started to send a good yelp review before i even tried my sandwich! But the sandwiches are very tasty and i recommend the turkey delight

This woman is amazing! Friendly old Chinese lady makes sandwiches with love and care in this tiny hole in the wall. Be prepared to wait 10-15 mins for your sandwich if there are other customers-- it's worth the wait. We had avocado BLT on Dutch crunch - add hot sauce. Amazing.
This is a thoroughly delightful little spot to grab a really yummy sandwich - no fanfare, no mentions of grass-fed-well-massaged-happy-go-lucky-meats, just super tasty, well-executed sandwiches.

Hands down the best in north beach! Every thing I have ever tasted there has been amazing. The pastrami in the Dutch crunch roll is amazing! The tuna sandwich in a basic wheat bread is amazing! The polish sausage in the Dutch crunch roll is AMAZING! Her pasta salad and chicken noodle soup will blow ur mind! I LOVE this place!
This review is long overdue and even though Petite Deli has many reviews, I thought I'd add mine since Young, the owner has catered two of my offices small parties!
Great local sandwich & salad shop in a sea of tourist restaurants on a popular stretch of Columbus.
I love this little place.

This deli is run by a super nice lady who takes very good care of you and makes delicious sandwiches. It's very small and sometimes it takes a while to get the sandwich but it's worth the wait. I was recently eating there when some tourists remarked that it was interesting because it was so petite. However it's not interesting because it's small it's interesting because it's friendly and delicious.

Best sandwiches In town made by a sweet and friendly lady who welcomes her customers with a cheerful greeting! The meats, vegetables, and breads are all fresh and delicious. I will definitely be back for more.

This is by far one of the best sandwich places. My husband and I both ordered the turkey delight. The bread was very fresh and there was the perfect amount of meat. The cranberry and honey mustard gives it the perfect amount of sweet. The lady who makes your sandwiches is so adorable. She makes the sandwich with love. I would come back to SF just for this sandwich.

This is my second review of Petite Deli. I think I've written a total of ten review in my life. She is part of my Saturday routine, which includes a long bike ride and a workout, and then call ahead and order a Pastrami Melt on Dutch. Dont order the dutch though cuz she runs out and I want it for myself. Maybe I shouldnt have wrote this review.

I spent a day looking for subs to find the best one, for me.  This was my first stop based on all the reviews.  I ordered a turkey sandwich on dutch.  I have to say that the lady that runs it is the sweetest lady I have ever seen make sandwiches.  She makes you feel very comfortable and welcomed.

From the moment you walk in to the moment you get your food you get a very friendly vibe from this place and its small little old Korean lady proprietor. This is by far one of the gems of San Francisco, even though it is a bit small. I usually sit at the outside tables after ordering, and if you get something go for the Turkey Delight, by far the best sandwich on the menu. When I'm in the area I go here because it is by far one of my favorite delis in San Francisco; and I really hope they expand the place a bit so there is more room as it can get a little busy sometimes.

This is honestly my favorite deli in northbeach. The subs & Sammie's from Molinari's & the other Italian delis can be heavy & greasy, but not at Petite Deli! Everything is fresh, fresh, fresh and I like that she uses many thin slices of meat & cheese.
The Petite Deli is really Petite, but If you are near in the neighborhood you should visit  this place.

The lady who runs this store is absolutely incredible and makes delicious sandwiches. I would highly recommend the mozzarella, basil and tomato. Definitely try to call in ahead of time with your order or expect at least a 15 minute wait.  It's worth it though.
Really good sandwiches for a great price. Mom and Pop kind of place, the owners are really sweet
Looking to kick start a great day!? Take a trip down to Petite Deli.

Petite deli is a true gem in north beach if you like classic well-made sandwiches. I'm a huge fan of the young's chicken, which they happily toast and heat. The woman who runs the place is truly the nicest person ever, as the other reviews have mentioned. She literally just caught a police officer trying to ticket my car and had me run outside in time to stop him. Place is small, so don't expect to eat in if its crowded.
