Best practice is to call your order ahead of its a busy time of day as she can get a little backed up sometimes. In any case, totally worth the stop.

The Petite Deli is a true gem. It is definitely petite with three tables inside (each sitting about two) and two outside tables (also sitting two). The woman who runs the shop is probably one of the nicest people I have ever met. We had just moved in a few blocks away and needed someone to take care of us. She did just that. She guided us through the menu and really took her time.
Place serves slices of pizza. I have come here more than once so it must be decent. I got a Hawaiian slice for $4 today.

I don't recommend ordering online from them. I waited over an an hour and a half to receive my cold pizza from them. I ended up having to reheat it in my oven. I contacted them through Eat24 and they would only offer $5 discount. I'm sorry guys but delivering cold pizza a half hour late is a fail. I'm writing this review since you didn't provide good service or accommodation in this instance. If you are reading this I hope that you do better for your customers next time.

Great prices. Decent pizza that somehow reminds me of high school cafeteria pizza. Bottom of pizza was black but crispy. Pizza was incredible bland and plasticy. I had some stomach issues half an hour later. Probably won't be back.

Good neighborhood pizza that delivers quickly with consistently good pizza.  They also participate in Eat24...making it easy to order, get delivery...and all with a decent discount to boot!  Our fave is their version of the "combo" the Pizelle Special.  For 2 people, a small (if you watching your diet) or medium (if you are both starving) will suffice.  We usually get a medium and have 1-2 slices to spare.  The large is HUUUUGE and has lasted for several meals (which is good when you are going camping for the weekend!). :D

Did a little bit of research on here for pizza places that deliver on out trip to San Fran, and oh boy did I make the right choice! We only ordered a pepperoni pizza with extra mozzarella, but this may be the best pizza I've had in years! Sauce is perfection, cheese is perfection, and of course the pepperoni are perfection! I can only imagine how incredible it would be straight out of the oven onto one's table! Yum!
Best pizza I have had so far in SF. Good balance of cheese and tomato, not greasy, not burned, delivered quickly (ordered through Grubhub). Also, great chicken wings.

This place is great! The pizza's delicious and so are the appetizers! Also the two girls behind the counters were very sweet and had a big smile of their faces! The best is that they have other options such as sandwiches and pastas. I also like that there's indoor seating. Most places in north beach don't have any!

The delivery person yelled at me on the phone, telling me he couldn't deliver because of parking.  He grunted and growled before saying he was going to call his manager.  I asked for the name of his manager, but he never answered.  I called he restaurant and they weren't particularly helpful, but finally said the delivery guy would be at my door.  When the deliver person finally got up here, he shoved my food inside the door and was extremely hostile and rude.
Came here again not too long ago and the pizza was semi better. But still too cheesy for my liking!!

How do you get food poisoning from an Italian restaurant? When they use bad cream in their Alfredo or Pesto sauces. Sunday a group of us ordered from Pizelle's, and 2 of the 3 of us ended up with food poisoning. Enough said, never again..
Decent pizza for 1am, and no charge for delivery. The pizza took about 50min to deliver however, even if you're a few blocks away - may consider pick-up next time.
I've had their pizzas several times, all were ok, but nothing to write home about. The pizzas are horrible as leftovers, so you gotta finish them right there and then when it's hot.
good rose pasta
I would give them 4 stars for food and 2.5 stars for delivery time. 45-60 mins is more like 60-90. We've ordered a few times only because my boyfriend loves their chicken wings.
Pizzele continues to deliver quality food at good prices. My only complaint would be that they took the ground beef steak off the menu!

Stopped by this place after walking around Columbus st. All that pizza from outside the glass looked so yum and glad we decided to try. Was pretty cheap,we got a special of two slices and a drink for $8.75. The dough is oh so yum!! Liked it a lot!

My sisters and I wanted to get pizza delivered to our hotel room so we could spend the night off our feet after a long day. We ordered from here because it had decent reviews on yelp and grub hub we got the pizza an hour and a half after ordering when they said it would take 30 min and the pizza had no flavor and was cold! A frozen pizza would have been better. The garlic bread also didn't have much flavor. Do NOT recommend! Its just money down the drain!
I love this place. They have pretty good pasta (love spaghetti meatball!) and crispy chicken wings!

We are new to the area and were so excited to give Pizzelle a try. We put an order in last night and got a notification that it would be an est 90 min for delivery. We figured it was slower because of the 4th holiday. After 90 min I called and was told our order was on the way and would be there in 10 min. After 15 min I called back and was told it had been delivered. It hadn't. (It was 2 hrs at this point) After being put on hold twice the guy gets back on the phone and tells us that our order was never made. There were 2 other orders to our building and they just didn't make ours. Then he told us the kitchen was closed.  What a disappointment. We'll definitely be picking somewhere different for delivery next time.

I have 2 say that 5 minutes ago this would have been a 5 star rating no doubt about it. WE order from this place EVERY DAY. The manager is fantastic and very helpful. the food is always great. In 2 years they have only messed up my order ONCE and they made it up 2 us.  the delivery people are always on time and very good!  UNFORTUNATELY we will no longer be ordering from here as their delivery minimum just went up by $7 dollars. Its just me and my bf and are usual order is about 18-20$ EVERY DAY plus a 18-20% tip EVERY DAY (dont forget the tax) and now that it has gone up we wont be able 2 afford it. Given that now we would have 2 order for 3 people in order 2 make the minimum delivery fee and sadly we just cant because it would be a waste of food. Our last order is tonight. We had 2 order a 6 pack of soda and 3 sides of ranch JUST so we could qualify for the minimum now add tax and a 20% tip and our meal that was usually no more than 22-25$ has become a 32-38$ dollar meal.  I am very sad about this because we are always busy and this place always delivered on time and always had great food.

The chicken tenders with the ranch sauce is a must have. I really love the crunchyness of them. The parmigiana sandwich and dinner plate are really good too. I usually order take out or delivery from them so I don't actually know how to review their restaurant, but service is pretty good. Especially when they give you an extra chicken tenders in your orders. I have also tried their pizza and their pretty nice. I like my pizza crust to be a little thicker than usual.

This is a solid 3.5 but I'll give if 4 stars because I can usually always count on consistently good pizza. Only once was it lukewarm and the dough was chewy/tough and "off". We've ordered from here many times now so it's one of our go-to pizza joints. I recently tried the chocolate mousse and expected just mousse but it was a slice of choc mousse "pie" but it tasted really good to me. Not gourmet, just rich and chocolatey.

Ok so everyone loves pizza right and most pizza places have decent pizza but this place has exceptionally good pizza. Big slices that are greasy. I love a greasy pizza. The staff is really nice and always sweet. I always stop here after going to China Town cause it's right near Columbus & Grant. Definitely a favorite of mine when it comes to pizza.
Absolutely love this place. No matter what part of the city I'm in, if I'm craving pizza, I always make the drive here... Even if I'm close to Señores or Orgasmica (my number 2 & 3 pizza choices)
Timely delivery, was here quicker than estimated delivery time. We got the San Francisco Special pizza. Delish!

Just had my pizza delivered and this was not what I expected at all. I had one simple request, place the pepperoni in the shape of a heart for a very special delivery. Apparently no one within a 5 mile radius of SoMa does pizza with pepperoni in the shape of a heart. After several phone calls and different restaurants around the area, I was sure Pizzelle di North Beach would help me with this one request. Unfortunately, I was let down; disappointed. And they did not even tell me it wasn't possible. pizza is mediocre to say the least. minestrone soup had vegetables that were just too mushy.

Was on mini vacation in the city and we decided to order out for some pizza. We searched on grubhub and yelp to find some decent pizza and came across pizzelli di north beach. Ratings and reviews seemed fine so we got the jalapeño poppers and an alcapulco pizza. Overall the taste was alright but the quality of the ingredients and how we felt after was not good. Would definitely recommend against this place, especially not for delivery.

As always Pizzelle NEVER DISAPPOINTS ME! The guy warned me they changed the taste of their Calamari, it's still yummy! I went off grid tonight and ordered a Bacon Cheeseburger, oh so delish! I love them so much! definitely worth the money I spend and the delivery drivers are always professional and polite!
Pizza was absolutely delicious! Delivery was earlier than expected.  Would definitely recommend.

BEST PIZZA PLACE IN THE CITY :)!!! After trying an abundance of mr. pizza man's and nizarios, this place makes the biggest and thickest slices. Also they don't short you on pepperoni (*coughs* nizarios). Not a frequent costumer cause of how far it is and the fact that I'm not a fan of the dirty 30 lol
I just ordered delivery and hoped that it wasnt as bad as the reviews told me.  Best believe it came quick and it satisfied me. The fries couldve been better though.
I ordered a pizza from Pizzelle's last night, and when I got

Sooooo LOVE this place!  Seriously...I get cravings for the food here it's so good.  Everything I have had has been delicious!  Eggplant Parm with the side of spaghetti is to die for!  Any time a visitor from out of state visits, I get delivery from here.
I have never even written a Yelp review, but this place was so terrible I have to.

First, we ordered for delivery in advance for a 6:00 delivery time. The pizza arrived at 4:30 and our nanny paid and accepted delivery. I called to complain so they came back to take the pizza and said they would bring fresh pizza at our scheduled delivery time. I drew a small star on the inside of each box before I returned the pizza. At 6:00 they returned with our pizzas and as I guessed, they brought the exact same pizzas that were about 2 hours old. I'll never order here again.

Passed by this place on my way back to the Hilton from Pier 39 and decided to try it out.  The young girl who took our order was nice and friendly.  My 3 year old and I shared a slice of BBQ chicken pizza and a side salad.  The salad was pretty standard and was a decent size.  The pizza was tasty and hit the spot.  I liked that we had lunch for under $7 bucks, too!
Love this place!!! I usually order the patate frittes and Lisbon pizza - best pizza I've ever had! So good! The roasted garlic melts in your mouth!
Online order took after 5 tries - 40 minutes to figure out. Get with the program.
The order details:

Absolutely terrible. I never spend time to rip on a restaurant but this place is terrible. Horrible staff, terrible ingredients, worst late night pizza experience. I've been to Many late night pizza places, and this is just terrible. Strongly, strongly do not recommend.
I eat here regularly for the last 20 years or more. I am meeting my relatives here tonight. Hope it is as good as usual. I love the laid back feeling of it.

Drove from the Peninsula, paid for parking, and walked my 90 year old Mother uphill one block to take her to a "special" lunch at Capps only to be rudely told they were closed for a private party.   That was after I checked the website to verify hours, etc.   Certainly not the Capps of days bygone!

Came back after almost 10 years. Huge delicious portions. I used to think it was expensive - now I think it's cheap. Soup still rocks (minestrone doesn't describe it - it's a yummy bean soup.) REALLY NICE SERVER.

Went for dinner on a Sunday evening.  It wasn't crowded by the time we walked over around 5pm. The menu all looked so good, but we ordered the linguine with marina mussels and clams  & the fettucini with prawns in white wine sauce.  The server was attentive and polite but didn't smile the entire time.  The buser was very attentive and our water cups never got ignored ( i love that bc i drink a lot of water )  Also, the buser cleared our plates quickly and the server never crowded the table... we got everything after we had obviously  finished the prior dish.

The best place in the city for Family-style Italian dining. Sit at the beautiful bar, or cozy up with some friends in their comfy dining room. Bring an appetite, or clear out some room in your fridge, because the portions are BIG! The fare is surprisingly affordable for the quality. I brought my parents here who were visiting from the East Coast, and the owner came out and personally welcomed ALL of us. I highly recommend their Italian Sausage dinner...YUMMM!

This is a family Italian restaurant that may not rival the food in Italy, but it will reel you in with the hospitality! Food was good with healthy servings. The staff and the welcome you receive upon entering and throughout your meal create the experience that is lacking in dining these days. You are a part of the family as soon as you enter and it feels like Sunday supper without the crazy in laws. Definitely a place we will return to.

After watching beach blanket babylon, these usually is the place to be.  With a homie atmosphere and a family style serving. Food here is really good.  If you like italian family style food i think Capp's can meet your expectations..:-)
Used to be great. Last time it was far to busy and the service suffered greatly.
Ambience and food sorely lacking.  Loud,cramped, and bland food. With so many fantastic restaurants in North Beach, one should go elsewhere.
Really friendly staff and humorous server.  Order came quick. Minestroni soup and a good salad (better than your average Olive Garden) to share while you wait for your entrée.

I'd heard about Capp's Corner and decided to eat there after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon. I'd heard from many others that it was a great place and right next door to the play so we went.  To be sure, it was old-style San Francisco dining complete with a ZERO personality grumpy waiter.  "Can we get a smile, please?"  I thought I was eating in a cafeteria served by a guy who hated his job.  Not even a "Welcome to Capp's Corner" let a lone a "My name is Luigi, I will be your server."  OK, I'll admit I'm a bit spoiled. My first advertising job was for a restaurant and I ate at the owners table for dinner weekly, so I got used to a certain level of service.  But isn't that how you're supposed to feel when you are going to a restaurant, that you're with the owner and he wants everything to be right?  As for the food, well, my mom like her meal but the rest of us food snobs barely finished our plates as there just wan't anything special about the entree.  The sautéed vegetable were good.  That was about it.  ONE NOTE.  The bus boy was good and very attentive at pouring our water and cleaning our table.  Too bad he was not serving us, I would have left a bigger tip....

We stopped in right before dinner service ended. Not only was the service friendly and quick,  but the food was incredible. The atmosphere was welcoming and we had a great time. We usually like to jump around to different places, but we'll definitely be returning here soon!

What a great time we had Saturday night at Capp's Corner. Located in North Beach, we took 7 adults and 7 girls for a late night dinner at 8:30.  The minestrone soup served before our meal was so tasty and all our meals were wonderful. I had a steak that was so large I was able to let my daughter have more than half!
Horrible service and bland food. I had to add seasoning to every single dish including the soup!

Yesterday a friend and I were looking for a place to get a glass of wine or a beer so we could sit and chat before heading home.  Two places we went into in North Beach were  not for us--one was too noisy for conversation and the other too expensive for a glass of wine.  So we went into Capp's and sat at the bar.  Decided to have a beer (Anchor Steam on tap) and asked if they had any appetizers we could order.  Oh, No!  they don't.  but the bartender drummed up cheesy garlic bread and meatballs for us.  Delicious!  And so filling that I realized I was going to call it dinner and just have a bowl of salad when I got home.

We had another wonderful lunch at Capps Corner today.  Once again the service and food was great.  I still love the calamari steak lunch and many of our group have the traditional spaghetti and meatballs.  Our servers were very good and very nice and really tried to make our visit memorable.  5 stars for Capps Corner!
Another lunch at Capp's on December 19, 2013.  Excellent as usual.  The prices never change.  Where else can you get an excellent lunch for $14?

Topped off a perfect visit to SF from down peninsula fo three seniors.  Was great to see BBB, find easy access nearby parking at Vallejo Garage, and dine just steps from BBB at this couldn't-be-homier little spot.  We happened to arrive as a large busload of seniors from Grass Valley arrived - unbeknownst to waitstaff, who couldn't be more cordial and inviting.  I could definitely imagine stopping in frequently if I lived nearby.  At the invite of waitress and ok from bartender we started our meal at the bar instead of waiting.  Yes, the minestrone was lighter, less pasta-laden than I am used to but I found it a nice lead-in to the salad and entrée, rather than being too filling.  The salad was traditional, as expected.  We did love the luscious beets and remarked at the creamy dressing.  We were informed it was simply egg and olive oil! Whoa-tasted like creamy cesear or...  Each enjoyed our entrée and felt a 3 course dinner under $20 in 'the city' was great to come by.  Thanks to all for a lovely cold winters night out.  We've recommended already..

Went here for my Mother-in-law's birthday. All the food looked great, except for what I ordered. The veal I ordered was dried out, and hard as a rock. Maybe that is not there speciality. Don't live in the city, so I would probably go to Buca di Bepo instead.

Are you kidding me?  I guess it is "the place" to eat before or after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon but we won't be back.  The noise was outrageous and we were crowded by very large customers sitting right behind us.  The 'family style' dining means they bring each table a big bowl of minestrone soup that is so bland it tastes like it's been sitting all day.  The big bowl of salad was good - tons of dressing but typical of what you would get in the 60's and I suppose that is what they are going for - the "pre-foodie" type of food.  The food was mediocre at best and there was no real 'ambiance.'
Boy has this gone down hill. The worst minnestroni soup I ever had. Taste like left over lental soup. Very bland. Capps What happened????
They fired the best bartender I have ever known and I will never go back there again.
Absolute garbage. Food on a plane is better. Do yourself a favor and go anywhere else. Yuck!
Perfect!! Service to food- awesome dinner after show up the street! Have many friends that drive 45 min into the city just for this place!

The minestrone soup is very good. And they give you lots of bread. I had the chicken parmigiana that was satisfactory. Our food server was very attentive and we were never low on beverages. My friend had the ravioli which she loved!  The location was perfect for dinner before Beach Blanket Babylon :) I would go back for the soup.
If you like bland, tasteless food, you're going to love the penne meat bolognese at Capp's!

Inept service. They told us it would be a 10 minute wait and then 30 minutes later they seated two groups who arrived after us before starting us.  They barely apologized. I suggest giving your money to restaurants with the professionalism to take care of all guests in the order in which they arrive.

From the moment my girlfriend and I walked in here we felt completely unwelcome. The hostess was flippant and seated 3 parties before us who had arrived later. Waited 10 minutes at the bar before we even got a drink. Then the hostess didn't walk us to our table. The waiter simply asked "you know what you want?" The food was decent but nothing special. The highlight was the attentive busboy. We tipped him more handsomely than the waitstaff. Overall, a really rude waitstaff and a bad environment.
Came here for lunch with my husband today. We had fast and friendly service; our waiter made sure we had everything we needed at all times.
Came here with one of my law school professors, who had been coming here for the past 15 years.
I have to give Capp's Corner five stars.
House salad + soup. Chicken parm, filet sole, decent portions. Friendly and attentive service.

Review of the bar only. We left The Saloon and headed to Beach Blanket Babylon but were early so we went to Capps Corner to have a drink. It's an old Italian Restaurant and bar. We sat at the bar and the four of us ordered drinks. The bartender chatted with us about the bar, the location and Beach Blanket Babylon. She had worked there for many years. The restaurant did a steady business. We looked at the menus and decided maybe next time. Good company and drinks.
Capp's Corner was one of the first Italian places I visited in SF.  It's great, homestyle Italian food in a family friendly atmosphere.  Great for a big group.  Definitely a good, relaxing dinner.

Great restaurant off of the beaten path. I had my birthday dinner here yesterday evening, really enjoyed the atmosphere and food. I had the LINGUINI WITH MUSSELS AND CLAMS, it was on point with the minestrone and salad before the entree.
Here's a small corner spot in North Beach with some real character.

Delicious, family style Italian food. My husband and I were meeting some friends for dinner and weren't sure if we were at the right place. I guess the staff noticed our lost look because they immediately came outside to ask if we were the couple - with the baby - that was part of the group of four. They brought us inside, seated us immediately, asked about a high chair and took an order for my daughter (who is only a year old). Service gets five stars from me. I felt right at home.

My friends and I were looking for a nice Italian place to eat at before Beach Blanket Babylon and we thought this place might be good. When we first walked in, the place had a really weird smell but I chose to ignore it and see what was on the menu. After seeing the very little variety they had to offer, I placed my order to the very unfriendly waitress who was very short with us. She served us soup and salad and removed the bowls from the table while we were still eating them. There was still food in the bowls!! She did this without saying more than two words to us. After eating the mediocre soup and salad our main courses arrived. I honestly believe chef boyardee and Kraft can make better Italian food. Finally the rude waitress dropped off the check without saying one word. The check had a sneaky extra $10 charged. After having her remove the "mistake" we left.
We went with a large group on 12/22/12 and had a great time. The food was good and the service ok. We were though a little rushed. Loved the soup and salad. Definitely will be coming back!

Excellent family-style, hearty,  Italian American fare. It was exactly what we needed on a cold, rainy night in SF. If you're looking for haute cuisine, you won't find it here, but you will get great food and service, and a lively, comfortable atmosphere.

I had the tofu dessert to go. It's okay, the tofu was not as silky as it should be. It's also relatively pricey, I think 4.50 for an order. I get that SF is a touristy place, but I could easily get double the amount at the same price in Chinatown in Philadelphia or New York.
Meh.

Not what I expected.  Thought the chocolate and the strawberry soufflés would be good, but they're not.  They looked very tasty and delicious, but was too sweet.  The sauce that came with the soufflé taste so much better.

Soufflés Cafe looks like your grandma's dining room. They have cute 50's décor, cute tea cups on the tables and such, cutesy overall. My sole purpose of going here was trying durian in some shape or form. I will get to the durian later. Our Server was nice, she did ask us if we had any coupons if we intended on using, I think you have to call ahead if you do, we did not have any coupons. We got the key lime soufflé and the green tea soufflé and some white tea. The soufflés are pretty awesome. I could see myself coming here for a post dinner dessert or for an afternoon tea with some girlfriends.

Never again! Went there and literally 2 people were eating in the restaurant and the rest of the tables had 'reserved' signs on them. We asked if we could sit and they said no because we didn't make reservations. As we browsed the menu, while standing in the corner, other people walked in off the street without a reservation and were gladly offered tables. We were told to come back in an hour for our food and when we did, all of the previous tables were still empty. Very upsetting. Souffles and smoothies were average at best. Completely disgusted with this place.

We went to Souffle Cafe at 7:30pm on a Saturday night and were pleasantly surprised that there was no wait. Note: we had a Living Social coupon and these require advanced reservations. No walk-ins. We had made reservations for 7pm but were running late and conveniently able to change the time to 7:30pm.
We ordered desserts to go - 1) mango pudding and 2) mango, pomelo and sago
Been coming here for a couple times now. Their food and service is ok. I don't like their water though! It tastes so weird..ask for hot water -it tastes better.

i think it is okay. they remodeled the whole place and turned it into a "high tea" place. they serve both chinese hong kong style food, souffle, and afternoon tea. it is kind of confuse i think. their food is okay but not like wow. price is okay, but the aftertea set is way too expensive i think. hard to find parking plus CASH ONLY.
I wouldn't bother coming here :(

OMG love love love. After years of saying, "I need to try this place," I finally tried it! My experience was just divine. Very small place. Victorian tea time feel. The decor and tableware were very elegant. Check in for free scoop of ice cream with $15 purchase. Also, from 3pm-7pm, 6 piece California rolls for $2.99.
This place is okay. Service is good for being in Chinatown

I'm a fan of this place. When I heard I could get a souffle late at night in sf and not be at a fine dining establishment ... I was suspicious. Well ironically after going to the gym, I convinced my friends to come and try this place out. Turns out the souffles weren't the whole story. You can also get food too.   Chicken wings, mussels, instant ramen and spam. Totally great for being one of the few places open past midnight. So far I have had the cinnamon vanilla, chocolate, coffee and strawberry (uses syrup but it's still good) souffles. I have tried the green tea and the durian ones, but found them not to be my thing. I had a taste of the almond souffle too and it tasted pretty good as well. Each souffle is roughly 10 bucks and takes 30 minutes and comes with a little bit of condensed milk. Pro tip, order ahead, or if you forget to do that, grab some snacks to hold you over while your puffed pastry dessert bakes in the oven behind the counter. The decor is sort of cheesy and yes it's no michelin star establishment but again, it's open late, decent price and tastes great :)
I am embarrassed to write this review because we only come here for late night desserts and food. I haven't tried most of the food because my friends and I always tend to order the same things.
This place boasts some of the most randomly eclectic (bizarre) decor I've seen in a restaurant in a long while.
I would like to think my horrible experience isn't a norm for this establishment.  Or any other for that matter.

Went here because my ex had a special one from groupon I think. Passed by there before but never tried it until then. Was an eat in special only. When we walked in the door there was a very pungent odor of some kind..what kind idk!! But a foul stank super strong one. My nose is uber sensitive & I couldn't stand it! It truly affected my dining experience. The food was good & the soufflé was divine perfection. Service eh they didn't seem to like black people or want our patronage.  I would go back just for the soufflé but I usually grab take out & due to the preparation process they require dine in only for orders of soufflé. Sucks cuz they were bomb delish!
Totally in love with this place!
I watch a lot of Hell's Kitchen and I know that soufflés are really hard to make and to find out that there's a soufflés restaurant so close to my work is awesome!! I had to try this place out!!
Souffles at 1am? Sure!

So so. I recommend getting ice cream with whatever sweet soufflé you get and if you really decide to go here for some reason or another, order and then walk around for a bit. Also the table mats and chairs seemed repulsive. I think it is the fact that I know they can't clean them easy and therefore don't.  Who knows...

Idk whats the hype about this place...like seriously. All my friends is raving how good their souffle is but to tell you the truth its okay, its not all that. Once the waitress delivers your souffle, you better take a good picture because, that souffle is going to sink right in the middle -__-  The reason why I gave it a two star is because this place is super cute (girly cute) It's perfect for a date.

I went here with my friends on 7-31-14 9:45pm'sh.  I only ordered a hong kong style milk tea for $2.95, since I wasn't that hungry after dinner.  Service is courteous, but definitely enjoyed hanging out and joking with my friends.
hong kong souffles!!!!!!! it took forever but whatever where else can you find a tin hau style souffle shop in the u s of a?!?!?!

From the outside, this place looks a little bit scary. Maybe it was because we got there at 9PM, but I was surprised to find a cute little HK-style dessert place here. Anyway, we got in and the cafe was pretty empty. We didn't have enough time to order souffles (30-45 minute wait). Instead, I had the mango pudding with coconut milk sticky rice and a scoop of mango ice cream. I really enjoyed my dessert! You can't really go wrong with coconut milk + mangoes + sticky rice. Service was quick and efficient.
The strawberry souffle looks amazing but not as good as it looks.  I still think the chocolate one is the best. It is good a la mode!

My first impression of the place, wow, reminds me of grandma's house but...smaller. It's really cramped and the decor is unnecessary. I suppose they wanted to keep an appearance of a refined British tea shop or something but dang, those dolls in the cabinets weird me out. Are the locks there to keep us out or to keep them in??? Back to the important stuff. We ordered a durian souffle. I love fresh durian but I wasn't sure what to expect. The waitress took our order and within 25 mins we got dessert. They have a sign that states souffles take up to 45 mins. It was definitely not peak hour though,  with only one other table occupied. I was pleasantly surprised with the dish. The souffle was delicious. It was quite light and airy, sprinkled with powered sugar. Not sure about their other flavors but they sound interesting.

The souffles are full of flavors, some are quite unique such as the red bean, and the black sesame, all are great, but it takes about 45 mins. after ordering, so make the order then walk around towen.
5stars for su-flei su-flei souffles lol
we waited 25-30 mins for a ham and egg sandwich, it took 45 mins for the souffles to come out.

I got the strawberry soufflé and my husband got white chocolate. AMAZING!!! The wait was so worth it and not any longer than another restaurant where they ask you to order soufflés at the start of your meal. Not that many employees working there, but they were nice and attentive! If you're just coming for desert and don't want to wait, they said that you can call ahead with your order.

We ordered the strawberry and chocolate souffles, and they were amazing. They looked fantastic, and tasted as good as they looked. The chocolate souffle had a pretty great presentation too, as the chocolate sauce poured on top spilled over the side of the souffle as he set it on the table. It was an amazing, if unintended, effect. And though I'm allergic to strawberries, my partner said that the strawberries on the strawberry souffle were definitely fresh. He also told me that the souffle itself had good strawberry flavor, not just from the ones on top.

The soufflés are AMAZING!!  Cooked perfectly and definitely worth the wait.  Bring a book or a friend because they really do take 45 minutes (like they do at ANY restaurant unless the laws of physics do not apply in said restaurant). The tea is really good as well and the girl that served us was very attentive.

Gd forbid you really have to pee...Don't use the bathroom first. They will make you order something first. The trapped my husband in the corner and secured an order before they allowed him to use the restroom. Wow.

Terrible, worst restaurant ever! Don't waste your time and money! They totally messed up my San Francisco trip. They do not have service AT ALL. I could even hear what they gossip about the customers (including me) in the kitchen. They will beg you not to blame because they will get punished if we complain LOL ridiculous!! They will STILL charge you even if you just had one bite of the dish after your complain. They will not appreciate. So complain or not? You decide. Environment is old, the dishes look old and dirty. Do not torture your sense of taste if you are looking for tasty food like me. They will definitely disappoint you.
I got a living social deal. You need a reservation.  Otherwise this is the best souffle place. I have decided this will be one of my to - go dessert places. Thank you for the deal on living social.
a bit overpriced..

Ordered a durian soufflé, first experience with soufflé. It was exceptionally tasty! I'd recommend trying this place out but their service is...actually, can't say there is any. They take your order 15 minutes later, have the chefs make it, and brings it back. You will never see the server again until you pay. The worst part, an 18% gratuity was added to parties of 6 or more. I do not think you deserve 18% tips if you don't even have the courtesy to check on us. And it's cash only. Come here only if you don't mind having no service!
If I could give this place 0 stars I would!

Yep, so I was like one of you and was browsing through the pictures and decided to come by with my friend.  The layout of the desserts are really pretty, but there are signs all around that says "Souffles take at least 20 minutes".. My friend and I were smart, we got one and shared it.  We were glad that we shared it, because we didnt want to wait over an hour for something too sweet.  We got the strawberry souffle. It was indeed really pretty, but WAY WAY WAY too sweet. The place is on the corner, but really needs remodeling done, it just doesnt look that pretty from the outside for a pretty dessert place like this.
This substandard chinese place survives on take out.  No one ever dines there.

I found a great place to watch a giants game. My friend invited me here for a giants party. The staff was so nice and very accommodating to our group. They had a great selection of drinks. The food rocks! Their wings the garlic and salt and pepper are delicious!! Great pub food and they have Mongolian beef chow mein. One of the greatest inventions especially with beer and baseball. They have a ping pong table and that is always fun. They have many TVs in the place. I think this is a great new type of sports bar. Highly recommended!

What do you want in a bar? That's really the question, not all this to be or not to be garbage. Although that's an interesting subject to dabble with if you're having a beer at the GungHo tavern with a  philosophically-minded buddy.
The Ho is still here!

Love the new remodel and new management.  Great food with alcohol and with TV's for my sport-fanatic needs...?!  What else can I ask for?  How about a ping pong table!!  Haha...very fun to play while a little intoxicated.

I have been coming in for the last few weeks now --- and have been quite impressed with the prices, bar tending staff primarily led by Keturah G. who is always quick to provide a cocktail and the tv selection.

Delicious and not expensive food.  Generals chicken and crab rangoon made my night and the happy hour prices didn't hurt either!  Great place for watching games on tv or playing board games on your table.
The food was pretty average, but what's more awesome than a sports bar that serves Chinese food?  Seriously, how has no one thought of this concept before?
Great new sports bar with a Chinese restaurant attached that does mostly take out/delivery but also full menu available to eat in. Tv's and a great happy hour (4-8pm).

I used to order from this place a few years ago (when it was Ho's Bar & Restaurant) when i first moved to the city and didn't know any better. The food was consistently bad (mostly, it was greasy and everything pretty much tasted the same, and it wasn't a good taste).

Lunch special and price is good. Happy hour specials are even better (bc of the libations). TV's are great. Pending on who is working, service, and typical restaurant procedure is baffling here. For instance, today's dining experience, square bar napkins were given (perhaps I was sitting at the high top bar tables), dude has not even asked if I need anything, nonetheless, how my lunch was. I ordered another app bc I am a fatass. I had to scream over the music while he was across the bar at the ordering/POS station. Finally, I said I couldn't hear him which he must have not heard me or not cared as he didn't come over within hearing distance.
The best, Jerry. The best.  $3 beers and apps and tv's.  And free pork skin.

Ho's had a bit of a makeover and it seems like they are in between relaunching as GungHo Tavern. I am not sure if the menu has changed, as I had never eaten here before. What I do know is they have a really great Happy Hour! Not only is it from 4pm-8pm (no more rushing after work to make it by 6!!), but they have $3 specials like egg rolls, salt and pepper chicken wings, well drinks, and all the beers on tap.

Pure coincidence that we stumbled across this place tonight.  Having just finished a full meal down the block, we wanted to find somewhere to finish off both the Warriors and Giants games before heading home (gotta support our teams!).  I was honestly captivated by the sign and name of this place, Gungho Tavern, pretty catchy.

I really like this place. The delivery can be slow, once it took 2 hours but it was worth it. We ordered the pork ribs, beef broccoli, chow mien, and orange chicken. I didn't get sick(diarrhea) from it, which is always a good sign as I have a weak stomach. Every thing was hot and delicious, I'd recommend anyone order from here who's just look in' for some good ol' fashion 'merican Chinese food :)
Two starts for nice guy on the phone and nice/quick delivery guy.  ZERO for the "food."

Can someone tell Ling Ling she can't cook??? The salt and pepper squid was hard and rough, the chow fun right off the bat tasted like it was found in a homeless mans butt, the Honey Walnut prawns were not up to par and tasted like someone's dog barffed up bubbly mayo onto a bed of wilted shredded Easter green.. I'm still in shock and awe from this catastrophe of a meal. Never again honey.....
ho's is gone.  It is now a dump called GungHo  tavern. Bad food, worse service.

Not terrible, but not great. Ordered from Seamless-no problems there. Except that I revived my confirmation email from Ho's that they received my order after I had received and finished my dinner. The cashew chicken was just OK. The biggest waste of money was the chicken wontons I ordered. I had to order something additional in order to hit the min delivery requirements. They should just rename it fried wonton skins featuring tiny chicken bits. There amount of chicken in each wonton was seriously a joke.

Some crazy delicious food, and crazy generous staff. Sat us at 1030 even tho they close at 11. The food was so yummy, and they got it out to us super fast. I'm a loyal customer now and look forward to many more troops back.

Found a menu for this place at the townhouse we are staying at, looked it up on Yelp and it has pretty good reviews for take out. Also this new option for "delivery now"app within yelp that's so easy to do, because calling sometimes is a language barrier Use this option it's awesome We ordered beef and bokchoy /chicken Mongolian /mixed fried rice /Pan fried dumplings and rice because it doesn't come with meals  Portions huge and delivery was fast less than 20 min we have left overs for lunch will use again

Not so fast on delivery but I get it I do not live in a easy neighborhood to park a car and it was a Saturday night. But the food was still nice a warm and  the person who deliver my food was super nice.

Keep looking for another place to order from - this isn't the place you want.  I have to give a star in order to write a review.  We ordered delivery from here and the food was absolutely disgusting, un-edible.  It came in these plastic containers that warped from the heat of the food (very appetizing). Definitely would never recommend, not even to people I don't care for.
I ordered from here on GrubHub. The transaction was good and the food was delivered in 45 minutes as promised.
This ho fo sho!

Our regular place was closed for Christmas  so we ordered delivery from Ho's based on the Yelp reviews. Ordered crab rangoon, General Chows, pork fried rice, singa pore noodles and green beans. We could only eat a 2 mouthfuls before we gave up and threw it away. The delivery however was super quick.

Took 1 hr for delivery. Everything was fresh and tasty. Ordered: Kung Pao Chicken, Beef Chow Mein, S&P wings, egg rolls, veg fried rice. They also gave us the spicy heat (HOT) that we asked for. The basic Chinese you crave!
Ok people, I can't be the only one who noticed the name of this place.  Seriously, Hos with free delivery?  Zoinks, Scooby!!

I ordered from Ho's on their website.  Delivery took about 40 minutes and the food arrived hot and delicious.  I ordered mongolian beef, pork fried rice, and salt and pepper calamari.  Got a bonus for a free soup too!  Generous portions and great prices.  I'm a very happy camper.  They have a sufficient size menu and variety of food online.  I can't wait to try other dishes on the menu.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it. I will definitely order from them again soon!
Food here is fresh and so tasty!
After a long day doing errands and playing with the kids, what is better than delivery!  We ordered  around 6:30 and it arrived at 7:10 still hot and steamy!
Pros: Delivery was on time, food was pretty tasty
This is for delivery service!

Yelp, you have led me astray! I ordered delivery from this place after seeing all the yelp reviews.  My experience was pretty meh - very average.  Delivery took a little longer than anticipated (60 minutes vs estimated 45 minutes), after a pretty easy and quick online order process.

Tried Ho's for the first time since they've switched owners.  I was very impressed, so I ordered for deliver the following night.  Great Chinese food with a full bar.  What more can you ask for?  How about cheap, fast delivery, and service with a smile!  Perfect for those lazy nights where you don't feel like cooking or washing any dishes.  Best of all, the food arrived at my door still sizzling HOT!  Will definitely be coming back for more.

We chose this restaurant for chinese delivery because of a recommendation from a colleague.  They stated it would be 45 minutes for delivery but ended up being more like 30 minutes.  The food was great, but they don't automatically provide white rice with your entrees - what???  We called back and they said there's a charge.  It would have been nice if they would let you know this.   The driver immediately came back with the ordered rice, but didn't have change, so my one order of rice cost $10.  Yikes
Why do i always drink so much.... maybe its because when I'm so hungover, nothing helps me get back on my feet better than Ho's delivery.

Just finished a delivery order. Was really surprised at just how good it was. I had General Tsao Chicken, pot stickers, and Hot & Sour Soup. The soup was mediocre, but pretty standard-tasting. The pot stickers were fantastic. The chicken was crunchy and well-glazed with sauce. It was exactly what I expected from a good delivery Chinese place.
On a lazy night I decided to find places that would deliver. I came across Ho's Chinese Delivery and decided to give it a try. Best decision ever!

It was the 4th of July.  Me and some friends were walking around the area to pre-game before the fireworks and stumbled upon this place since they had some hot girls inside drinking at the bar.  By the end of the night, we didnt go see fireworks and just stayed here and got pretty sloshed.  Prices are cheap, food is pretty good, and the bartenders are super friendly.
This place is SMACKIN!

Great place, we bought food here because our hotel was 2 blocks down and we loved the food. Not expensive and good portions not greasy and made to order. Please visit this place, it was empty inside but its because people take the food to go. So good we got take out 3 nights and ate the left over for breakfast :)

Pretty nice place to get take-out dimsum. They always have a huge selection of fresh baos (some of which to this day I still have never tried before), and of course all the dimsum is hot and fresh as well.
Blue Sky's Custard Tarts are the only ones that come even close to Golden Gate's. Nice flakey crust and delicious custard.   I can't wait to try the red bean pancake!
$0.50 bao?! yes please.
The gigantic steamed buns in the window caught my eye. Blue Sky had handwritten menus in Chinese and English. Older Chinese guys hang out here (usually a good sign).
Specialty are the baos and pastries, but the dumplings, while limited in variety are great.  This place is better than You's.

come here at 8am anyday of the week for best fresh dimsum and baos.  seriously i've had dimsum in hong kong and the top places in the bay area like yank sing, hk flower lounge, etc.  those places are of course going there with you family and enjoying nice long dimsum sunday lunch.  here at blue sky, you can get a pint of jook (thousand yr egg and pork) for a $1.10??? really???  and its better than some restaurants that sell jook for 5-6 bucks.  their rice noodles are good as well as baked baos.  the lady is super nice too.

I hate writing bad reviews for places I like.  I usually come here every Sunday to buy food for our 10 minute party at church.  The buns are good and cheap!  I come here to eat the dim sum as well.  Recently, one of my friend told me her sponge cake had mold on it.  No way!  She was right!  GROSS!!!!!!!
Delicious!!!  The lady is super duper nice!!!
Old-timer Chinese hangout.
This is the second dim sum counter that I've been to in a row that microwaves my order, in front of me to boot, before giving it to me...
I just came here to get a quick bite.I brought three stream choi yaik  buns.  It a nice relaxing place to sit.

This place calls itself a restaurant but to me it seems more like a one-room tiny hole-in-the-wall cafeteria. They have dim-sum items and other hot foods. It's located just five blocks from my place, so I walk over often to buy a fast cheap bite to eat. Usually I buy the little egg custard tarts at $3 for $1.75 or the shrimp dumplings at about the same price. The lady behind the counter doesn't speak much english but I can point!!! The place is always filled with asian retirees, and have seen tourists inside eating too.

Yuck, disgusting!  Ok, we passed by this place - mostly empty or table of older Chinese men sitting drinking coffee and eating buns.  It seems they are supposed to be famous for their flavored rice.  Appear to have some dim sum pieces and baked buns.

I was just walking home from across town and I was hungry for a little treat. I stopped in to this corner joint that says "you get best dim sum here" in english. Low and behold that is exactly what ends up happening. The usual linguistical chaffing occurred during the ordering phase of the transaction; especially with my heavy NY "what?" and her not really giving a shit if I got the exact five or six 40 cent dumplings that I wanted. Not sure if i specifically order it or not, but steaming hot and fuckin on point is what I got. Which coincidentally enough is all I am really looking for in a chinatown dumpling; whatever the little buggers are stuffed with is inconsequential if they are tasty, and I'll be damned if this wasn't the best mother loving dim sum I've gotten to date. The icing on the proverbial cake is that it is cheaper than a quick toss in the -loin if you know what i mean...huh.... huh.... huh.... .....ahhh you know what i mean.
A new over-the-counter dim-sum place for me.  They also have tables, so you can sit-down for a quick, nourishing meal too.
Sushi rolls are yummy! I got the Godzira Roll, Spider Roll, Spicy Scallop Roll with some green tea. The Service was great. I would come here again.
The food is here is solid and the prices are reasonable. The sushi may not be the highest quality sushi in the world, but it's reasonable for the price.
Very good sushi for takeout

If I had seen the reviews I may not have come here, I am glad I didn't. The food is amazing, the prices are great, the chef seems to be an awesome person. The Hana roll and hamachi lover roll is amazing.
Love this place. Sushi chef is great, service is fast. Always something new on the menu as well! Love having nigiri and beers at the sushi bar!
This place looked promising and inviting.  There is a large sushi bar and typical sushi bar decor.

The best sushi for your buck in town. I wish I would have checked out this place a long time ago since I live in the neighborhood -- but so glad my friend introduced me to it. The sashimi platter was delicious and huge (which is saying a lot bc so many places really thin out the portions). Really chill setting during the work week. I will be back!
the staff is nice and friendly. the food is great and fresh.

Stopped in here for a bite to eat on a whim and was pleasantly surprised with the food. Although the ambiance is nothing fancy, the food was good and so affordable. I think the miso soup was $1.75 and along with edamame, three rolls, and a bottle of sake, the bill was just barely $40. We had a spicy tuna roll along with a yellowtail roll and both were topped with very sizable and meaty chunks of fresh fish. If we are strolling down Polk and in the mood for sushi there's no reason we wouldn't return.
Wow, what a bargain! Big slices of fish on your roll and it doesn't break the bank....even with a bottle of sake!
Great for weeknight staple sushi - friendly staff, rarely crowded, and good fish. Won't find any next-gen sushi innovation here, but the standard maki and nigiri are both solid.
We went here last night randomly and was pleasantly surprised. The place was small, charming and CHEAP!

I love House of Sushi!  I go here a couple times a week.  It is good food at such a great price.  It has a wonderful, cozy neighborhood feel.  The waitress is always happy and sweet. Get the Boston Roll and the Oregon roll.
Good prices for good sushi!
Not an enjoyable experience.

I've gone to this place a couple times when I just want something fast and cheap to take home for dinner.  The prices are really good, and they have good dinner box specials.  It's not somewhere I'd actually go out to eat though.  There are also places that are pretty comparable in price that have sushi that is tastier in the area.  I would go back though since I live so close by.

I've been going to House of Sushi for the past 5 years. It's really one of the few great sushi places on the street. It won't be as crowded as okoze and puzzle. You have to know what to order here. The owner is very nice and great to talk to. I highly recommend the House Salad, Boston Roll, Unagi Unadon, sake sashimi and Sweet Potato roll. That's good enough for 2, we paid $46. They also have great oysters. Friendly service, quick and reasonably priced. I enjoy this place and will certainly return.

I have really enjoyed my rolls each time I go here. The thing I hate most is when am served this dainty little roll at sushi houses. House of Sushi on Polk/Vallejo is fresh, chilled and substantially portioned. I will continue to patronize this place and highly encourage you to try for yourselves. Cheers.

Inexpensive sushi that actually tastes good!  The hot food is mediocre but the sushi is fairly fresh and decent.  Servers are friendly and the storefront is cozy.  A little gem particularly for weeknights out!
After deciding that the highly rated Okoze Sushi place a few blocks away was too expensive for our budget, we ended up here looking for Japanese food.
This is my second trip to House of Sushi.  The first visit I gave them a pass, assuming it was a bad visit.  This time,  the service was abominable.

Sure it isn't the best sushi in San Francisco, but for anyone living in the area it is a quick and easy alternative to the more pricier and fancier sushi places in the area. I agree with most positive reviews -- consistent taste, friendly and reasonably priced.

Very typical, run-of-the-mill sushi restaurants on Polk right next to all the bars. Full of drunk people that go there for some fillers and not so much quality, sophisticated Japanese foods. they have a good selection of menu items but nothing spectacular or unique. The restaurant itself is a little old too but people do not come here expecting Morimoto.
Best, healthy late night option.  Great, friendly service.  Reasonably priced.

This place is depressing. The chef hates his job, has a bad attitude, and is a sad person to be around. On top of that, the music will set you in a somber mood. I honestly try to stop by here to help them out a little but the experience is always so pathetic that I'm throwing in the towel. the service is poor and have a tendency to be rude and not acknowledge you until you speak to them.

So, I was going to give a one-star but then the sushi was halfway decent. I literally waited for a single roll for 30 minutes while the chef made order after order for takeout. I almost walked out. When I got the roll, it was better than average which was minorly redeeming. Sigh.

I wish it was possible to give less than one star.  I went in to place a to go order and ordered a California Roll minus the crab ($4.00).  I was then charged $5.50.  I showed him the item on the menu and asked why it would be more, when I only wanted 2/3 of the ingredients listed (I didn't expect it to be cheaper, but I certainly didn't expect a $1.50 up charge).  He got extremely flustered and started rambling.. then told me I could just take my money.  No comment on the sushi since I walked out without it, but based on the awful customer service and unappealing look of my to-go order...I'd say I didn't miss out.
Great sushi and rolls, great service, very reasonable prices and given we live just up the street; great location.

I live right down the street from this gem and frequently stop by for sushi to go for dinner.  The sashimi is always fresh and the waitress is always friendly and ready to take my takeout order. I was also offered complimentary hot tea while I waited to take my food.  I came here for a sit-in dinner once and had a great meal.  Highly recommended.  Prices are very reasonable.

This place is pretty much the worst sushi place I've ever been to.  The chef was completely oblivious to his customers.  The sashimi they serve is not fresh by any stretch of the imagination.  Avoid this place at all costs!!!

We are neighbors and have been coming here for 7 years.  Service is excellent - we only eat at the sushi bar where our sushi man works - he is fantastic - friendly, warm, caring and inviting.   The sushi is always very good - you will not find edgy roll combinations here, nor will you find many misses.  The house roll and kamakazi rolls at $5.75 each are excellent, loaded with fish and impossible to beat for the price.
Very reasonable prices for tasty sushi.  They always answer the phone and my order is ready in ten minutes.

The sushi was good, the waitresses were SLOW, and the place was a bit packed. Expect to wait a bit if you want to sit at the bar. The fellow who makes the sushi is actually Japanese, good at what he does, and very friendly. The wasabi was good, but not excellent. The fish was flavorful, but not the best I've ever had.
Sushi? Decent
Golden birthdays and rolls.

Had I written this review after my FIRST experience at House of Sushi, it would have been a 2. In fact, I came home and explained to my boyfriend that I found it underwhelming at best. My boyfriend ended up going with a friend a few weeks later, only to tell me how GOOD it was... okay, there was clearly a mix up somewhere! Recognizing the real possibility that I just placed a bad order, we went back together and I let him do most of the ordering. I'm a bit embarrassed to admit that the first time I went in, I didn't really see the special rolls on the boards (my eyes are bad, gimme a break), but that's where the deliciousness lives. Those rolls are exceptional. Huge, satisfying and fairly affordable. We ordered two special rolls, one regular roll, miso soups and sunomono and were totally satisfied. I left a much happier camper than I did the time before and am happy to report that this will likely be one of our two sushi go-tos in the area now (Nara being the other one). There are lots of sushi places around but it's somewhat hard finding a place that's not overly trendy, fairly affordable and has the quality that you want when eating raw fish (am I right?). Based on my second experience, this place does it. Looking forward to our third visit... hoping they don't let me down!

Service SUUUUUKS.  You have been warned. Wait staff consists of 2 young Chinese girls who barely look a day over 16 and both are totally clueless and looked at me like a deer in the headlights at even the most simplest requests.  Many times I noticed them delivering food to the wrong table, including dishes to me (I was sitting at the bar) that I didn't order. I only ordered sushi so everything I should have gotten would have been only from the Sushi bar.  It took forever for me to get a menu once I was seated, because the girls were stressing over this rather large to go order that took forever for them to completely get organized. Twice, the sushi chef had to stop making sushi and go back into the kitchen to help the waitresses sort out the order. So of course I had to wait much longer for my sushi to be made because the time that the sushi chef had to spend in the back doing what the waitresses were supposed to be doing. Once I got my food it was worth it, sushi was fresh and tasty. However it took forever to me to get my check, and once I paid it took forever again to get my change back. I left a very paltry tip and will not be going back. On the way out I saw a "help wanted" sign in the window, and yes, I agree, they do need a lot of help!

What a pleasant surprise! Hungry for sushi on a Sunday night, my wife and I stumbled across this place and really enjoyed ourselves. We sat at the bar as all the tables were filled, and got to see the chef making the rolls, which is always fun. He was also very nice, as was the rest of the staff. On that note, service wasn't noticeably slow, as I've seen several reviews mention, though I imagine if the place were slammed, things could get dicey.

Went here after a few drinks and was extremely impressed with the food and service here. I've had many different qualities of sushi, miso, and edemame and this is right up there towards the top, I will definitely be working this into my weekly routine.

Came here for dinner with a couple of friends that thought it was very under-rated.  Decent service, decent prices, and really great rolls.  I thought the rainbow, white tuna, and dragon rolls here were very excellent.    We didn't really order anything else so I'm not able to comment.... but the rolls we had were pretty terrific.
Great quality at great prices! The food always is prepared as before!

Service was great, food very tasty with generous helpings.  The only issue we had was that they close at 9pm and by 8:50 or so when we wanted another cup of tea they told us they had already thrown it out.  Otherwise it was great!

I'm Vietnamese , this place sucks . Bad service , they are not even close to qualified to making pho .  This place would ruin  Cup O Noodles ! No parking . No drinks on the menu were available . I have nothing nice to say about this dump .
Love it! Cheap, fast and good.
Totally unpretentious and good value. No need to worry this place will not get overrun with gentrifying hipsters(Gipsters?)because it is too real.

I la la la la looooove this place. Their seafood pho is the best I've ever had! Their bbq pork chop is really good and their beef and broccoli. That what my family and I get whenever we go. I'm kinda sad that one of the waitress quit. She was my favorite. The new one is okay but I just go for the food that's it.
3/7/14  Lunch

The food quality is pretty decent. My parents and I usually eat here when we are in the Chinatown area. I have gotten their bun bo hue and I enjoyed it. My mom got the seafood pho which was supposed to come with shrimp and she only got a puny one. She told the waitress and she got some more for her so I guess that was nice. No small or large, there is only one size so prepare to be full afterwards. However, the service is a tad slow. Usually have to wait about 20 mins for the food to come out after ordering.

Good reasonably priced food.  Good portions and straightforward menu.  CASH ONLY, though, so be prepared.  They also are closed Sunday.  Beef & Chicken Phos are faves, but BBQ meat plates are also yummy.
This place is usually open late, so if you are looking for late-night Pho, this would be one place to go to. Also, the Pho does taste pretty good.
I'm a big fan of pho, both of the South Vietnamese and North Vietnamese variety.
Stopped in randomly on a nice day with the boyfriend.
The sweet smells of cinnamon and star anise always seem to seep out the restaurant as I walk by in the evening so I was excited to stop by for some pho on this chilly day.
This is my go-to Vietnamese restaurant whenever I'm in the area. Portions are big and the food is CHEAP.
My favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Food tastes so good and cheap. I probably come here more than three times a week. I would say Pho Vung Tau is one of the best restaurant in North Beach area.
All of the noodle soup my family ordered are so bland...this is waste of time and money...just so happened to pass by it and was so hungry but our hunger did not help make the food taste any good...

It's pretty good here! Their bowl portion is SO big, omg I could barely finish my bowl of pho, and I LOVE pho too. It's bigger than my head D; But overall, it taste so good, I'll be coming back here more often. My favorite pho place in chinatown :)

north beach casual meal...returning to find pho vung tau...replacing chic-n-noodle-do vietnamese...returning with locals...taking recommendations...chicken and beef satay noodle soup requested...hot, rich and flavorful...good size and filling...the fried egg rolls on the other hand...decent, but quite thin...small and long...tasting mostly fried skin and very little filling...get a rich bowl of noodle soup at pho vung tau...
Vietnamese omelet is very interesting.

I only come to this place because it is conveniently close to work.  Last Friday I ordered Bun Rieu and walked out smelling like Korean BBQ.  Their Bun Rieu is not authentic.  They give you half of a tomato with overcooked pork meatballs.  I don't remember seeing any tofu and question if there are any crab meat in this noodle soup at all.  Their imperial rolls are also really tiny, probably the size of an index finger for comparison.

So we order a squid salad to start and share before our 2 bowls of pho. The salad comes out and it smells like an overnight trash bin from a seafood market. We point this out to the server who was very apologetic then the female owner or manager comes out and starts yelling NOTHING WRONG WITH SALAD, YOU PAY, YOU HAVE TO PAY. It was like a frickin" comedy skit, quite hilarious. I left and had a great lunch a block away at Yuet Lee.
Food - CHEAP! Most things under $7 and huge portion size.
no service and cheat customer's tips.

This place serves one of the best Satay Beef Noodle Pho I've had in a while. The place looks pretty clean and service is average but nice. Serving size is above average for San Francisco. I'm impressed.

So I've only came here to eat the pho usually since its close to where I get my hair cut. I don't have any complaints here since the pho seems decent here and the portion is well sized for the price. I may try the rice plates and other things since that is what other people seem to talk about. But the broth isn't overly salty and the noodle to meat proportion seems equal, not too much of anything. Ingredients like the bean sprouts seem clean and fresh. Overall the food here is pretty good, service is okay. For a place in Chinatown though, it's pretty darn clean! I still probably won't eat off the table if something fell, but it's cleaner and not sticky like other places in Chinatown. Overall, worth a try!
Great food taste just like home cooking. But beware they always seem to run out of ice??
shrimp roll is good and thats all i get wen im here lol. im pretty sure the food is good and will come back since its in the neighborhood my friend lives in
Good food, good service = 5 stars.

Happened to take a chance on this place. Doesn't look like the cleanest restaurant but that's usually the type with the best food. Ordered the shrimp rolls, Dac Biet bowl, and wifey got the seafood jean mein. Surprisingly, the entrees were pretty good, but the shrimp roll bordered on bland. The mein came out shaped like a bird's nest so that was unique. Don't order the viet sandwiches as there's more bread than meat in it. Prices overall were on the low end. Good place for lunch but watch out for rude chinese patrons. We'll still be back.
The vegetarian spring rolls are awesome! I've now had them twice.

Finally tried this restaurant after passing by it so many times. Came on a Saturday around 1 and it was pretty packed. There was a group ahead of us but we got seated  right away. I doubt the authenticity of how Vietnamese it is since the waitresses were Chinese but maybe the chef is Viet? Ehh who knows. We ordered a #27 and what would be a #1 in other pho restaurants but here, it's #20 or something, and a Thai iced tea. #27 was a spicy beef stew with egg noodles and it was alright, but there was a layer of oil floating in the soup and it wasn't spicy :( I tried some of the #20 and the noodles weren't as chewy as I like it... Their tea that they use to make the Thai iced tea must've been steeped for too long because the color of the drink was wayyyy too dark. I  guessed that they didn't have time to make it right since they only have 2 waitresses working.
For the low prices and fresh tasting food, I would definitely return.
Had rare beef Pho the broth had a unique cinamon/anise type of flavor that I could not pinpoint not in a bad way just unique.

I went to Pho Vung Tau for the first time and ordered what I normally order at Vietnamese restaurants, the #1 Beef noodle soup. It was pretty delicious. At least delicious enough to make me want to drink the soup. The service was not bad either.
After dropping by semi-consistently over a few months, I finally got a smile out of the owners! HAHA!
The place was pretty packed whenever we came in for lunch, but we got a table quick. Mom got the Special Beef Pho while I got the BBQ Chicken Pho w/ fishballs.

The mung bean and coconut milk drink was a wonderful and refreshing introduction to what I was about to experience.  The enormous, piping-hot bowl of BBQ beef pho arrived before me with all of the necessary fixings; I only wish it were smaller so I could have had room to try more items, like the delicious-looking Vietnamese sandwiches.  The staff was attentive enough to cater to a consistent ebb-and-flo crowd as well, and the free green tea was a lovely gesture.

i've been coming to this place for a long time and they don't disappoint!! i usually  have dinner there but my hubby decided to have lunch.OMG the place was packed but it was a short wait . the food is as good  as it was. the seafood noodle soup the broth is the DA BOMB!!!

It's a hole in the wall place, but it's a standard spot for me and my roommate. Everything there is super tasty and we've always had good service. It's also really clean and the prices are great. Definitely one of my favorite spots in Chinatown.

There are those times when I wish I rely less on Yelp and more on instinct for my dinner here turned out to be a huge mistake.  First off, the customers dining in when I visited recently were all non-Asian.  At a peak dinner hour that should have raised a red flag, but I stayed anyway because I was hungry and I was curious.  I had just hiked down from Van Ness Avenue and Sacramento Street after volunteering at a One Brick event, and not having had lunch I was starved.

Not a bad place to grab a pint if you're stuck in the uber-touristy area that is Fisherman's wharf (long story).  The downstairs felt like a standard city Irish bar, but it was tiny and a bit too cramped for my taste.  However, a large display of police and fireman patches from all over the country raised the place up a notch. The service from two lady bartenders was unsmiling, but efficient and adept.

Can anyone say happy hour???  Had a couple of beers near the Wharf for less than ten bucks!  And not just domestic, Smithwicks and Magners cider.   SAWEEEEET!  ...and until 7 on a Sunday.  Service was great. Limited beer selection with only 10 taps, but you should still be able to find something to drink.   Nice way to pass by a lazy Sunday in San Francisco.

Awesome service. Awesome bartender (sweet girl from England!). Awesome drinks. Awesome music. Just freaking AMAZING all around!!! The bartender allowed us to get the happy hour specials early. The food looked and smelled fantastic (didn't personally get anything since we were headed to dinner with friends soon!). She was very knowledgable about drinks and different mixes and concoctions to try. And the other patrons in the bar were very friendly!
Awesome Irish bar! Grant the bartender is the best! Keep an eye out for him. He'll probably be wearing a niners hat
Great and generous drinks, kind servers, and simple tasty food.  If you're picking someone up from the airport and you'd like to sip on some perfect drinks this is your spot!
Service was terrible. Staff was disconnected and rude. Pub was crowded. Patrons were also rude. Maybe a bad night but I'll find another bar next time.
We had a blast at this place tonight!!!!!!! The Bartender was great, the music was great !!!! Loved it!!!
What a fun place to stop into!!!! Bartender Otto.....you crack me up. Thanks for the awesome experience while visiting SF. We will be back.

Um honestly Fiddler's Green made me and my friends feel uneasy on a semi-late Wednesday evening. The smell of weed and people talking loudly outside, plus the rather deserted inside save for older men... No thank you. We promptly left and opted for somewhere else for dinner.
My friends have been here before during the  day and the whiskey coffee was so much better then. High expectations and I'm kinda  disappointed :(
Fun ambiance. Loud and lively. The floor upstairs was so sticky you literally have to peel your foot off the ground after every step. Didn't get food, but drink prices were moderate.
Beers are good and so is the service. Food is great so far (only ate here twice so far). Looking at decoration and music choice not much of an Irish pub, but surely a good ace for a couple of beers!
We loved this bar!  There was live music below and dance music upstairs and the drinks were good. Just be careful because my wallet was stolen from here.
DID NOT EAT SO CANT REVIEW FOOD but it's a fun little Irish joint with a good selection of Irish beers and friendly staff - I'm a tourist but this place feels pretty legit

Went there last night, and arrived about 9:30  only to find the kitchen was already closed. Um, isn't that a wee bit early to close the kitchen at a pub? I don't know about anyone else, but I, personally, like to have food to go with my beer. Add to it that, I assume, because the kitchen was closed, there was no wait staff to seat my girlfriend and myself. This wouldn't be too bad a thing if it wasn't loud, and my girlfriend and I weren't totally blind. Live music and loud conversations make it a touch difficult to easily find a seat when you cannot see. Just sayin'. Mind you, my opinion is likely to change as we plan to go back and actually try the food! I mean, come on! Who can pass up corned beef and cabbage any time of year? Not me!  Oh, and my girlfriend, Donna and I would like to thank the anonymous person (or persons) who covered our tab last night. It took the edge off a very nerve-racking situation. Thank you. We'll pay it forward some day.
I love this place. Their food and beers are great and the service was very very nice as well.

A local referred my friend and I to this place for a Saturday morning breakfast. $8.50 for eggs, toast, ham AND a Bloody Mary. Everything was absolutely delicious and not to mention a great price. It was really quiet in the morning. Perfect way to start the day. I will absolutely go there again next time I'm in town. Ps. I'm not a ham eater but this ham was so incredible I licked my plate. Same goes with the Bloody Mary.

So ive worked around this place for years had many a company party here but last month me and a group of friends when there for some drinks my buddy closed his tab he had first round  the female bartender came out to us asking for a tip! We were still eating our food and shes complaining we didnt tip her we wernt even done this place has gone down hill and wouldn't recommend that kind of service to my enimes

A tale of two visits. First visit was not crowded. Service was great and woman bartender was very nice. On a bad note, she did get into a screaming match with another customer not with us. We had a few beers and had an overall nice visit.

The ONLY place I'll go to wet my whistle! Great atmosphere and friendly staff! Best place to be if you're Irish away from home! If you're in while the kitchen is open, I'd highly recommend the shepherd's pie! Better than mom's!
Yes
I am the furthest thing from Irish but this little place makes me feel like they would accept a black member one day. I have had a couple of interactions at Fiddlers Green and both were pretty legit.

We were looking for a bar to continue our night of partying after dinner at Capurro's.   Guitar player singing "American Pie" as we walked in to the crowded bar.  We went upstairs whee a DJ was mashing the latest music. We had a great time.  Drinks were nice and stiff and everyone was friendly even the security at the door.

Love this little neighborhood bar.  I have never had the food, so I can't speak to that, but the beer selection is amazing.  Lot's of Irish beer selections (as to be expected I guess).  If you're in the neighborhood, check it out.  It's a nice break from the tourist scene.

If there were a bar I would never come back to again, it would be Fiddler's Green. I came here for a event that was held on the second floor of the bar, and this was the saddest bar I've ever been to. Beer on tap is almost non-existent, and bottles selection is also very poor. On top of this, when I ordered my Sapporo, the bar tender honestly could not open the bottle without having half of the beer foam over. Are you serious? I sat there for a bit wanting to give this guy a chance to redeem himself but sadly he wasn't able to as he popped bottle after bottle, foaming each one over. Get this guy out of here! There are so many better bars in the city not in bro purgatory.
I miss the days of customers being refused service for attempting to order a black & tan or singing 'God Save the Queen'.
My family was in the area when dinner time hunger struck. A look on yelp, and we decided to try the fiddler's green. Where better to get some fish and chips than an Irish Pub?

Hidden gem of the city! Great little Irish spot with with REAL Irish drinks, food and people. Patty and Diane are the best. Recommend their Bloody Mary, anything from the breakfast menu or Shepard's Pie. Irish pub by day but weekend nights there is an upstairs playing hip hop music with full bar service. This place is a must!

I spent a few consecutive nights here recently and had a pretty good time. It's a friend's favorite bar in SF, so we stopped in for his birthday. I like that they have live music most of the time (and most of the paid talent is cool with letting other folks take a crack at the mic), and the crowd is fairly laid back. It rarely gets so crowded that you can't find a seat, although you might want to beware of roving packs of drunken sorority girls that stop in for short periods of time. Oh, and a couple of the bartenders are crabby. I still like it, and the crowd is generally good. Also, there is parking nearby if you aren't taking a cab.

Cool, chill dive bar for locals. Very low-key. Nice to get away from all the tourists. Foods pretty gross, but if you're going to a dive to eat, that's to be expected. Nice hole in the wall to hang out for a bit or go on your lunchbreak.
Almost went to a spot across the street (The Parlor), but was put off by the music. The fiddlers green has a great local vibe. Lots of beers too.
