We asked a bartender for a recommendation in the vicinity. She told us Fiddler's Green is where the locals in the area drink, which was good enough for us.
This place has a very dear place in my heart for so many reasons, which could easily be seen as alluring me to be a bit bias with this rating.

I went to Fiddlers Green this past weekend.  It's two different worlds in one place, downstairs the restrooms are discusting, the bartender wasn't very good - didn't make our drinks well and was kind of rude (I guess since we were not regulars she didn't have time to let us know we could go upstairs especially since we were asking if it was open yet).  Upstairs:  The DJ was very good.  The bartender knew how to make drinks.  A little cleaners restrooms.
Been coming to Fiddler's since '93.  Can't remember the last time I visited SF without stopping in for a pint. Irish breakfast is a delicious cholesterol bomb. Best pint of Guinness around!
Fiddlers Green might just be my favorite bar in the city. From the street it seems pretty unassuming, like a typical pub, but one you step inside you know this place is a hidden gem.

The Place: is beyond a doubt one of my favorites. Practically every time I visit SF, I drag whoever I'm with to this great little Irish pub. It's smaller than the other two rush pubs nearby, but that just serves to make it more comfortable-- and cozy on winter nights when they blaze up the fire place in the corner!

After being here for about 2 hours I love it. The people are incredible. So many different personalities. It's a beautiful place to be.  Music is awesome. Nora is the best bartender. She gave us so much advise on where to go and what to do and she made sure we were having a good time. All I have to say is thank you.
I DJ here every other Friday, always good times!

What can I say? We live in Marina, CA just 2 hours from SF and aftr our first visit to The Fiddler's Green it is now on our SF rotation every time we are in town. Just around the corner from the world famous Buena Vista is a better Irish coffe for almost half the price.  We have never eaten here. However, for a late morning and/or early afternoon Irish coffee and/or beer this place cannot be beat! The Fiddler's Green is also great if you are looking to listen to some great traditional (sometimes non-traditional) Irish music and party until closing.
this place is closed!

it's great to have another deli in no beach besides molinari's -- especially one open on sundays. great service, huge sandwich, reasonably priced and well made. not very many deli items -- but that's what i go to molinari's for, cheese, meats, olives, and deli items -- not the sandwiches. this is my new panelli bros.

Came here on a monday afternoon which was yesterday... In the past... I have been to Molinari's to many times just to order a sandwich!!! It was time for a change... So I went to try GEPPETTO'S sandwich... The sandwich that, I ordered for the first time at GEPPETTO was a Black Forest Ham, Roast Beef, Mortadella with Swiss Cheese and some pickles on a Sourdough Bread and it was huge!!! Just check out the picture and you' ll know what... I am talking about!!!
Tried a few sandwiches from this place since it opened for business months ago. The sandwiches were edible. But since Molinari is just around the corner, I will not go back.
Great food, awesome and knowledgable staff, this is probably at the top of my North Beach eatery list. All of the food here is tip top quality.

BF suggested Italian Sub. We walked from Russian Hill to NB only to find out that Molinari was closed on Sundays. So we scoped out the menu here for a sandwich. A guy was also checking out the menu and told us that this was a great spot for sandwiches and that we should try it. So we did. One Italian Sub later we were full beyond belief. The sandwich was HUGE. Packed full of meats, cheese and oil and vinegar. Wow. BF and shared it and each portion was so big. I barely finished mine. The guys in the shop are super nice and knowledgeable. Offered free samplings of their deli items. Highly recommend.

Finally a deli in North Beach/Chinatown that matches the flavor and quality of the old Pinnelli Brothers deli.  Worked in a deli for almost five years so I am a bit of a stickler when it comes to buying Italian Deli sandwiches.
Came by with hubby and shared an Italian Hoagie ($7.75) and grabbed a can of the San Pellegrino in blood orange ($2?).
2 friendly guys

Me and my girlfriend decided to try La Boulange while we waited for Tonys Pizza to open up, We didn't realize that we were a couple of hours early lol. So we decided to have some pastries and maybe a cup of coffee. So after walking around we landed on La Boulange, has nice decor, has a modern feel but not over top. When we saw their pastries we knew this place was gonna be good! I got the strawberry and blueberry Danish I think my gf got the chocolate croissant, not sure...But my Danish was so good! vary tasty, the strawberries and blueberries tasted fresh not old! WAY better than what other coffee shops have!

Good neighborhood Boulange.  They would have gotten 4 stars, but they don't have Wi-Fi...I mean whaaaaaaaaaaaaat...?!!  Seriously?  They need to get that in the North Beach neighborhood....c'mon man!  Their coffee is decent...and the food is typical Boulange fare and quality, so no complaints there.  I had most recently the ham/cheese quiche and a latte...both were good.  Staff is friendly (and they also are surprised they don't have Wi-Fi, BTW!).
My very 1st lunch here on my 2nd day, my friends sure know the right places, as to be expected ;)

I was coming here once a week and would occasionally get the blt. Today the roll was different shape from before. It was some the most stale bread I've ever bit into. I hope this is not a sign of things to come.

Let me start by saying I love la Boulange on polk st. This location however does not have a high standard for themselves. I tried a variety of dishes for breakfast, and each disappointed.  I usually strike gold with the croque Madame so decided to explore a sandwich with Lorraine eggs on a pastry with potatoes for a side. Eggs were microwaved, pastry was spongy, potatoes were undercooked in the middle, most likely also microwaved.
The line is out the door, and this place is famous as I've heard of it outside of San Francisco.

I love this place.  They don't have the best coffee in the world, but it's good.  The team that work here are outstanding (I wish I could hire a crew as engaged and dedicated).  I come here every once in a while on the weekend with my daughter and order a coffee and a walnut baguette - and indulge in the FREE Nutella.  Last weekend, I didn't even have to order, Cristina (I think that's her name) had my large coffee and walnut baguette waiting for me on the counter - that's the kind of service I might expect at a very expensive restaurant - certainly not a $2.00 coffee shop that I don't frequent very often.    The almond croissants and open face sandwiches are also delicious.

Coffee was amazing and for breakfast I split the egg sandwich with bacon on a croissant and the hazelnut chocolate croissant. The hazelnut chocolate croissant was warmed up and it was crisp on the outside and gooey and warm on the inside. Delicious! Would definitely go again!

We come here almost every Sunday. Really relaxing because no one bugs you. You do meet interesting people from all over, if you feel chatty. At least on two occasions the person moved here from Roma's across the street; the same reason we, and other friends did.  The pastries are great here, especially if you ask them to warm it up for you.
The atmosphere is adorable, but the food was disappointing.
Had the Croque Madame - made for an excellent breakfast!

La boulange is a super cute coffee shop! My favorite is their tasty pastries, cutely packaged goodies, and ambience of a high end coffee place. If yelp had half stars, id give this place a solid 3.5. There's no obvious major reason why it's not a 4, the service is just not at a 4-star level and it's disappointing that it doesn't gave wifi!

Cute place for a coffee date. I'm glad Starbucks hasn't completely taken away the small business feel. Almond croissant was to die for! Also good were the chocolate croissant, raspberry/lemon/red velvet macaroons. Hard to find parking and seating, but one can always buy to go, and picnic at the park down the street. I wish they were open later though. Thank you for good pastries and friendly service!

Stopped here for lunch drawn by the Zagat rating and good Yelp reviews. Extremely disappointed. Open faced tuna melt boasted apples and celery tomato and cheddar cheese. Tomato wasn't ripe. The apples and celery were minced so finely as to be completely undetectable. All you tasted was tuna and cheese, not worth the $9 price tag for what was essentially a simple tuna melt. The open faced turkey had very little in the way of turkey spread over not even two full slices of bread. Again, extremely overpriced for what you're getting. Maybe the desserts are better but I will not be going back to find out!

Quiche, pastries, and espresso drinks are good. Sufficient seating most of the time. There's sidewalk tables, and a counter against the windows to people watch. My only problem with this place is I can't find the tip jar.
Awesome stuff! I can see why Starbucks partnered up with them.
Solid coffee, nice outdoor seating, good food, friendly staff. Everything about it is good, not spectacular. I'm happy to have it in the neighborhood though.
Great Breakfast! Really felt in France at the Heart of San Francisco. ;)

First time in North Beach area on December 31st, and I was hungry. I browsed thru the line of restaurants along Columbus, and I noticed these people eating on tables and chairs outside like Parisians, with great views of many other stores in North Beach and great people-watching [tourists, primarily].

There are a bunch of these places in SF but just because it is a small chain didn't mean they had lost a real personal feel.  I was just hustling through the city on the way to a conference and it was a very convenient place to stop by and get a quick and tasty pastry.  Friendly employees, good prices, and a wide variety of pastries, coffee drinks, etc.

Bumped into this place looking for brunch and it's quite nice. Food was delicious and a bit pricey but well worth it. A bit noisy since the door is open and the street has a lot of traffic. The people working here are very helpful and provide great service. Wouldn't mind stopping by next time I'm in town.

I like the fact that they have almond milk and great pastries, but had a beet salad that had moldy tasting lettuce one day and returned it.  When I told them about it, they gave me a refund, but they didn't bother looking into their lettuce.
My family and I were in town from San Diego and actually tried to go to Mama's nearby, which was too crowded. We drove around looking for another place and found this cafe!

This doesn't get the best reviews. I wasn't too impressed by it. I thought it was overpriced by 1-2 dollars for every item including pastries. I tried "La Combo," which is a half-open faced sandwich and soup. I got a smoked salmon sandwich and French onion soup. I thought it was okay, but not filling. I also got a lemonade, which was fine, but again overpriced. The pastries didn't seem that amazing, but I'd still like to try them out sometime.

Cute coffee shop in North Beach. It's a great place to stop in and get a pastry and a cup of coffee. I got a chocolate croissant and a small cup of mocha. The croissant was warned up so the chocolate was nice and gooey. The mocha tastes like how it should taste. Both of these items together was kind of too much chocolate for me. My bf thought it would be a good mix.

Good place to get a pastry and cup of coffee to stay inside from the cold sf nights. The place has large windows for people watching. We had a chocolate croissant and a mocha. They both were delicious. I enjoyed the atmosphere and will come again when I am waiting around in North Beach.

I had just left City Lights and walked by, then turned around because I got good vibes from the place.  The manager was super friendly, we chatted about being baristas (though I, on the other hand, work for a corporate place.).  I needed less coffee in my life at this point so I opted to go with an iced chai; she suggested to make it sweet and spicy -  I did.  Took a drive up to Coit Tower and sipped on my delicious drink, this wrapped up my experience on a great note.  A pistachio cookie was a yummy treat to snack on in traffic as well!
Okay place for food... Great place to grab a latte.
Great goat cheese salad. Lovely atmosphere. Don't get the French onion soup. Good for a casual brunch with friends.
"Meh" about sums this place up entirely.
I've never tried their brunch/lunch/dinner menu, but I had my loyal customer cards to prove how many times I have came back here for their coffee (and sometimes pastries).

Visiting SF for the weekend from Orange County and we ordered the fruit, yogurt and a few pastries and all were amazing!!  we don't have anything this good in OC.. atleast I haven't found it.  I am very picky and found this place to be excellent.. really fresh! We had great service too.

Maybe it is just because I hail from the sun-challenged city of Seattle, but I was in absolute awe of the great open air feel of this place from the large open window I sat in front of...the incredible people watching as pedestrians ventured to the nearby park added a lot to the experience as well!
Super fresh breakfast. Had the frittata sandwich and egg sandwich. Loved the pesto and potatoes w the frittata.

This place has been kicking butt as of late. The food has gotten much better without any price increase (they have quinoa salads now!). After some solid miles and lifting, I come here to just sit and people watch as I eat a grilled cheese (delectably crunchy and gooey at the same time) with a super large heaping of quinoa on the side. The pastries taste softer now as well, and the service is still fantastic. The tables are always clean, and the cashiers are entirely friendly and helpful.

It was a great experience visiting this place! Very nice service, the boy that was working there really seemed happy to work there and was very nice with visitors. The cake we've got was pretty good too.

Cute cafe. Went by to just pickup their mini macarons. My sister and I got the passion fruit mango and pistachio macarons. The mango one was so soft inside and so perfect with the crunchy mango pieces on the shell. The pistachio one was very fresh tasting of pistachios. Will be back for more and to try other pastries!
Had lunch here today with my girlfriend. First time visiting this chain. Did not get a first impression.

A very reliable SF chain of restaurants and the location in North Beach is one of their more average stores.  Much more pedestrian traffic and a bit more cramped than the others.  However, the food is always good and the service is pretty quick.  Their prices are a little steep for salads/sandwiches in general, but I always know I'm going to get something I like.  Highly recommend the smoked trout salad and their open faced sandwiches.

I really like this place a lot.  Today was my first time and I ended up getting the goat cheese and mushroom open face sandwich.  It came with a mixed green salad with a vinagrette sauce.  The sandwich was savory and good.  The salad was okay. My friend got a sandwich with their potato chips.  The chips were fantastic.  I think they were seasoned with rosemary.
Excellent, fresh bagel sandwiches and never a wait. My goto for a quick morning meal before commuting out of the city.
He poured too much cream in my coffee I asked for another one and he wanted to charge me ! Very rude

This place has AMAZING breakfast sandwiches!! I had the breakfast croissant with turkey jalapeños and avocado. My mouth is watering thinking about it and I already just ate one! The other restaurants nearby are all just a hype. Come here if you want a very delicious breakfast bagel of croissant sandwich!

The food was delicious. I had a breakfast bagel with cream cheese, bacon, egg & avocado & a great iced soy mocha. This is definitely a laid back experience, came here on a Sunday with some girlfriends and we sat on the patio.

I ordered the French toast here, it was pretty good but the rest of my food was slightly bland. The service was fast, almost to the point of being rushed. It looks like they also have a small selection of pastries. Overall, I would come again for an easy and inexpensive breakfast.
Maybe two.

Justa Bite has an interesting menu that includes, salads, sammies, omelets, Chinese food,  and pastries. So what does one order at a place like this? The chef salad. It was ok, everything tasted fresh, I added avo to it, which was good.

I was meeting friends...so I got there a little early and, as I got two feet in the door, the gentleman behind the counter  (whom I could barely see) yelled:  YOU WANT COFFEE? got up to the counter and said, O I am waiting for some co-workers & will wait for them to come., and sat down in EMPTY cafe.  After a minute (maybe less), he said:  You cannot wait in here.  So I stood outside the door to wait for co-workers in the cold.

Worst place ever! I live down the street and decided to try this out one day. Walked in to 2 old Asian people who were very rude. We ordered a sandwich and fries and threw it away. It was impossible to speak to the owner about how wrong the order was and i gave up. I honestly don't know how they stay in business- they probably have owned teh building for ages in their family and have low overhead. Its always empty and if someone is inside its either a soon to be disappointed tourist or little Chinese kids after school.

Stumbled upon this place walking through North Beach and saw that they sold ice cream...So wandered in, placed an order, and was very offended by the proprietor's lack of customer service. Then when you coupled that with me paying $8.50 for three extremely small "Dixie Cup" (Two separate cups) scoops of ice cream...I knew I had made a dining error...And to top matters off, I asked for a couple of napkins and he gave me "TWO!" Never dining here again!
I don't know why I decided to come here when there's a gazillion other (BETTER!) places in the North Beach area.
This place is where breakfast goes to die. No, where ALL FOOD goes to die.

Local mom n pop cafe. We had a decent breakfast (a bit too oily, use a napkin to take the excess grease off :p). Fast attentive service...it u want a quick bite to eat, feel free to stop here n support local businesses!
I had a great latte to go the other day. The service was quick and friendly. They have a $10 minimum card limit so I was glad I had some cash with me.
This place was soooo bad.

I didn't have much time, no cash, and I wanted justa bite. I saw the Visa logo in the window and the menu looked okay so I went in. I wasn't sure what I wanted so it took me 5 to 10 minutes to choose. The man a the counter was friendly and patient  until I pulled out my Visa card. "No, $10 minimum for credit card" What! my order was nearly $7 and didn't most places stop doing this in like 1998? And even then it was usually $5 and sometimes $3. So I told him to "forget it" in a firm but polite tone. This angered him, "fine!" Clearly is was my fault that he has a dumb ass credit card policy.

Cute little North Beach Cafe! My Raspberry Cappuccino and breakfast croissant sandwich was very good! Service was especially attentive. My only complaint was the cookie that I got to go for later was stale and fairly tasteless. Given the large selection of homemade cookies that they carry, I was expecting more. Place lacks in atmosphere but the service and food it good.

A cute, quaint, chinese-owned cafe in North Beach. I don't know why, but I was suffering from a really bad cold, and I had their lemon ginger tea. For some reason I felt so much better sitting there, sipping it. It's a small place, great to watch the rain fall. I did not try the food so I could not vouch for that. I did see that they have a plethora of cookies and mitchell's ice cream.  The woman behind the counter was very nice to me... but I can see how she might be a bit surly, as she brushed off some people who tried to come and get quarters in change to pay the meter. Yet and still the pastries and coffee in this cafe are probably cheaper than you wll get in the Italian cafes in North Beach, so if you just want to go in for a quick coffee, tea, or pastry, I guess it's a pretty okay place.
I have only been here once, and it was for coffee and toast but I had a good experience unlike so many others.
DO NOT EAT HERE!
Free wi-fi is the only plus at this bare-minimum coffeehouse. I went in for the wireless and felt compelled to review.

I am completely APPALLED by this establishment. My dad and I came here on Father's Day to get a little lunch after taking a tour of Telegraph Hill. We ordered a bagel sandwich and a couple of drinks (not cheap) and then sat and ate and rested.
salmon deli sandwich. meh. not the worst ever, but I definitely can make a better one with canned fish.
Very average steak sandwich.  The menu claimed the steak was lean but it definitely wasn't.  Overall it's not a bad a place, but nothing special either.  Also, not much ventilation inside.
their breakfast is very delicious. i loved their homemade hashbrown.
nothing too cool but at the same time i ordered the coolest thing ever.

I had a roast beef sandwich here.  It was okay.  The bread tasted a bit stale.  The cashier lady (owner?) didn't seem too honest.  She didn't want to give me back my change.  I gave her a $6.00 for my $5.10 sandwich and she closed the register without giving me back my change.  I was the only customer so unless she hasn't been sleeping for days there's no excuse for "forgetting" to give me back my change.  I can tell when someone conveniently pretends to forget to give me back my change.  Having to ask for my change back...that's negative 5 stars!
worst grilled cheese. ever.

I am suprised at the bad review. I thought this little place was great. They have one of my favorite breakfasts. Food is always hot and the service is usually very prompt. Great addition to North Beach. The prices are slightly high but that's okay with me. All in all, I do recommend checking it out at least once.

Seemed a bit pricey for a microwave sandwich. I think I was expecting something different. The breakfast sandwich was good - but I would not say I would go there every weekend. Cafe Roma has a power breakfast sandwich with hard boiled eggs and tomatoes which while different feels much healthier and is cheaper.

I defintely like the family-owned vibe they have going on (it looked like the owner's daughter was working). The food was good and hot (breakfast croissant with bacon, egg, and ham). My only complaint was the prices were justa bit too high for a small sandwich and drink...
Probably the best chai I've ever had (I'm a vanilla-y chai fan though). And the mini eclairs are heaven.
My girlfriend and I went to Da Flora for the first time tonight to celebrate our 6 month anniversary!
the food is super delicious, so there are the two stars.
Oh my stars, this was good, good, good.

My husband and I recently moved into the neighborhood and a friend suggested we try this restaurant. I'm so glad we did. It's everything you want in a neighborhood restaurant - great food, nice ambience and friendly staff and owners. The gnocchi and focaccia are amazing and our main dishes were delicious as well. Looking forward to our next meal there.

I've been going to Da Flora for ten years and in all of this time has never failed to delight.  Favorites are the sweet potato gnocchi in a garlic cream sauce starter. The squid ink risotto is always good, and they are one of the few Italian restaurants to put liver on the menu - last visit I had chicken livers, cooked to perfection.

Da Flora is the best Italian food I've ever had (outside of being in Italy) and some of the best food I've had in SF period. My Dad discovered this gem a while ago and we've been going here as often as we can ever since.

Walked in to get a quick meal as recommended by someone I was staying with. I was not greeted when I walked in despite a staff member looking me directly in eye. I asked for a table for one and was told to take a seat. As I was just pulling out my chair, another waiter came and told me I would need to wait 45 minutes as they would like to fill the restaurant up with groups instead. It is a small restaurant, but there had to be at least 6-7 empty tables. I have never been refused service for being a single customer - when I told the waiter I will look elsewhere he shrugged his shoulders and just said "yeah, probably". It was embarrassing and I do not recommend this place at all - judging by other reviews they are clearly just a Money making machine and do not value the importance of their customers' experience. Zero stars.

This is a bit of a hidden gem. A piece of old school Little Italy if you will. One of my college friends swore by it and dragged me here retty much ever since they opened. I think it's evolved a bit. Nowadays the gnocchi/bread are the stars but back in the day I remember having a great carbonara. It's rare that an Italian place in NorCal will focus mostly on an area and the Venetian bent here makes it worth going to for that regional flare.

A wonderful intimate Italilan restaurant with an amazing, unique menu. The sweet potato gnochi is amazing! WIne list is primarly from Italy and surrounding regions with some excellent choices. Staff is very friendly and attentive. The food is fabulous!
This place is a real find. The ambiance is charming. The staff delightful. The food is spectacular. A must go
Absolutely unique and delightful. 10/10

I have found the Holy Grail - quote from my dinning companion and the absolute truth!  The food was AMAZING!  The service and space was just as good.  Can't believe I have walked by this Jem so many times and never stopped in.  The bread was so delicious it brought tears it was so amazing.

I selfishly want to keep this place to myself, but I will share it because they deserve the business. My lady and I live in LA, but every time we are in SF, it's a MUST for us to eat at Da Flora. This is a wonderful mom and pop restaurant. It's the best Italian food we've ever had and I'm Italian! The bread before the meal is so warm and fresh and perfectly oiled and spiced, it could be a meal in itself.  We always get Mary Beth as our server and she is amazing. Eating here is like having homemade food that your Italian grandmother would make. Jen the chef is not just a chef, she's an artist and the menu is handwritten and Jen changes it regularly, so we're always looking forward to what delicious creation she'll come up with next.  You must try the sweet potato Gnocci; it's out of this world! The ambience, the intimate environment, the people, the food.....you get the whole package here!
Sadly ... or experience had some extreme highs and lows. I cant recommend the place.
Excellent gnocchi.  We appreciate that they were able to accommodate a party of seven on short notice.  Proprietress was very pleasant.

Ok - this is tough as IT REALLY deserves 3.5 stars - not quite 4 as I just gave that to SPQR and reserve 5 for French Laundry types - second time here prior to seeing comedy show - good food, very, very nice service, but just not OUTSTANDING - prices insinuate a bit more to the food, however, still would come back.  Small and quaint with very friendly service - food is interesting but lacks that PUNCH one would expect - needs a bit more on simple seasonings like salt/pepper - quality of the food is great - the gnocchi is REALLY good and the ceaser was exceptional - the Manicotti was actually the best part of the meal which was layered in wonderful cream and basil sauce that complimented the rich, velvety interior of the manicotti itself!!

I must admit that the first time I visited Da Flora I was not that impressed but I had a good enough time to return. The second time around everything fell into place. It's that kind of place. It takes a little getting use to. The owners are very friendly and the their recommended wine was great. I can't remember what it was but the four of us had three bottles.

Had a dreamy night here on my birthday - possibly the best birthday dinner of my life; though I have to confess that the company factored in. Bottom line is, I grew up with my Grandma Carmella's gnocchi as the gold standard. I've been on a quest to find gnocchi that measured up my entire life, including the 9 months I spent studying in Italy. The sweet potato gnocchi here measures up; in fact, if I were being entirely honest I might even say it surpasses my grandma's (please don't hate me, Grandma!). In addition to that, Da Flora is the epitome of romantic. The lighting, the paint, the restroom, the hand written menus,  the tables - all fabulous. Thank you for an evening that will always be among my favorite memories!
If you'd like to be ignored and receive the slowest and likely the worst service in the city give this place a try.

Can't even give this restaurant one star - but this app is making me.  We live in the neighborhood and have been wanting to try this place for years.  Based on some great yelp reviews we finally planned and made reservations.  We were excited to try this local spot...

Around the corner from where we live, the folks at da flora put out lovingly made food that's delicious but probably not low-cal (bacon gnocchi to die for). The place is warm and inviting and definitely not a tourist trap.
Truly a gem! A small, cozy place with a small menu of food made well.
Food=scrumpcious, real, fresh, local. YUM
This has been my favorite Italian restaurant ... and favorite overall restaurant ... in SF for several years.  Both are big statements, and Da Flora lives up to them easily.

Da Flora is quite unique. The atmosphere is quaint & friendly. Several people that walked through the door were greeted with a hug from the owner. They prefer cash & ask that you don't use your cell phones (I'm a fan of the no cell phone usage during dinner btw). The menu changes daily, but the one thing that is always available is the homemade focaccia bread. This was hands down the BEST focaccia I've ever had. I would go back just for the bread alone. It was crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, had a hint of salt, and was lightly coated in olive oil. We ate two full plates of it between the two of us, and for once in my life I didn't feel guilty about the carbs because they were worth every bite. We had the stuffed artichoke for a starter. I expected it to be served warm, instead of cold, but it was still really good. The crunch of the breadcrumbs and the tender artichoke heart was a great contrast. My dinner companion had the halibut served over asparagus. He thought it was a little bland. I had the risi bisi: risotto with fresh peas. Great flavors & texture. Not too rich, and very filling. Overall I really enjoyed the meal and the ambiance. The prices were on the higher side, but fairly average for NB. Go try the focaccia!!

We've eaten at Da Flora's several times over the years, and until last night I would have given them 4 stars consistently.  Bread excellent, fabulous even; ditto gnocchi and desserts.  I thought the entree was so-so, consistently.   Also, as noted by other reviewers, the two women running the place lacked a little something in the area of class and good manners.
I've had my eye on Da Flora for awhile now - I live in the neighborhood and I keep reading and hearing great things. I decided to take my parents here while they were visiting.

With so many fabulous restaurants in San Francisco, I can't imagine why anyone would put up with a grumpy, unwelcoming place. The food was nothing special. They don't like you to pay with credit cards.
Pulled in by the great ambiance.
I've been coming here for years. Cozy, romantic restaurant with tables spaced acceptably.
**3.5 STARS**
Great place! The food was excellent. The staff is so matter of fact. It's hilarious. Loved the atmosphere.
The best restaurant in the West Coast!  Flora is such a great host -- no winning and make sure your cell phone is off though... Trust her with the wine selection.  The gnocchi are out of this world!

This hidden local Italian restaurant is a gem!  And our tradition in North Beach.  Far and away the best Italian food, and the best wines.  MaryBeth makes the best focaccia and desserts, Jen the best gnocchi and pasta ever, and Flora is hands-down the expert on Italian wines.  We simply tell her she's in charge of our wine!

This restaurant is the best high-end Italian you will find in the city.  The food is excellent, the wine is excellent, and the atmosphere is a pure delight and a welcome escape from the sterile, flat-screen peppered trend traps that seem to be taking over the universe these days.  I am a concierge, and I regularly recommend Da Flora to my guests, especially when they are planning a birthday or anniversary dinner.  Not one of my guests has ever been disappointed by the cuisine or by the service there.
This is the best restaurant I have ever been to.

Ok walked into the place on a Saturday night at 9:30 pm and was turned away with 5 available tables. To add salt to the wound, it was my birthday dinner. DO WE NOT LIVE IN A MAJOR US CITY?  I now give up on this place, the food is amazing but Shrek, owner #1, and the other fat lady provide the most horrible service that I just cannot go there ever again

Their foccacia bread & sweet potato gnocchi with bacon were absolutely unforgettable!!   Unfortunately, so was the offensive service and attitude we received from Flora and the rest of their wait staff (as many others have pointed out).  Definitely the worst I've ever experienced. EVER. We will not be going back, and will not be recommending this restaurant to any of our friends.

It was just okay. The Caesar salad was good, but the linguini with onions was a bit dry.  We had to ask for our check as we waited a long time for our plates to be cleared. It wasn't crowded at that point. Only 4 tables left. The woman that sat us was nasty.  It was as if she didn't want our teenage sons in her restaurant.  Overly expensive for portion size.

What a find! Had a truly unique and amazing meal -- delicious all the way around. The food was simply superb - Venetian Italian with Hungarian influences. The decor felt sumptuous and elegant yet cozy enough to drop in for a week night meal. Fantastic Italian wine list. The staff was very friendly and informative. I will put this one on my "regular" list.

Came here for breakfast today. I love the five dollars breakfast. It includes milk tea, pancakes and your choice from a huge list including porridge, sandwich and noodle.....The place is clean and roomy, free Wi-Fi. I think everyone should know about this hidden gem. Very close to the Vallejo parking lot. I have lunch here before, not bad.

For a Hong Kong-style restaurant, this one is quiet and clean. Though, I may not know the Health Department score. I do feel optimistic on the cleanliness since this café is still located in Chinatown.
Pretty good HK food place--not sure why everyone is hating on it!

Horrible service. I ordered for delivery (estimated 45 minutes) and they called me over an hour later saying that were busy but would start making the food then. Very unprofessional and the food isn't even that good.
Asian style cafe

Ive always been afraid to go to a cafe during my lunch break due to slow services that I have experienced. But this place was quick and easy! I ordered the curry chicken with rice.. Oh boy.. IT WAS SO GOOD! The chicken was very very tender ! Service was also good. I was seated immediately when I arrived and greeted with a warm smile! Definitely will be back ! (: My new go-to spot on my lunch break !

Not the best but definitely cheaper than Washington. If you want something quick. This place is ok. I was here before the change of ownership and it used to be a lot better. But now, my friends hate it. I think it's ok.

This place is disgusting. I was staying at the Hilton in downtown and decided to order delivery. First, the delivery man didn't want to come across the street into the hotel. He kept calling me phone, telling me to come outside and cross the street to get the food. ??? Weird.
Not bad, not great either. Call this Plan-C, when you absolutely cannot find any other place to eat.

I only come here for breakfast since it opens hella early. I love to get the satay beef ramen here but the quality of it varies. The first 2 times it taste amazing but the recent time noodles were soggy and stuff.
I gave them a shot after the change of the ownership of this place.  The service is okay.  Unfortunately, their food are not up to the par.  I really miss their tasty dishes from their previous chef.
Little Garden has new owners! If you remember this as a hole in the wall kind of place, give them another chance! The restaurant is clean and welcoming, and the food is delicious!
This place embodies "Meh".

If you're on a budget, this place is CHEAP! They have very large portions for a good price...usually ranging from 4-7 dollars. I ordered the groupa with the sweet cream corn sauce and I did try this dish at another hong kong style cafe, but this place was a lot better! It was very yummy and fattening!
First time here, this place has the Hong Kong cafe feel when you walk right in with so many ads of menu items taped on the wall and the tv on the corner near the door.

The kway teow (Singaporean-style fried noodles) had some nice heat to it from the red pepper flakes, but I was confused why there was spam involved. The shrimp was the usual touch, but the spam strips? While tasty, it made the whole dish a little greasier tasting than it should have been.

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to eat at a Chinese version of Denny's?  This place has it all.  From the screaming kids, bad service and extensive menu, it makes for an unforgettable experience you would never want to repeat.

i was with some friends after walking around ct in the summer and i got thirsty. (this is actually a late post). i was really craving a red bean ice, so i got one. it was... not good. the red beans were chewy and not soft; there was no flavor; it was pretty much ice; the price was a bit high, kinda. point is, don't order that here!
I'm bumping up to four stars for the following reasons:
My friend really likes this place. He goes there all the time. I love cream of mushroom soup and my friend said this place had it.
The waitresses are nice to you if you give them a big tip.
the proportions are not big. i can get this food mostly at anywhere. it's a OK place to eat.
This was an average HK tea house. Being chinese, I eat this type of food on the regular. I had the Stewed ham and chicken spaghetti  and it was yummo. Always a good place to grab a quick bite.
What the F. The first time we went, it was horrible. It wasn't the food exactly though.
Is cheap and I love Hong Kong style food, I am from HK, we always call for delivery. Good place to eat and price is cheap.

Typical Hong Kong style cafe with decent Chinese food. I usually come here because it's right across the street from the North Beach Garage and it's convenient. I order the satay beef ramen which comes with chewy (not the best) slices of beef, bell peppers, onions, and bits of pineapple. Comfort food but undoubtedly packed with MSG. Fiancé orders Ma Po Seafood Lo Mein which is noodles with squid, shrimp and tofu, which he loves and quickly devours. Their hot milk tea is made with the perfect amount of sweetness. The service is decent for a Chinese restaurant. They get you what you need. The waitress there recognizes us so she jokes with us.

Cheap, but I've had cheaper. Decent at best. Definitely a local's spot. If I lived in the area, this would probably be one of my regular spots, but I don't, and it's really not worth going out of your way for.

It's about asking for what you want.  They actually do it when the place is not overcrowded.  I love steamed and stir-fried veggies ... hold the rice, spice and grease.  I said anything that's fresh.  I said to the waitress, "Make a large vegetable plate the way you would want to eat veggies for your self.  I know it'll be great.  Lots of veggies."  I loved it.  It was cheap.  It's right across the street from the cheapest garage in Chinatown.  No where near Portsmouth Square, right next to North Station Police Department.  It's perfect.  Then you take a walk to the Filbert Steps by way of Montgomery.  Watch the parrots fly.  Walk to Coit Tower to see the Diego Rivera murals.  Life is good.

Beware of this place... there is no parking at this place 1st of all, and the prices went up for the parking lot so i wouldn't wanna park there... when i ate here once... i had a bad experience... i had a fat ass stomach ache  right after ate their food. never coming back here again

My friends and I were all craving for Chinese, and my best friend (who lives in the Bay Area--the rest of us are from the Sacramento area, though I did grow up in Daly City) recommended  this place.  All I gotta say is wow, the food is affordable and yummy!!  I ordered a beef satay with enoki.  The noodles on the bottom were still crunchy, but the sauce softened it up.  The beef was savory.  The portions are just right; not too big, not too small.  We also all had milk tea, which tasted like a latte without the extra sugar and the stomach runs.  The service was fast, and the owners were friendly.  My only complaint was that when we got tea (regular, not milk tea), it wasn't hot.  Just lukewarm.  Oh well.  I wanna try many amazing restaurants to try in San Fran, but I wouldn't mind coming back.
Food: 2 Stars

Came here to eat with the grandparents who enjoyed the Chinese takes on western dishes like rack of lamb. My pork cutlet was pretty tender, and big portions like you would expect in C-town. They also have a lot of other more traditional Chinese noodles and soups deal. Family-owned places like this always makes me feel the food is more homecmade, especially with all their children watching cartoons at an unoccupied table like its the daycare corner. Very affordable, simple restaurant.

I came here because I realized after living near Chinatown for so long , I've never came here to eat . When I first walked in , it reminded me of D&A but a cleaner version . They have a TV and a specials menu . The regular menu is really long . The prices are pretty fair but the quality is ehh . The food itself is mediocre . The first time I came here , I ordered a steak which tasted okay but kind of bland in a way . The second time I came , I ordered fried soy sauce noodles which tasted good . I also ordered curry deep fried oysters which was a complete rip off !! It was just deep fried oysters and some blandass watery curry sauce on the side in a separate dish . I also ordered a iced lemon w/ honey which wasn't sweet at all .

I was pleasantly surprised by this place.  It reminded me of D&A when I walked in.  We ordered the clams in black bean sauce which were delish and only $7.50!  They were flavorful and the clams were huge!  Also, the oyster clay pot was yummy as well.  I'm alwayz afraid that when ordering clay pots that the food will be overcooked, but it wasn't.  A complaint I do have about this place is that they like to serve a whole table before moving on to the next, so we had to wait a while before getting our food.  Once one dish came, the rest were right behind.  Prices here are pretty good.  For 3 people, we ended up spending around $35, which included tip.  All in all, a great bang for your buck!

Wanted Chinese and to try somewhere new - saw that they have the 3 dishes for $15.99 special and decided to give this place a try.  We've walked by this place plenty times given it's next to the police station and the parking garages.  Over the weekends, this place was pretty busy but the evening we were there - there were 2 other tables, 1 with 6 and another with just 1.

Being a fan of D&A or VIP Coffee, it was hard to pull me way from the gravitational force of those two, but we decided to mix it up.  we ordered from the chinese menu (you know - 3 dishes for $16 + soup).  the food here is pretty solid, and really tasty compared to other places in chinatown, so i'd definitely go back.  but the menu is freaking incredible.  in my experience, too large a menu = too much indecision on my part.  but it gets 3 stars b/c it's not necessarily a compelling restaurant, but something that is a reliable fall-back.

The food is all right and the service is typical of Hong Kong eateries.  The menu is massive, but items are cheap.  We ordered the fried squid, stir-fried noodles with beef, pineapples and Enoki mushrooms, and the Ma Po Seafood Yee Mein.  The beef noodles were good, but quality of beef is average.  The calamari was delicious and fresh.  Then the Ma Po noodles were just bad!  I'm into new Asian dishes, but this was something I could not enjoy.  The noodles were like a white sponge texture and the sauce was brothy & spicy hot, but some how bland.  The dish's seafood was good except for the scallops used, it was just off for some reason.  For a cheap spot, I guess you get what you paid for.  I recommend for all patrons to stay away from the Ma Po noodles.
I would've never entered this place if it wasn't for my friend. It was very... eh.

I love coming to Jack's for beer when I'm visiting San Francisco! Hands down, this is the largest and best selection of beers you will find in a bar. Every time I come here, I get a different beer I haven't tried before, and all of them have been delicious. I haven't tried the food here, I just come here for the beer. The environment here at Jacks is awesome too.
Great staff.  Cash only.  Great beer selection. $1 oysters all day that won't poison you. Great location for sports if you happen to be in tourist territory.

Worst server I have ever seen. She started taking orders from customers who came after us. She did not even clean table and totally ignored us. She might not have taken any serving classes but she did not even have any common sense. We left after waiting for 20 minutes.
Do NOT eat here. I've never had heartburn, until now. I burped for hours after eating the fish and chips.

I can't really comment on the food or drink because we walked into the place, got dirty looks from all the patrons already seated and than the staff didn't even bother speaking to us. After waiting for 10 mins to be even spoken to, we decided to take our business else where. Considering this was our 3rd stop on our "pub crawl", it was disappointing that given the very cool atmosphere, to have such a rude experience!!!! But that's ok since there are no lack of bars to try in this area!!! Onto the Blue Mermaid next door!!!

Clean, friendly staff, super layed back with over 60 beers on draft. Hubby was happy the beer was super cold.  Kind of empty during the day if you like to avoid crowds.  We enjoyed our time together as we watched San Fran's baseball game. Nice spot if your visiting near pier 39.
Chowder was ok at best (eatable). Cash only! Everything fried. Chicken sandwiches,  fried cutlet. Needless to say, not coming back...
Really plastic cups for beer and crap chowder... will never come back! THIS IS TRULY a crap place. DO NOT EAT HERE!
68 beers on tap, $1 oyster shooters! What a great place. Jack's was busy but I never had to wait for a drink. I love Weyder's Pear Cider and they had it on tap. Great place!
$1 oysters/beer selection here are great but service can be quite slow. The outdoor area is perfect on a gorgeous day. Usually street performers are playing as well. Great ambiance. Tip-CASH ONLY

I'm not sure about the food, but the beer selection is excellent here. They do have $1 oysters and they were delicious. There are beer 68 taps available, but you better bring cash because they do not take debit or credit. There's also an old school Galaga machine :)
Love this place!!! I'm definitely coming back! Their fries were delicious, and beer was even better

Love this place. It's like a glorious oasis unto itself, tucked away and smack dab in the middle of the touristy, overpriced, annoying chaos of the wharf. For some inexplicable reason, this bar never gets inundated with tourists and is always quiet, comfortable and a great spot to enjoy a pint. They have about 60 different taps so there's a great selection to choose from, especially Anchor.
This is a great draft beer place. If you want to sit outside and have a cold beer and relax, this is the place to be!
Horrible service is all I can say!
Cool place and very nice bartender however they only take cash would of been nice to know up front luckily we had the money after we had our drinks with friends
Cool little bar and a wonderful bartender who poured us great drinks amd tvs for the game with music and a stuffed gorilla

Would be a 2 on the food but the excellent beer menu bumps it to a 3.  Prices for draft were $7 which is even higher than beer in Canada.  Go and have a couple pints just to try the beer but don't go for the food when there are so many other places to eat.

Jacks is a must when on the Wharf. They have a HUGE beer selection, live music, good bar food... And $1 oysters!! Although it's in the hub of tourist attractions, it has a very warm, locals bar feel to it.
Loved our bartender. Very knowledgeable about local craft beers and the local wines. Fun crowd and my wife loved the Irish coffee. Didn't try the food but the oysters looked great.
Beers were plentiful & cold. Hit the spot. Food on the otherhand, STUNK. Overpriced, frozen food.
I wish there is a 0 star option for this place.  It deserves it.
Great beers but kicked my Australian friends out for not tipping enough. Not cool. Cultural differences not accepted.

Mediocre. The food was eh.. Alright. I've honestly had better clam chowder in Stockton California. The lemon drop was good but small at 8 a pop I was good with one. I probably won't be back. Way better places to eat in this area.

CASH ONLY.  Good beer selection, good basic food.  Good live music, and a very cool building.  The bar tender did refuse to serve me a beer I wanted because "he didn't like the brewery" so that was kind of douchy, but all in all a good time was had.

Nothing special,  bartender was bordering on looking like he was annoyed by customers,  verbally complained out loud that a customer (she) deserved to be punched in the face after a tip he thought was too low.
It was ok.  Kitchen closed  awful early.  But the price is right, lots of beer on tap.

Stopped in on a quiet Monday night...only 6 other customers, each already had been served but it still took the bartender over 10 minutes to acknowledge us and take our order. Never offered a menu, wasnt very friendly. Then she overcharged us by double! When we called her attention to it, she was quick to put the correct change on the bar. Don't go there...they prey on the hapless tourist.

Extremely slow service, with no explanation until after waiting 45 minutes for appetizers that kitchen was backed up even though half the restaurant was empty... I don't expect fast food but this was ridiculous.
Good beer selection, though they never update their menus, so you never know what they actually have.
This is your typical pub.  They have a wide variety of beer, and we ordered the sliders which were pretty good.  They only accept cash, FYI.
The steak was absolutely De-licious...The bloody mary was off the hook.... Im goin back!
Loved this place. Stopped here with my brother visiting. We sat at the bar for hours trying all different beers. They had TONS of beers on tap. It was impressive.

This bar was pretty awesome! The staff was pretty bland...waitress yelling at the owner...bartender pretty stiff and no fun. But the beers were excellent! The food was so-so. I had a sh*tty BLT and my husband had the clam chowder and calamari. But it was a bar that had tons of beers to choose from! There was also a live musician playing some pretty awesome cover songs at 3 in the afternoon! Can't beat that.

Stumbled upon Jacks Bar on a Sunday afternoon. Good place to hang out at the bar and watch the game. Bartender was friendly and talented. My friends and I ordered the Bloody Mary with the works. Seriously, the best Bloody Mary I have had....ever. Also came with olive, cocktail pickle, cheese, cube of ham...practically a meal in itself. A little pricey but well worth it.
My goodness what a great bloody Mary. The world's best that -I've ever had

I wasn't there very long, but it was cool. Old, but comfortable. Staff was friendly enough, but their liquor inventory was limited. Didn't eat anything, just had a few cocktails. I'd definitely come back.

Love love love this place. Good service, friendly staff, a nice huge selection of beers on tap, and overall great time. Definitely reminiscent of any local bar. Very welcoming and they they've got some great food too. Definitely coming back.
Good place to pop in and get a beer not sure about anyting else it was early when I was there.  Everyone appeared either sleepy or wore out from the night before.
At first glance this bar or restaurant on the main stretch of fisherman's wharf seems somewhat of a tourist trap. But once inside it definitely feels like an authentic town sports bar.

I'm a plant-based mountain local and wish someone would open one in Reno or Tahoe! We have no vegan options on the North Shore. How insane is that? If you like veggies and Chinese food, you can't go wrong. Had the Eggplant Tofu & Thai iced tea. Great as always.

I went here with a group of friends a week ago. The food was great (thank you happy cow app). The Pad Thai I got was so delicious I'm going to make a point of getting more next time I'm in San Fran. The crispy noodles my friend ordered were really good too. The orange chicken was pretty good, though a little crunchy for my taste. You shouldn't order the #2 spring rolls as they're really dry and taste like nothing. The bathroom was a single and kind of dingy.
"fast-food" vegan.

What an amazing treat it was to eat in a vegan restaurant with an amazing array of Asian dishes.  It was great to contemplate ordering from a menu without worrying about hidden animal-based ingredients.  My daughter and I came for lunch, and saw a tantalizing buffet.  Still, we both ended up ordering generous portions of vegetable wonton soup with noodles, since it is impossible to order vegetarian wonton soup in the area where I live in the Northeast.  From the first sip of the delicate broth, I was hooked.  If I hadn't been so full after eating my soup, I would have ordered a slice of vegan coconut cheesecake.

This is a review based on my take out order. I was feeling lazy and didn't feel like cooking after working a long day so I decided to order for take out. I ordered the chow fun and the bun bo hue. The chow fun had good flavoring but lacked mushrooms in it but that's just in my opinion. There was soy jerkey, asparagus, carrots, bean sprouts and an Asian veggie. The bun bo hue on the other hand.. omg where do I start?! It was so fucking horrible. They separated the noodle and the soup like any good restaurant would. Broth pretty flavorful but the noodles.. one bite and I almost threw up. Ever had a restaurant that messed up an order, had it sitting there for quite a good amount of time and recooked it or.. like when you have noodles on the stove top for so long and totally forgot about it? Yeah, bottom line is my noodles were SO mushy I couldn't eat it. The noodles are sitting in my fridge right now and I literally had to make my own noodle soup.. disappointing because I ordered the noodle soup from the loving hut in the Westfield mall a few days ago and it was soooo delicious. Be forewarned if you order from here do not I repeat do not order the noodle soup, save your momey and order it from the Westfield location even though parking is going to be a pain..

This was probably the worst meal I've ever had at a restaurant. It was a plate of bell peppers in sweet and sour sauce. I don't know what I was thinking when I ordered that, but it was disgusting. None of my friends were happy with their meals either.
I went looking for love and found it! Iove this place! But first, I am not a VEGAN. I lift heavy at the gym and I need my Protein. However when it comes to "Eating Clean" this is your place.
I tried it again and even though they don't have the awesome cake they used to have, the food got much better!! Really good actually! I had the eggplant again and I loved it.
Healthy and yummy

My Father, a Vegan, recommended this place for a quick lunch whilst in SF. Had to give it a shot! Really enjoyed the "seafood" tofu tempura and basically everything else. The only thing, was the price. A bit higher than you'd want to pay if you're looking to order a few things on the menu. Overall - GREAT EXPERIENCE. Love the Loving Hut.
Service was excellent. Food was very good and I am a super picky eater. Was clean and will def be coming back when I visit.
Loving hut, I'm loving you! (I'm sure I'm not the first to use that pun).

I really like this place and very importantly they use organic tofu so you can be sure that you are not eating nasty genetically modified soy, which largely defeats the purpose of eating vegan since you are in essence torturing the Earth by doing so, not to mention poisoning yourself. This place is not quite as good as Golden Era Vegetarian Restaurant was, the selection is not as broad but alas, Golden Era is now closed. This is by far the best of the 3 Bay Area Loving Hut locations. It's very tasty and a good value. I absolutely love the location at the edge of Chinatown and North Beach, it's a genuine cultural experience, the customers are a mix of folks living in Chinatown or nearby looking for healthy food and tourists from all over the world looking for vegan options. The lunch special is a very good value but the pricing is very reasonable overall. The jasmine tea and likely the other teas are organic also. It's small but has great light and awesome views of the street scene of Chinatown.
My wife and I stopped in here for a bite after visiting The California Academy of Science and deYoung museum in Golden Gate Park.

This place is almost too quiet and serene, like a spa rather than a happening restaurant, and the food was just ok. Tried the orange meatless chicken which was sweet but not tangy enough and had no real orange slices in it. Also had the kale and Goji berry dish and a tiny portion of rice. I think the reason it's affordable is that you get so little food in each dish. On the plus side, there are tons of items on the menu so I think it's worth another try. Sounds like the lunch special is worth checking out.

We came to this place for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the Wonton Noodle Soup, the Spicy Noodle Soup and the Vietnamese Fragrant Claypot Rice. The wonton noodle soup was in a delicious and refreshing clear broth and the wontons had a bite to them. The Spicy Noodle soup or Bun Hue had all the right flavors of the traditional non-vegan Vietnamese Bun Bo Hue. I had never tasted a vegan Bun Bo Hue that so flavorful but be warned that it is very spicy. The Vietnamese Fragrant Claypot Rice was the highlight of our dinner. It was definitely fragrant and so flavorful. We left this dish for last to ensure we get the crispy layer of slightly burnt rice formed by the clay pot. If you see this dish on the menu, you have to get it. The portions were just the right size that it allowed us to explore and share three dishes between two people, although I think I ate slightly more than my friend did. My friend, who wasn't vegan, still loved the food and was glad we gave this place a chance. I can't wait to come back and try all of their other dishes.
Was really excited to try this vegan spot!! They were very accommodating as I arrived at about 2:58pm and they still let me order off the lunch specials that end at 3.
Overpriced and portion are small.

Tried this location while on vacation.  Fast, friendly take out service twice.  My husband really wanted to try the banana split (not availavle for take out), but we couldn't eat in either time due to sleeping children.  Went once at night and once around noon.  Parking both times was not easy and at lunchtime, a pure nighmare.  He just let me out, I ordered and he circled and picked me up.  He enjoyed the veggie burger.  I ordered my favorite soup I get in Norcross, GA which is the Pho soup.  There was a flavor in this particular soup I was not use to and did not like.  I was unable to eat the soup.  :(  The lemongrass and the Orange flavored meals were delicious.  They have a large screen to show menu items.  I do not believe it is used as a tv.  Special lunch menu consist of a 4 choices.  Three different soups and veggie burger.  Each cost $6.95 at lunch time.

Such damn good wonton soup and a serving of fresh spring rolls. They were out of fresh juice but the guy offered me organic jasmine tea (he emphasised the organic factor). Delicious meal in relaxed atmosphere. The go vegan propaganda in the windows is pretty funny. I learnt that a lot of hot celebs are vegan. So that's good. The service was terrific - quick and attentive. Thanks, loving hut!

The Crispy Chow Fun is excellent!  A nice, rich bed of crispy pan fried flat rice noodles smothered in a sauce with vegetables.  The crispy noodles were the highlight of the meal and I'd return for them in a minute.  The sauce was a bit weak and the veggies not so impressive.  My friend had the Kung Pow Wow and told them to make it very spicy.  It looked good but had a thick chili powder aroma that turned me off and my friend wasn't overly excited -- he thought it was good but nothing spectacular.

My kids and I ate dinner here twice this past week. We really enjoyed our spring rolls, won ton soup, chow mein, pho, pad thai, and deluxe vegetables. We really wanted to try the burgers but they were out. Two of us are pescatarians and the other two carnivores. We all loved our dishes and I will try the Loving Hut in our neck of the woods.
delicious. stopped here with family. eggplant and tofu with brown rice. radical! chow mein was mighty tasty too. and very reasonable prices.

We tried this place as a group c. 2 weeks ago, having heard it was under new management. The wait staff was super helpful and sweet but the food is still so-so. I loved the two different soups we tried but the main dishes were quite bland and generic with overcooked veggies and annyoingly synthetic fake meats and "seafood". Not what I'd hope to see at a vegan place that could make so much of fresh veggies and an Asian influence. Good value for money though and I'll be back for the soups.
Hot STeam table lunch is now $6.95, finally after 5 years it went up $1, which is still a great deal.

Loved my experience here! It's run under New management now by a lovely family that really makes sure the customer is happy. I had the Bun Hue spicy noodle soup and as a meat eater I was quite impressed. Not only was the soup delicious, but I felt great eating it! No guilt for eating a tasty, spicy noodle soup and thinking "oh theres msg in here.." but wait theres No MSG!

The Loving Hut chain of restaurants has an impressive assortment of dishes, including Asian and "Western" fare.  One of my favorite dishes is their vegan fish and chips; the batter they dip their fries in is to die for.  The vegan pho is fantastic as well.  There are a lot of fried and greasy dishes on their menu, so I only eat here on occasion.  The prices are very fair and the service is good. Be sure to check out their desserts if you still have room in your stomach.
I'm far from being a vegetarian but I loved the food here.

I ate here in May 2013 and definitely love the food.  I had the grilled soy jerky in skewer (#6) and the spicy cha cha (#63), a shrimp-like dish. I have to say that both dishes had a meaty taste that I miss in other vegetarian foods. I will definitely visit again.
Delicious food, in a peaceful, bright interior. Everyone was very friendly and the food was worth the hike.
Was grabbing dinner with a vegetarian friend and stopped here.

The food is very salty. The service is bad. The waitress recommended me to have a mango smoothies, which was very very sour and tasted badly. I guess they just wanted to clean out the expire fruit. So don't listen to their recommendation. Also, $9 for a little bit of "beef dish", that's not worth. It's my 2nd time to go, I thought they would improve but so sad they are going badly.
Weird, vegan, good.

The food is decent, the restaurant is cramped and feels sterile. The service is so-so to downright lousy, the lady most likely to take your order or ring you up for take-out is always distracted or indifferent to you.  The reason to go if for pretty decent vegan food, but if you are eating here for any other reason you ought to pick any of the dozens of places selling decent food with Great service in the area.
I have had lunch at this place for a few times now. I have always enjoyed food here. The service is bit slow at lunch time (which can be improved).

I still remember my first Loving Hut experience (out in Virginia.) I seriously fell in love with the food and their mission. Fast forward years later and I'm still fond of the Loving Hut chain. However, their mission is starting to take over - my friend whispered that this place is turning into a cult when she stepped foot inside this location. I don't blame her - with all the booklets and pamphlets, in addition to all the facts listed ON the menu...it's a bit much.

I'm really happy that in Chinatown, there's an MSG-free vegan restaurant that I can go to. This Loving Hut is my go-to location for lunch when I don't want to risk getting any traces of meat or MSG into my system from other restaurants that supposedly have vegetarian options. Their lunch specials are very affordable and delicious.

I never thought I'd ever say this but vegan food isn't so bad. What I hate is when places try to imitate meat when obviously the real thing is better. This place does that, but they also serve a lot of other dishes that doesn't try to be what it isn't. Service is also excellent, especially for Chinatown standards.

Walked in because they had vegan cupcake flyers on the table outside and Peta magazines. Of course meat guilt overwhelmed me and I had to go. I actually love meatless 'meat' so I enjoyed my sweet and sour 'chick'n' and brown rice.
I'm glad I'm not a vegan.  But, if you miss the real stuff, not sure how having fake textured soybean products will make up for it???

To put it simply, I am obsessed with Cappuro's! I'm a local and while I do think Fisherman's Wharf is clouded in tourist traps, Cappuro's is not one of them. The food is amazing; I've tried about 8 different things on the menu and I'm never disappointed. Their calamari is the best I've ever had in my life. The service is always incredible and the owner Paul is what makes the experience so awesome. At Cappuro's, Paul makes every guest feel special and welcome. If you have a chance definitely stop in and give them a try! They deserve it!
Greasy tourist trap. Crab cakes were of poor quality and shiny with oil. Fish tacos had tiny pieces of fish in a thick batter that was fried in what tasted like very old oil.
Both food and service was excellent. The clam chowders, both styles were great. Has a kids menu and friendly servers.

My friend and I stopped in and took advantage of their happy hour drinks and food.  The food and drinks were good (though one of the appetizers was a bit overbreaded). Staff was good.  Solid place for happy hour!
Greasy food. Slow service.  There wasnt many people, so not sure why service was so slow...???
The host was great, the food was amazing,,,,,, our server was one of the most terrible that we have ever had !!
Had lunch here and the sand dab sandwich was very good.
Sometimes you do t leave a review because you assume people will know it's good just by looking it.

Worst place. What's a Marguerita pizza without the fresh basil leaves and fresh tomatoes. What we got was chopped cubed tomatoes and no basil.  The "owner", well he claimed to be owner. Claimed his family owned this for a long time. Well if they left it for him, it will be short lived.  He kept making excuses. A simple we're deeply sorry and how can we make it right? Would have suffice. This bozo couldn't do that. If I could give him a zero rating that would have been too much. Customers beware.
I just ate there and had a delightful time.  I ate the never-ending sourdough bowl of clam chowder.  Free refills - it was a pleasant surprise.
Overall rating: tourist trap. Recommendation: avoid.
Didn't get to enjoy the food, but the friendly bar staff walked right up to us and offered a few happy hour deals a half hour after it was over. Can't beat that sort of courtesy IMO.

We were looking for a place near fisherman's wharf with reasonably priced seafood that could accommodate a group. This restaurant fit the bill and was a perfect choice. The crab chowder is to die for! I might go back for another cup this trip.

I love this place! It's probably my favorite seafood italian restaurant to go to. I came here 3 times in one month before. The wood fire roasted crab is to die for, the oysters outstanding and the service has always been incredible. If you are a seafood and italian food lover this place offers the best of both worlds. Also, conveniently enough they have there own parking lot behind the restaurant that makes it easy to get to.
We had a wonderful experience here last night. Both the owner and his staff were very friendly and accommodating. The food was outstanding. We did not have a single complaint.
Great location, atmosphere and friendly staff, this is as San Francisco as you can get with seafood, yummy clam chowder and an ocean view!!
Summary:  Ugh.

We had to come here because one of my friends said they had the best clam chowder in all of San Fran. Little did we know this was an Italian restaurant. We just wanted a light snack so we ordered the Fried Calamari & the Clam chowder of course. I'm being generous here by giving them 4 stars since I really liked the place so much.  The restaurant was pretty full for an afternoon. Then again this is fisherman's wharf where all the tourists cling to. Service was good. We were checked on several times. Our Calamari was very delicious indeed crisp batter which was well seasoned, although it had a ton of thyme in the batter which I don't mind. But after it being in the clam chowder as well which it shouldn't be in a classic clam chowder soup it got to be over whelming in taste. I felt the clam chowder was over kill in taste of thyme. You could barely taste the creamy silky broth of the chowder or even the melt in your mouth clams. I always love my chowder spiked with tabasco & this didn't even help it. I suggest they get rid of the thyme in the clam chowder & add it to their Cioppino instead. I understand that this is an Italian restaurant but don't mess with an old time classic. Stick to the basics for a famous clam chowder.

Stopped by for lunch. They had lunch specials which were pretty good. Clam chowder and sourdough just as good as any others on the Wharf. Fish sandwich was very good too and so was the kid's pizza. Service was good but there were only 6 or 7 tables with customers since it was almost 2 pm. It's clean and better decor than the 60's motif most others at the Wharf have.

I went to Capurro's for lunch during my visit to the pier (Fisherman's Wharf). The hostess outside was very friendly and did a good job explaining specialty menu items. Since the outside hostess was so polite, we decided to give the restaurant a shot. Servers bring complimentary bread to your table. For appetizers, I had fried shrimp with tartar sauce. The shrimp appetizer was excellent. They were jumbo shrimp, fresh, and fried to perfection. I definitely give the shrimp appetizer 5 stars. I went with Capurro's tri-tip sandwich special for an entree. Normally, I wouldn't order tri-tip at a seafood restaurant. In Virginia, we don't eat much tri-tip so I took advantage of a good deal. The sandwich came with cole slaw. I thought the tri-tip sandwich was tasty. Capurro's did a good job grilling the meat (flavorful). Their cole slaw was average in my opinion. Our server wasn't very attentive. We had to track him down for refills and different condiments we needed.  Capurro's has a nice ambience on the pier. They open all of the windows for fresh air.  I give Capurro's a 3.5 rating.

Came back for another visit this weekend. FABULOUS! Perfect lunch with hubby. We were seated quickly, had a friendly waiter and let me add a hot waiter. LOL---well, he was. He got my order perfectly though I had a bit of a special request.

Was greeted by a lovely hostess, and seated quickly.  Immediately the owner came over and introduced himself, and gave us the specials for the day, and also brought us some bread.  The waiter was super nice and very knowledgeable. I ordered the Sole and the honey ordered the Snapper.  I also ordered a small salad(to share with my daughter who was super hungry and couldn't wait) salad was average, but since my daughter decided to eat all the tomatoes, the owner brought her some of her own, so sweet:-)  My Sole was cooked perfect, good seasoning, risotto was a little heavy, and green beans were not overdone.  Dessert of in house mascarpone cheesecake was wonderful.  Not sure how Overall, great service, great food.  Would recommend to others.

Food was okay, but service was horrible! Our server, Carlos, was rude and inconsiderate. He would ask how we were doing, but then dash off before we would even have a chance to answer. It was obvious that he didn't care.
Service was good. Food was ok. I have a cup of clam chowder everywhere I go. This was the worst I've had. It was ok. Just bland and tasteless.
Looking for the City's most incompetent waiter? Well, the search is OVER because Carlos of Capurro's that award is all yours! You did it, congrats!!!
Seriously, how many San Franciscans (born, raised, or pay property taxes here currently) like coming to the wharf?  Yeah, none of us.

Food was delicious and fairly priced.   I had The Signature, crab legs dripping in garlic butter and a filet mignon.  Yummy, and perfect sized portion.  The kids meals were 9.95, big portions of fish and chips and my kids loved it.
Stay away from this place!!! Don't waste your money on this over priced, out of date, tired old wharf rip off.  Food is bad, owner is rude, pushy and overbearing
3.5 stars.
Came here for dinner. I had the crab and steak combo. The crab tasted fishy and not fresh. The steak was a disaster. The taste was awful. Tasted like old meat. Would not recommend!

Staff was welcoming to a group of 7. Our waiter answered questions about the menu and accommodated special requests. The specials were mixes of wonderful tastes: halibut and shrimp risotto, sea bass and gnocci.

I give this place 4  because of what I had was fairly good and the service was good.  We ordered Calamari and clam chowder. The chowder came with Caesar salad which I thought was excellent.  The food came out hot and steaming within 10 mins of ordering. Granted it was fairly easy to prepared but nonetheless good service. The Calamari was wow to me...very different flavor than what I had before and I have tasted many. We killed it to say the least. Price was fairly decent being on a high tourists area. There's out door tables which was perfect for people watching while munching :-)...very entertaining I might add ;-)...try it if you're at the Piers and not sure what to pick.

Average place to have dinner around Fisherman's Wharf. We tried the clam chowder, fried calamari, and the surf and turf. The clam chowder was creamy and flavorful. The fried calamari could have been better. It seemed a little too oily for me... Or maybe it wasn't allowed to sit and let some of the frying oil drip off. The surf and turf was also average. I felt that the waitstaff was attentive, available, and pleasant. Overall, a good experience for my first time visiting Fisherman's Wharf.

First, giving Capurros' a three star only on rating for the two pizzas ordered and nothing else. Service and ambience deserve 4.5 stars otherwise.  On 6/4, Wednesday, late afternoon about 6 p.m., my friend and I decided to try Capurro's for it's pizzas.  I will confess that I have never been a fan of cracker thin pizzas, regardless if that is current trend  Trends are not equal to quality and taste. I prefer to also savor a yeast rising, hi quality blend of flours for authentic traditional Italian based mouth feel, texture and taste.  Nonetheless, I ventured to try a thin crust pizza which is the only way Capurro makes them.

Totally 3.5 stars, but I'll round up. It's touristy and overpriced. But it's fun at the same time AND the crab is really good, and I liked the tangy zingy caesar salad, and the waiter was charming, and the clincher for the 4-star rating was the little mason jar of butterscotch pot de creme - WOWZA on that. So, it's fun.

I purchased a Groupon for the crab dinner for 2.  It was a great deal.  We were seated at a nice booth, facing the Jefferson.  We enjoyed watching the people walking by.  The restaurant was full of light.  We arrived around 6:00, can't stand dark restaurants.  After everyone in my group arrived, we did have to look around for our server, but that was the only time. Our server was friendly and nice and made recommendations on which type of crab to order.  Although he was not super attentive, he was attentive enough for us.  The water glasses were always topped off and the french bread was never ending.  The clam chowder was unbelievable and I am not a fan of clam chowder.  The roasted crab was delicious!  The fish and chips were too big for the plate! The batter was light and oh so good!  The fried calamari was tasty as well.  The have their own cocktail sauce, which everyone who likes cocktail sauce should try.   My son had the lobster ravioli and devoured it, so I guess it was very good.  Since we only had two desserts with our Groupon, our server brought two extra for our sons.  All in all a great night out with the family and I will come back without a Groupon.
Would give zero stars if I could. Terrible food, terrible service. Went in for drinks and oysters and the oysters tasted like sewage. We ate 2 of the 6 and our waiter could have cared less.
Alright, all I can say is my wife told me, "this is the best sandwich I've ever had."  Questions?
I was able to use a groupon to experience this restaurant. Really good food and attentive staff. I recommend their woodstove crab with garlic white wine. It was delicious!
came in with a groupon and totally worth

I love their outdoor seating. Their dining area was also great, I love their utensils. From that elegant glass to their spoons and fork. Then I asked my self, how is this place was in the Food Stands category? They're more like a restaurant to me in any aspects.
