After being dropped off in Little Italy we had no idea were to eat get food. So we asked a local who recommended this place. I had the meat lasagna and that was the best lasagna I had ever had in my entire life no exaggeration. My friend got the Fettuccine Bolognese which I tried and it was soooo good. Expect high prices which was totally worth it however they are decent size portions. Marco was an awesome waiter. We sat outside which had a beautiful view of the park and Cathedral. Must try these dishes if this is what you crave.
Ok food and the most expensive coffee and tea we've encountered on our trip in the US. We should have checked the reviews on Yelp first and gone somewhere else.
Surprised to see the other reviews - best espresso I had in SFO...serious.  I guess I got lucky with the guy making it.

Luke warm drinks and weak tasting coffee.   We pointed out the problem to the person at the espresso bar and he told us how the foam for the lattes came from a pitcher in the fridge (huh?). Looks neat but I won't give it a second chance given all the other options in the surrounding area.

Several of the Italian restaurants near us on a Sunday afternoon San Francisco stroll were closed and this was the only one in walking distance that seemed open...plus we were all starving. I was pleasantly surprised though as the food was delicious:
food was ok , probably tasted better because we where starving after waititng 45 min for our food!! they didnt even apologize . dodge this place

Good location and big signage so it is easy to see why unsuspecting tourist would wonder into this establishment. I thought the food was just OK. The portions were quite small like tapas considering the full size plate prices. Wait staff was a little weird - friendly but jaded. I suggest to try a less cutezee cafe down the road because there are lots in this area.
We has 2 appetizers, caprese and Funghi portobello. Absolutely fantastic with Pagui Sangiovese.  To die for!  The bread service with amazing olive oil was divine. Famtastico!
Ok, double cappuccino ($3.00) on a sunny afternoon as a few tables outside ...dry pastery for (3.00).  Which was probably ok in early morn.  Many other places abound in SF.

This place is the best AYCE I've ever been to. They don't use too much rice on the nigiri, the fish melts in your mouth, and the service is super friendly! I recommend the HAMACHI, maguro, and sake nigiris. This place sparked a love for nigiri that may burn in my body for a long, long time. I have been here three times in the past couple months and I will be back very soon!

I love this place and have probably eaten here over 30 times in the past 2 years. It's not the best sushi in the SF but it's pretty good and the price is not crazy like other places. The all you can eat menu is my jam. 5 stars!

Meh.  Sushi Hunter would be in the bottom quartile of San Francisco sushi restaurants, more akin to something you would see in Kansas City (both the vibe and the food).  The all-you-can-eat menu is full of the typical cheapies, all done with a maximum of rice and a minimum of fish.  And the fish you do get tastes a bit like the boxed arrangements at Whole Foods--not terrible, but not particularly flavorful.  Once you have ordered, expect to wait a while to get your food, even if the chefs do not appear to be particularly busy.  The wait staff at times is not particularly attentive, sometimes requiring a lot of hand-waving to pay attention to you.  Everything screams "bargain," from the mediocre wines to the kitschy interior.  If you are looking for great sushi in North Beach, try Katsu on Columbus (a short walk north of Sushi Hunter).

I love this place I've been coming here for years and the food is amazing. Great sushi, great environment, and great people. The only difficulty is parking but what do you expect this is San Francisco.
I ordered the hamachi nigiri and it was so chewy I had to spit it out. :(
They did the calculation of tips for you , which is 26% ,and kinda half force u to pay it .

Casual all you can eat sushi ($25) and unlimited hot sake ($11). All rolls and appetizers are made to order And fresh. They aren't the most extravagant rolls but are flavorful . The staff was helpful and accommodated us even though we came near closing time. I think this would be an awesome group spot. I will certainly be returning .

Great buy for all you can eat sushi in San Francisco! For less than $30/person, you can get all you can eat sushi and appetizers.When I arrived at Sushi Hunter, I was wary at first because the restaurant was almost empty, but I guess I just arrived early because within an hour it was completely full with a line of people waiting. The sake and beer wasn't as extensive as my friends, who also came to drink, not just eat, would have liked, but they decided on a cold sake that the waitress recommended and they loved it.

Saddened by the 2-hour wait for AYCE Korean BBQ in Japantown, my friend and I ventured here for consolation. Of course it was packed on a Saturday night - the servers were definitely stressed out from accommodating customers' requests. Since they were preoccupied with serving tables with 50+ piece sushi plates, it took us 10+ minutes to get seated (despite there being 2 tables readily available). We could have just seated ourselves, gotten our own menus, and saved everyone the trouble...

Some what disappointed. I don't mind paying $55 for sushi and sake but make it quality sushi and/ or sake. The sake was light in alcohol and the sushi was 90% rice and low quality fish. For what I paid, there are at least 10 better restaurants in the area let alone in SF

Not the best and not quite the worst either. If average was a spectrum they would be somewhere in the lower middle. However, two of the items we ordered were unavailable and they informed us of one after other items have already come out and theother unavailable item was informed at the end of our meal. Bottom, theres a ton of other choices in north beach, dont bother with this place!

I normally don't write good or bad review unless it's really good or really bad! This place is the worst sushi place I never been to! $28 for a BS sushi buffet, and only couple choices of fish, ok fine, so I was expecting for some good fish, but WTF, the fish tasted like shxt, I can't even put it close to my mouth, those weird smell, OMFG! If I can give negative star from -1 to -10, I will give it -10 no doubt!
Best Sushi spot in North Beach. Nice fun atmosphere with all you can eat options, good for groups. Try the Hunter Salad.
for 25 bucks all you can eat sushi, pretty good quality. Great service too.
I had Katsu Curry chicken on Aug. 29, 2014. I have been a curry freak since living in Japan in the 70's. I can and do make better tasting curry.

Sushi Hunter is one of the few AYCE Sushi joints I've found (I'm not counting those horrid buffet places where patrons gobble up all the good stuff as soon as it's put out, and their kids manhandle everything else- like Kome).  The AYCE menu is, not surprisingly, somewhat limited-  more so than their regular menu.   For example,  there's no salmon roe nigiri,  but there's enough other classics, and if the pieces seem  small, you can always place another order.    There's a larger list of rolls, but by swapping out avocado for cucumber or tuna for salmon you can see how combinatorics leads to a huge list with very few base ingredients.   They also provide a wide selection of other items (tempuras, salads, gyoza, etc), so you shouldn't run out of things to try.

Just went in to buy a beer so I could use the restroom.  The waitress was so rude to us that we started calling the place c@nter sushi.  Avoid this place and go spend your money someplace run by nice people.
So i must admit that it's not the best sushi, however they have my card on file and know my order every time I call so they must be doing something right since I keep coming back for more.

Went for the first time tonight and had a great dinner! All of the servers were incredibly nice and helpful, never making us feel rushed even though we took forever to decide what to get from the AYCE menu at first! The food felt like it was consistently made with care, and everything was served hot and fresh (well, at least the warm items!). I really enjoyed the sushi - I've been to other AYCE sushi places where they attempt to disguise lower quality fish, etc. by dousing rolls in strong sauces - thankfully, that's not the case here. I also really appreciate the variety of non-sushi appetizers on the menu, because as much as I enjoy sushi, I love being able to choose from a range of other Japanese treats. I had a really lovely evening here, and will definitely be back!

I'm rating this based off the All-You-Can-Eat option. There are definetly better sushi restaurants in SF but I don't know anywhere else in the city or near SF for made per order all you can eat sushi. I think fish quality is fresh and good. Have been 4-5 separate times and never had issues with quality of ingredients. Like ordering the seaweed salad, miso, gyoza, and then the nigiri and rolls. Hamachi nigiri great as well as tunas. Wait staff very friendly. Good value, good food, nice location, and best about eating all you can eat at sushi is you're not going home feeling sick or going into a food coma but you still fore sure get your dollar's worth. Highly recommended! Also, they do bottomless house hot sake for a good deal if you feel like getting a cheap buzz!

My roommate and I both got the all-you-can-eat sushi from here. It was probably the biggest mistake of my life. First, we both got sick. Additionally, their all-you-can-eat sushi menu is horrible. They claim there are 31 options but it is really just made up of 4 or five options that are slightly modified. STEER CLEAR OF THIS PLACE. it also did not taste good at all.

Great place for all you can eat sushi and sake.  I usually sit at the bar.  Despite the sometimes loud large drunken groups there the acoustics are such that the space itself doesn't get unbearably loud.  The service is great.

The nigiri was just OK. I think I was disappointed because I assumed being so close to the Marina the raw fish would have been better. It was not as cold as I would've liked it to be and that kind of threw off my opinion from the start. However, for 25$ all you can eat I definitely got my money's worth.

surprised to find myself giving 3 stars for all you can eat sushi, which concept I dislike, but for $25, it wasn't bad granted I ate mostly non sushi items such as the spinach, broiled mackerel, tempura, gyoza, etc.

BEWARE: "All you can eat" is not available when they are busy. We made a reservation to get our fill of sushi but was told it's not available to us even though EVERY other table had it available to them. Apparently it's up to their discretion even though it's clearly advertised outside. And they don't inform you until you place your order.
One of my favorite sushi places to get take out from. The wait time is always reasonable and they're open late! Rolls are good and they have BUTTERFISH:)

Our default pick for sushi takeout. The rolls are all pretty decent and delivery time is reasonable. I'd say a bit on the expensive side, in terms of the value you get for your money. Being in a high-traffic tourist area, I can see why that's the case. Still, definitely better than any sushi places in China Town.

I've eaten here several times.  The sushi is good, the staff is friendly, the prices are reasonable, and I love the atmosphere.  My boyfriend and I usually go for the sushi platter for two.  It's a good amount of food and good variety of sushi for two people.

This place is great! There aren't that many AYCE sushi places in the city and sushi hunter has a great selection for the price. The service was great, our waitress always came by to see of we wanted to order more.  Not only do they have rolls and sashimi, but you can also order things like tempura, miso soup, teriyaki, and all sorts of little dishes! My favorite was the sake nigiri. I could probably eat 50 of those in a sitting.
Very good food. Price is pretty decide for SF. Everyone there is very nice and friendly. Can't really beat all you can eat sushi, and it's fresh!!
There are a lot of wonderful sushi restaurants in SF.. this one was ok.
Chose the All you can eat Sushi. It' was just ok for me. Clams had sand in them. Spider Roll - Barely any crab. Just the legs... Nigri style fish was ok fresh. Weekday nights not as busy as weekends

I always have a good time at AYCE sushi places because, hey, lump sum + sushi forever = good times in my tummy. But I'll preface this by saying I've been completely and utterly spoiled by Toronto and its mecca of AYCE sushi places that defies logic, both in terms of price (soooo cheap), quality (soooo good) and quantity (this menu is how many pages long and they're ALL included in the deal?)

Regular customer - Always satisfied with the AYCE menu. Rolls are carefully made with good ingredients. Great non-sushi selection in the AYCE menu to complement the meal. Knocked 1 star off because service can be a little slow sometimes - but not to the point where it is a major inconvenience the experience.

Had not been here in about 10 years, but in the last 6 weeks have been back 3 times!  They have an awesome all you can eat menu with over 60 items with choices from Tempura to Sushi, for $25 it is an awesome deal.  Their Gyoza is really good. They bring it to the table which is nice but service can be slow on the down side.  All in all if you are in North Beach and want Sushi this is the place to go!

It's been a while since I been here. Maybe 5 years or so. I was coming maybe twice a month. My how the quality has gone down. Let's start with the green tea. Which was neither green nor tea. More like luke warm water. Then the sushi rice. With any sushi, the quality of the fish is important, but without the base. Without the sushi rice, nothing matters. The rice was more or less just white rice. Somewhat sticky but that was it. Terrible. I couldn't even finish my Chirashi. Only ate the fish and that was it. Maybe they're cutting corners due to their $25 all you can eat. But that's not what I ordered. If you can't get your sushi rice correctly, they you have no business running a sushi bar. I will never come back here again. Sorry guys.
I should have gotten the all you can eat when I came here.
I recently moved to SF and was excited to try sushi here, as everyone told me it was very good in the Bay.  Well, after about three duds, I found this awesome restaurant!
Have only come here for the all-you-can-eat @ $28.00 per person.

Very slow service. We definitely needed time with such a large menu but was way more time then needed and they could have at least taken our drink order. Sushi was ok but with all the other choices in the city I'm

Can't say I'm a fan. Coffee is very overpriced, the almonds macadamia nut latte tastes like almond milk without coffee, WiFi is turned off on weekends and there's a faint but persistent smell of trash and sewage and small flies flying around.

So I sadly impart to you the news that this former coffee snob has quit the brew. I'm done. Finito. Kumaliza, as my Swahili-speaking friends might say. I don't need that caffeine kick anymore. I'm outsies.
Coffee here tastes nuts! Literally.

I wish there was a Saint Franks shop in the Los Gatos area (where I live)! I was exploring San Francisco with a friend this past week and we had to start our adventure with some coffee obviously. We browsed a few and found out that St.Franks is something like #3 in the nation!-we definitely had to go. Finding parking was a cinch, even though it's SF. Walking into Franks we were hit by the cool laid back hipster kind of feel that a lot of new coffee shops are taking on-we were definitely diggin it. I browsed the menu, even though I already knew what I wanted, and ordered my usual drink-a latte, in house. One thing to note, however is that I was really interested in their tea selection and will definitely be going back for some tea next time I'm in SF. There was really not a long wait since it was a Monday around noon, but the seats were all taken and once we received our drinks (Latte for me and a Cappuccino for my friend, which btw were made very quickly) we grabbed a few stools and sat with someone else at a table.
This is a perfect third wave cafe. Great ambiance, quality coffee. Best cafe this side of Market st.
High ceilings + wood walls + wood seatings + down to earth baristas = KUDOS

This is a popular coffee shop, when I went there was a line but it wasn't too slow. I got a pour over iced coffee (never had a pour over coffee before) and it was great, really easy drinking and refreshing.

The Almond Macadamia Cappacino is delicious! You taste so much almond and macadamia, it's awesome. The honey lavender is good too! The almond macadamia definitely is better in my opinion though. The decor of the place is so nice. It's super open, bright, and modern. The barista had a lot of technique making my cappacino. Very impressed!
One of my favorite SF coffee shops. Continually impressed by the quality and flavorful cold and hot brews. Highly recommend.
I had almond macadamia cappuchino.It was deep,intense and smooth.Probably those who like more milk in coffee wont prefer it.service was quick and easy.Lots of space to be seated.

Great quality coffee, nice friendly neighborhood, great friendly staff. What more can you ask for? When you enter the shop you feel relaxed and comfortable knowing you're in good hands and will be expecting a good cup of coffee. With blends like almond macadamia latte or cap, or lavender honey iced latte you can't go wrong.
High standard carefully prepared coffee using a specially designed coffee machine. Good stuff
Nice decore coffee is good but its not exceptional. Minus one star because they have no WiFi on weekends.

Awesome coffee and a clean/bright atmosphere where you can't help but feel awake.  A great addition to Polk Street.  The only complaint about this place is that each time I've stopped in, the tables are always being hoarded by "squatters" with their computers.  Perhaps they should try to apply a "no squatters policy" or something like that, as it's kind of annoying for those coming in who want to sit down to enjoy a cup of coffee.  A few times we've been forced to take our cup of joe to go; when you're paying a premium for this kind of coffee, it'd be nice to have the option to have the option to enjoy it to stay if you so choose.

Polk Street gained a huge asset when this place opened!  There is no question that Saint Frank serves clean-tasting, crisp, smooth coffee.  The simplistic space is also wonderful: there is an abundance of natural light and plenty of room to spread out and do a little work.
Good solid coffee; I enjoyed my ice mocha today.  Nice clean-lined atmosphere, plenty of seating along the side and front to fit varying party sizes, quick, friendly service.

I came to San Francisco / Sacramento with a handwritten list of recommendations by Joshua Bonner of Ladies & Gentleman coffee roasters in San Diego himself (best coffee roaster in california IMO).  Josh has worked at Stanza & Blue Bottle coffee in SF simultaneously, so the man knows sf coffee.
Personally i think 3 stars are fair enough. Don't take me wrong, i like this place, but it's not my best favorite.

I used to be at a loss for great coffee around this neighborhood, but recently found this unexpectedly awesome spot, a short walk up the hill from Van Ness. Cappuccino was delicious, folks were friendly and super efficient. Also dig how clean & modern the whole place feels. Will be making this a regular spot for sure.
I went because I really wanted to try their almond milk latte but they were out of the milk so I got the tonic espresso. Not my thing, I wish I had been able to try it before dropping $5 or so.

I'll start by saying they make a good cup of coffee, but the attitude I received from the staff while placing my order was off putting. The positives are a good cup of coffee and a nice minimalist atmosphere. The only draw back was the hipsters attitude. I asked for a vanilla latte and I got a very pretentious "we only have hand crafted honey lavender syrup" . I won't be returning.

Shitty, free wifi, but big (2 long tables upstairs, fits 3-4 people comfortably, 5-6 singles and 3 long tables downstairs), playing indie pop (postal service, 2 door cinema club), young college crowd, and serves craft coffee (it doens't get any more craft than this-- homemade almond and macademia nut milk for their lattes).

Went there past summer, and it is still on my mind. Pour over heaven, and they have it to a science. Bright, clean, and roomy. Didn't go upstairs as I was short on time. Tried the Salvadoran coffee, and that's why I'm hooked to that place now. Hope they never discontinue those beans.
The current darling of San Francisco, I had to try this out to see if it lived up to the hype.

Simply the best coffee experience I've ever had. The quality of Four Barrel or Ritual (which makes sense, since Saint Frank partners with Ritual for importing and roasting) with none of the snootiness. And the aesthetic is jaw dropping. So clean! Worth every bit of the hike over to Russian Hill.

On my recent trip to California I was truly spoiled by all the fabulous SF coffee joints. Saint Frank's was no exception. I'd read in other reviews that the coffee shop is reminiscent of an Apple Store; clean lines, lots of white and super modern. Check, check, and check. This place was beautiful! There were also some wood accents and gorgeous espresso machines that are a first of their kind (I think! Don't quote me on this!) and are mostly built into the counter-top. Everything in here is stealth and hidden yet out in the open. It was tough to find the menu, it's located right by the cash register and on paper on a clipboard. I ordered a decaf coffee and opted for a little of their homemade almond milk. No sugar. This coffee was unreal. It was so bold and deeply flavored, layer upon layer of taste! Service was ok. I felt as if I was annoying the barista just by ordering a drink. I sat down with my coffee for a few minutes and really relaxed. Great atmosphere and great coffee.
Great space to hang out and read or work but the coffee wasn't the best.

I would give 5 stars for its interior. It is so bright and airy, filled with nature light from the skylights above and the tall windows up front. The wall is half covered diagonally by light wood planks. The coffee machines, display shelves, stainless preparation counter space, every detail is beautifully designed. Feels like a gallery space. Watching the barista preparing our coffee is like a show. However the coffee itself failed to impress. Btw I only drink black coffee, no drinks with milk/cream.

My new favorite coffee shop in the city. I first discovered it on a late Saturday morning after moving to the area a few weeks before. Looks like a great place to hang out, read, relax and/or get work done. Would definitely return for the coffee and the ambience!

Love the clean look of Saint Frank. It's like the apple store of coffee shops, hah! I'm obsessed with Califia almond milk. I had an almond latte, despite having 2+ kinds of almond milk from the brand in my own fridge right at home. Lattes are luxurious to me. Any cup with that much milk to coffee ratio is indulgent and this one was no different.  Good and smooth. I shared the granola and croissant with ham and ricotta. We got the last croissant and it was a Saturday morning. It was a few hours after opening time but the place had a steady line and I was so close to disappointment due to the popular (and limited) croissants - come early!

I only got an espresso so I can't speak for the eats, but my drink was excellent. The place was hopping on a Monday morning and the baristas were super friendly. Loved the vibe. I hung out for an hour using the free wifi. It wasn't too crazy, but I can imagine how it would be on a weekend.
Delicious! Great baristas, talented and friendly! Try the house made almond Macademia nut milk!
Checking out a new coffee shop on the other side of Russian hill.. A very nice open and very hip coffee shop.
Saint Frank has some of the best baristas in the city of San Francisco-- they care, they smile, they never rush you.
Nice addition to upper polk... it was packed with people but the staff were all very friendly and quick with everyone's orders.

Any business that names itself after Francis of Assisi instantly gets my attention. And the decor and vibe are great. But the house-made almond macadamia latte is hands-down the best almond milk latte in San Francisco. These people know what they're doing.
Yes, just another SF coffee review... but this is pretty damn good stuff. Really smooth coffee and happy it's a new gem to add to the rotation!
love this little neighborhood find, the partner and I enjoy walking over and sitting down for a bit to unwind and enjoy a good drip.
Great space and super friendly baristas! Coffee isn't the best you can get for 3.25 but they use organic milk and will make custom drinks with a smile. I live down the street and will return

Saint Frank is the type of place you'll go across town for. The coffee is so good, the line extending out the door won't bother you either. The annoying parking and/or traversing Everest to get here seems worth it too; because, in the end, you're guaranteed an amazing cup of coffee!

We stumbled upon this place because the restaurant on our planned itinerary was closed. What a gem! Freshly prepared, nothing short of spectacular- we had the carpaccio, cozzi vongole, polenta and funghi, and snapper focaccia. Wow! I highly recommend this place!

went in for a salad which was delicious. I substituted chicken instead of anchovies. The salad ended up costing double ( $20 for a Caesar salad is ridiculous). The server should have mentioned the dramatic price increase for a substitution.

The food was fantastic! We went there with a fairly large party, and was given great service from beginning to end. The hospitality was spot on, but even more importantly, the food was authentic and tasty. From one member of the party, "best ravioli - hands down!"
May have changed ownership because the service/food has been terrible. Stay away. Over two hours for delivery and food was cold

I used to frequent North Beach Pizza when I was in the neighborhood.  Now, I will be hard pressed to ever go back.  The service has been really bad recently. There are plenty of other places that seem happy to have my business.

We went to pier 39 tonight decided to get a bite there. We ended up at North Beach pizza. Well don't bother with this place. First off they moved all the way in the back 2nd floor. By the merry go round. The maps said it's in the front??

I'll have to be honest I thought this pizza was fantastic when I last went to San Francisco in September 2008 I honestly thought it was great pizza. Coming from San Diego all there really is to eat is expensive steak restaurant.

Disgusting place! Went here for dinner one night with my Fiancee & it was just downright nasty! Everything was watered down. The salad had water at the bottom of the bowl, the tortellini tasted like it was bought for Safeway & the Alfredo was from a can. The cheese garlic bread was bought & had cheese power sprinkled on it. My fiancee blamed me for picking this nasty place. Not worth the $30 we spent here. DON'T EVER GO HERE, IT'S NOT WORTH IT!!!!

I honestly feel it is a little pricey, but EVERYTHING is at the pier. Honestly, do not order-out, always eat in with this restaurant to make it worth the price. The service is generally great and they have good pizza (not the best, but good). The desserts are also delicious. Only thing I could complain about are some of the other customers.
These folks make really awful pizza.
Pizza by the numbers:
Oh man, I can't tell you how bummed I am. I feel betrayed, lost, and most of all, queasy.
Maybe God is telling us to stop eating at Pier 39. Again we found ourselves looking for grub in a tourist area. Nothing seemed "mm mm good," so I thought pizza was a safe bet.

I obviously have no taste because I've never seen so many 1 star reviews before in my life. Oh well, I thought the vegetarian pizza was excellent. It was fresh and delicious...not soggy or greasy at all. We didn't go for the buffet so maybe that's why the pizza tasted so darn fresh...Very delicious fresh vegetable soup as well (with fresh cut big chunks of veggies...nothing from a can or sitting around rotting for hours ...impressive!) . Salad not so hot. Just average. Dog friendly, people friendly. Loved it here. I could've eaten a whole pie here by myself...that's how much I loved it.  I guess being from nyc I just don't know good pizza..ha ha...

Terrible and gross. I am pretty bummed that tourists unloading off cruise ships are funneled into this place on Pier 39 stating that it is "The Best Pizza in San Francisco". I know, I know, traveler beware and all that. If they won't make the effort to seek out quality joints then it's on them. But even they don't deserve to eat at this place, that's a little too much punishment for being lazy and scared. I have been served rotten food and have given up getting more slices after waiting 20 minutes in between the restocking of the "all you can eat" pizza lunch buffet. I have been here more than a couple of times because I work in the area and people in groups somehow end up here. Rotten old food, terrible service and a strange rip off all you can eat buffet. They lucked out that I got too busy at work to file a complaint with the Health Department.

North Beach Pizza was our fallback. My girlfriend wasn't feeling 100% and didn't feel like our scheduled seafood dinner before our Alcatraz tour. North Beach Pizza had been recommended to us by a friend of a friend down in Santa Maria when we were there earlier in the week.

The only decent thing about this place was our "waiter" who was friendly and talkative. The claim that it's "San Francisco's Best Pizza!" is a blatant lie and honestly the most appalling thing I have ever heard. As everything else on Pier 39 is excessively overpriced and we could only go somewhere to validate our parking we went here. Initially we thought it wasn't absolutely the worst thing ever, but it was. The "cheesy" pasta was so dry it hurt to swallow. The sauces were way watered down and were worse then the cheapest pasta sauce you could buy in a jar. The pizza was okay but extremely greasy and made you feel as though you were about to die. The salad bar was mediocre but I was really concerned at how long the stuff had been left out for. Also, the salad lettuce container had inches of water in it! They don't even dry the lettuce! The dressing was weird and not the best. The whole restaurant was dirty and the bathrooms were kind of gross. I could not understand why the women's restroom had two toilets in it but no door to separate them. Are you supposed to pee next to someone else sop you can watch them the whole time?!?!? CREEPY! I felt like I would die after this meal and would never come back here. I would rather pay $30 for a plain Cesar salad from an overpriced eatery.

We went here as a second choice for lunch and I was less than pleased with my experience. First, it took forever for our waitress to come over and she didn't seem very happy we were there. We had the buffet which was just OK, personally I thought all of the pizzas had the same flavor. We only saw our waitress twice at our visit, to take our order and bring our check, the rest of the time she was yelling at the bus boy in front of customers. C'mon now... The bus boy spent more time with us taking our plates and getting us a refill, I hope he got our tip and not her.

They have a buffet which is a great idea so you can have pizza, pasta, salad, bread sticks etc. Unfortunately everything was cold, looked like it had been sitting out for a long time, etc. It was quite disappointing b/c I really like the other NB Pizza in NB.
When you get in.
Well the service was excellent, my server was very energetic and quick to help us. The prices were very nice too.

Well, I've learned one thing from this dining experience. Never go out to eat on vacation without checking yelp first. North Beach Pizza is a decent looking restaurant on the outside, 70's pizzaria feel on the inside. We were at Pier 39 and wanted to get some good food for our last night in SF. I was prepared to just eat at Bubba Gump, which is right next door, but then we saw a sign for a pizza/pasta buffet. I was starting to get hungry, and a buffet sounded far more appealing to my friend and I. Wrong, wrong, wrong decision. Let's just cut this into sections, shall we?

So my friends and I decided to take some people from Denver out on the town. We planned to go to Bubba Gump's but ofcourse it had a long wait..then someone saw North Beach Pizza. The price for unlimited buffet was $12.99. I thought "Ok that price is good for me"

This location used to be really good back in the day.  Great view of the bay and validated parking, what more could you ask for right?  THIS WAS HANDS DOWN THE WORST PIZZA I'VE HAD IN A VERY LONG TIME.  My school cafeteria serves a better Freschetta pizza.  First off the dough seemed way undercooked.  I like it when my pizza can support the toppings and the only time that a weak support system is acceptable when there is wayyy too much stuff on top of it.  Service was HORRIBLE to say the least.  We ordered the combo pizza (whatever it was called there) and the garlic twists.  The garlic twists came out and they were burnt beyond belief.  I can't believe that they had to nerve to even try to serve that.  After I sent them back I noticed one of the waiters come out and stand there eating them.  I really don't care but I don't want to see you standing around eating not doing shit when it's obvious that waters need to be filled etc.  Afterwards the horrible pizza came out and it wasn't until we were almost done when the garlic twists came out AGAIN.  I had canceled the order just prior to them arriving at the table because seriously, we were done with dinner already and you just now bring out the appetizer???
Pizza here is to real pizza as pier 39 is to San Francisco -- It's an expensive greasy mess and the bathrooms are dirty.

We were visiting San Francisco and stayed @ Fisherman's Wharf and the concierge at our hotel recommend this place. We were shocked at how pricey it was. The Cesar salad was the best part, and it was pretty run of the mill. The pizza was ok. Nothing special, especially considering the price.
Came by with the wife & grand kid for a quick meal. The place was packed on Valentine's Day. We did the buffet and kids under 4 eat free!

If i could rate this restaurant anything lower than one star I would. I went there today with a friend for lunch and each ordered a dish off the pasta menu and some soup. The soup was awful and it looked and tasted like it came out of a can. The pasta was the worst though, we each tasted out dish and couldn't eat more than two bites. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone so save yourself the trouble and just find something else.

If you like greasy pizza (and I do, though it's not the only kind I like), then this is the place for you. My friend and I split a large pepperoni and sausage pizza; the pizza had a nice crust, but it was quickly marred by the greases from both meats soaking through to the pan. While I didn't mind this, others who prefer a crisper crust may be turned off by this.
NB Pizza... we woulda gone to NB, but it was too far to walk and we didn't know if we'd make it without biuying another bus pass.  Yes, we're poor.

Two stars for being there when your hungry and all else might be to pricy when you want to buy other stuff in the city. Their pizza wasnt bad nice tasting crust. Their pasta sucked and they had a typical salad bar but nothing special. Everytime we went it was very packed. They are on their toes. You can watch the owner/manager yelling at ALL the staff, everytime I went he was yelling. They are brazilian i think. They do have a really great view of the bay and boats etc. If you get a table near the window....OOH its nice. But if your not at the wharf for seafood come here if your starving...  to a pizza buffet around 12.00 per person.

So one night on the wharf my boyfriend and I decide to get a bite to eat. I have had NBP before, so I felt it was a safe choice.....WRONG! First off, they have the absoluted unprofessional service and the hostess was rude. I know it isn't a 5 star place...but seriously, how hard is it to be courteous and polite? Another, their "buffet" was cold, un-inviting, and the pizza was nothing like the signature NBP I have come to know and (previously) loved.
Synopsis:

i totally agree with anthony y. i will only eat it if its there/free and just cuz it has melted cheese on it. on par with fat slice and other cardboard esque establishments. go to little star, patxis, or zacharys and see what pizza tastes like.
ok here's the situation my parents went away on a weeks vacation and they left the keys to the brand new porsche would they mind hmmmm well of course not...

Pricey for a pizza buffet but overall it was good. The salad bar is mediocre at best ranch was really thick and weird. Their marinara sauce was kind of runny. But the pizza was pretty good I'm a pizza fanatic and i thought this was ok. I had a hawaiian slice & pepperoni w/ sausage slice of pizza they were both good. Not alot of sauce which i enjoy but my boyfriend hates he LOVES sauce haha. So overall this place is good but definitely not worth the price. Make sure to grab the $3 off coupon
Took a little trip to SF and of course, they all wanted to go to Pier 39.  Personally, I've DONE Pier 39, so I'm kind of over it... BUT I have NOT done North Beach Pizza.
This place is not what I expected. I bought a groupon for my birthday. The only thing good about this place was the fried calamari. Not the italian that I am used to. Not very happy.
I am a North Beach local and the best Italian restaurant I frequent is Volare.

The food was yummy, excellent service. We will sure come back again. The calamari was the best tasting I have ever had. Very fresh and delicate. The veal and scampi were tasty. We had tiramisu and panna cotta for desert and they were fresh and delicious.
Love their food, carpaccio is excellent, ambience is nice, price is good, we spent $90.00 for 2 meals, a glass of wine, appetizer but overall this restaurant is good.

This is one of my most favorite restaurants, ever. I wish it were closer and more convenient. Every time I go up to the City, I stop here. It is the most authentic Italian food, I've ever had. The gnocchi with the bolognese sauce is my favorite. But I've also had the lasagna, which was yummy. The regular gnocchi, and I've tried a few other pasta dishes. You honestly can't go wrong here, I love it and I love the staff!

Went here with a groupon which got us an appetizer, pasta and dessert. Everything that we ordered was mediocre at best -- I am not really sure they made their own "handmade pastas" since they didn't taste fresh. The real reason I am taking the time to write this review is to say DO NOT ORDER THE CANNOLI. It was literally the most disgusting dessert we've ever had. Either the filling was supposed to have a tinge of acid (lemon), or it was so old that the cream filling had spoiled --- it tasted like the latter and please do not order it if you want to end your meal without having to go to the local gelateria near by to cleanse your palette. There are admittedly a number of Italian options in this area but none have been great in our experience, thus far. This place is like the rest -- overpriced and underwhelming.

Delicious food! The appetizers are a bit small, nothing to write home about, but the main dishes are amazing! Definitely go with the cioppino. The service is also wonderful and the place has a very mellow family vibe. All in all a good experience.

Casual atmosphere. Menu is seafood and fresh pasta centric. The sweet chewy bread served up front w oil & vinegar was great enough to make a meal! Enjoyed the fresh spinach salad, nicely dressed. The Cioppino was beautifully presented in a glass bowl. Nicely spicy tomato broth. The whole dish was slightly overlooked but on balance nicely done.  A very dry house Chianti topped it off- Nice!

I have to admit, I'm surprised to read the less than appealing responses; my friend and I had such a wonderfully memorable dinner here last night.  As others have mentioned, we were greeted with the bruschetta at the door when deciding whether or not their menu fit our taste.  The bruschetta was delicious, so in we went.  We split a bottle of the house red which (not being an avid wine drinker) exceeded our expectations of a typical house red; had more depth to it.  We were provided a basket of warm fluffy bread with olive oil and balsamic for dipping as well as herbed olives.  I typically don't eat olives but managed to put away half of what was provided.  We ordered the bruschetta (wanted more of the deliciousness we'd just had), and decided to share the homemade pasta in pink sauce with salmon and the seared salmon entree (both of us love salmon, can you tell?). The salmon entree came with rosemary potatoes and an eggplant ratatouille type side.  The salmon was cooked perfectly and had this delicious sear to it that my friend declared was the best salmon she's had.  The pink sauce pasta and salmon was also delicious with generous portions of fresh, well-cooked salmon. The sauce was rich and had a lovely flavor profile of delicate tomatoes and cream.  Sounds like an odd mixture, but it is delicious!

I was a little worried to visit Volare Trattoria when I read some of the reviews. I had purchased a Groupon awhile ago to the restaurant, but it had expired. My family and I went to Volare trattoria to just use the face value of the groupon.

Used a groupon to eat here once. Ordered 2 sets of cioppino. Salad was okay. The cioppino was good. Also had wine. Overall food is not bad. That's why I gave it 2 star instead. Seems like if you aren't their type of customers they don't treat you good. Out service was not good at all. Nobody wanted to seat us for 5 minutes. Asked for water twice. No recommendations. Very ride when we mentioned the groupon.

My wife and I had dinner here on a Sunday some time last month. From my observation (tables around us), most people came here because they've bought the deal on Groupon (so did I). The server had forgotten to bring us bread and we had to ask for it. The bread was hard and stale. The fried calamari appetizer was under seasoned. I ordered cioppino. There were a couple small pieces of salmon in my soup and the scallops were smaller than the size of a dime. Wife ordered the grilled salmon and it was served with some cold eggplant - didn't like it. As for dessert, we ordered the tri-color ice cream/ spumoni. It was more like a two scoops of ice cream cos all we could only taste the strawberry and chocolate flavors. It was definitely not a spumoni and did not come in vanilla, gianduia and mango-sorbet flavors as stated on the online menu on Yelp.

The groupon for this place is an obvious scam. When you buy it they say your salads will be of a value up to $16. Um.. the salads we got were simple greens. The Cioppino online is listed as 23ish dollars on most menus I could find, but in the restaurant they list it as 29. The wine is cheap. So, for the $40 groupon plus tax and tip - which they reccomend you pay at an estimated value of over $90 worth (LOL!), you definitely do not get your money's worth let alone a good deal. This is my definition of a scam. My partner didn't have a claw in his cioppino but I did.... not that it mattered. It was like picking out crab claw from soup... with your hands. Hella messy. I was not given a cracking device for the crab legs until I asked someone walking by because the waiter was not very attentive. The ambience is pretty tacky too. I just want to be like yo!, step it up a notch people! This is not the first time I have purchased a groupon for food and been totally let down. Seems to me this restaurant is desperate.
Got seated quickly and food arrived quickly. Food was very average; there are much better Italian spots in North Beach. And our server was actually one of the rudest servers I've ever had.

Consistently deliver quality food and service.   Pizza, pasta, salads, wine . Desserts and coffee too, as you would expect. All fresh. All good. There are more trendy and hip places along Columbus, but don't be fooled.  Volare's  is old school and a little well worn, but the quality and service and price point makes this a top choice for Italian in North beach .

after ordering the waiter lost all interest in us. it took 10 minutes and a reminder to get the wine and water (and some bread). after being in the us for almost 2 weeks, being served without the overwhelming friendliness of american waiters, it was as if we were back in germany, in the service-desert as we call it half jokingly.

It was easy to make reservations a few days in advanced for 5:30pm, unfortunately we were all late. We called and they were accommodating. The downside was they wouldn't seat us until we were all over, but that's okay.

Don't write reviews very often, but felt I had to do this one.  Below average food, below average service, below average wines by the glass, highly overpriced.  I think we got "touristed".  Would never go back there again - stay away.  Should have realized it wasn't very good when it was the only place on Columbus in North Beach that had any seating at 7:30 on Sat. nite.  Live and learn.
Went for dinner last night with a reservation using a Groupon.
came here with a groupon and would come only with a groupon.

So went in the other day it was kinda slow I had a groupon  and decided to check it out.   Food was ok but when I got my bill the waiter added gratuity of 5.31$ umm where did that come from. So I didn't say anything since I would have given more but it was late. I definitely won't be going back and I kinda think that is illegal. I was a party of one and gratuity is something you earn not just expect.
Just finished the most wonderful meal at my new most-favorite restaurant! There were eight of us - and we had the groupon deal for six: amazing value - so we got to try a lot of things.
NOTE: We went here about a month ago.

What lured us into Volate Trattoria was the kind gentleman standing in front one sunny afternoon who observed us looking at their menu that was posted on the door. He kindly interjected and told us what their specials were that day. We listened and pondered if we wanted Italian or not... I asked the gentleman if they had caprese salads there, and he confirmed with a smile. I opened the door for my boyfriend and we took a seat.

The food was really delicious.  The lasagna is really outstanding.  The pasta in the lasagna was perfect and the sauce could not have been better.  Then it goes down hill.  There was no bar back.  No bourbon or any kind.  No Bombay Gin. Empty bottles decorated the shelves.  The waiters and bar tender argued constantly.  We were sitting at the bar.  Very, very unpleasant.  We will not be back. Other places offer delicious food and help you enjoy you evening.

So lovely! We used the groupon and got GREAT service, really light n tasty calamari, eggplant Parmesan and the cute little cannolis. Everything was real satisfying, including the complimentary olives. Oh jah, mama likey.
We went here tonight with a groupon coupon. The service was excellent. They knew we had the coupon too. The food excellent. We had the veal saltamboca, chic Marsala, lemony chic dish and gnocchi.

This is an excellent place to stop if you are in the North Beach area.  The Brushetta is loaded with fresh ingredients.  The pasta dishes were all cooked to perfection.  The service was attentive and the establishment is one of the more Groupon friendly with the exception of limiting dessert choices for Groupn users ( ie no cheesecake offered)

Never been here before but came because of Groupon. Hey, it worked, we'll go back. They never blinked an eye about using it and the waiter, Nico, was the best!!! He made suggestions for the meal and wine which were spot on. The food was great, the service was fantastic, and the atmosphere was pleasant.

We went there on a nice day for some drinks and apps. While the service was actually pretty decent, we were very disappointed with what we ordered, and the drinks were over priced. The prosciutto e melone was not very appetizing. The melon was very cold, not ripe, and crunchy. The bed of arugula that was advertised on the menu was just lettuce. It goes against everything Italian that I know. If it's not in season and delicious, then don't serve it!

Good and bad. The food was incredibly tasty. The owner warmly welcomed us in as we looked at the menu outside. Our server Rai is who failed. He messed up my daughter's order (he didn't write anything down). He offered two of us parmesan and only one of us cracked pepper. We asked for more bread which he didn't bring. I asked for more parm for my daughter and he sat it on the table and put his hands in the air. He came up when we were done eating and said, "So you're ready for the check"? We would have gladly had dessert and coffee had it been offered. He brought the check and within 2 min came back to process it. We hadn't even had a chance to get our wallets out! We only left a little over 10% which is rare for me since I've been a fine dining server for over 10 years. Weirdest  dining experience I've ever had. We really felt like Rai was annoyed with us from the time we sat down. I'm giving 3 stars because the owner was so kind and the food was INCREDIBLE! Service unfortunately failed big time.
I went here for dinner, it was pretty empty at 6:30pm on a Friday. We were immediately seated and the waiter was very friendly.

I came here over the weekend with the boyfriend because we wanted cioppino and found the Groupon deal.  The $35 deal gets you two salads, two cioppinos, and two glasses of wine.  I regret passing up on this option because we ended up getting the $29 deal instead (an appetizer, two entrees, and one dessert).

I was a little apprehensive after seeing the mixed reviews about this place, but overall it was a great experience. I went with a friend and even though we were 45 minutes late to our reservation, they were very generous about it. In addition, they reserved an earlier time for us so that we wouldn't have to wait as long.
Great gnocchi, the fettuccine was freshly made but the Alfredo sauce was a little more on the dry side. Overall really great taste & casual environment.
First lets talk about how we epically failed on forgetting to order any pasta at this place!

I went on a Groupon that included 1 appetizer, 2 entrees and 1 dessert. I was very skeptical of this place based on the negative reviews. However, I was pleasantly surprised. When I called to place my reservation, they were very friendly. The waiter greeted us at the door and gave us an excellent seat by the window. He said we could order anything from the menu, even though the Groupon has limitations.
The food was excellent. We had the bissteca (which is Italian steak). My son loved his Alfredo pasta.
No.

Our waiter was friendly and accommodating which made the birthday celebration most enjoyable. We loved the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce and ravioli. The gnocchi melts in your mouth!! The eggplant appetizer anti-climatic and resembled cat food. The chocolate cake was to die for!! The restaurant has a strange old smell that can be distracting. I'm glad we used their groupon deal, would not have tried it otherwise.

Not recommended for delivery.  I ordered via GrubHub, and the estimate was 50-60 minutes.  My food arrived 2 hours later, and when I called after 60 and 90 minutes to check for an update (I was very polite), the person who answered blamed GrubHub for sending the order late.
Ordered pizza for delivery and it arrived cold. Decent enough food after heating it up but nothing spectacular.

One of the best pizzas in town. We always order Favorite with prosciutto, garlic and veggies. Although it tastes different every time, we always devour it with delight. We will be definitely back to sample more dishes.

I've been here twice and their food is delicious, the portions are good and the ingredients are fresh, the decor is a little weird ( the ceiling is full of fake dry grape leafs) other than that definitely coming back

Ordered the "Viva" Pizza for home delivery...it showed up with just pepperoni...that's like ordering a Big Mac and you got just bun and patty, but by the time you've realized this, you're too far from the cashier to complain...not cool

For being the first time in SF, eating at this restaurant was amazing! It may be a bit deceiving if the restaurant is empty, its the complete opposite. I ordered the Tortellini with the 3 cheese sauces. Let me tell you, that was to die for! If I were to be able to eat a second plate, I would !!!l haha

This was a delicious pizza! We had the one called The Favorite which had prosciutto, tomatoes, onion, and artichoke hearts. The bread was crispy, still yet soft inside. The sauce was very delicious, and zangy. We had a glass of cabernet which was pretty decent actually. Parking is very challenging in this neighborhood for the most part, so good luck to you. The waiter was slightly pushy about taking our order; he came back to take our order like twice in 5 minutes while we studied the menu. I think our bill was about $25.00. Great pizza!

This place leaves a bad taste in my mouth, one that can only be matched by the borderline horrendous food they serve. I tried this restaurant out of wanting to get a bite after a long day of walking. First off, I doubt the owners are Italian. I'm part Italian and was mostly raised in an Italian household, so I know how Italian food is made and tastes. Viva did not cut it for me.

The worst Italian food I have ever had. I ordered the chicken pasta to be on the safe side, but the pasta sauce and chicken were extremely bland. I also tasted the eggplant parmesan and cheese ravioli, both of which tasted awful. These latter two dishes are some of my favorites at other, decent Italian restaurants too. Don't let the nice sitting space fool you.  Avoid at all costs.

The staff seemed irritated and annoyed by my girlfriend's and my presence. The Caprese Salad was a mess. The tomatoes were hard like apples and the mozzarella shouldn't have been allowed to be called cheese. It was rubber city. The pasta was terribly weak. The sauce bland. The dishes seemed microwaved. The place mats were essentially parchment paper with grease stains from the previous customers. So basically you could say it was a pretty crummy experience. With all the amazing food in San Fran, you simply must pass on this restaurant.

We picked this place as our usual spot was not open due to a private party they were hosting. The salad was ok but the lasagna and the chicken cacciatore was excellent probably the best I've had to be honest. Service was ok and considering that the place is located on a main busy street you see people and hear a lot noise, we were used to it. It is located in North Beach after all.
The food was good, but not excellent. It was definitely affordable but I feel like I could get better quality for my money at another restaurant on Columbus.

No starter(s), but my entree, P.B.S., pesto, broccoli, spinach, garlic, green onions was very tasty. Tiny bit oily, but tasty. My other half got the Chicken Risotto. He thought it was "o.k." Service was fine, decor a little odd.
The red and white sauces tasted like it was a from a can. This place is cheaper but for a few bucks more, I recommend other places.

Ymmm lunch time lamb chop I allway order this it favor and the service is very good and other than that it's not crowded it right now and I have try everything on the menu the best chocolate mousse ice cream dessert is so ymm give it a try will it warm an nice day hope all of have good afternoon an get home nice an safe
Been there probably 6 times. Once was so-so. The rest were great. This is not a Michelin 5-Star, it is a quaint neighborhood Italian restaurant with very good food that is reasonably priced.
Incredible four cheese pizza......and people, if you love a good mediterranean salad the you MUST go here for one....wow!
We really liked this place. Friendly and fast service and very tasty food. I thought the house Cabernet was good as well. We had a good experience.

DO NOT GO HERE WHATEVER YOU DO! We ordered food from here and can't even believe they had the nerve to serve this nasty stuff.  You've got to try really hard to make pasta taste like dog doo. The noodles were cooked days too long. I would have preferred can sauce over this flavorless "sauce." We were really hung over and honestly just about anything would have tasted good. We had to throw it away, we couldn't touch it. It was that bad. We called Eat24 (the place that delivered it) and they called the restaurant. The restaurant had the nerve to offer us FIVE dollars off our next order. You would have to pay me 100's of dollars to ever order that stuff again. I told Eat24 this and they said they would throw on another 5 bucks. HELLO, WHY WOULD I WANT MONEY TO GARBAGE!?  Ugh, I got ripped off. Don't go here. If it's bad when you're hung over, it's got to be AWFUL when you're feeling fine.

The pasta pescatore was probably the best I've ever had. Fresh salmon, muscles, clams, calamari and shrimp (I think I named them all), cooked perfectly, along with a great tomato cream sauce. Overall, amazing. Oh and it was big enough for two people and less than $20! ($17.95) can't beat that. I will definitely come again and would also recommend the the tiramisu, very good.
Meh. I neither hate nor love Viva...it just doesn't live up to the better spots in NB.

I have tried a bunch of Viva's pizzas and pastas and I now understand why this place has a solid three star ranking on Yelp - it's just smack in the middle of the spectrum of mediocrity. None of their items are particularly great, and yet, none are truly terrible to justify anything other than 3 stars.

Really nice place, good atmosphere, cheap food and drink, including daily specials. The food is very good, not amazing, but very good bang for your buck. We've come back many times and brought friends.
I still have dreams about this restaurant.

I had a horrible experience with delivery here. I accidentally got the address wrong for my order. I called and gave them the new address, my pizza came THREE HOURS later!! I tried to call and cancel before then but the owner told me he was not at fault because they had already tried to deliver. When the pizza finally arrived I found out they had purposely pursued other deliverys from people who had called in well after me with orders, so rude and unprofessional! Everyone makes mistakes, I didn't purposely mean to put in the wrong address but I felt like I had been punished for it. Even after my apologizing, the delivery guy threw the box on the table and evily muttered "enjoy your COLD pizza.."
This post bar crawl pizza really hit the spot. Quick service, totally yummy and they even had ranch dressing! Sweet!

The staff was friendly, the house wine was a value, the food was pretty good.  Chicken piccata was good but a bit too much lemon.  My husband ordered a meatball on the side, and it was dry with no sauce or anything.  The salads could use a tad more dressing.  Otherwise, everyone enjoyed the food, and it was a good place to stop without reading reviews first.

After over a decade of going here I still don't think I've had the pizza, but I pretty much always leave with a smile on my face, even after a hard day. I love all the appetizers & I've tried half the pastas, and it's the only place I drink Chablis! :)

I've never had a bad meal here.  I don't go to North Beach often, but when I do, I try to eat dinner here.  I've ordered everything from the baked ziti to pizza to eggplant parmesan; they were all delicious!  Plus, the portions are huge and the prices are fantastic.  I also enjoy the bread too.  Furthermore, the servers are nice and attentive.    I have no complaints.
This sucks and I hate to re-edit my review again.

If you want REAL Italian food from REAL Italian Restaurant while you're in San Francisco, you have to go here. Servings are large. Food is tasty. Get the garlic appitizer of roasted garlic cloves. They are soft and spread like butter. So good. If the fake vines hanging from the ceiling from the chicken wire doesn't show you that this hole in the wall, that's been there for OVER 25 YEARS isn't real, nothing will. Not fancy. You won't impress your first date here. But you will impress your friends that you found this hole in the wall restaurant with the great pizza and great pasta.

This place is awesome!  If you're looking for a solid option for traditional Italian food in North Beach.  Plus the price is on average 3-4 dollars cheaper on average than the surrounding restaurants.

Went there for lunch. Excellent pasta & great sauce. Excellent service & good quality for low price in comparison to other local restaurants. I wanted lunch & lunch prices. Other restaurants only had dinner prices. Very pleased with our selection.

We ordered delivery from here and it was seriously inedible. The pasta was so over cooked it was like mush. The sauce on both dishes didn't have flavor at all. The chicken was too scary to try. We couldn't eat any of it. The pop was the only good thing. I literally just threw away 60 bucks.
Pros:  two small pizzas, soda and an appetizer for about $30.  So lots of food.  Big glass front where you can sit at the table and people watch.

Oh dear. All of the good places were 2+ hrs wait. We should have gone to a grocery store and picked up a wrap. Instead we ate here. Big mistake. Unequivocally, the worst professionally-prepared food I've ever eaten. Our waitress was friendly. The wine tasted watered down. The pizza was burnt, and disgusting. We would have complained, but we're British, so we soldiered on, stoically.

Stopped in after walking by. The place looked nice so we gave it a try. Service was great and had multiple people checking in on us throughout the meal. Food was very good. Lots of leftovers. Good portion sizes.

Two star for friendly service and yummy shrimp alfredo fettucini a friend got, I went with the chicken primavera with red sauce I hated mine but loved my friends food. The girls were nice but would not recommend and won't be back.
Felt like having pizza, but then saw the calzone on the menu, so ordered the small (12").

I've come to Vivia a handful of times over the last few years. Every time I come, I always have a lovely experience. The staff is attentive and friendly. The food is absolutely delicious, and the value is great!
No. Parklets are just plain stupid.
Sad that the parking spaces are being privatized for the benefit of elite local businesses. This has also been done in a secretive fashion  --  with no proper notification to neighbors.

Check out this wonderful new public space in North Beach!  The Columbus Street Parklet #1 has benches, café seating and landscaping at this, the City's third Parklet project. Bamboo used for the surface decking is an environmentally friendly renewable resource and all landscaping used are low-water species. Café Greco has agreed to provide daily maintenance, although all seating is free and open to the public.
The family and I recently spent three days in San Francisco. The main reason we chose SF was the food. We love seafood!

Try to avoid this Holiday Inn restaurant..  Decided to take a chance in here today (just was tired of the rain and we were staying here) with my kids.  We thought we were on MTV's Boiling Point or Food Network's Chef Wanted -- 'cause the dinner service sucked (the weather did too so I was patient tonight).  Would have given less than 1 star but manager comped our entire meal, so 1.5 stars.

Definitely stay away from this one! Rude staff, terrible drinks. The prices would be reasonable if the drinks weren't tiny and light handed. My drink was supposed to be shaken according to the menu but was poorly blended leaving my tiny cup mostly full of ice.

So I brought my three kids along with me while traveling on business, I thought I'd take up the "kids eat free" offer by the hotel restaurant downstairs. I don't know which had less personality, the food or the waiter. The waiter literally walked up to our table and proceeded to ask us what we wanted with no introduction or welcoming phrase whatsoever. His personality was as dry as the Mohave desert. Ordered the buffalo wings, which were just as dry. When we asked for more sauce, he wasn't shy to tell us that they come frozen and pre-packaged with that amount of sauce. I couldn't believe we just paid $10 for 5 dry skimpy chicken wings.

There was a time when the quality of the nightly seafood buffet in this Holiday Inn dining room was such that it ranked among the better eateries in the Wharf area. Over the years, however, it has deteriorated into a hit-or-miss proposition - there are times when its sins are venial and easily forgiven, others when no amount of penance will make things right. If the fish isn't fresh, extra seasoning or lots of melted butter won't disguise its age. Their downward slide has brought them to a level where, with so many outstanding restaurants a brief walk away, there's no reason to take a chance on this one.

A disgusting spot in SF I have ever had. Horrible, bland and expensive food with a terrible staff that are yelling over your head and while they are serving you. And when you see the chefs, you will get even more disgusted. Restaurant is unsanitary, a big bowl of cheese is passed around the entire store for customers to add on their food. Everyone breathing on it and touching the same spoon and it sits on the side without being covered. This place needs to be shut down.
Delicious pizza

What a great idea, offer free glass of wine  by the hostess that is standing out front telling us to come inside and grab a bite to eat.  The server brought a glass of wine and some bruschetta. I really enjoyed the complimentary appetizers.
Wow. Worst meal I've ever had in San Francisco. They gave us a plate of gummy bears for dessert. The food was bland and terrible. Least I saved money on the tip.

My sister was visiting me from out of the country and ate here while in the city.  When she told me about her experience I was very upset.  Aside from the food being served cold when they were leaving they asked the Maitre D for directions to Union Square.  He told them to walk straight up Union St and it would take them to Union Square.  Well anyone who knows the city knows that this is not true.  They got extremely lost.  They were on foot and had to hire a cab to take them back to their hotel.  I thought that this was not very nice at all.  This may be due to the fact that they complained about the food being served cold. Anyways we would not recommend this restaurant at all.

I wish I could have enjoyed my experience here better. The pasta (I ordered the seafood) was something I could have made better hungover. The tomato sauce was super watered down and the portions were tiny for the price. Sadface.

Hey, I won't deny it. The place is a bit kitschy.  The hodgepodge of statutes and replicas of other famous Italian artifacts make this place look like it's trying too hard. But then, you walk in and you are pleasantly surprised that they aren't trying to hit you over the head with Italy, it's all over the top with humor, love of the homeland and unabashed pride. So who cares if it's a little kitschy. They're not trying to be the new next thing or anything that they are not.  And when you take a bite of their homemade tiramisu all is quickly forgiven.

We were visiting San Francisco and wanted Italian, so walked up Columbus looking for a good place. We were lured into Michaelangelos from a guy outside, and though we had our doubts due to this and due to it being really empty, we went here for dinner. Although the waiter tried to make it seem that he was giving us special appetizers "on the house", it was very obvious that they gave the same free appetizers to everyone. However, free bruschetta, olives, and a bigass bread basket is still totally worth it! Our meals were delicious too - amazing tortellini and spaghetti with seafood. One of the servers was the owner, which was impressive, everyone was very attentive. Then, we ordered a tortufo that was HUGE and also got free cookies and gummy bears. Delicious! And for an amazingly low price!! We loved the food, service, free apps, and ambiance. Would come back again!

Two of us went after ckg online reviews.We were not disappointed. Small quaint place with cool artwork - copies of Michelangelo's famous pieces. All seats have wonderful view of Washington Pk and Coit Tower.  We joked that it was like being in Italy across from a grassy piazza and the Pisa Tower. The service was outstanding, efficient, and friendly, going out of their way to please. I always order veal when I see it on a menu, and had the veal saltimbocca which was OH! so tender and plentiful accompanied by potatoes cooked like I'd never seen before but delish! Enjoyed a btl of wine and free bread with olives, bruschetta, cookies and gummy bears! Prices are excellent! We may return again this visit (so much great stuff on the menu to try); if not, it's on our list of places to go whenever we're in town!

ZERO, ZERO, ZERO, ZERO, ZERO. I would never return. We went despite the fact that it was pretty empty. Our first mistake. Our server treated us like the building was burning down and he needed to serve everything as fast as possible to collect our dinner fee. We ordered multiple appetizers but were only served one. We assumed that they would at least take these expensive items off the bill but they brought us a very expensive bill for sub-par food. We had to have them correct the mistake. The calimari was hardly cooked and inedible. When one of our party asked to have her untouched pasta boxed up, the server instead threw it away! When 10 mins after we settled the bill, I still had not received the leftovers, I inquired as to where they were, the Manager insisted that he was very sorry and would make a whole new dish! We waited and waited AND WAITED for the dish. When it finally came it was literally 1/8 the size of the original pasta dish.  Terrible service, terrible food and very expensive.

My friend and I were searching the streets for some good Italian food at a reasonable price and wandered by Michaelangelo's. After a warm invitation from the manager Tony, we ventured in and had a delicious meal, served with yummy bread, and a taste of their bruschetta. I would definetely come back for their authentic food and good service.
Food got funny taste to it kind of like soap. My gf order the chicken parmigiana. She did not like it at all. I taste my gf chicken parmigiana it had a funny taste to it. I Would not eat it.
If only the food was as half good as the sales person getting you through the front door...

Tourist trap ...What do you expect if they hustle you in. .. followed test of por group against better instinct and had all my fears materialize: cheap may house wine, old bread, tasteless pata with cold scallops, mini portion for the milanese chicken. We had been promised no-pay if we didn't like the food but had eaten too much of it, basically because I didn't believe in that drivel anyhow. Lesión learned and confirmed. ... There are so many other great looking places around where we could have spent les money for better food.

Walking through San Fran on a Friday night with a large party (13 adults and 1 child in a stroller) we were wooed by Tony at the door of this smallish restaurant. He said he could accommodate our group immediately AND HE DID! We were in and sitting in 5 minutes.

Does not earn a single star but required to post. Tried this restaurant with a groupon so we were mot sure what we get but... Italian restaurant with the obligatory olive oil for dipping, however, as I was dipping and eating my bread I noted that the bottomed the olive oil container looked cloudy. Picked up the bottle looked at it from the bottom then tipped it but could not get a clear view so used a piece of bread and gross-  mold in the oil. The table next to us. .. same.  Disgusting!  We told one if the wait staff who took the bottle and never came back, we told our waiter and he did not seem to understand English suddenly.  All I'm dying is IF you are dirty enough to leave something like that in plain view then I am super concerned about other issues that may be worse or even dangerous. Stay away.

If you are thinking of buying the Groupon for this place=DON'T. The guy at the door hustles you in (of course) tells you that it's the best food in North Beach. So my girlfriend and I are starting to eat our (not the best) bread, with the olive oil and balsamic supplied at the table. After eating a few pieces I happened to focus on the bottle of oil and noticed something on the bottom. It was large chunks of mold! When I showed this one waitress she just kind of shrugged it off and removed bottle. The other table next to us appeared to have the same issue, had a hard time not pointing it out to the people eating the bread.

If you are the kind of person who expects to be waited on hand and foot and is hella picky about service from an American point of view (i.e. a waiter at your table every ten minutes interrupting your conversation to make sure "everything is fine"), this is not your kind of restaurant. If you are looking for a hole in the wall Italian restaurant with great food, bread on the table, and an overall warm, delicious culinary experience at a reasonable price for the quality of the food, do yourself a favor and come here for dinner on a weekday. The place is not packed, the food will make you happy, and you will leave with a smile on your face. Also, complimentary marinated olives, red wine, and gummi bears. Can't wait to go back!

Ugh. Not another bad experience! The fried calamari appetizer was lukewarm. The Caesar salad was bland, how do you screw up Caesar salad?! I need to know.. The gnocchi was undercooked and the sauce in which it was drowned was supposed to be pesto? It didn't taste like it at all. I noticed the guy next to us took a few bites of his and didn't seem to like it either. I hate to admit but I was suckered in by the guy in the ponytail too, I should have known better. I need to know.. Don't order the steak! Omg. I can't even put words together. I will say that the waiter was nice and sweet, I took a liking to him maybe because he looked like  a homeless Marc Anthony. I need to know...tell me baby girl cuz I need to know...

The service was great and one of the reasons we went in. The free bread was great and had a good taste. However the ravioli tasted like they were bought in a supermarket and not even fully cooked. Very disappointing. The sauce was fantastic but couldn't make up for what was missing. The pizza my friends ordered looked very small for the prize but didn't taste too bad. The place itself was nice and had the World Cup on which u enjoyed. They did seem weirded out that we didn't order anything but the pizza and ravioli. Maybe they are not used to poor college students? Not my first choice but it was fine that one time.
Food was medicore-service was quite UNattentive. Not worthy of recommending other than the complimentary brischetta.

We walked past four times on walking tours and during exploration of North Beach and each time a nice young lady greeted us with a smile and a hello.  My wife decided if she was nice again, we were stopping.  Persistence paid off and the fifth time was the charm.  Food was quite good.  Service and personal experience was better.  We were served by Sal, the owner, and he was great.  The door guy was friendly too without being pushy.  Having lived near NYC for years, we knew the Little Italy experience there and there's so much pushy upselling to get you in the door.  This was not the case at Michelangelo's.  We got all the goodies others have written about.  Complimentary bruschetta that my wife went nuts over.  Gummy bears and cookies at the end of the meal.  We were even treated to a complimentary tiramisu that was delicious.  Sal told us about the business, the ups and downs, the story behind the gummy bears, and we just felt like guests and not just another table. I'm sure there are other places with similar food in North Beach but we won't need to go further up the hill if and when we are back in San Fran.  Sal and the door man shook my hand on the way out and thanked us for the visit.  Wife had the veal, I had the pollo valdostana and we were both very happy with the quality and size of the plates.  Overall a great experience at Michelangelo's with great service and attention to detail.

Came here for a quick lunch and was pleasantly surprised. The hostess was friendly and attentive. Olives, bread and oil were served as I waited for my meal. I had the special carbonara which was a delicious, generous serve. I would definitely recommend.
Great food and they gave us a free appetizer and haribo gummibears for dessert. Would definitely visit again.

Came in with a groupon and we were not impressed.  The veal saltimbocca was small and had a funny flavor and the Veal Marsala tasted off too.  Expected more since we are in North Beach.  The service was good and they were good to our kids and split their gnocchi.  The creme brûlée was great and highlight of the meal.

Got lured in as well...even being on expenses. The house wine was very drinkable.  Service friendly and good.  Had the lamb chop special- nice quality on the meat...I'm from the midwest and pretty particular about the chewiness.  All in all a very enjoyable meal.

I have my favorite Italian Restaurant (Enzo's) here at home in Portland, Oregon and I would have to say that Michelangelo's is my favorite in San Francisco.  Granted, I have not tried any others, but I like to go where I know the food will be delicious.  This was our second time in a span of about 7 months. The Tiramisu is divine and the complementary Amaretto Cookies and Gummy Bears are a plus.

We chose this place as a recommendation from the gelateria just up the block.  It may not be as swank or as pretty as many other of the Italian joints up and down Columbus, but Michelangelo definitely gives great value and the owner definitely knows how to hustle.  The food though was spot on.  We too received the complimentary bowl of briny olives (which is always a plus in my book) and bruschetta appetizers.  Beef carpaccio was excellent, tenderloin shaved paper-thin on the ice-cold plate, garnished with just lemon, a few capers, and shavings of nutty sweet parmigiano reggiano.
