I had a craving for spaghetti alle vongole, just like the kind I had on the island of Ponza so many years ago, and Michelangelo's did not disappoint.  Al dente spaghetti served in a white wine and clam nectar, some garlic, chili flakes, parsley and a generous half pound of manila clams.  She ordered the Fettucine Mari E Monti which was absolutely fabulous.  The seafood was incredibly fresh and there were some nice hunks of portabello mushrooms all melded together with that rich creamy tomato base.  The Amaretti cookies were a nice complimentary touch at the end of the meal, and the free gummy bears were humorous and somehow in their strangeness reminded me that somewhere inside of me there still lies that child who can never be too surprised.
Food was good, but the chef was a little rude when we asked if we could basically get another mug for sharing a cup of coffee.  He also seemed in a hurry to hand us the check.

It was late we just caught the showing of "Beach Blanket Babylon" enticed off the street to come in.  What amazing people that work/own this place. It was late we were the last people there and were treated like royalty!!! We shared a dinner of Pasta bolonese that was so fresh and tasted amazing!  The view of the beautiful Catholic Church all lite up in the back ground was breath taking! We had the opportunity to talk extensively with the staff who were so warm and easy going. Not at any point did we feel rushed even though they were closed! Luv luv loved this place!  Go check it out!

The host is a very nice man that persuaded us to eat there and he made our night. The food was excellent. My grandmother was from Italy and my mom uses her recipes to make dinner every night so I know real Italian food and this place has it. The service was even better than the food and the owner it's the chef who was born and raised in Italy. This place is defiantly a must try and you will want to come back.

As an Italian who grew up eating Nonna's cooking for 25 years, I am very picky when it comes to Italian cuisine. My friend and I headed to North Beach on Sunday and studied most of the restaurants along Columbus Ave before deciding on Michelangelo.

My family and I made reservations to celebrate my sisters birthday.  When we arrived they had our table ready. The service was great from the beginning to end and they were very friendly. We had a really great time there. Thank you for a great service and making it welcoming. We will be definitely coming back soon :)

These people are trippin!! Authentic everything. Spaghetti and meatballs to die for. Meat stuffed tortellini in cream sauce tasted like they made it today!! Spinach and cheese stuffed ravioli in tomato cream fabulous thank you! Custard yum Spinoni yum. My new fave place in the city!!!!

Michelangelo's is an absolutely wonderful place to take a  guest, especially an out of state guest. My husband and I took my Vermont sister to Michelangelo's and, boy, did we have a great time. We were looking for an Italian North Beach experience and we got it. The decor is intimate and the wall statues make you feel like you are in Italy. Our waiter was the restaurant's owner, a real Italian born with genuine accent. He was filling in for an absent waiter and he was tons of fun and gave us superior service. He spent lots of time talking and joking with us. When I switched my order from spaghetti and meat balls to eggplant parmigiana, he brought me a big side of the spaghetti and meat balls anyway, for no charge. They were the best meatballs! My sister's and husband's dinners were also excellent. After olives and bread, a large delicious antipasto, entrees+, dessert and the tasty house chianti, we had to take the finale gummy bears to go. We used a Groupon coupon, but it was well worth it without the coupon. We will return to this fun and delicious find!

Best food in Little Italy and phenomenal service. I was wandering looking for a place for dinner and the greeter invited me in offering a free glass of wine (red or white). When I sat down he decided to give me the best bruschetta I've ever had, on the house. I had the pappardelle which was phenomenal. All the staff have Italian accents, adding to the authenticity. One of my best dining experiences in San Francisco.

Wonderful service and food. My fiancé and I wandered into this restaurant 30 minutes to close, and the staff were all so warm and accommodating. We both had salads to start, and the food was obviously fresh and the dressings are made from scratch, even so close to closing time. The bread was also fresh and perfectly warm and cooked. We would HIGHLY recommend the crab and lobster ravioli and the tortellini. The pasta was made from scratch and the portions we perfect. All the staff are originally from Italy, and the chef Salvatore himself came to the table after we finished our meal to thank us for our patronage and to ensure we enjoyed all of our food. Massimo was our server, and personally made sure we knew a good way to walk to our hotel from the restaurant so that we would be safe. Best Italian food I've ever eaten.

I ate here on a Groupon and had a great time. I'd go back without the Groupon.  If you are looking for white linen fine dining then go elsewhere. For a clean, tasty and  reasonably priced ($15-$19 per plate) Italian dinner I really enjoyed this place. The restaurant is located right across from the park in the center of North Beach.   I called for reservations and Tony said to just come by and ask for him. I showed up a few minutes late and Tony was there to greet me on the sidewalk by name. He got me a good seat and even though I was on the Groupon he asked the chef to send out some Bruschetta for me while I waited for my fiance. This was in addition to the olives and endless bread. He then kept an eye out for her as she was arriving by bike and greeted her by name as she pulled up. We had an enjoyable bottle of Sangiovese, Ceasar, eggplant parm and a chicken dish with fontina and ham that was very good.  The white chocolate/dark chocolate dessert cup is fantastic and I'd call it a must order dessert.  At the end of the meal we were surprised with gummy bears and cookies on the house. Throughout the meal we chatted with Tony and the staff, learned about the history of the place and North Beach.  It was a very personal dining experience. If you want to be  left alone and dine in solitude I'm sure that's an option but where Michelangelo's shined was good priced, good tasting food with a fun bit of socializing with the crew.  Some have commented on the idea of someone working the sidewalk as pushy.  I like that there is someone who wants to bring you in and while you are eating wants to make sure it lives up to the billing he gave it. I like that the owner is there and the people working feel a sense of ownership and pride in the place.  I'll take that over a restaurant the staff just shows up to work at and goes home with nothing personally invested but time.

Tourist trap! It was a cold and windy day, and we basically settled on this place. The guy outside was working the door trying to entice people to come in by offering a free appetizer. That should of been red flag number one. Any great place wouldn't need to push so hard. It reminded me how the people push things when your vacationing in Mexico. But as I said, it was cold and windy. We are seated and soon after he takes our order. The food arrives, but we never receive a table check the entire time we are there, not one! My wife's salmon is cold, the broccoli had no seasoning what so ever, and the rest was just OK at best. If your starving and everything is closed, this place might do the trick. But if your planning a trip to San Francisco, and your looking for a cool/great place to eat, well, this isn't it! I enjoyed my food at offthegridsf food trucks more then this place. Keep walking down Columbus and find another place to eat at!

The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere is very "real"... looks and feels like a real Italian restaurant, and hearing the staff actually converse in Italian is a good sign, so after eyeing a few in the area, we decided on this place. It was a good choice.
The name and the look of it may be deceiving, but the food was GREAT.

I usually come here for lunch. I've tried the spaghetti and meatballs. I've tried the Monte Cristo which I really like. I'm hoping to try some of the other daily specials in the near future. I really liked the spaghetti sauce as well as the portion.

Wonderful, traditional Italian-American restaurant. Friendly service and food that tastes like what Nonna would make at home.  This isn't the Tuscan or Ligurian food you'd get at an upscale Italian restaurant, but delicious Southern Italian food (Calabrian, Sicilian) you find all over the US East Coast. If you live in the West and have a craving for spaghetti with meatballs, Veal Marsala, or great Chicken Parm....this is the place!
Love this place. I didn't catch the server's name, but he has been there a long time, knows the menu inside and out, is very friendly and makes good suggestions.

Ordered delivery which was posted as 45-60 mins delivery time.  2 hours later, I was the one who had to find out where my food was and where it wasn't at (my home).  So strike one.  Shame to because I was looking forward to trying a new place.
This is where I go for an Italian lunch - and here is why:

I read the reviews and totally confused. This place was horrible !! My pasta Alfredo was so bad no flavour and pasty:(( cold bread with packaged butter !! Maybe for some this place is quality  then they need to up the bar alot and try somewhere else to see what their missing .
Love love love this place.  Great history, friendly owners.  A must stop when in little Italy. Great price on the lunch menu. Outside street seating was a plus.
I've been here twice now and all the people I go with seem to love it every time (and have been coming here for years) but I have been disappointed both times.

This place used to be a couple blocks up the street on the corner some years ago, then it moved to it's current location. It's been a San Francisco staple for over half a century. The food is excellent, their calamari is the best you'll ever eat, I promise!!! Pasta is excellent, I've never had a bad meal here in all the years I've ate here, and I've been coming here since i was literally an infant with my family.

This was my first time here.  I came with a large group. It was wonderful. The wine was flowing. The fish plate appetizers was amazing. It had everything.  The Pallele was great.  I had the chicken Marsala and enjoyed it.  Everyone loved their meal.

In town for business - I walked for a while then decided to eat here racist it was getting late 8:15 - disappointed - stale cold bread to start - small $7 salad - then wait..... Wait.... Still waiting for my chicken parm - it's now 9:05 and they are closing around me?

Amazing! We were recommended to eat here as my fiance and I were looking for a caterer for our wedding in September 13'.  They typically don't like to cater, but the dinner we enjoyed was beyond delicious and anything else we had tried, and we asked Gespare very nicely, and he graciously agreed.  The food delivered to our wedding was perfect; warm, tasty, and very much enjoyed by all of our guests.  We continue to return and eat here, and the food is constantly great, and beyond expectations.

Flavor was good, but the quality of the ingredients could have been better, especially when it's seafood so close to the pier. Overall - I would say 3.5, but Yelp doesn't do half star ratings in reviews.
I've been here a few times and have enjoyed every single visit.

Excellent service. excellent food. the only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is the butter is served in foil packets. My wife had muscles and their were twice the amount as any other restaurant I've been to.
Sometimes one tries a restaurant, for no other reason than you're standing in front of it!

I know this place has a lot of history, and I wanted to like it...  The service was good.  Prices OK.  Ambiance kinda average.  But I just wasn't that excited about the food.  Nothing to write home about.  Meh.
First let me state that I only tried two items here: panella and meatballs as we visited Original US as part of the food tour.
five stars because everything we ordered tasted excellent and prices are very good.

We ate here on a Friday night and on a bit of short timeline. The waiter did a good job moving our order through, although he did misinterpret our request to split a kid's meal and brought a split adult meal. Other than that, the service was great and the server was really friendly. The food was good, I had the baked rigatoni which I thought was delicious although a little dry. My wife ordered the half antipasto, which was just meats, cheese and veges, no salad, but she liked it.  The kids' spaghetti and meatballs were good, but they asked for more ragu' also. We would go back again when we have more time to explore the menu a little.

Bus boy seated us after standing in front for a couple of minutes in a very quiet Thursday evening... manager was at best in different to us being there... Served us the wrong wine... Food ok... Felt very cold and not very friendly
I am writing this review after removing a one star review of the Original US that I had posted in April of 2013.
Very, very good.

Bread was not fresh. Mozzarella sticks were overlooked. Not sure how that's possible. Our main course took over 25 minutes to be served. The Chicken Piccata sauce was tart and chicken was chewy. Chicken Parmesan was burnt at the bottom and red sauce was watery. Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken had chewy chicken which seemed to have been microwaved. The pasta and sauce was okay.  Kids Pasta with butter was okay but fries were dry. Overall it was disappointing coming to Little Italy for such an awful mean.

This was one of our stops during our sidewalk food tour (which was fantastic by the way). We sampled the panelle (garbanzo bean fritters), the meatballs, and an eggplant dish. All were delicious, especially the panelle, which I've never had before. The texture is light and airy and completely original in flavor. I would come back just to taste these again! The meatballs were very good too. Meaty but not fatty, and very moist. The eggplant was good too, but I'm not much of an eggplant fan.
NORTH BEACH EATING PART V: SICILIAN CUISINE

My grandparents are first generation Italians, and always used to eat here whenever they visited SF. Just went back for the first time since I was a little girl, and was more than pleased. The gnocchi gorgonzola was, by far, the best I've ever had! Melted right in your mouth! Definitely looking forward to going back again :)
A small place with good quality food and great service...love their carbonara. WIll certainly come back here.

The food was decent, but the whole evening was overshadowed by the horrible service. We waited over 30 minutes for our entrees, and had to nag the waiters several times to get our food. They were in attentive and unapologetic. Then it took forever to get a bill! What a disappointing experience.

I so love this restaurant in North Beach. Their fish is SO fresh and delicious, the pasta is delicious and the staff is always so friendly. For a true Italian-San Francisco experience, don't miss Original US Restaurant!

This place was more fun than I expected based on the cheesy name.  The food was delicious, and the atmosphere was entertaining.  Italian was spoken everywhere including most of the customers.  It looked like a ratio of 10:9 Italian to non-Italian customers.  And the main guy (owner?) was charming.  Glad we stopped in!

Went here for dinner after trying their meatballs (Spahettie Polpette) on the Sidwalk Food Tour of North Beach. Tried everyone's food at our table (there were 6 of us) and everyone had yummy items! The special for Thursday was a spinach and ricotta cannelloni, and it was my favorite thing to try (...I ate a few bites from my grandma's plate...sorry grandma). I ordered the Penne Arrabbiata, which I tried in Rome last year - I knew it would be a little spicy, but I swear when I ate it in Rome, it was not too hot. At Original US, it was blazingly hot and I was crying and snotty from the heat - it was so good I kept eating it, but I could not believe how excruciatingly spicy it was! spaghetti polpette, the ricotta and spinach cannelloni, the spaghetti pesto trapanese , gnocchi bolognese and even the corned beef and cabbage were all top notch. This felt like a place that a lot of local Italians frequent, it seemed like everyone knew each other and the owner kept greeting people off the street that he knew! I'd come back here for sure.

This is one of our favorite restaurants in SF. We live here so have many great places to try out. When we want to stick with "tried and true" we come here-a lot! The salmon is always good, the meatballs are excellent, and the service is friendly.

I have been to most of the Italian restaurants in North Beach and US Restaurant is by the the freshest, most authentic Itallian restaurant. It is my new go-to restaurant. The quality of food is excellent and the cooking style is not heavy. The prices are very low compared to all the other restaurants on Columbus which is another big plus. You can't make the dishes at home for the prices they charge. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants good, fresh Italian food for a good price.

This place was recommended by a local friend and then, later, by a touring couple who we encountered while dining there (on their second visit in two days :P). I loved it and even my other friend, who knows his Italian food, gave it a rave review.
From 8/2011

My parents, husband and I were walking around North Beach looking for a good place to eat. My mom asked a man on the street if he has any suggestions and he suggested this place. His recommendation was right on point!
